name: Crazy Adjudgement
description:
Crazy Adjudgement is a party boardgame produced by Taiwan MJBD Games in 2009. Players play the dual role of officials and criminals during the game. Through a battle of wits and lucks between officials and criminals, the final winner will be determined.

The game is played over several rounds.Each round is divided into six phases(For example with 4 players)：

Phase 1：determine the role (citizen、detective、6 officials and 10 criminals)
Each player receives one random purple cards and four random black cards.

Phase 2：catch the criminal

The player who hold the citizen card can accuse any 1 criminal of the 10 criminals. The player who hold the detective card will catch the criminal. He guesses which player hold the criminal card. If he guesses correct. The player who hold the criminal card will be punished.Otherwise the player who hold the detective card will be punished.

Phase 3： adjudge the criminal

The player who holds the judgment officer (one of the officials) card judges the criminal. He draws 1 card of the green card deck. The card will determine the result of punishment.

Phase 4：replace the criminal

The player who will be punished can choose 1 of the 2 Joker cards.If he choose red card.he draws 1 card of the red card deck.The card will change the result of punishment. If he choose blue card.he draws 1 card of the blue card deck.The card will change the criminal.

Phase 5： punish the criminal
When the criminal is finally determined. The player who is the criminal will be punished. The player who hold the execution officer(one of the officials)card will punish the criminal.

Phase 6：ending the round
The player who is the criminal is the loser and the dealer next round. Repeat the above steps to enter the next round.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Dungeon Attack!: Poison Dice
description:
Need more challenges? Try adding these Poison Dice into your next Dungeon Attack! game.

This set contains x4 Poison Dice and rules card.

In game play each poison hit taken lowers an Adventurer's Combat Rating by 1. So stay away from these poisonous critters or defeat them before they get you.

name: Iceberg
description:
Players slip into the role of penguins who try to collect as many ice floes as they can while trying not to fall off the iceberg, which is becoming smaller and smaller with every round.

Each movement must be well thought out, because on the slippery ice each movement will also have an effect for the next round. The movement you perform on Round 1 will become your momentum for the next round, and so on.

But that’s not all. You must also imagine the intention of your opponents, because if a penguin collides with another penguin, it will transfer its momentum to the other penguin.

The game ends as the last penguin falls into the water. The player with the highest pile of ice floes wins the game.

The game was nominated for the "Landespreis für Spielkultur 2010" (State Award for Board Game Culture) awarded by Styria (Austria) under its German name "Eisberg".

name: Surfside Scramble
description: Every player draws 15 flip-flop shaped pieces, each with a letter on one side and a different letter on the other. Players race to create chains of words in which the final letter(s) of one word is/are the first letter(s) of the next. Play continues until one player completes a word chain using all 15 pieces. He gets 5 points. The player with the longest word gets 10 points, and all players receive one point per word created, including nested words.

name: Wä läv, hät Räsch: Das Rheinische Weisheitenspiel
description:
Memory-style game to build Rhenish sayings out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting Rhenish dialect words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun.The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to discussions about local dialects, but the one finding most (new) matching pairs is the winner.

name: The Three Pillars: A Paranormal Card Game
description:
The Three Pillars is a fast-paced, witty game of checks and balances that celebrates the paranormal community while gently satirizing the drama that is often encountered within it. Assemble your team, visit haunted locations and submit evidence to close the cases - but be warned - not only must you deal with Murphy's Law, but with other paranormal teams investigating the same places as you - and chances are, they won't be helpful. Never before has Paranormal Division been so fun!

Players compete to score the most points they can by playing Evidence cards at three separate locations. Each turn a player picks up a card and either plays or discards a card - each time they are faced with a choice: they can play a card to help themselves or to hinder their opponent. Event cards are triggered at various points in the game to introduce an element of randomness and can either be good or bad - you never know!

Meant as a stand-alone game, it can be played straight out of the box. Expansions are being developed to keep gameplay fresh, while maintaining the core rules.

name: Operation Olive: Gothic Line '44
description:
ASLer and historian … and Repubblic of San Marino national, Gian Carlo Ceccoli has crafted a tasty bit of MTO history for you in GL44-OpOlive.
The set combines a set of 16 historical scenarios set on geo boards from your standard collection-plus 3 historical maps provided in the set using the new lay-flat, hard boards. You also get a set of historical notes to bring the battle home to your gaming table.
Gian Carlo poured his heart and soul into this effort-and researched it as only someone with on-site capabilities could. We kept the look classic and G.C. really shows a touch for straightforward, playable scenarios. You will NOT be buried in piece density.
You WILL be buried in esoteric history!
Includes a sheet of overlays, 3 maps, special rules, and a full scenario set.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Triksterimuster
description:
Board game about Estonian folk dance.

Players roll the dice and move around the Estonia answering the questions about Estonian folk culture. Some cards instead require you to show some dancing steps.

Correct answers and dance steps give you a piece of a national costume. Player who first gets the full set of clothes is the winner.
mechanics: Action Queue, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: The Woods
description: The Woods is a board game set in a world of Celtic Folklore and Faerietale. Up to six players undertake a coming-of-age-rite and venture forth into the woods beyond their settlement to acquire character aspects which will take them from childhood to adulthood. Along the way they will encounter Folk from other realms, left in the world when the mysterious Fae departed through their gateways centuries ago. These encounters furnish the players with items to help in their quest, or the aspects they are seeking. 'Aspects' are counters collected during the game. First to 6 aspects wins the game.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: Hunters: Battle of Arkady
description:
From the publisher's website:

From the beginning of time, evil has threatened to break free of the abyss and overrun our world. But there have always been a few brave souls who have fought to hold it back. They are called HUNTERS. Hunters: Battle of Arkady is a fully cooperative action/horror board game for 2 to 6 players ages 13 and up.

Hunters: Battle of Arkady uses poker-sized cards to create a dynamic playing board, allowing each game experience to be different. Players then work together to defeat the Arch-Demon Avenastur before the town of Arkady is consumed by darkness. Players have a choice of six characters to play as, each with individual stats and abilities. During the course of play, additional monsters are revealed and must be fought or dismissed as the character's abilities allow.

Each turn has eight phases, beginning with the character's movement about the board. Avenastur (the Demon) then moves to "chase" the nearest player. If the player has moved, then one or more monster cards are revealed. Once there is a monster in the player's "stack" then the attack/defense part of their turn begins. The player must always roll their attack, depending on the number of d6s their character has, and then roll the attack of the monster who attempts to hit them. Once all the monsters in the "stack" are defeated, the character my Investigate their location. Certain locations have special perks, such as extra lives that can be collected for use by any player, or additional abilities granted to all players. Next the player can regen their health/mana pool as their stats allow. Finally, the Growing Darkness phase flips a location card facedown, losing any special perks remaining, and ending the player's turn.

The game is won or lost depending on the defeat of the "Main Boss" Avenastur. Killing him wins the game for all the players. However, if the town of Arkady is overrun by the Growing Darkness, the players lose.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Have You Met [my...] Family?
description: The first expansion for Paved With [my...] Intentions adds 28 new story cards (creating hundreds of millions of new potential story combinations) and support for 4 more players, expanding the game to support 2 to 10 players. The four new white cards start stories about your various family members, and have the expanded ability to represent your choice of gender (or species), allowing even more personalization of your stories than before.

name: Attack on Mars
description: Genericorp's experiments opened the rift at the bottom of the of the Helles Sea, horrific monsters are pouring through, and you need to fight them back! Attack on Mars is a co-op game for 2-4 players. Choose your pilot, your corporation, and your Mecha. Upgrade your Mecha while defending cities and fighting monsters. Research how to close the rift and then fight the Guardian in order to do so. Win, and Mars is safe. For now.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Administration
description:
The rules of the game, for example, start out with this explanation: “Unlike other board games, nobody really wins at Administration. During the game each player gets poorer as, little by little, all money and property pass into the hands of the Administration. Thus the game is much like real life.

The object is to remain “financially solvent” if possible and the winner is the player who is still able to pay of his debts at the end of the game.

As one plops around the board, after a throw of the dice, he is able to pick up certain pieces of property.

These include such holdings as “The Managed News Service”, the “Re-run TV Network,” the “Feather bedded Railroad”, the “Lemon Auto Co.,” the “Rusty Steel Co.,” and the “Big Brother Power Co.”

HOWEVER, THERE ARE other blocks to land on and some of these carry rather snide directions such as:
“Collect $2,000 for information on fellow taxpayer.”
Or, “Election time; Administration exacts your contribution. Pay $3,000.”
Or, “You are remanded to public psychiatric hearing for remark critical to the administration; lose one turn.”
Or, “You get free Medicare but each other player pays tax of $1,500.”

Apparently, the game can get quite complicated. Quoting again from the rules: “When a player lands on another player’s privately owned property, rent shown on the deed is paid as follows:
1. The landing player pays rent to the property owner.
2. The property owner is taxed half of his rent by the Administration, except that unions are exempt from this tax.
3. If the property has a union, and if the union is owned, the property owner pays half of his remaining rent to the owner of the union.”

Still another aspect of the games comes in the collection of cards the player must draw from time to time.

These are broken down into three groups, “Planning, Court Rulings and Favoritism.”

The Planning cards include such directions as:
“Share the wealth. Give $5,000 to the player who has the least cash.”
“Administration announces a new welfare program. You get something for nothing. A new tax. Pay $5,000″.
“By extensive correspondence, you refute Administration claim that you owe $600 in back taxes. Pay $500 postage.”
“Administrative planning staff hires malcontent leftist professors recently employed by the university. Pay $2,000 staff salaries.”

“COURT RULINGS” cards include these notices:
“You win case but must pay $1,000 to Administration for court record.”
“You lose case and are charged $3,000 for contempt of court.

“FAVORITISM” cards run like this:
“Rusty Steel Co. gets order from Communist for 190 million shovels. Administration subsidizes sale. If you own the company, collect $5,000 from the Administration.”
“Administration gives you $9,000 for concocting an October crises for the next election.”
“Collect $3,000 for not raising cotton.”
“As a relative of the chief administrator, you get cheap oil lease from Administration, which you sell back at a profit. Collect $4,000.”

According to the message on the box the game comes in, Administration is “simple enough for children” and “delightful for adults.”

name: Galilean Run
description: A press-your-luck board game for two or more players. Each player is the captain of a freighter on the Galilean Run between Mars and the moons of Jupiter. The object is to get the most supplies to each of the four major moons. The challenge is to balance fuel and cargo. Each ship carries six units of fuel (represented by dice). Each cargo token displaces a fuel die. To move to the next port roll the dice. Rolls of 1 or 2 are displaced as spent. If any fuel dice remain, move up the track. At each port you can deposit or collect cargo tokens but you can only deposit other players' cargo tokens at Mars.

name: Brawl
description:
In Brawl, two players fight to the finish. You don't win until your opponent is knocked out.

Each round, both players play a card from their hand face down, then they flip over and execute the card played in the previous round. The five cards (Block, Dodge, Jab, Hook, and Roundhouse) allow the players to use offensive and defensive techniques and combinations to reduce their opponents health to 0. If your health reaches 0, you\'re knocked out and you lose.

name: Cay Control
description:
Cay Control is a pirate themed strategy game for 2 players that takes about half an hour.

The board shows a sea dotted with islands and pirate bases on either side. Start by placing your ships on your base. On each turn you'll roll the dice and move your ships. You capture enemy ships by landing on them, but you have to bring them back to your base to claim them. Stacks of ships can be captured over and over, and you can even break out with a lucky roll.

The first person to claim all of their opponents ships wins the game.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle of Byeokjegwan
description:
Battle of Byeokjegwan is an issue game of War Drum Games' wargame mook for beginners "Battle on the Table" #1.

The Battle of Byeokjegwan is a battle between Japan and China, fought in Korean peninsula on 27 January 1593.
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Byeokjegwan

Including one mapsheet, six Chinese units, nine Japanese units, two markers and two dice. Each unit represents one commander and his troop. Rules, tutorial and historical notes are included in "Battle on the Table".

Chinese victory condition is decline of Japanese morale or killing Kobayakawa Takakage or Ukita Hideie. Japanese victory condition is rise of Japanese morale or killing Li Rusong.

name: Gaffes & Promises: WA Senate Re-Election
description:
Gaffes & Promises: WA Senate Re-Election is a mini expansion for the 2013 Australian Federal Election game, Gaffes & Promises.

It adds four new political parties to the game, along with four new event cards representing moments from the WA Senate re-election that was forced after 1400 ballots went missing.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Political

name: Racławice/Maciejowice 1794
description:
Two most important battles of the Thaddeus Kościuszko Insurection. Racławice, although they were just tactical victory, become symbol of brave and solidarity between social classes, because of the decisive role of scythes using militia knowns as "Kosynierzy" (Scythe-armed). Battle of Maciejowice was the last battle of Thaddeus Kościuszko Insurection. Polish forces, outnumbered by Russians, lost the battle.

Game was published in 38 issue of magazine "Taktyka i strategia". It uses "Napoleon" system rules.

Each battle has two scenarios:
- Racławice (for Racławice)
- Kosynierzy (for Racławice)
- Maciejowice (for Maciejowice)
- Wzgórze (for Maciejowice)

name: Penguin Smash
description:
In Penguin Smash, players are a group of penguins that can not take the cold. To stay warm in the south pole, they figure out that they can just smash each other to keep body temperature high! (What a genius penguin!)

Penguin Smash is a dexterity game in which players will put one hand on the table and take turns flipping one card from his/her own deck of penguin cards by the other hand. If the total number of the revealed penguin cards matches the corresponding penguin player's status card, everyone must race to SMASH that player's hand on the table. The first player to smash the penguin player's hand scores all the corresponding penguin cards. The player who manages to SMASH the most penguin will be the master of penguin smash and win the game.

Be alert! Some special cards will put your penguin into sleep or sent it to dinner, and therefore making the SMASH not easy as you may imagine.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Copy Catwalk
description:
Here comes the CAT FASHION SHOW! Dress your cats up and have them show off your fascinating costume design on the catwalk stage! Whoever earns the greatest fame after three fashion show seasons will be crowned the Master of Catwalk. But be alert! Don't let those copycats get all the fame out of cloning your masterpiece!

In Copy Catwalk, players earn fame points by carefully playing their cat cards (number 0-10 plus three Copycat). Cat cards with higher number (more gorgeous costumes) win you some bonus, but only if no one play the same number as yours. Playing Copycat cards grants you no fame points, but they give you chances to copy other players scored costumes in the end of every season.

Manage your cat cards carefully, predict your competitors' next move wisely, wish for the best luck using your Copycat, and you shall become the Master of Copy Catwalk!

name: Das ist des Deutschen Vaterland
description:
Objective: be the first reaching space 60; increase patriotism - learn more about German history/cities
- moving by turns -

Simple 'Roll & Move' game; buy in first; starting in Berlin each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on a marked space follow instructions.

Note:
Likely published early 1930s
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing, Travel

name: Microvores
description:
Microvores is a 2-4 player game in which players assume the role of a microorganism, and must choose to seek out food, avoid toxins, attack other players, evolve, mutate, or subdivide during their turn. The winner is the player who had the last microbe alive, or is the first player to begin their turn with 5 microbes.

In addition to the beginning and ending administrative phases of each player's turn, the 3 key phases are the Metabolism Phase, the Drift Phase, and the Action Phase. During the Metabolism Phase, the player must choose to pay food or take damage to fuel their turn's activity. The Drift Phase involves randomly determining where to place food, toxins, and special particles on the game board available for all players to consume. The Action Phase allows players to choose one action: Hunting & Gathering (includes moving, eating, and attacking), Evolving, Mutating, OR Subdividing.

Evolving costs a player 3 food, but allows them to draw an evolution card at random which grants their microbe(s) abilities, possibly to move further, attack harder, and/or have some other unique ability. Mutating costs a player 4 food (and one evolution - if any), but it increases the total number of evolution cards a player can have in play, the base movement, and the base damage of the player's microbe(s). Mutation also allows some damage to be healed. Subdividing costs a player 5 food per subdivision, but each subdivision creates a new microbe on the board for the player, allowing them alternate start locations each turn, an extra life should a microbe be destroyed, and moves the player closer to a win condition.
categories: Animals, Educational, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Monopoly: Auckland Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Auckland, in New Zealand.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Momonga Jump
description:
The momonga (Japanese for flying squirl) siblings are leaving the nest, jumping from tree to tree and collecting food. Who will be the first to establish their own nest and win the game?

Players take turn swooping the velt momonga from the tree branch to the landing tree in the center. Your momonga lands successfully if it sticks to the landing tree, which is divided into 3 parts by 2 lines. Depending on where your momonga lands, you either move 1, 2 or 3 spaces on the circle tile surrounding the landing tree. If you land on a tile with a paw print, you collect a food by taking one of the outer circle tokens. If you land on a tile where there is another momonga already, you can steal a food from that player.
There are 5 different kinds of foods and the aim is to collect 4 different types. The place where you gathered the last of the required food tokens will be your nest. Next you have to go around the forest one more time to inform your friends of your new home. The first player to complete the circle and land exactly on their own nest, wins the game.

The game also includes leaf tokens. You can exchange a food token for a leaf token. A leaf token can be played for one of the following two actions:
1) You momonga is allowed to try one more jump.
2) When another player's momonga is making it's jump, you can blow from behind the landing tree to hinder them.

The rulebook contains a few optional rules to change the base game and some other game variants.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Zombie Invasions Basic Game
description:
Zombie Invasions is a Zombie Apocalypse Survival Horror Combat System developed by Frugal Rock Games. This board game allows for 2 - 5 players to take on the role of either Survivors or the Zombie Master in a strategic turn based fight for survival.

Survivors must employ their wits and a selection of weapons in order to defeat wave after wave of shambling nightmares. Meanwhile the Zombie Master who takes control of the horde must use superior numbers and devastating attacks to bring the Survivors down at any cost.

A game or 'wave' consists of two distinct phases. The Encounter and the Post Encounter.

The game is designed to bring fun, strategic thinking and competitiveness to the table top by employing robust Action Point and Health Point systems, as well as the scoring of Earned Points which allow Survivors and the Zombie Master to buy new weapons or zombies.

Zombie Invasions is designed for consecutive games, 'waves' to be played for as long as the Survivors can live up to their name.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: ¡Santiago y cierra, España!
description:
"¡Santiago y Cierra, España!" is a solitaire wargame on the Reconquista in the Iberian Peninsula.

The player is in charge of the Christian Kingdoms that tried to recover the peninsula from Islamic control. He begins in a few regions of the north, with initial troops. Each turn he decides where to attack, places the reinforcements he receives, being able to choose which type of troops are send. Leaders are an important aspect of the game, and will be appearing throughout the game, and may be eliminated by combat or a natural death by old age. The IA will try to stop our progress, replacing the cities we attack, creating troops near conflict zones, which can counterattack if you do not plan your defense well. After the last turn of the game, your level of victory or defeat depends on the number of zones you've managed to reconquer.

Available as Vassal module, will be available in Print & Play as future (along this 2014), both free versions. (Rules English).


Wargame en solitario sobre la Reconquista en la península Ibérica.
Nos pondremos al mando de los reinos cristianos, que intentaran expulsar y recuperar la peninsula del control Islamico.
Comenzaremos en unas pocas regiones del norte, con unas tropas iniciales.
Cada turno deberemos de ir decidiendo donde atacar, e ir colocando los refuerzos que recibamos, pudiendo elegír en que tipo de tropas gastarlos.
Los lideres son un aspecto importante del juego, e iran apareciendo a lo largo del juego, pudiendo ser eliminados por el combate o de muerte natural por vejez.
La IA del juego irá intentando detenernos en nuestro avance, reponiendo las ciudades que ataquemos, creando tropas cerca de las zonas en conflicto, y pudiendo llegar a hacer contrataque si no eres capaz de planificar bien tu defensa.
Al acabar los turnos del juego, tu nivel de victoria o derrota dependerá del numero de zonas que has logrado reconquistar.

Disponible como modulo de Vassal, a lo largo de este 2014 estará disponible como Print & Play, ambas versiones libres.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Dilemma
description:
Dilemma is a two-player strategy game in which players compete by moving pawns around the board to collect tiles worth varying points.

The 49 tiles are placed in a preset pattern on a 7x7 grid, and two pawns are placed on top of two tiles in the central diagonal. One player can move the pawns along columns, while the other moves them along rows. Players cannot move the same pawn they moved the previous turn, so strategy is built around knowing which choices your opponent has next, and working to make those choices miserable — thus putting them in a dilemma. Some of the tiles affect the board when collected: moving tiles or pawns, returning pieces to the board, or stealing tiles from an opponent. When neither player can move, the game ends and whoever has the most points wins.

Skillful maneuvering and forethought are the name of the game in this engaging, classical board game.

name: Spurs and Sprockets: Revolutionary Decks
description:
Spurs and Sprockets: Revolutionary Decks is a stand alone game for 2-3 players. It includes 3 new Spurs and Sprockets decks and a new set of rules that will allow players to combine it with the basic Spurs and Sprockets decks to allow for 4, 5 and 6 players to play at the same time. The game decks also include artwork used with the new Flanking rules.

Spurs and Sprockets is a perfect information, abstract strategy game. Players have eight matching tiles that they take turns placing orthogonally into a grid, in an attempt to link three or four in a row. There is no board in Spurs and Sprockets so the grid grows organically, based on the placement of tiles. The grid also varies in size and dimensions based on the number of players.

Spurs and Sprockets sets comes with sixteen tiles and rules for many different ways of playing, ranging from a simple Tic-Tac-Toe-like game where players gain 8 points for four in a row and 3 points for each set of three in a row, to a game where every placement of a tile may result in an attack and removal of another tile.
categories: Abstract Strategy, American Revolutionary War, Card Game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Crisis Averted
description: Crisis Averted After listening to the community of BGG we have decided to make the game free to print and play. We have taken the time to ensure the game is a fun experience for all ages and enjoy a healthy debate on your favorite comic book icons. Welcome to Crisis Averted! Players will be dealt cards representing different iconic characters from popular culture, using knowledge of these characters they will avert the crisis set before them. Crisis Averted can be best described as a role-playing multiplayer party card game; where creativity is pivotal to winning. Crisis Averted fuses traditional role-playing storytelling elements with a competitive party game format. The game uses a Judge System, one player per round is the Construct, from their hand of five Crisis Cards they must devise of scenario to the other players.
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Party Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Zombies

name: Boreml 1831
description:
A game about the battle of Boreml (April 19th, 1831) which was biggest cavalry battle during the Russo-Polish War (November Uprising).

Game was published in 33 issue of "Taktyka i strategia" magazine. It uses "Napoleon" system rules.

name: Victory Under Sail
description:
Victory Under Sail (VUS) is a quick-playing miniatures game of fleet naval battle during the last century of the age of sailing warships. It is designed for a small number of players to recreate the larger battles of this era in a reasonable time. It is not an overly simple game, but it is designed to have simple and quick mechanics to speed play.

Each side has a fleet of ships (represented by counters or miniatures) subdivided into squadrons. VUS is based on squadron maneuvers rather than individual ship movement, although each ship is individually moved within the requirements of the planned maneuver. The movement system uses a true 12-direction movement system on a hex grid that is unique among games of this genre. Squadron maneuver cards and random event cards recreate the challenges of command & control of a fleet of sailing warships.

VUS uses a “Hordes o’Dice System” for combat that is based on the use of different types of dice to represent various types of cannon batteries. The dice mimic the results of a traditional combat results table without the need to reference charts.

The game includes more than 30 scenarios from 3 wars.
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Nautical, Wargame

name: Blood Oath: The Beginning
description:
Game Play Variants: There are 2 game play variants of the game, 1 vs 1 and the free-for-all 3 way battle. The Recommended Variant is the 3 player free-for-all game which is the basic setup of the game's gameplay. The game can be played 1 versus 1 which will still use the play mat and will still use the unit positioning area such as the left/right flank unit placement.

Game Objective: Reduce all opponents’ Leader life Points to zero.

Game Setup:

1. Select Race Players choose which race they wish to play and thoroughly shuffle their decks. Pass each deck counter-clockwise to next player for reshuffling until it goes back to the designated player.

2. Place Leader Card Each player must place their leader Card in the field (playmat designated area). A Leader Card starts with 30 Health Points. (If a leader’s life points drops to zero, that player is eliminated from the game).

3. Determine Play Order Randomly select which player will go first. After the first player’s turn, player turn order will resume in a counter-clockwise direction.

4. Draw Hand Cards All players must draw 6 cards from their chosen deck. Every play turn, players can draw 2 cards in their library. All players can assign up to 2 cards on the mining placement area which will produce 1 gold per card per turn. The more cards assigned to the mining area, the more gold it produces. However, re-assigning the cards/using the cards from the mining area has an additional cost of 4 gold. It is the penalty for the cards being re-assigned as unit in the field.

5. First Turn The first player begins their turn and performs the actions described in the Play Sequence section of these rules.

Game Play Sequence:

These are all the actions a player may perform during their turn. Each action must be completed in the order designated below. In a free-for-all game, the player chosen to go first takes their turn. Next, in a consecutive order (going in a counter-clockwise direction), the other players will fulfill their turns.

1. Re-draw (Optional) A player can elect to declare a Re-Draw action at the start of their turn. This action is performed in place of any of the regular actions associated with a typical turn. When a player has no useful cards in their hand, they can choose to use the Re-draw action. The Re-Draw action allows a player to discard their hand of cards and draw 6 new cards from their deck. This action ends their turn. The player is not allowed to take any more actions, and will not be able to produce any Gold until their next turn. Note: If you don’t need to Re-Draw, skip this action and take a normal turn. Simply begin your turn with the collect Gold action and precede through the subsequent action steps until you wrap up your turn with the Upkeep action.

2. Collect Gold Collect the amount of Gold equal to the total Gold on all of the cards placed on the mining area.

3. Draw Card Draw 2 cards from your Race deck.

4. Activate Cards This action lets you establish and activate any type of cards, use Command cards, and/or assign new units. During this play sequence, a player may perform all four of these options: - Play 2 Card to the mining field. Note: All cards in the mining field should be placed facedown. - Play any number of Passive and Instant Command Cards. - Play any unit cards to assign any number of new units on the left/right flank.

5. Re-assign Once the unit is re-assigned from mining area to any of the field flank, it cannot go back to the mining area. However, once a unit is assigned to any flank, you can re-assign it the other flank with a cost of 2 gold.

For further information of the game's "How to play", please download the game's Rule Book.

name: The Art of Food Conversation
description:
A new game from the makers of The Art of Conversation: The Art of Food Conversation.

From the website:
Do you eat to live, or are you one of those passionate souls who lives to eat? Food is certainly enjoying a high profile at present. With hit TV shows, social sites, glossy ranks of gastro-porn at every newsagent, and the return of the dinner party, many of us have headed back towards the kitchen as well as continuing our passion for dining out.

TAOC serves up 300 culinary entrees on topics like food destinations, cooking classes, slow food, fusion, indulgent food, leftovers and bizarre food ideas. It includes a comprehensive guidebook to culinary communication, complete with fascinating endnotes.

Like all TAOC editions, it’s not a quiz – it’s not about who knows the most. Rather, it’s a communication tool that draws on your own experiences, thoughts and reactions to facilitate fascinating discussions. Even wannabe foodies and reluctant eaters will love it, because let’s face it – we all eat!

name: The King's Highway
description:
In order to improve trade, quality of life, and his militia’s ability to quickly respond to threats, the king has commissioned you and your team to complete highways between the towns and villages throughout his Kingdom.

The king’s highway will be constructed with dice having highway segments on their faces. Players work from a communal pool of dice and take turns placing sections of the road to earn prestige. Of course, whoever completes the highway earns a boost of prestige. Be careful, though, completing the highway before all of its paths are finished will cause you to lose points.

Because the king is too busy to pay attention to who did the actual work, whoever has the most prestige at the end of the project is given the credit, the glory, and the money!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Network and Route Building
publishers: Lagniappe Games, The Game Crafter, LLC

name: Top Deck
description:
A game of guessing, bluffing, and betting to out-wit your opponents and collect the most points.

Comes with everything you need for 2 - 6 players. You can play a couple of matches for 15 – 20 minutes of fun, or spend up to an hour playing a full game. Top Deck is designed so that inexperienced gamers can rely on dumb-luck to get by, but experienced gamers can develop specific strategies in hopes of out-thinking other players.

You will each use a personal themed deck, Bonus cards, and character abilities to compete for individual Slots. The highest bidder wins, but each slot has an increasing value, so the stakes get higher as the game goes on.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Memory, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Missionsspiel
description:
Missionsspiel (Eng. Game of Missions) was published in 1930's in Germany by Salvator-Verlag. The game is about Pope Pius XI and his Catholicism missions through continents. The players are missionaries. They start in Rome and travel around the world, until they reach Rome again.

There are two different sets of rules for the game. One concentrates more on the travel adventures, whereas the other concentrates primary on the collection of money for the mission.

- Typical roll and move board game where the first player who cross 120 stops (travels around the world), wins the game.

- The player who collects the most money wins the game.

Game board: 44 x 66 cm;
Box: 27,5 x 34 cm.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – A Deadly Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

“When the snows fall and the white winds blow, the lone wolf dies, but the pack survives.”
–George R.R. Martin, A Game of Thrones

Play the game of thrones for higher stakes than ever before with A Deadly Game, the second Chapter Pack in the Wardens cycle for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game! In this expansion, you’ll find new support for some of the Wardens cycle’s key themes: trait-based decks, limited responses, and cards that reward you for using some of the game’s most powerful and recognizable characters.

This Chapter Pack offers sixty new cards (three copies each of twenty different cards), including new versions of cards such as Brienne of Tarth, Khal Drogo, and The Eyrie. Whether you choose to bide your time with Castle plots, create decks based on traits such as Dothraki or House Tully, or observe and strike from afar with House Arryn, you’ll find the cards you need in A Deadly Game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Edge Entertainment, Fantasy Flight Games, Giochi Uniti, Heidelberger Spieleverlag

name: Odkrywcy Internetu
description:
Odkrywcy Internetu (Explorers of the Internet) is an educational board game designed for children and teenagers. During the game the players will learn some tips about staying secure in the Internet but also how to not break various laws using available resources on-line.
In the game the players will gain levels of knowledge in various skills, useful while using the Internet. These skills will be helpful when some dangerous events occur. So one should better be ready and score as many points as they can while they still can! They will also need some luck to get the most wanted benefits and they should always have some free space in their memory to remember some very important facts. The player with most points at the end of the game will win.
publishers: Wojewódzka Biblioteka Publiczna i Centrum Animacji Kultury w Poznaniu

name: Parasprite Panic!
description: Parasprite Panic! is a fan-made cooperative board game based upon Hasbro's My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic franchise. The game, which draws upon events from the television series (particularly the Season 1 episode, "Swarm of the Century"), can support from 1 to 6 players and has an approximate running time of 45 - 60 minutes. Players assume the roles of the series' primary ponies (the 'Mane 6'), who must, through the use of an action point allowance system, stem the spreading tide of devastation by abating the swelling swarm of cute but calamitous parasprites while simultaneously attempting to rescue the injured citizens of Ponyville and preventing the utter destruction of their town.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kings of War: Hellfire & Stone
description:
Hellfire & Stone is a supplement for Mantic's fantasy mass combat game, Kings of War (KoW). In addition to Kings of War scenarios and background, it also provides a scenario for Dwarf Kings Hold, a dungeon exploration/fighting game of Mantic's set in the same fantasy world.

From the publisher: Hellfire & Stone is a narrative campaign for Kings of War, featuring an epic conflict between Dwarfs and Abyssal Dwarfs. As well as six scenarios that link up the story of the campaign, you will find an optional Dwarf King’s Hold scenario plus full rules for three new models: Arhak Soulbinder, Berserker Lord Sveri Egilax and the mighty Dwarf Bombard, as well as painting guides for some of the units involved in the war.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Fore Par Table Golf
description:
Bumper Golf is a deluxe version of the carom golf game, you might play at a Parks and Recreation building. The game board depicts an entire 18-hole golf course. Players shoot their 'balls' (wooden disks) from the numbered tee spots and aim for the equivalent numbered 'hole' (cup depression.)

There are two ways to play. In the first version, each player plays each hole one at a time keeping track of his shots. At the end of 18 holes the player with the fewest strokes wins. For a more interactive game, players alternate taking shots, thus allowing chances to block off holes or knock other players balls out of position. In this version the first player to complete the course is the winner.

This original game by World Wide Games would later be republished as Bumper Golf after an acquisition by S&S Worldwide.

name: La Battaglia di Gravellona Toce 1944
description:
Gravellona 1944 è la simulazione della battaglia di Gravellona Toce, svoltasi tra i partigiani della Repubblica dell'Ossola e i reparti repubblichini nel Settembre 1944.

Una simulazione tattica con diversi spunti interessanti!

Regole in italiano, pedine di gioco e tabelle!!

The game represents the battle between Italian partisans and republican fascists in September 1944. It is a tactical simulation with interesting ideas; units can do Actions by using Action Points, which are gained at the end of each turn and which must be planned carefully by the player.
Combat units are usually at platoon level or single veichle; each unit has a different capacity of fire, depending from the type of fire (Infantry, Tanks or Artillery) and the type of target (Infantry, Tanks and Veichles, Concrete targets). Morale tests and Hit results can apply on Fire, as well as during Melèe.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Able Archer
description:
"Able Archer" is wargaming systém, which will put players into role of company or battalion commanders durning fictional conflict in 1983. You will assume command of NATO or WARPAC ground forces. You will lead tanks,infantry but even artillery or airforces. You will be fighting in conflict that was greatest fear of every politician and commander durning Cold war. Can you defeat Soviets before they could reach the Rhine? Or will you lead final push towards the Paris as Soviet commander?
Able Archer unlike many games situated in Cold war gone hot scenário, is played in 1:1 scale. That means 1 vehicle represent one vehicle, base of infantry represents team and so on.
In smaller games you will lead companies, while in larger games you can command battalions or even regiment worth of troops.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Lords of Conquest
description:
Lords of Conquest is a strategy game of territorial struggle. You begin by taking turns selecting territories on a game map. Because of their locations and wealth, some of these territories will be important and powerful, while others will be insignificant and weak. The rich ones contain "resources" such as Gold, Horses, Iron, Coal, or Timber, which you will work to acquire because of the powerful weapons and cities they can buy.

The action in Lords of Conquest takes place in yearly cycles. Each year has four of five phases. During each phase, you will have an opportunity to make decisions in preparation for that year's action. The first phase is Development, during which you can invest in new weapons and cities. Development begins during the second year, and is the first phase of all subsequent years. The other phases are 1. Productions, in which your resource-bearing territories produce wealth; 2. Trading; 3. Shipment, in which you have an opportunity to move either your wealth or some of your forces to a more strategic location; and 4. Conquest, in which you relentlessly assault your neighbors' territories.

Battles between territories are decided on the basis of the number of supporting territories and forces (in the form of weapons, horses, boats and cities) held by each side. During the year, all the players will have a chance to expand their territories and wealth at the expense of their neighbors. Ultimately, you become strong enough to start building cities. The first player to build three cities, and successfully defend them for a year, is the winner. One last word of advice, show no mercy, and expect none! Not everyone has what it takes rules the world.
categories: Dice, Territory Building, Video Game Theme

name: Fleet: Arctic Bounty – Captain "Peg Leg" Louder
description:
A new Captain Card that can be used with the 1-2p variants and is the toughest Captain yet!

Text says:
Reveal the top boat card at the start of the launch boats phase. If it a 2 coin boat card add it to Captain Louder's fleet, if not, discard it.
During the auction phase, Captain Louder will be on licenses even if has already won one that round. He may win more than one license during the auction phase.
The auction phase end remains unchanged

Available as PnP (found in the Fleet: Arctic Bounty files section) as well as a physical card from Unpub 4
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Nautical

name: Das Turnier
description:
In the game Das Turnier, players try to get the most supporters in a big medieval tournament and lead their knight to victory.

The game lasts several rounds, where players place their workers on the board. Depending on the kind of worker and the field the worker gets placed on, they get different advantages, such as improvements of their skills, the possibility to build stands or money and equipment. Also there are different regions on the board in which the majority of workers gives the players special bonuses.

Besides placing workers the player also have cards to play which can give you an advantage or spoil your opponent. Since the game is about a medieval tournament, there sure are some fights. These fights are resolved with custom fight dice. In the fights, the players use their collected equipment to gain advantages.

Another important part of the game is building stands for the crowd that is going to watch the tournament. There are different stands that will provide space for different kinds of supporters. The more supporters one knight has at the end of the game, the more victory points he will get.


In "Das Turnier" versuchen die Spieler mit ihrem Gefolge die meisten Anhänger zu gewinnen, um ihren Ritter zum Sieg zu führen.

Das Spiel verläuft über mehrere Runden, in denen die Spieler ihre Gefolgsleute auf den Spielplan setzen. Abhängig von Feld und eingesetzter Einheit bekommen sie dadurch verschiedene Vorteile, wie Verbesserungen ihrer Eigenschaften, die Möglichkeiten zu bauen oder Geld und Ausrüstung.

Zusätzlich können die Spieler karten ausspielen, um ihre Gegner zu behindern oder sich Vorteile zu verschaffen. Da es um ein Ritterturnier geht, dürfen auch kleine Scharmützel nicht fehlen, die durch spezielle Kampfwürfel ausgetragen werden. Dabei kommen den Spielern die im Spiel gesammelten Ausrüstungen zu Gute.

Außerdem können alle Spieler Tribünen erbauen, was zum einen Punkte bringt und ihnen zum anderen ermöglicht, eigene Anhänger in die Arena zu locken, die ihnen wichtige Punkte bringen.

name: Gaudim Barcelona
description:
Gaudim Barcelona is a board game that encourages people from 5 years old until 99 to enjoy Barcelona. It is an amusing opportunity to reminisce about the trip if you have already had the chance to visit Barcelona before or to discover for the first time this fantastic city with friends and relatives. What seems certain is that you will all have fun walking around the city.

During the game, the players act as visitors who plan to spend 5 days in Barcelona. You have to help each other out in order to find a souvenir for each of you. You will experience the benefits of group travel. You will be assisted at the Tourist Office, which will be your meeting point as well as reference point. You will visit squares, monuments and singular buildings. The Mediterranean diet, awarded Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity by Unesco, will set the pace of your stay in Barcelona.

Goal of the game
All visitors must get their souvenir before leaving Barcelona, that is, before the tourist bus reaches the airport/harbor.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Feral Frontier
description:
Feral Frontier is a space themed worker placement in a universe where humans are long extinct. In the absence of humanity animals have continued to evolve and have taken to the skies. Human artifacts are extremely valuable and thought to hold mysterious powers, and one has just been detected at a long abandoned corner of the galaxy. So fire up your ship, gather your crew, and prove yourself the most dominant to claim the artifact of humanity.

The game has many exciting mechanics, including:
Worker Placement
Variable Player Powers
Modular Board
categories: Animals, Humor, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Praeda
description: A man to man assault on a Roman fortified camp, set in the times of roman conquest of Gaul.

name: Husaria: rycerska gra planszowa
description:
Husaria - rycerska gra planszowa is easy wargame for youngest adepts of such games. It focuses on the fictional battle between Polish Commomwealth and Osman Empire. Players goal is to eliminate enemy's leader or more than half of enemy units.

Game contains board, plastic counters, rulebook and six multi colored dices.

name: Blenheim 2004
description:
The "Blenheim 2004" rules were written specifically for playing large to very large battles of the war of the Spanish succession such as Friedlingen, Speyerbach, 1st Hochstedt, Schellenberg, Blenheim, Ramillies, Oudenarde and Malplaquet down to the battalion and squadron level - these being the smallest tactical element.
They are designed for multiplayer (8 or more) and the command and control is aimed at using a separate player for the commander-in-chief and a separate player for each division.

Figure scale is variable depending on the size of the figures used, any size could be used and it is suggested that players use whichever size they wish.
categories: Age of Reason, Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Variable Set-up

name: Strike Legion Tactical Rules Compendium
description:
More than just a simple compilation of the four books in the Strike Legion Tactical series (the award-winning Strike Legion Main Rulebook, Module 1: The Genome Gambit, Module 2: The Clockwork Armies and Skunk Works), the Strike Legion Tactical Rules Compendium contains one of the most complete game systems available on the market today for playing ‘hard’ Science Fiction or Science Fantasy miniatures battles using small-scale miniatures (2mm to 15mm).

While the easy-to-learn core game rules and procedures (including Strike Legion’s unique, integrated Electronic Warfare system) have not changed from their original versions, many of the procedures around those core rules have been simplified or standardized. All of the various weapons and systems whose use was formerly tracked using check boxes on unit Data Cards have been modified to simple (Depletion or Usage) die roll functions, obviating the need for most written records during game play, and many other sections have been edited or re-written for better clarity and ease of implementation.

Every section of each rulebook has been collated and consolidated into a unified whole, with all related rules being found in their respective sections. Some of the rules, vehicle systems and infantry attributes have been removed or consolidated to single entries to avoid redundancies, and a few new rules and options have been added for those wishing to implement them.

Each section that has been significantly altered has been marked so that veteran players will quickly be able to grasp the differences and improvements in how the game is played. While the Strike Legion Tactical Rules Compendium is not written in a progressive learning format, sections that are not critical for new players to learn before their first game are also clearly marked, allowing them to begin their first game in short order.

Additional game features include:

6 general scenarios playable with any forces, with some scenarios offering significant suggested variants to change the nature and scope of the action
100 pre-designed unit Data Cards representing the four human and two non-human factions involved in humanity’s First Secession War, along with organizational charts for each faction.
A revised Unit Construction section that allows players to create their own forces ranging from savages with bows and spears to genetically modified (or grown) troops and bio-mechanical vehicles, from historically-based armies representing any period (including the modern or alternate Victorian eras) in recorded history to the wildest (or strangest) visions of combat in the far future taken from the players’ favorite SciFi novels, TV shows, or films
New options for Overwatch order resolution, Air Strikes, and Stomp attacks by Walkers and Large Organic elements
Rules for solitaire play
Revised graphics for all Data Cards and informational markers, including edit-enabled blank Data Card PDF forms for players wishing to field their own unit creations.
Revised game reference charts that include all of the ‘basic’ To Hit, Hit Location, Terrain, Damage, Infantry Combat, and Crew Quality Test procedures and modifiers
The scope and scale of combat in Strike Legion Tactical have not changed: a player’s forces are grouped into platoons of 2 to 4 individual squad, guns, or vehicles and each player can easily handle a reinforced battalion on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Nam Dinh
description: Nam Dinh is a traditional game from Vietnam. Both the soldiers and the king move one square along the line in any direction. They capture by jumping over a friendly piece, landing on an enemy piece. (It is not allowed to jump over an enemy piece.) Capture is not mandatory. A soldier is prohibited from capturing a king. You win by checkmating or stalemating your opponent's King.

name: Don't let them get you
description:
Don´t let them get you is a solitaire game originally designed for the 2014 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.
It can be played using two standard decks of cards and a few other playing pieces.

The basic game´s theme is as generic as the material used -
its a typical escape the dungeon board game:

You have to go somewhere you are not welcome,
you have to fulfil a task (or three..),
you have to get out of there before they get you!

For a less generic game experience there will be thematic add ons that contribute new rules that define the setting the game takes place in.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement

name: Dinos, Dice and Dynamite
description:
It’s the late 19th century, and you and your rival are paleontologists seeking academic notoriety in the American West. The rivalry is fierce, and you must manage your crew, defend against verbal and physical attacks, or sabotage your opponent’s research in order to discover new species of dinosaurs, or important scientific discoveries. Your goal is to have more victory points (academic notoriety) than your opponent when the draw deck runs out.

Dinos, Dice and Dynamite is a solitaire game designed for the 2014 Solitaire PnP contest. Each round, the player must supply and then decide which activities they and their crew (dice) will do, from finding new sites to dig, to studying fossils, to sabotaging your opponent's discoveries.

The player places generic cubes and six sided dice to mark these choices. The dice may give a bonus to some activities, but they might also prompt a reaction from the AI controlled opponent. The player may nearly uncover a new dinosaur, only to have their work destroyed by a jealous opponent. A combination of careful planning, and riskier sabotage is needed to earn more victory points than your opponent.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement

name: The First War
description: An empire-building game for 2 players in which they utilize discovered terrain, four types of pieces and technology cards to their utmost efficiencies. Conflict is entirely deterministic, depending on position and availability of forces, but technology, terrain and reinforcements are determined by varying levels of randomness. In particular, players have some control over which technologies they decide to pursue and some control over the types of reinforcements that appear.
categories: Exploration, Prehistoric, Print & Play, Territory Building, Wargame

name: Petite Pastiche: Extra Commissions #1
description:
This is the first of three mini-expansions for Petite Pastiche. Only compatible with the "Petite Pastiche" edition, not with the first edition or international edition of Pastiche.

This expansion pack consists of 3 extra commission cards, with artworks by Franz Marc, Domenico Theotocopuli, and Vincent van Gogh.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Educational, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Lo Sbadiglio del Drago
description:
Che noia, essere un invicibile drago. Nessuno osa più entrare nella stanza del tesoro, e non basta il luccichio delle monete per divertirsi. Cosi il drago decide di lanciare la sfida: lascerà passare il migliore. Ed ecco il tortuoso sotterraneo riempirsi di eroi, principesse, maghi, nani, impostori e presenze invisibili. Ma occorre fare presto, prima che arrivi il suo tremendo sbadiglio!

How boring it is to be an invincible dragon. No one dares to enter the treasure room, and not just the glint of coins to have fun. So the dragon decides to launch the challenge: I will let pass the best! From that moment the tortuous underground filled with heroes, princesses, wizards, dwarves, thieves and invisible presences.
But they must act quickly, before they gets its tremendous... YAWN!

name: Petite Pastiche: Extra Commissions #3
description:
This is the third of three mini-expansions for Petite Pastiche. Only compatible with the "Petite Pastiche" edition, not with the first edition or international edition of Pastiche.

This expansion pack consists of 3 extra commission cards, with artworks by Edouard Manet, Sandro Botticelli, and Edgar Degas.

Adds the following three new commisions:
- "The Fifer" by Edouard Manet
- "Virgin and Child" by Sandro Botticelli
- "Dancer with Bouquet, Curtseying" by Edgar Degas
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Pot O' Gold
description:
Pot O' Gold is a colorful, fast-paced family card game. Each player takes on the role of a leprechaun trying to be the first to complete their rainbow and get the Pot O' Gold - but they have to be wary of the other devious tricksters who have the same goal!

Pot O' Gold includes nine different cards, each of which have actions associated with them. These include seven different color cards - Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, and Violet - that may be played sequentially to form a player's rainbow or to take an action that will help them manage their cards, get new cards, or attack another player. There are also two special cards: Pot O' Gold acts as a Wild Card as well as the winning card; Leprechauns are tricksters who undo the last action played.

On their turns, players may play in one (or both) of two ways: to add to or to solidify their rainbow in front of them, or as an action. Hand order matters, and players must play the first card from their hand every turn; they may choose to play the second if possible. Play continues until one player has played all colors of the rainbow in order and plays a Pot O' Gold to win the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Take That

name: Noueni 5-6 Player Expansion
description:
From the developer:

5-6 Player Expansion to Noueni. You need the base game to play.

Noueni - Japanese for "On top of" describes this abstract game.

In Noueni each player has their own unique deck of 18 cards. Each card is broken up into two halves and each half has a scoring orb on it. The goal of the game is to have the most visible scoring orbs.

Laying new cards follow a simple set of rules:

1) Connectors on connecting edges must match in number (0, 1, 2, or 3 lines.)
2) New tiles can be placed next to a tile, or overlapping one half of other tiles.
3) A tile may not completely cover another fully exposed tile.

Just because the rules are simple doesn't mean that finding the best place to put a tile to cover up your opponent’s orbs and protect your own is easy.

Make sure you end up on top.

name: Magical Square
description:
Magical Square is a 'paper and pencil’ puzzle game started from the 'Match 3' games.

Each player takes a sheet with a 7x7 table and plays the game simultaneously. The game master draws and reveals 3 number cards from the deck, then each player records them in order. After that, players can check 3 or more numbers which are same or continuous in a row horizontally, or vertically, and gain some points according to the quantity of the numbers he/she checked. The player checked numbers take a bonus number, then gets a chance of additional check. When a player checks fixed times, he/she gain some special ability which would be useful for the game. The game ends when every player couldn't record the numbers, then the player with the most points wins.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Math, Number, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Darkness Comes: The Board Game
description:
Sometimes when a family moves into a new house, it's not the best place to live. It does, however, turn out to be the best place to stay forever...

Darkness Comes is a co-operative board game that tells a story of a family trying to escape from a haunted house. The game begins quickly. The set-up is gamified as the players use their cards to create the initial situation on the board. They decide which areas are haunted and which doors are closed, how much time they need to escape, where they can find useful items, what they should do before leaving the place. Every card they play increases the tension, and strange things start to happen: Menacing shadows gather, and family members' faces disappear from photographs. All these events prepare us for the forthcoming nightmare.

Then the main phase of the game begins. The house tries to ensnare the characters inside or kill them. Trying to find their way out, the family members encounter many kinds of horrors. Every time it happens, they decide whether to strengthen the house, hurt themselves, or change their plans.

Characters co-operate and support each other by transferring love points — but sometimes they have to risk their sanity to survive. And sometimes they lose their minds. That's why the rules of the game can change. The possessed character may decide to side with the sinister house. It comes as no surprise for horror fans when the father of the family gets mad and finds the axe!

name: PALEON
description:
“PALEON”, a board game with PvP tactics made in Japan, has already sold more than 340,000 sets.

In this game, you are a paleontologist who can pass through time by the time machine. You visit different eras in the Prehistory and collect the various cards of primitive life forms. When you come back to the present time, you submit these rare card you collected to “the Paleontological Society”. The player who submit the RAREST card at one meeting wins and be promoted to one higher rank as a paleontologist. When you are promoted 4 times at meetings from the lowest rank ‘a student’, you become ‘a professor’ in the end and wins the game.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Educational, Prehistoric

name: Pick a Vowel
description:
Pick a Vowel is a 2-5 player (works best with 3) board game for families. Players move together around the board collecting letters and cards, aiming to create long and high scoring words. The first player to reach the word limit (decided at the beginning) ends the game, giving all other players one more turn.

There are many different strategies that can be taken, such as; ‘lots of small words, a couple of long words, or go all out on completing objectives’.

The great thing about Pick a Vowel is no one is left idle. Even if it isn ’t you turn, you still move around the board collecting letters and cards. This makes it especially good for younger players as often children become bored waiting for their turn.
Another great aspect about the game, is the unpredictable winner. Since there are so many ways to get points, like using words which have lots of vowels, or completing heaps of objectives, by the end of the game, the winner could really be anyone.

Cards are one of the most important part of the game, as they are used to interact with other play ers, like stealing their letters, or stopping another player make a word, but also are used for perks, like increasing the value of vowels or allowing you to make two words in a turn.

Pick a Vowel has many different levels of complexity, offering a light,gentle game for children, or an intense, challenging game for adults. The use of objective cards, and letter penalties increases the difficulty dramatically. The length of the game can be adjusted by simply deciding the word limit at the beginning.

"Very cool word game with lots of interaction, interesting twists, and very little waiting time. Makes you want to play again. Why didn't I invent this game?" - Professional Game Designer and Mentor - Martin Nedergaard Anderson

"There are choices, you stay involved, there are different strategies that can work - but it rewards longer/more difficult words" - Manager of Board Games Australia

"Easy to play, good pace, enjoyable - Competitive and encourages bad blood between players" - Designer from Protospiel - Sydney 2014 "

"Fast pace, interactive, different levels of difficulty, great for all ages, can't predict the winner!" - 18 year old play tester.

name: Karatte
description:
From the designers:

Karatte the fast card game.

They are furry, make housewives scream and squeak happily themselves: Rats!
But what are they doing while they are not scavenging our trash cans or haunt the sewers?
Correct, they learn the arts of KA-RAT-TE!

Each time when the big cheese dome rings, their best fighter meet to determine the best in the legendary KARATTE tournament!

Karatte, the fast card game for 2 players.

In Karatte the players fight in the KARATTE tournament and try to hit the opponent three times. To achieve that, they pick 2 of 3 possible actions: Take breath: Draw 2 cards, attack, defend. Attack and defend are done by playing cards. The characters give special abilities that offer more variety and tactical options.

Original German description:
KARATTE, das schnelle Kartenspiel!

Sie sind pelzig, bringen Hausfrauen zum Schreien und quietschen fröhlich vor sich hin: Ratten!
Doch was tun sie eigentlich wenn sie nicht unsere Tonnen umkippen
oder durch die Kanalisation streifen?
Richtig, sie lernen die hohe Kunst des KARATTE!

Und jedes Mal wenn die große Käseglocke läutet, treffen sich ihre
besten Kämpfer und halten das legendäre KARATTE Turnier ab!

Karatte, das schnelle Kartenspiel für Zwei!

In Karatte kämpfen die Spieler im legendären KARATTE Turnier und versuchen dabei ihren Gegner 3 Mal zu treffen. Dazu wählen sie jede Runde 2 von 3 Aktionen: Verschnaufen (2 Karten ziehen), Angriff oder Verteidigung. Angriff und Verteidigung wird dabei durch das Ausspielen der Karten gemacht. Zusätzlich bieten die Charaktere, von denen jeder Spieler einen erhält noch besondere Fähigkeiten und weitere taktische Möglichkeiten.

name: Second Mouse
description:
Use your strategy, wits, and a little luck to survive Mouse hazards while stashing away the goal amount of cheese in your nest and scurrying through the levels quicker than your opponent to win!

Second Mouse is a two player game for ages 5 and up. A complete game takes about 20 to 40 minutes to play, but it can be shortened or lengthened easily. The game is comprised of several “rounds” where each player utilizes his mice to draw cards from any of three cheese piles in an attempt to gather cheese. Within the cheese piles lie cheese, traps, tools, and the dreaded cat. Each player must gather the number of cheese indicated on their “Escape” level card and get it transferred to their nest before the other player to win the round!

When a round is won, that player advances to the next highest Escape card. The first player to finish all of their Escape cards wins the game! By removing some Escape cards the game can be shortened, or conversely adding extra Escape cards the game can be lengthened.

Although the concept of the game is simple enough for even youngsters to pick up quickly, the strategy and suspense behind every card flip make this an addictive game for all ages!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math, Number
mechanics: Action Points, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Kotra: A Cardassian Board Game
description: At last, the Kotra rules are finished! These were gleaned from what little information there was in the DS9 episode "Empok Nor", as well as production notes, and the script. The rules are derived from chess and stratego, since the script described the game as being a cross between the two. Other elements, like the use of dice, were gleaned from scenes in the episode. The board design and markings are based on the fabulous concept art by John Eaves, but the rules and gameplay are mine, please do not claim them as your own.

name: Spurs: A Tale in the Old West – Gatling Gun Promo Card
description:
Spurs Gatling gun promo card.

Available through signing up for Meeple Monthly at Gen Con 2014.

Adds one Gatling Gun equipment card to the game.

Card states: Draw 1 Extra Bullet When Robbing Banks or Fighting Desperados. Costs $50 and gains one victory point.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Adventure, American West, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Monuments: Wonders of Antiquity – Phaistos: The Lost Monument
description:
The monument Phaistos was lost during the development of the game — but now it's part of the game again!

With Monuments: Wonders of Antiquity – Phaistos: The Lost Monument, nine additional cards are available for building Phaistos by each player (not only two of them). To get a Phaistos card, you must pay another card with a matching symbol. Each card is worth 6 points when being a part of a history (instead of 3 for the others).

Phaistos: The Lost Monument is the sixth expansion for Monuments: Wonders of Antiquity and was limited to 1,000 pieces that were available at SPIEL 2014.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game

name: Rising Sun Form 10s
description:
This product supports the Command at Sea (CaS) supplement Rising Sun, which provides scenarios covering the first half of WW II in the Pacific (December 1941 - November 1943). A Form 10 lists all the statistics for the ship, along with weapon ranges and hit chances, sensor ranges, maneuvering data, and a damage tracking form - all the information needed to use that ship in a CaS game.
Consisting of over 360 separate Form 10s, it provides the ships needed for all the surface battles in the Rising Sun scenario booklet. And the ships are listed in their exact configuration for each scenario. If a ship was refitted between one battle and the next, it has a form for before and after.
There are no carriers or submarines, only the surface ships, and only in the configurations needed for the scenarios in Rising Sun. There are no rules included. Players will need the CaS 4th edition rules to use these Forms.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, World War II

name: Articulate Sex
description:
Articulate Sex is a fun and educational sex themed adult word game!

​Articulate Sex is an adult game that consists of 1000+ words related to sex. Challenge your friends’ knowledge about sex and how well they can describe it!

How to play instruction cards are included inside the pack and on the official website. The game has been designed to integrate with other word based board games, such as Articulate!, Balderdash, and Taboo.

Each card consists of words in six categories:
Object - anything physical used for sex or to create arousal.
Action - sex activities or positions.
World location - places where adults have sex or go to find sex.
Person - porn stars, sex symbols, influential people, or people types.
Nature - human physiology, emotions, and psychology.
Random - anything related to sex!

The words in this game aim to be inclusive of all gender identities and sexual orientations. Only commonly legal activities are included.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Stabil-IT
description:
Stabil-IT (pronounced "stability") is an IT themed management game where the players aim to generate the most business value.
All players work off two central boards, one featuring the Stabil-IT matrix and the other having the resource roundel. The resource roundel is used to control the availability of resources to the players and also to establish which player is in control of the game at any given time.

Each player is managing two IT services, where each service relies upon one application and several technical services (represented in the Stabil-IT matrix).

Over the course of six rounds, each player performs actions to improve the confidence in their IT services and to life-cycle them to an updated version. Each action takes one or more resources which can be technical specialists, application specialists or analysts/test specialist.
At certain points in the game, stress tests are carried out to find the weakest point in the matrix which leads to a loss of confidence at that point.

Some actions may result in knowledge being gained which can, in turn, be used to reduce the resource used from the roundel or to give business value at the end of the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Turn Order: Time Track

name: The Rumplebum Academy for Bug-Based Baking
description:
Welcome to the Rumplebum Academy for Bug-Based Baking! You have enrolled at the finest culinary school for young Trolls in all the Kingdoms! Under the guidance of Chef Cordelia Rumplebum, you will be taught the fine art of baking delicious foods with only the finest ingredients: crunchy, juicy, savory bugs!

The Rumplebum Academy for Bug-Based Baking is a lighthearted memory and set-collection game. The players are trolls who are going out into the forest to turn over rocks, looking for bugs. They'll use those bugs in the recipes they bake back at the school. But they'd better be careful, because sometimes they'll turn over a Knight who might attack! Then again, they might find a beautiful Princess to help with the next dish.

name: Explorers of the Lower Vistula
description:
Explorers of the Lower Vistula region is a family and educational board game for 2-4 people. In the game the players are put in the roles of travellers who step by step discover and combine in pairs the most interesting and and the most beautiful places of Sztum county.

The rules are very simple and you can learn them in 5 minutes. The game will provide plenty of fun for the whole family. By playing this game you will discover historical, natural and cultural attractions that are worth visiting and exploring.

In the game there are two options available: for kids aged 4+ and 8+.

name: Panzerarmee Guderian
description:
Expansion for Moskwa 1941 that covers fights around Tula in second half of November 1941.

Contains board and 84 new counters.

name: Fierce Battle! Kawanakajima
description:
Fierce Battle! Kawanakajima is a game of the battle of Kawanakajima which occurred on 10 September 1561 (Fourth Battle of Kawanakajima).
One player commands the Takeda forces, the other the Uesugi forces.

name: Pixel Tactics: Mercenary / Gerard Matranga
description:
Pixel Tactics Promo card that is a kickstarter/convention promo

Card text: You can attack with any hero in your unit, regardless of the current wave. Each of your heroes can only attack once per round. You can attack during the round 1 ceasefire
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Pixel Tactics: HD Leader Card – Shekhtur Lenmorre
description:
