Pixel Tactics: Shekhtur Lenmorre is a single leader card for use in either Pixel Tactics or Pixel Tactics 2

Card text: Whenever a hero in this unit is defeated, that hero immediately makes a free melee attack. ( The damage from this attack occurs after checking all casualties if it happens during the end of a wave. )
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Pixel Tactics: HD Leader Card – Cadenza
description:
Pixel Tactics: Cadenza is a single leader card for use in either Pixel Tactics or Pixel Tactics 2

Card text: Your heroes and leader take 1 less damage from attacks
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Spin-Out: A Pod Racing Game
description:
User Description

A fan set of miniatures rules are inspired on the Pod Racing from the movie Star Wars - The Phanton Menace.

The rules require some models of pod racers, some six side dice, deck of cards, tape measure and some scenery.

Each turn in the game has four phases which each player must complete before the next players turn.

Each turn of racing the player can speed up and move his Pod in a straight line or turn it, but there is a chance he will Spin-Out his Pod or even stall its engine. There are even rules on how to ram other Pods (just like the movie).

At anytime in the game each player can play a card which can benefit him or play on anther player (dirty tricks).

The winner is the player who crosses the finish line first.

The rules are free and avaliable from The Armchair General website.
categories: Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Dungeon Twister: Dwarf Elf Slayer
description:
(4/2) (Goodies, 2008 Championship of France)


The Dwarf Elf Slayer gains a +1 combat bonus against elves for both attack and defense.



He can go onto the same square as the wounded elf and can use him like a shield. The dwarf keeps the +1 combat bonus as long as he is in the same square or an adjacent square as the elf (even in attacks against other characters).



He cannot move the wounded elf.



He is a dwarf, and like other dwarves gains a +2 combat bonus when attacking with the Runic War-Hammer.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Maze
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Modular Board, Secret Unit Deployment, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Stabil-IT
description:
The second edition of this business strategy game has improved pieces, extended features and more set-up options.

Stabil-IT (pronounced "stability") is an IT themed management game where the players aim to generate the most business value.
All players work off two central boards, one featuring the Stabil-IT matrix and the other having the resource roundel. The resource roundel is used to control the availability of resources to the players and also to establish which player is in control of the game at any given time.

Each player is managing one or two IT services, where each service relies upon one application and several technical services (represented in the Stabil-IT matrix).

Over the course of six rounds, each player performs actions to improve the confidence in their IT services and to life-cycle them to an updated version. Each action takes one or more resources which can be technical specialists, application specialists or analysts/test specialist.
At certain points in the game, stress tests are carried out to find the weakest point in the matrix which leads to a loss of confidence at that point. If there is no confidence to lose, an incident occurs.

Solving an incident may result in gaining permanent or temporary knowledge which you can use to reduce the resources needed for your actions or retained to give points at the end of the game.

name: Free Ski: The Card Game
description: In Free Ski players are skiers who attempt to navigate the challenges of a randomly generated ski slope while taking jumps and trying to get to the bottom of the hill as quickly as possible. Terrain cards are drawn from randomized decks and each player has their own ski deck from which they draw cards that allow them to change direction and gain points as they progress down the slope.
categories: Card Game, Exploration, Print & Play, Racing, Sports
mechanics: Grid Movement, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Boom Bokken: "Perfect" and "3 Hit Combo" promo cards
description:
Those promo cards are special goodies to Essen 2014.

The "Perfect" card can be played at any moment. Indicate a player, choose a number and make a call (more or less), and the game goes on.

The "3 Hit Combo" card is played as a Timeout : indicate a player who place the previously played cards under the draw pile, then draw 3 cards, and restarts the game
mechanics: Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: StormChasers
description:
You are a Storm Chaser in Tornado Alley. Get pictures of the twisters to earn money, upgrade, and expand your Storm Research Vehicle fleet. The player with the most money at the end of Tornado Season wins.

StormChasers takes place over 10 rounds or at the end of the round in which all tornadoes have dissipated, whichever comes first. Each round starts with the Tornado Phase, in which tornadoes are spawned and moved according to the Tornado Deck. Following the Tornado Phase is the Action Phase in which players spend action points to move vehicles and take pictures of tornadoes. Money is gained from taking pictures with the first pictures earning the most money, and further pictures earning successively less. Following the Action Phase is the Upgrade/Cleanup phase. Here you must balance end game money with upgrading to better protected and faster vehicles.

Gameplay occurs on a 20x20 hexagonal grid. The board is littered with many different type of "Landscape" tiles [house, barn, and field tiles] that inhibit movement, but also provide bonus points if a picture is captured during destruction. These tiles are placed randomly during setup. Road tiles are also included and provide bonuses to movement. Road tiles are placed either according to scenario rules or by each player in turn order.

The tornadoes are spawned and moved via the "Storm Deck" which is built during setup. The game's speed is dictated by the number of spawning cards, with the higher ratio equaling a faster game. Tornadoes dissipate randomly via dice and time track mechanic.

At the end of the game, players count only money on hand. The player with the most wins, ties are broken in favor of the player with the most pictures taken.

name: Slicks: Tracks & Tricks – Expansion #2
description:
With Slicks: Tracks & Tricks – Expansion #2, up to ten different tracks may be created for your Slicks races.

On the front side, you get a very short curve right back to the finish line, enabling you to take a race over the full distance of six rounds. On the back side, you find a piece of track to enlarge your circuit to three sheets, connecting one track part with the pit lane and one with the curve of the basic game.

New options are saving fuel and tires by driving over matching symbols on the track. This allows you to stay out of the pit lane longer.

Tracks & Tricks can be played with the basic game alone or can be combined with Slicks: Tuning-Expansion #1.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Tactical Cube 001 Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the grand prize for the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, Resistance is Futile.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Urbania: Catty Corner
description:
This Promo Expansion adds 5 tokens(1 per player) that allow a player to, once per game, renew diagonally instead of orthogonally.

It also has alternate rules for building renewing.

name: Chef Showdown
description: In short rounds players race to capture as many of the image tiles as they can. Each player has three character markers and a deck of cards with multiple images on each card. Everyone flips through their deck as quickly as they can looking for the image that exactly matches an image on one of the three tiles in the center of the playing area. If they find a match, they use their marker to claim it. If someone else's marker is already there they knock it off. Players try to claim as many tiles as they can and when the timer runs out whoever has their marker on a tile gets to collect it. Player with the most tiles at the end of the game wins.

name: Road to Heaven Board Game
description:
Road to Heaven Board Game is a fun multi-sensory game created to bring families together & bring the Bible alive in the hearts of all ages and backgrounds thereby drawing them to God and on their own Road to Heaven. The Road to Heaven was developed to provide people of all ages and backgrounds the opportunity to experience and learn the Word of God as spoken through our Lord Jesus Christ and as written in the Bible while having fun through an interactive multi-sensory game.

Travel 157 spaces from worldliness all the way through the cross and end at Heaven’s Gates. But beware. Do you have what you need to get into Heaven? Along the streets paved with gold, players will learn how to live a true Christian life. Players will need to think strategically as they meet up with temptations and worldliness, a simple roll of the dice can determine your fate. Will you roll one die or two? Which piece or card will you decide to take? Encounter the forgiveness of the Lord and rejoice will the blessings showered upon you. The Holy Spirit is your guide, helper and companion throughout the game. As you play you will: Experience excitement to draw your family and friends together; Progress along the books of the Bible; Draw cards to test your Bible knowledge; Be reminded of strategies for addressing temptations in your life; Learn the difference between the wisdom of God and the foolishness of the world
Realize the importance of having the Holy Spirit as your companion and helper.

The Road to Heaven Board Game design and game pieces are biblically based and include 3 sets of playing cards (Bible Book Cards, Blessing Cards and Knowledge Cards) and the following CUSTOM plastic pieces: 13 Lambs Book of Life pieces, 6 Crosses, 7 Earths, 6 Earth Stands, 6 Tips and Reminder Cards and 12 playing tokens in the shape of the Ichthys symbol or "Jesus fish" which are typically used to proclaim an affiliation with or affinity for Christianity.

Road to Heaven Board Game comes with a full size bible and has original art work. Both the cards and plastic pieces are made of higher quality than is required and standard. A minimum price of $39.95 plus tax per game was suggested by the manufacturer (plus shipping). It is priced to sell.

Road to Heaven Board Game is a fun, family-oriented, Bible focused board game designed to be as competitive and engaging as it is spiritually enriching. It is a game that will bring families together while at the same time teach all ages the books of the Bible and the scripture inside. You learn about the Bible in the midst of the ups and downs of the action.There is nothing comparable on the market that can provide a platform to learn the Bible in such a fun and exciting way! What an opportunity to outreach and introduce Jesus to unbelievers in a non-threatening way. You never know what will happen next. We pray and know that this game will have a positive impact on your life and that you have a great time playing it again and again.

Road to Heaven is a wholesome Christian game that’s fun AND meaningful. Road to Heaven teaches you how to live your life for Christ. Learn how even good things come out of bad things that happen along the Road to Heaven. This teaches that challenges you go through become opportunities for you to help others grow.

name: Kontesa: il libro e la spada
description:
This game allow you to discover the history, traditions and folklore of an italian province, answering to many question regarding 6 big themes (history, curiosity, geography, etc..) and gaining control of areas in the map, scoring points that will lead you to victory.

A correct answer allow you to put a meeple in an area, and to draw a card that can help you during the game. During established turns in the game you will verify who control the areas, and score point accordingly.

There are many version of this game, regarding many province: Bergamo (first version), Brescia, Brianza, Padova, Treviso, Venezia, Verona, Vicenza.

name: The Beautiful Match
description: Play a soccer match. In The Beautiful Match, players have a hand of seven offensive and defensive cards (5/2,4/3,3/4,2/5 chosen at start of generic match) and two bonus cards. The players who controls the ball plays offensive cards which, combined with a die roll, give the result of action (move of the pawn on the pitch and possession). The defender can play defensive cards (challenge and closed down) which give a result with a die roll (die negative modifier for attack action, foul, take possession of the ball, etc.). When the pawn is near the goal you can shoot (roll dice; you read the result on a chart). All off soccer is here: substitutions, red cards, corners, free kicks,clearance,cross,...moreover the game could easily be modified with houserules. The rating of teams of the beautiful game could be used in the beautiful match.so you can use the beautiful game to play the majority of matchs of the season and the beautiful match to play derby or most intersting matchs.the number of cards is 7 in generic game but this number can be given by a conversion of the rating of the teams given in the beautiful game.

name: Glyphs
description:
Glyphs is a 4 player trick taking game based on Whist. It plays similarly to hearts, spades, and bridge, but with expanded play. Players will create a shape of cards, called a Reference Glyph, and then attempt to gain ownership of it by recreating the actual Glyph through trump style game play. One team must attempt to create the glyph of cards through play, while their opposing team tries to deny them points.

Glyphs is played in turns comprised of three phases. The first phase involves creating the Glyph of cards. The second phase is the conflict to build and control the glyph. The third phase is scoring for the Aggressor team.

name: Soda Jerks
description:
Colaville is the soft drink capital of the world where the soda fountains never run dry. Drug stores have popped up all over town, serving up endless varieties of tasty concoctions. In this “take that” style game, players take the role of a Soda Jerk at one of these drug stores where they will try to make as much money as they can by bringing in customers who want what they have, while sending soda and customers to other players to try and cost them money. Stealing customers and soda will help but a fire could strike at any time, forcing a player to start from scratch. The game ends when the draw pile is exhausted with the player who made the most money being declared the winner.

During the draw phase of each player's turn, players draw as many cards as there are players and play each one of them according to their rules. There are four types of cards:

Customers - Who are brought in by playing them in front of the player who drew them but they can sent to other player's drug stores instead by placing them in front of the other players.

Sodas - Like customers they can be played in front of the player who drew them or played in front of another player.

Soda Jerks - Are dealt before the game begins and gives each player a special ability that can be used once per game.

Events - A variety of events can hurt or help a player depending on which one is drawn.

name: Think Again: Promo Cards
description: The Think Again: Promo Cards is a small promotional deck for Think Again!. It gives you just enough cards to get a taste for the game, but the questions are also completely distinct from the base game, so this can serve as an expansion, as well.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: Veggie Sales
description:
Welcome to the Veggie Mall! Hold your shopping lists tight, Keep your eyes wide opened, get ready for the crazy daily sales and the veggie high! Veggie Sales is a simultaneous action game where players try to fulfill, as quickly as possible, their shopping cards with a variety of vegetables. The player, who collects the most vegetables in order to fulfill their shopping cards, becomes the happiest veggie shopper and wins the game!

How to play:
Players start the game with a certain number of Shopping Cards in hands and share a basket of random Vegetable Tokens in the center of the table. The youngest player shouts out “Veggie Sales!” and everyone tries to manipulate the Vegetable Tokens in the Shopping Basket so as to match the compositions on their Shopping Cards. There are three things players can do:
(1) put ONE Vegetable Token into the basket,
(2) remove ONE Vegetable Token from the basket, or
(3) swap exactly TWO Vegetable Tokens in and out of the basket.
If a player thinks that they can fulfill one of their Shopping Cards in hand, they immediately play the card in front of them, grab the Shopping Basket, and perform exactly one of the three possible actions to fulfill the card they have just played. If it successfully matches the card, they place the Shopping Card, face-up, beside them as their scores, and return the basket to the center of the table. After that they give exactly one Shopping Card in hand to any one player next to them. However, if they fail to match the card, they must turn over one of their scored card (if any), face-down, and return the basket to the center of the table, and other players may try to play cards and grab the basket for themselves.
The game ends immediately when one player has got rid of all their cards in hand. All players count the total vegetable icons shown on their scored Shopping Cards. Whoever collects the most vegetable icons wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Print & Play, Real-time

name: Spinergy G-Rings: Mmm...Chocolate! and Hullaballoo
description:
Two themed ring sets for the game Spinergy.

Mmm...Chocolate! is a 3-ring set with words pertaining to chocolate. (ie- fudge, sprinkled, dark)

Hullaballoo is a 3-ring set with words pertaining to sounds. (ie- car alarm, sonar, mosquito)
Added Rule: In your response, you must create the sounds represented by each of the 3 words.

The rings from the two sets can be mixed and matched with each other or with the rings of the base game or other expansion.

name: One-Minute War
description:
You and your opponent each command a tiny army of five soldiers. Each round, you and your opponent simultaneously choose one of your soldiers to fight. However, not every soldier is created equal--some are stronger than others, and some have special abilities. Can you anticipate your opponent's move and choose a soldier that will beat his? Will he make the "obvious" choice, or will he pull a bluff...or a double-bluff? Win the war by defeating all of your opponent's soldiers, or having more remaining soldiers when the war is over.

This game requires one card (included in the download) and three hands--one of yours, one belonging to a friend, and another one of yours to hold the card. No tabletop needed.

name: A Call to Arms Rules Supplement 1
description:
The A Call to Arms Rules Supplement series brings you an array of new rules, information, articles and ships. It is an invaluable resource for any A Call to Arms player and will change the way you play your games!

Within Supplement 1 you will find wide variety of new articles designed to expand and develop the way you play A Call to Arms. Whether it is new rules for incorporating hyperspace and space stations, advanced fighter combat, or an in-depth study of the Centauri Maximus frigate, you will find something to get your teeth into. Scenarios and campaigns haven't been forgotten either, and you will find and exciting Raider campaign ready to run as well! With the Second Battle of Quadrant 14 scenario plus updates of those in the main rulebook, Supplement 1 is packed with great additions for A Call to Arms!

name: A Call to Arms Rules Supplement 3
description:
The A Call to Arms Rules Supplement series brings you an array of new rules, information, articles and ships. It is an invaluable resource for any A Call to Arms player and will change the way you play your games!

Within Supplement 3 you will find wide variety of new articles designed to expand and develop the way you play A Call to Arms. With complete fleet listings for the Vree Conglomerate ande the aggressive Drazi Freehold as well as a scenario pitting the Army of Light against the Vorlons, plus massively expanded Refit tables, A Call to Arms Rules Supplement 3 is not to be missed!

name: Friends & Foes
description:
A Fantasy Team Brawler Board Game. Play as one of seven unique characters in this exciting, easy to learn game of fantasy combat.

Guided by modern game design principles:

No Player Elimination
Simultaneous Turns
One Hour Play Time
Easy to Learn and Teach
Deep Strategies


Game Play Highlights:


Play on teams and use teamwork and strategy in head to head combat.
Draft characters or deal them randomly.
Build your character by choosing your abilities before the game starts.
Play one ability per turn, simultaneously. You have access to all of your abilities every turn.
Gain and spend "focus" using your ability cards.
Reveal rune cards for bonus effects on the ability you play.
Play a "level up" ability to add a wild card to your rune deck, giving you better odds on bonus effects for the rest of the game.
Move and attack using your ability cards.
Make meaningful choices about how to spend focus such as:
Tactical Movement
Fast, high damage attacks
Level up for a late game strategy

name: Agents of SECTOR
description:
To better combat the rising tide of terrorism and threats around the globe, a new commission has formed. Comprised of elite teams from several intelligence agencies of the United States, SECTOR is mandated with the front-line defense of freedom and liberty.

But someone has to lead this organization, and you plan on being the one chosen as Administrator. So be prepared to defend against espionage and sabotage… and to commit acts of both to come out on top!

Over 12 rounds (weeks), each player will choose to place their three agents to perform one of the following options:

Perform an Action
Work a Mission
Get Help from The Agency
Play a Resource
Appropriate Resources

Managing resources wisely and completing missions will gain you Merit Points. Direct, make shady deals and even sabotage other agencies to become the best! The best managed agency at the end of the 12th week/round is the person who has earned the most merit points.

name: Kasernenleben
description:
Objective: be the first arriving at target space 50
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game;
translation of the title "Barracks life".

remarks: the theme seems not to be a perfect platform for a 'Children's game', but the educational touch of the rules well.

name: Shut the Front Door
description:
Shut the Front Door is a simultaneously turned, fast paced matching game about childish insults. The deck contains 50 cards each with 6 childish insults and one compliment on them. There are 30 different insults spread among the cards.

The rules contain several variants but the main mechanic of each is to find matching words between cards, shout it out (Cootiehead!) and discard or add the cards to another pile faster than the other players. Variant rules include relay races, shouting out only the compliments, penalties for making mistakes and even drinking games for adult players.

Other decks in the series, available separately, share the same rules but have words with different themes such as Sci-Fi or Shakespearean insults.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: Clinic Expansion: ICU free bonus tile
description:
This expansion only contain a free bonus specialized module to thank the BGG users, it can be found in the upload section with the rules. They allow the author to improve the first version of the English rules.

This new tile allows the player to treat one patient without removing it with his car. A red Patient becomes Yellow and an orange Patient becomes White.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Simulation, Tile Placement

name: Dungeon Storming: La Cripta di Razidar
description:
From the back of the box:

"Alone, in the depths of the dungeon, surrounded by monsters. A priestess and a thief fight their way trhu hideous ghoul back from the dead. Rich treasures await you, with which you can get new weapons, armor, spells and scrolls.

A collaborative game for two players or solo. It can be played with more players by combining two or more sets of Dungeon Storming!"

The game is played by moving the miniatures of your heroes on the map, room by room, battling the monsters with a simple roll of a die, dodging the traps, collecting treasures and magic objects, until the heroes reach the last room and try to overcome the boss monster (the heroes can exit the dungeon and buy new objects with the money found).

The map and the layout of the rooms for this dungeon are fixed (all the tables for the encounters, treasures and magical objects are printed on it), but it can be played with four levels of difficulty.

name: Pithecus
description:
Pithecus is a simple close tactical combat game. The players control groups of early primates: Ramapithecus on one side and Australopithecus on the other.

The primates are rated for strength, movement, and morale. Each may take one of four actions (attack, stay, flee, or fight) each turn, but must make a morale check first. There are some simple terrain rules. Wounds and death are recorded by rotating the "counters," which are actually folded paper cubes.

Two maps are provided, each in two sections.

The game was one of Kaylor and Humrichouser's Games With Depth, which all used folded 3D paper pieces.

Note: Ramapithecus is today not regarded as its own genus, and in any case lived millions of years before any of the Australopithecus species.

name: De Schout van Lokeren
description: Against the background of the history of the City of Lokeren (a city in Flanders, Belgium) players try to acquire local products (pigs, hares, hats, linseed, corn, turnips) and sell them on the market. With profits made on the market players can construct buildings or improve their modes of transport (cart, horse and cart, truck). In the meantime players can obtain title deeds and chance cards which are worth victory points. The one with the most victory points at the end of the game wins.

name: Six Days Campaign: 1814
description:
Covering the 1814 campaign in a half sized magazine game.
This game uses the same simplified card-driven system as Conquest of Shinshu from the same designer.

The map covers the Eastern France from Sedan to Paris.
The 110 counters includes leaders, strength points and markers.
The game uses only 16 cards.

The victory is basically determined by moral of each force. If one side's moral drops to zero, he instantly loses the game.
Coalition player wins the game by eliminating Napoleon or controling Paris, he also must take a number of important cities each turn.

Issue game of Command Magazine Japan #119.
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Hoppers: Chinese Vampire Action Adventure Game
description:
What are Hoppers? Hoppers are Chinese vampires (a.k.a. Jiangshi). Unlike the blood-craving vampires of Western myth that turn into flying bats, Chinese vampires do not transform and their bodies become stiff. The only way for them to travel is to hop and that’s why they are called hoppers (well, that’s why I call them that).

Hoppers is a 4 to 9-player action/dexterity party game for all ages. In the game, players are guardians of the realm and each holds a power stone that gives them the ability to travel into the Mystic Forest. Player must beware, however, because one of the players may be a demon in disguise and hold the evil Hopper Stone.

Each game of Hoppers is played over the course of up to five rounds. In each round, players attempt to pass a dexterity challenge in the Mystic Forest and only successful players can examine the stones of power. When a player’s matching power stone is found, the player has the ability to capture the Hopper Stone and win the game. Otherwise, the game ends in the Hopper’s Way and all guardians disappear into the dark of the Mystic Forest.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Zombies

name: The world of Stena: let the game begin
description:
From the back of the box:

This is the game about the Stena Sphere. You buy, sell, swap and build Stena's various business areas to win. You will also meet unforeseen events on your way towards honour, success and fame. By using good businessmanship, timing and some luck - hopefully you will end up as a winner! read the rules carefully. No cheating and let the game about Stena begin!

User Summary:

The game plays in a similar manner to Monopoly. Although the board layout is circular, and you're bidding more for assets, employees and properties. The aim of the game is to bankrupt your fellow members.

The hotels and houses of Monopoly are replaced by Head Offices and Offices respectively.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Oklahoma Boomers: Sante Fe Railroad
description:
Oklahoma Boomers: Santa Fe Railroad is a mini-expansion for Oklahoma Boomers, that adds railroad tracks to the game.

The railroad tracks are placed on the board at the beginning of the game so that they connect two sides of the board. If at the end of the game, a homestead is divided by the railroad tracks into two or more sections, then the player can only score one of these sections. However, of two or more boomers share a homestead divided by railroad tracks, then more sections can e scored.

The mini-expansion contains 15 black railroad tracks.
categories: Abstract Strategy, American West, Territory Building, Trains
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Enclosure

name: Grubfist: Gamblin' Goblins
description:
Grubfist: 3-7 Players. Plays in 15 minutes. Matching / Trading Game. Comes with 7 sets of goblin goodies and 6 gemstones. Standard and optional rules included.

Grubfist is a game of matching sets with things you might find in a goblin’s belt pouch. Players of all ages will find the game tempting to pick up and play. While passing frogs, ants, bits of chain or blunted fish hooks, players may feel the urge to cheat… which is not only allowed, but totally expected from time to time in a goblin’s cave.

The game includes matching sets of goblin goodies which bring a unique feeling to game play, bright plastic gemstones for the final grubbing of each round, and instructions for standard and optional rules.

Keep your favorite goblin treasure, and pass the unwanted to your fellow goblins. Cheat if you feel you can get away with it, and when someone grabs for the gemstones… don’t get kicked out of the cave. There can only be one goblin king!

name: Psychedelic Quilt
description:
Psychedelic Quilt is a solitaire game that merely requires a single set of A-Type Nestortiles, but could instead be played with a piecepack — although the more suits the better. Build a quilt (of any flat shape) according to the Quilting Rules, so that every swatch is part of the quilt.

Setup
Shuffle all swatches face-down. Draw 1 tile of each color and place them face-up in front of you.

Play
Stitch (attach) one of your face-up swatches to the quilt on the table according to the Quilting Rules below (obviously, the first swatch attaches to nothing, and ignores the Quilting Rules). If there are any remaining face-down swatches of the color you just attached, draw a replacement of that color; otherwise, you get no replacement.

Quilting Rules

A swatch can only be stitched to a swatch of a different color.
A swatch can only be stitched to a swatch with one more or one fewer pip.


Game End
If you stitch all swatches into the quilt, you win; otherwise, you lose.

Achievements
If you win the game and complete any of the tasks below, check them off! Check them all off to prove your quilting capabilities!

Rectangle: Your quilt is perfectly rectangular.
Magic Rows: Each row adds up to the same total.
Magic Columns: Each column adds up to the same total.
Magic Rectangle: Each row adds up to the same total (X) and each column adds up to the same total (Y). X does not need to equal Y.
Small Square: Play using only 5 colors and the numbers 1 through 5 of each; make your quilt perfectly square.
Baby Sudoku: Each number appears only once in each row, each number appears only once in each column. Thus, each also adds to 15.
Magic Sudoku: Each number appears only once in each row, each number appears only once in each column, and each number appears only once in each of the two diagonals. Thus, each also adds to 15.

Large Square: Play using only 6 colors, and make your quilt perfectly square.
Sudoku: Each number appears only once in each row, each number appears only once in each column. Thus, each also adds to 21.
Mind-Wrecking Sudoku: Each number appears only once in each row, each number appears only once in each column, and each number appears only once in each of the two diagonals. Thus each also adds to 21. Is it even possible?


Candy-striped: Each row of your quilt alternates between only 2 colors.
Donut: Your quilt has a fully surrounded hole in it.
Ghost: Your quilt has 2 fully surrounded holes in it.

name: Turbo Ludo
description:
This game is a reimplemention of Ludo containing a the normal 4x4 player pawns, a Globe-ludo die (with four numbers, a star and a globe) and a redesigned Ludo board:

The board is like in the normal Globe Ludo, but with added features;
Orange spot = Move 3 ahead
Green spot = Move 2 back
and a spot for taking a chance card.

The basic rules are the same.

name: L'Alaska
description: French game called "L'Alaska" could also be called - "The Hunter". It is about hunting in Alaska. Players are going around the map. The first player, who cross finish line - wins the game.

name: The Barbie World of Fashion game
description: Traveling around the world, Barbie and her friends are teen fashion models: meeting new dates and earning money to buy kicky fashions. Rolling a die, players move around a 3-D molded playing board, attempting to land on spaces where they can receive date cards or earn money to later buy clothes cards at Shop spaces. Once a player has at least 5 of these cards, they make their way back to London in order to win the game.

name: Hvem Bliver Millionær?
description:
Easy roll-and-move which contains a bit of math:
The board resembels a Monopoly board and contains with 24 "value" spots and more.

The goal: Get one million.

The 24 cards are placed under the board on the right space so it can be seen and taken.
When a player lands on a spot (s)he can take the cards under the board - if the card is taken by another player you take it from that player.

When you have one million you are the winner.
You can also play where you play either "x dice roll" or "x mintues" and the one with the most money is the winner.

The game is made before 1948.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Able Dog Skyraiders over Korea
description:
Skyraiders over Korea is a light solitaire war game that and is in no way meant to be an accurate representation of the Korean air war.

You play as a navy pilot flying strike missions against North Korean targets in an Able Dog, AD Skyraider from USN Valley Forge from July 3rd – 19th July 1950.

You will need to balance the mission success against the Skyraider's ability to absorb damage and decide whether to perform another attack run or head for home. It is a fine balancing act and one that can result in mission success or becoming a POW.

Welcome to the “happy valley”
categories: Aviation / Flight, Korean War, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Idiom Link
description:
English description:

Idiom Link is played with a thirty-six grid square dial. Players have to make words. Each word has to start with the last character of the previous word.

Chinese description:
「連線字龍」遊戲為ＭＪ工作室所設計的中文成語填字遊戲。(ＭＪ工作室成員為Michael Lou樓齊賢、Jack Li李子建)
「連線字龍」遊戲是由三十六個格子所組成的方形字盤，字盤中置入了十個「字龍文字」，可組合成三組頭尾相接的成語，就是後一個成語的頭一個字必須與前一個成語的最後一個字相同（例：「花言巧語」的「語」，接「語重心長」的「語」）。請根據字盤中十個字龍文字的提示，先確定可組合成那三組頭尾相接的成語；再將字盤中的十個字龍文字按照三組成語的頭尾順序，在線條不交錯、格子不重覆的方式下，用一條線將字盤中的三十六個格子全數串連起來（即以第一組成語的頭一個字為起點，第三組成語的最後一個字為終點），即可完成極具高難度的「連線字龍」遊戲。

name: A.I.M. Agents for Infiltration and Mayhem
description:
Every government needs a secret team for spying, hacking and destruction
A.I.M:- Agents for Infiltration and Mayhem

Agents for Infiltration and Mayhem are a team of special agents with a variety of skills and talents. Different combinations of the A.I.M. team are deployed for different mission.

Your mission, should you decide to accept it, will be to defeat all the challenges thrown at you and save the world.

In A.I.M. you play a secret “off the books” government agency who are given deniable missions to achieve.

Think A-Team meets Mission: Impossible meets Charlie’s Angels meets Man from Uncle. Here is your chance to re-create those great TV and film shows for yourself.

Gameplay
A.I.M. is a deck builder game. You select one or more roles and mission scenarios and a small starting deck. As the game progresses you develop your deck of talents, weapons and equipment. You will face increasingly stronger challenges: locks, thugs & military teams, computers to hack, people to charm and confuse.

As you overcome challenges you earn the ability to collect additional cards from the Quarter-Master.

But you must beware of other agents hidden agendas and possible plot-twists that will really test your abilities.

Every agent has their own agenda, it may be to protect the other agents, to make more money, to progress further – or maybe they will have to betray the team…
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Airship Assassin
description:
This is Captain Fredericks of the Graf Zeppelin. We shall shortly be concluding our New York to London transatlantic flight. I would hope to wish you to enjoy your trip, however we have had word from the secret service that we have a King and an Assassin on board. The King is travelling incognito for his security. we do not know who the King is. The Assassin is also unknown to us. You must find and identify the assassin before our voyage is over.

Each guest at your party takes on a role, maybe Diamond Thief, Body Snatcher, Police Inspector, Hypnotist and more. Each card has certain powers and lets you look at another players card. In that way, each guest can work the room until they can identify the Assassin and the King. BUT! Players can swap cards – so who you thought was the Assassin might be someone else by the time the game ends!

There can be several winners. If you have met your personal objective – as set on the card you hold at the end of the game – you are a winner. Also, if you can identify the Assassin – you are a winner

This game is a variation on the idea and mechanics first seen in 2 Rooms and a Boom, but re-engineered for longer and more free-from party play.

The pack of 60 cards is available for download and print and play.

In addition, you will need to link to one of the sound files which acts as a timer through the game.

Select the sound file you want depending on how long you want the game to last.

You can play the sound file direct from the website, or you can download it for playing on PC, tablet or MP3 player.
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Humor, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Chepy
description:
Chepy is a mini version of Pawn's Shephy solitaire card game. It was released at Tokyo Game Market 2014 as a set of 4 postcards, 3 of which are the Chepy playing cards (6 per postcard) which must be cut out prior to playing. The last card is a double sided rules card. All cards are Japanese language only, unlike the dual language (ENG and JPN) Shephy.

The rules are basically the same as Shephy, but scaled down slightly. The player starts with one sheep in their field, and must manage the event cards presented to you in order to accumulate ONE HUNDRED sheep in the field before you go through the deck of event cards three times.

The sheep deck consists of values 1, 3, 10, 30, and 100; at the start of the game, you place a 1 sheep card in your field, then shuffle the event cards and lay out three cards to form your hand. On a turn, you choose one card, carry out its effect, then refill your hand to three cards. Event cards might duplicate existing sheep cards, add new ones, swap one value of sheep for another, remove sheep, etc. Play through the deck until you have no cards in hand, then shuffle the event cards.

If you go through the deck three times without having at least one 100 sheep card in the field or if at any point in the game you have no sheep in the field, then you lose.
publishers: Adventure Planning Service (冒険企画局 / Bouken)

name: First to Fight: Wehrmacht / Gestapo Promo
description:
The title of First to Fight refers to the famous slogan and poster distributed in European countries after Poland was the first country to be attacked by Germany in September 1939. This game, released by Fabryka Gier Historycznych (Historical Games Factory) in cooperation with Fundacja Niepodległości (Foundation for Independence), takes place throughout the entirety of World War II, with the players taking the roles of commanders of the Polish forces that are fighting on numerous fronts: Eastern and Western Europe, Africa, etc. By allocating their troops in different regions of the world, they aim to carry out missions (including the most famous battles of WW2) and earn victory points (VPs). The players do not "own" or control the soldiers, which are represented by neutral cards, moved by the players around the board, and activated only when it is the time to play a mission card in a given region; that said, their particular specialization may increase a player's chance to win a mission. The player with the most VPs at the end of the War (May 1945) wins.

Wehrmacht / Gestapo is a promo card avaialble at SPIEL 2014 at the publisher's booth. It introduces a new phase to the game and two new effects in each round, depending on whether the particular region is currently occupied or not.
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Variable Phase Order

name: A Guerra dos Tronos: Card Game – O Tempo para Corvos: Parte 1/2 do Ciclo
description:
“The smallfolk say that the last year of summer is always the hottest. It is not so, yet ofttimes it feels that way, does it not? On days like this, I envy you northerners your summer snows.”
— Grand Maester Pycelle

The A Song of Summer, The Winds of Winter and A Change of Seasons are 3 chapters, each of them with 60 cards (3 copies of 20 differents), belonging to the A Time of Ravens cycle, expansion for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. These new cards were created to complement existing decks and add a thematic variety to the A Game of Thrones: The Card Game.


“O povo diz que o último ano do verão é sempre o mais quente. Não é bem assim, mas muitas vezes parece que é, não é verdade? Em dias como este, invejo-os, nortenhos, por suas neves de verão.”
— Grande Maester Pycelle

A Uma Canção de Verão, Os Ventos do Inverno e Mudança das Estações são 3 capítulos, cada um deles com 60 cartas (3 cópias de 20 cartas diferentes), pertencentes ao ciclo O Tempo para Corvos, expansão de A Guerra dos Tronos: Card Game. Essas novas cartas foram criadas para complementarem decks já existentes e adicionar uma variedade temática ao jogo A Guerra dos Tronos: Card Game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: The Book of Prehistoric Pop-up Board Games
description:
Simple roll dice and move games with a dinosaur theme, in the form of a pop-up book with four three-dimensional boards, a set of paper pawns for each, a spinning dial and an informational booklet.

Very visually attractive and easy to grab for travel, it's a perfect distraction outside the house.

name: Planes: El Chupacabra
description:
Expansion kit for Planes: High Pilotage game.

Kit includes 1 El Chupacabra model (which you assemble snapfit) and 1 El Chupacabra Plane card for the game.

There is no additional flight stand included.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Planes: Rochelle
description:
Expansion kit for Planes: High Pilotage game.

Kit includes 1 Rochelle model (which you assemble snapfit) and 1 Rochelle Plane card for the game.

There is no additional flight stand included.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Planes: Skipper Riley
description:
Expansion kit for Planes: High Pilotage game.

Kit includes 1 Skipper Riley model (which you assemble snapfit) and 1 Skipper Riley Plane card for the game.

There is no additional flight stand included.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Task of Ezrok: The Hand of Ares
description: The Hand of Ares is a mini-expansion for The Task of Ezrok solitaire card game; set in a heroic fantasy world that revolves around druids. The player oversees Ezrok and his companions as they travel northward to destroy the Chest of Seth. This expansion provides greater game depth by adding ‘Favor” cards and new encounters via the ‘Wandering Threats’ deck. This expansion includes a total of 12 new cards along with a single page of rules.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Sixte
description:
Paraphrased from The Penguin Book of Card Games (2008 Paperback "Jack"):
This basic traditional trick-taking game calls for exactly six players, either individually (Sixte) or in two teams (Sizette).

Six cards are dealt to each player. Reveal the last card for the trump suit. Suit must be followed if possible. Tricks are won by the highest trump played, else by the highest card of the suit led.

A point is awarded for winning three tricks. On the other hand, if every player wins one trick, whoever won the first trick gets a point. If neither condition is met, no points are awarded. Play to six points.

name: Epunamun
description:
Components
64 bi-color stones
8x8 board

Setup
The board is placed between the players and starts out empty.
The 64 bi-colored stones are set nearby so that both players have access to them.
One player plays black the other plays white.

Group - a set of 2 or more friendly orthogonally adjacent stones.

Play
Black starts, turns then alternate.

On a turn a player must,

Drop 2 stones (one of each color) onto 2 empty orthogonally adjacent spaces on the board.

If a player closes off an area that contains 2 to 4 spaces, either by surrounding them with dropped stones or by using a combination of dropped stones and the edges of the board, he then proceeds to fill the enclosed spaces with his own color stones.

The game ends when a player is unable to take his turn.

Object
The player with the largest group wins.

name: Deadzone: Incursion – Campaign Book
description:
Incursion is a campaign expansion book for Deadzone that introduces two new alien species to the conflict and also outlines rules for multiplayer games to expand beyond the two-player core rules.

From the publisher:

The conflict on Nexus Psi escalates with the arrival of the dour Forge Fathers and the mysterious Asterians! Pursuing unknown agendas of their own, these two factions bring their own respective brands of urban warfare to the Deadzone! Also includes rules for multiplayer games to reflect the increased conflict
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Saint Petersburg (Second Edition): New Society Completition Pack
description:
Was available as an add-on from Spieleschmiede crowd funding Saint Petersburg (second edition)

Includes the rest of the cards of the old "New Society"-Expansion, that are not included in "The Even Newer Society" stretch goal, made with the new artwork
categories: Age of Reason, Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game

name: Lustige Reise durch Grossdeutschland
description:
Lustige Reise durch Grossdeutschland (eng. "Funny traveling through Great Germany")is typical roll and move game for children about Nazi motorway network, which includes current Germany, Austria, Poland and the Czech territories.

The first, who cross all route from Muenchen till Reichenberg (53 stations) wins the game.

This game was published in Nazi Germany around 1939-1941, because the map shows the title "The General Government". It was an occupied area of Poland that was under colonial administration of Nazi Germany during World War II, from 1939 to early 1945. The Nazi government designated the territory as a separate administrative region of the Third Reich. As of 1941 it included much of modern-day western Ukraine cities, which is not shown on the map.
Game was published after 28 September 1939, after The Molotov-Ribbentrop revised version, when the German and Soviet representatives met again to take in the Soviet sphere Lithuania and entire central part of Poland came under exclusively German control. The game board shows it.

name: Usotsuki Jinrou　うそつき人狼
description:
This game is just like many other werewolf games.
However, this game is suitable for all players, even for new players.
The difference is that each cards at the bottom there is either a + or a - which tells you the difficulty for each team. +sign for villagers team, and a -sign for the werewolf team.
Furthermore this game has 19 different characters. Below are the characters that appear in the game with their difficulty sign:

Villager: +1 (3 different art 5 each type in box)
Werewolf: -6 (3 different art 2 each type in box)
Prophet: +7
Prophet's Apprentice: +4
Medium: +2
Body Guard +3
Twins: +2 (2 cards in box)
Werewolf Possessed Human: -1
Tough Guy: +3
Crazy Person: -3
Fox Demon: +-0
Hunter: +4
Cursed: -3
King: +2
Dictator: +3
Prophet's Mother: +5
Trap Master: +4
Teen Werewolf: -4
Copycat: -1

So if you would like to make an easy game just make either side + or - or a normal game which would be +-0.
(Note all the rest have only 1 cards each in the box)

There are also 10 summary cards to let players view the effects and powers of each characters for easy playing.
Japanese required to translate the effects, but once you memorize it is really fun to play!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting

name: Deathball
description:
Deathball is a fast paced and brutal sports game inspired by others such as Dreadball and Blood Bowl. Challenge your friends in a match of this violent sports contest where a well-placed pass is just as important as a well-placed punch.

Deathball is a single-page ruleset played with Warhammer 40,000 and Warhammer Fantasy, miniatures that was designed to be fast to learn and simple to play.

Inspired by Blood Bowl and other sports games the system pits you and your friends in a fast paced competition of violently hilarious ball play.

The game is played in turns, where during each turn the coaches activate their players. Once a coach has finished activating all of his players once or has failed an activation play passes to the other coach.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dust Tactics: Axis 2014 Forces Deck
description:
These decks contain a card for every Axis model available for Dust Tactics released before January 2014, and include cards for the D-48 premium range.

Each card decks contain 100 full colour stat cards to make your force compatible with the new edition of Dust Tactics!

A copy of the Dust Tactics rulebook is necessary to use the contents of these card decks.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: Allies 2014 Forces Deck
description:
These decks contain a card for every Allied model available for Dust Tactics released before January 2014, and include cards for the D-48 premium range.

Each card decks contain 100 full colour stat cards to make your force compatible with the new edition of Dust Tactics!

A copy of the Dust Tactics rulebook is necessary to use the contents of these card decks.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust Tactics: SSU 2014 Forces Deck
description:
These decks contain a card for every SSU model available for Dust Tactics released before January 2014, and include cards for the D-48 premium range.

Each card decks contain 100 full colour stat cards to make your force compatible with the new edition of Dust Tactics!

A copy of the Dust Tactics rulebook is necessary to use the contents of these card decks.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Castle Men 4X
description:
Castle Men 4X is a 4X micro-game set in a fantasy world. Players are vying to create the most successful civilization on a small map made from just 9 cards. As each card contains multiple territories of different terrain types, the map varies from game to game.

Players must explore the terrain on the map, expand their settlements by exploiting local resources and of course try and exterminate their opponent.

To help their civilization grow they can gain knowledge which is traded in for developments that impact upon game play. 18 different developments are available to help, on just 9 cards. Each development a player chooses deprives them and their opponent of another alternative one.

Player actions are selected on a roundel, with a range of actions available each turn, although repeat actions are not possible. Each completed journey round the roundel completes a season of the year and the different seasons confer benefits and responsibilities upon players that affect the progress of the game.

Players win by being the first to accrue a specified number of victory points. Victory points are achieved through gaining developments and building developing settlements.

All components for play can fit in a 2oz tobacco tin making it highly portable, and files include labels for the lid of such a container.

name: Yakkaz
description:
Yakkaz is not available to purchase, being the third in a series of specially commissioned welcome gifts for visitors to Le Grand Massif ski resort in Haute-Savoie, France. The previous games in the series were ZOU in 2012 (an adaptation of MOW) and Kizz-Kizz in 2013 (an adaptation of Okiya).

Yakkaz is similar to Yahtzee, but instead of regular dice, five sides have images of the Tootizz, guardians of Le Grand Massif (see the Tootizz story). The sixth side has an image of Zhinzho the dragon.

On a turn, players roll the dice up to three times and mark one (or optionally two) results on a score sheet. If more than one Zhinzho is rolled, they can be used to improve an already marked score; each line can be improved only once. The highest score at the end of the game wins.

name: Me Throw Rock
description:
Lets face it, trolls are a bit grumpy and usually don't get along well with others. Fortunately for this group of disgruntled trolls they happen to be quarreling in a field full of boulders. In Me Throw Rock players play the role of trolls who happen to be in the thick of an argument that can only be settled by throwing large rocks at each other. The player who has the best accuracy wins the game!

Me Throw Rock is an eighteen card dexterity game where players throw a set of six double sided rock cards at target troll cards over a series of rounds. Every round a single target troll card is thrown onto the floor. Each player takes a turn throwing their own colored rock cards at the target card until all their cards have been thrown. The player who has the majority of three rock cards that are the closest to the target wins the round. The winner of the round collects the target card and any of the three closest cards that are showing the split side up.

The games ends after all five target troll cards have been collected or if a player has one or less rock cards to throw. After the game has ended the players must tally their points by looking at the cards they have collected. Each target troll card collected scores three points and each rock card of the players color scores one point. The player with the most points wins the game. Ties go to the player who has collected the least number of rock cards of their opponents color.

Me Throw Rock is designed to be played on the floor with a space of about 8 to 10 feet in length. However, Me Throw Rock is not limited to play on a floor and can be played on any surface with a suitable flat target area such as a table or bed.

name: Logiq
description:
This is a logic game created by Martin Nedergaard Andersen. Each player becomes a choreographer of one of the Princesses. He gets a dance board which he has to fill with tiles of five different colors. The tiles have different length and shape so each player has to think fast and grab the tiles that he needs before his opponents take them. The first player to fill his board gets 5 points but beware of mistakes! If you used a tile that you were not allowed to or a tile was wrongly placed the player receives penalty points. Additional points are scored for unfilled hexes on opponents boards.

The first player to score 25 points is declared the best choreographer and wins!

name: !Arriba Espana! Spanish Civil Wargame Rules
description:
A set of war games rule designed for 1/200th 1/300th and 20mm miniatures.

They are a brigade level set of rules, with each stand representing a company.

The Units are groups of stands representing battalion sized formations, although there are no limitations for forming units.

An option is given for 20mm variation that says it is Brigade level but is probably Battalion level as each stand represents a platoon.

The game uses a chit system to achieve simultaneous movement.

name: GeoCards Europa
description:
GeoCards Europa includes 47 cards with which players can play three games that challenge their geographical knowledge about Europe. Each card is double-sided, with the outline of a country, its name, its population and its size on one side of the card and its capital and the surrounding countries on the other. In all three games, whoever collects the most cards wins.

In the first game, shuffle the cards with the capitals face-up, then take turns naming the country depicted on the card. Guess right and you claim the card; otherwise, remove the card from the game.

In the second game, deal the cards out evenly among the players with the capitals face-up. On a turn, you hold one of your cards capital side-out toward your left-hand opponent. If he can name one of the countries adjacent to the depicted country, he claims the card; if not, the next opponent in clockwise order can try to do so. Remove the card from the game if no one guesses correctly.

In the third game, deal ten cards capital side-up to each player. On a turn, choose two cards and hold them out to your left-hand opponent. If he can guess which country is larger in size or population (depending on what choose at the start of play), he claims both cards; otherwise, remove the card from the game.

name: Schnell, Prinzessin Sissi!
description:
Princess Sissi has made a big mess in her dressing room. Now she is called to the great ball and the players have to help her find her accessories quickly.

The playing field in Schnell, Prinzessin Sissi! consists of an open 6x6 grid of tiles, with the tiles depicting six different accessories and one flowerpot. The princess is placed on any tile to start.

On a turn, any player rolls four dice: One of them shows which accessory the princess is looking for, the other three show numbers from 1 to 3 or an arrow. All players now look for a path from the princess to one of the matching accessory tiles, using the following rules: Each of the movement dice must be used to move the princess in a straight orthogonal line; an arrow lets you move the princess to the edge of the grid. At the end of the three moves, you must reach the accessory tile. The first player to find a solution calls out and demonstrates it, receiving one diamond if correct. If the path leads past one or more tiles with a treasure icon, there is a bonus diamond. If the path doesn't work out or leads past the flower pot, the player loses a diamond.

The first player to collect five diamonds wins!

name: Nika: Rules and Variants
description:
This expansion includes new variants of play and a sticker sheet with 24 stickers, 6 stickers for each color, which are attached to the back of the playing pieces.

Variant 1 - Adds a General that may order adjacent pieces to move/rotate as a free action per turn.
Variant 2 - Adds a Hero with the strength & weight of 2 men.
Variant 3 - Adds the Fury that will rout the enemy that routed the Fury.
Variant 4 - Adds a Knight that has a free action of move/rotation per turn.

From the author:

The rules and components needed for various expansions and variants for Nika.

Nika is the ancient Greek word for “Conquer!” The concept of Nika came to me in a dream while I was studying abroad in Athens. The rules were honed across nearly two years of testing. The board shape and core mechanics were inspired by ancient Greek geography and warfare. Greece has many narrow valleys and mountain passes, and sometimes the only way to defeat an enemy force was to collide with them head-on and literally push them off the field. This othismos (“shoving”) is thought to have been the critical phase of most battles between hoplite armies, who were the heavy infantry that dominated ancient Greek war for four centuries. In this game, you command a Greek city’s hoplite soldiers who must force their way through enemy lines. Your troops can push or rout those who would block their way across the narrow battlefield. Coordinate attacks with your ally to secure victory, but make sure to watch your flanks!

name: Superman Card Game
description:
Simple "Pairs" card game featuring Superman characters from the 1966 era of the comics.

Rules (From the Rules Card):
Shuffle the cards and deal one at a time until all the cards have been distributed. (Players will not all have the same number of cards.) Each player arranges his hand and lays down any pairs he has been dealt.

Player to the dealer's left begins by drawing a card from the dealer's hand. If he can make a pair, he lays them down. Play then moves clockwise, the player on the left taking a card from the player on his right. The game continues until all the cards have been paired. If a player has used all his cards he waits until his opponents have played all of theirs. The first player to use all his cards receives a bonus of five points, but his pairs can still be captured.

Using the points on each card the scores are then added up and recorded. The first player to reach a score of 50 or the player with the highest score over 50 is the winner.

A Superman card has no value alone. However, it can be used to (a) cancel out a pair of minus cards, (b) capture an opponents pair, (c) protect one of the player's own pairs. It is placed on top of the pair it has captured, cancelled out, or protected from being captured. Players must wait their turn before using a Superman card. After playing the Superman card they also draw from the player on their right. Once a Superman card is used it cannot be used again.

name: Mage Quest
description:
Long ago in Seven Cities of Gray, two adepts began quests to create libraries of spell books. They sent their allies out across the lands to gather rare elements and the mana needed to aid their growing hunger for power.

Mage Quest is a microgame for 2 players lasting about 30 to 45 minutes. The game is a prequel to Mage Clash.

The object of the game is to create four Spell Books by collecting and trading Elements while moving across lands and seas with ships and caravans.

During the game, each player has two actions per turn with players alternate turns. Players may take any action in any order during their turn and may take the same action twice.

The Actions are:
A. Build a new Ship
B. Convert a Ship into a Caravan or Convert a Caravan into a Ship
C. Move any or all Caravans or Ships
D. Collect Elements
E. Trade (within a City):
1. Trade Elements for Elements
2. Trade Elements for Mana
3. Trade Mana for Allies
4. Invoke Speed
F. Create a Spell Book
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Trading

name: Jerusalem: Extra Resources
description:
Extra Resources is a new Action card for Jerusalem. (set #2)

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

The player who plays this card receives one silver Bezant from the bank and add one Prestige point to his total by moving his cylinder one space up the Prestige Track.

name: Jerusalem: Foreign Baron
description:
Foreign Baron is a new Action card for Jerusalem. (set #2)

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

The player who plays this card gets an extra Baron (use a simple white pawn to represent him). The player may use it any time during his turn in the phase nr. 2 (even in a following round).
To use the Foreign Baron and block an Area (small or large), the player must place at least three new Squire in that area.
At the end of the round the Foreign Baron is removed from the gameboard and he is discarded.

name: Jerusalem: The Artist
description:
The Artist is a new Action card for Jerusalem. (set #2)

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

The player who plays this card removes one Squire behind his screen (return him to the supply) and add one Prestige point to his total by moving his cylinder one space up the Prestige Track.

name: Jerusalem: Pass
description:
The Pass card is a new Action card for Jerusalem. (set #2)

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

The player who plays this card may move one of his Squire inside an area blocked by any Baron. He may enter the blocked Area or he may leave the blocked Area.

name: Jerusalem: The Merchant
description:
The card called "The Merchant" is a new Action card for Jerusalem. (set #2)

Just add the card to the basic Action card deck to play with it.

The player who plays this card receives from the bank one silver Bezant for each floor built of the highest Tower on the gameboard.

name: Zhukov's Brutal Battle:  Operation Mars, 1942
description:
Zhukov's Brutal Battle: Operation Mars, 1942 is a brigade to corps simulation of the battle, in 11 2-day turns, 25Nov-16Dec42, 7 miles/11 kilometers per hex, and 35 ground units on each side. (The weather reduced flight operations considerably.)

The surrounding of the German 6th Army in Stalingrad had happened, and in the game von Kluge must try to (irretrievably) withdraw as many panzer divisions as possible to send to Stalingrad, while stopping Zhukov's attempt to retake Rzhev and erase the salient it was in.

The Russians get points for any victory point cities they take, for clearing out German defense zones along the front line, and for eliminating German units, outright or in exchanges.

This heretofore little-known battle was the subject of Col. (rtd.) David Glantz's revelatory book, Zhukov's Greatest Defeat. Historically, the Russians took horrendous casualties and achieved little, other than preventing panzer divisions from being transferred south, to try to help save 6th Army surrounded in Stalingrad.
categories: Educational, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation, Turn Order: Time Track, Zone of Control

name: Lost Legacy: The Mysterious Chest
description:
User summary:

This Lost Legacy set was first handed out as a promo sheet (2 A4 sheets) on Game Market fall 2014 in Tokyo. The customers had to cut out and sleeve the cards themselves.

Please refer to the Family entry for details on the publications of the different sets.

name: Lost Legacy: The Qualities of an Adventurer
description:
User summary:

This expansion, of unknown compatibility with all Lost Legacy sets, was first handed out as a promo sheet on Tokyo Game Market spring 2014. Unlike the other promo sheets, this is not a separate set, but a set of 8 special ability cards that are possible to use with any Lost Legacy set and that gives the player a special ability throughout the game.

The promo status of this expansion was primarily because it wasn't fully tested and the designer was not sure it wouldn't completely break certain sets or combinations of sets.

name: Algeciras 1801
description: Published in Alea magazine 32, add two scenarios and new counters for Cien Cañones por Banda (Algeciras July, 7 and July, 13 1801). also expands the rules for Gunboats and Shore Batteries.

name: TreeForts
description:
Who can build the most AWESOMEST TreeFort?
August 1978 – no computers; no cable TV; no money; no girlfriend; and no grown-ups around to nag about chores! School’s gonna start next week and you’re sick and tired of hanging at the mall and the local swimming hole. “What do you wanna do today?”…”I don’t know, what do YOU wanna do?” “Hey, let’s build some tree forts!”

Tree Forts is a fast-paced and surprisingly strategic card/board game that will take you back to the days of lava lamps, Atari video game consoles, and lazy afternoons spent scavenging for stuff to add to your fort. Players compete to determine whose fort is best - but be careful - your neighbor might have some water balloons or a mud flinger to pelt your fort (and damage your chances of winning)!

Players start with a Pallet card and use candy and resources to purchase and build additions to their forts. Each addition has a point value and when you reach a certain point value you win. Player interaction occurs through mud flingers and water balloons that may be used to remove points from player's additions.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: A Very English Murder: Murder at Woodperry Hall
description:
The year is 1955 and everything seems quite normal in the village of Thornbury and its most famous residence, the stately—yet slightly run-down—Woodperry Hall. England has been at peace for a decade, the family and guests are at the Hall for a evening meal, the cook has prepared a delightful supper, and the staff have arranged the summer’s mauve and white flowers in crystal vases in impecible fashion. Everything is simply tip-top ... except for the still-warm body found on the grounds of Woodperry Hall. Was it murder or suicide? Was it simply an accident, or something far more sinister? Oh, without a doubt it’s murder alright, and now Oxford City Police detectives will arrive and dramatically solve the case. Who will be discovered to have commited the crime?

A Very English Murder: Murder at Woodperry Hall is a three- to eight-player murder mystery game set in the fictional village of Thornbury, near Oxford, England in 1955. It is a narrative game where players cooperatively construct a story about a murder that takes place by answering questions and trying to appear innocent. Each player assumes the role of a character who is frequently found in classic English murder mystery novels. Every turn, one player assumes the role of an Oxford City Police Detective to question the other players who, in turn, build a case against each other to make sure another character is responsible for the murder that took place. At the end of the game, the Detective will solve the crime and—in dramatic fashion—reveal who the murderer is. Will you turn out to be the one who committed the murder?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Role Playing, Storytelling, Variable Player Powers

name: Trip from New York to San Francisco
description:
An unusual board game based on the "new Union Pacific Railroad".

Objective: be the first reaching space 45. Roll the die and move forward. If you land on one of the special spaces follow instructions.

The game board shows forty five beautifully executed views of places along the Union Pacific route, starting with "Rail road depot in New York" and ending in "San Francisco, the metropolis of California". Along the way, we have, among others, views of Pittsburgh, Omaha, "surprise by savage Indians", "wild heard of buffalloes", "railroad bridge over the Platte river," Cheyenne, Green River, Humboldt Valley, "Trukee" Valley, Sierra Nevada and Sacramento. The text is titled "Trip from New-York to San Francisco by the Union Pacific Rail Road. A new illustrated Travel-game with 45 stations, 1 dy, 12 cars and 12 numbers charts". The text is written in German and English and explains the game and the views. The cover of the game box (19x24) has a lovely colored litho view of two women joining hands across the American Continent, one representing America and the other Asia.

(Trivia: It is very likely that this game was also sold by the on-train concessionaire ("news butchers") on the trans-continental trains of the Union Pacific, just as promotional picture booklets were sold showing the scenic views along the route -- in other words, a tourist's memento).

name: The Game of Commando
description:
A simple version of the classic fox & geese type of strategy game using counters. Creatively set in a world war two theme using commando parachutists attacking an enemy camp.
Made by Chad Valley and looks to be early 1940s.
The game is to see whether the three commandos (yellow counters) can defeat and outwit the 15 defenders (blue counters) by moving across the board to reach the end points.

name: Ivory Towers
description: Players place dice on the hex board to form towers. Dice rolls are used to determine the coordinates where dice can be placed. Dice can be placed either on a vacant hexes (gaining power tokens), or to increase the height of the player’s towers, or used to reduce an opponent’s tower. Power tokens can be used to adjust dice throws or directly alter towers. Towers have influence over neighbouring hexes, the closer the hex and the higher the tower the more influence. At the end of the game each unoccupied hex is a Victory Point awarded to the player who owns the tower that has most influence over that hex. Victory Points are also awarded for remaining power tokens.

name: Dark Age: Devastation
description:
EVERYTHING DIES…EVEN MACHINES

We have watched the Saints of the Forsaken march across thewastes to do battle for the ruling Prevailers. The Outcasts have scavenged a living in the corners of the frontier. We have reeled in terror at the cannibal rituals of the horrific Skarrd tribes.The savage honor of the Dragyri warrior castes have dragged gasps of awe from each of us. We have even locked our doors at night against the inscrutable monsters of the Brood. The world is soaked in blood and littered with the remains of those who could not weather an existence here. It is a hard life filled withpain, suffering and barbarism……and it just got a whole lot worse. Within this book you will find a new evolution to Dark Age. This includes the Cult of Metamorphosis, a new tribal faction within the Skarrd created from the fully transformed cabal of the Heretic Saint Johann, and the C.O.R.E. – a never before seen army of tireless robots on a murderous rampage of expansion. Samaria…and Dark Age…will never be the same again.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Dark Age: Conflagration
description:
All will be reduced to cinder!

We have winessed the birth of Metamorphosis and the revival of the C.O.R.E., but now, from of the flaring sands of the east, the blazing subterranean dwellings of the Dragyri, and even the very sky above, new threats rise to challange the factions of Samaria.

Dark Age Conflagration is the newest expansion book for the Dark Age Miniature game line. Conflagration contains 140 full color and beautifully illustrated pages nestled in a hardcover binding. Inside readers will find generic forcelist additions to all of the factions as well as the forcelist of the new Kukulkani, Ancient warriors imbued with alien technology hell bent on sacrificing every living thing they come across for their alien masters. The Dragyri Sub-Faction of the Fire Caste, unlike their Air and Ice Cousins the Fire Caste use alien technology and what can be deemed dishonorable methods. The new Outcast Sub-Faction of the Slavers of Chains Barrow, these ruthless Outcasts capture and enslave those they come across without mercy or morals to fight for their amusement or greater gain.

All contents have been writen to work in conjunction with the new 2013 Core Rules.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Penny For Your Thoughts
description:
From the game's website:

Unleash the fun in your festivities with this award-winning party game! Discover cool, fun things about yourself, those you’ve known for years, or those you just met with lots of hoots along the way!

Each player uses their personal answer dials to privately give their personal "Yes" or "No" response to the card read. Players then use the number wheel on the dial to privately answer how many total players in their party they think would answer "Yes" to the played card. See how everyone answered and let the fun begin!

The game is Penny for Your Thoughts! Players score custom party pennies with accurate predictions about what the other players thought about the card read and how many they thought would answer "Yes". First player to 10 pennies wins the round. Play again--because one round is never enough!

Makes for great inter-generational play with questions meant to bridge the generation gaps.

name: Meta Chess
description: A game of chess played on a game of chess with two sets of chess pieces: a big set that carries a small set. The goal of the game is to take the small king. On a move the small pieces can either move across the tops of the big pieces or pilot the big piece they're on.
