Small pieces cannot leave their big piece board unless there is an adjacent big piece to legally move to, and can move across several adjacent big piece boards in a move as long as the move is legal and uninterrupted by gaps.

name: Rabbits!
description:
Make the biggest rabbit clan ever by expanding the warren, and finding food enough for the whole family!

Each turn, players place cards to dig tunnels, build and upgrade rooms, and find food. Players score points when there is both food and room enough for more rabbits in the warren!

This game features 7 players with unique abilities! 20 special upgrade rooms! Poker Rooms! Powder Rooms! Cigar Rooms! All original hand-painted watercolors by Aaron Youngren! A different game every time you play!
mechanics: Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Cyvasse
description:
Cyvasse is originally a fictional two-players game in George R.R. Martin's A Song of Ice and Fire series; he described it as "a bit of chess, a bit of blitzkrieg, a bit of stratego. Mix well and add imagination."

This fan-made implementation by Alex McRitchie is played on a hexagonal board and features 10 different playing pieces, including cavalry units, ranged units (a catapult, a trebuchet and crossbowmen), and special units such as dragon, war elephants and mountains.

Like in Stratego, before game starts players secretly place their units on the board, using a screen. Each unit can only capture units that are as strong as it or weaker, except that some units can "trump" stronger units: a trebuchet is the only unit that can kill a dragon. Many units have unique powers, like the ability to move twice or to attack from a distance.

name: Fighting the Flames
description:
Typical roll and move game. Players are going around the game board. The first player who cross the route, wins the game.
Great graphics feature the intrepid Ahrens-Fox fire pumper truck, a folding board is traversed by 12 cast lead miniature Ahrens-Fox pumpers in 4 different colors.

name: Dead or Alive
description:
It's not easy keeping a family close, especially when everyone can shift between their DEAD and ALIVE states at will.

In this quirky take on the fundamentals of game theory, players need to agree to meet in the land of the dead or the land of the living. If they cannot, they lose. If they can, they win. The twist is - if 1 family member is able to betray the rest, they win big, and the others lose big.

Collaborate, debate, investigate... be the one who discards all their cards first by cheating your way between the land of the dead and the land of the living.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles, Negotiation, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game

name: Music Rocks
description:
Music Rocks is a game of Music. Divide into teams or play one on one and beat each other in finding hit songs. It’s free for songbirds to sing the songs and for musicians to add optional instruments.

The symbols on the dice represent the most popular words in hit songs from 1890 to date. Roll the dice and try to think of a song lyric with the help of the symbols.
Example: The symbol of the Sun may make you think of Soundgarden's "Black Hole Sun". Or why not "Summertime, and the living is easy"? But remember, you must always be able to explain it afterwards.

The game has one basic game play and many suggested alternative rules.

name: Awkward Moment at Work
description:
We’ve all been there. Embarrassing slips of the tongue, wardrobe malfunctions, secret (and not-so-secret) workplace romances, accidental emails, bathroom mishaps, copy room shenanigans. Awkward Moment at Work is the party game that helps you play out those all-too-familiar moments — and show them who’s boss!

Each turn, players try to impress “the Decider” by submitting the best reaction to the awkward moment from their hands of cards.

Awkward Moment at Work is the adult version of Tiltfactor's award-winning card game Awkward Moment. While the game’s awkward workplace situations may be unfamiliar to kids and teens, the game is family friendly (contains nothing you wouldn’t see in a PG-13 movie).

name: The Kenya Safari Game
description:
The Kenya Safari Game is a roll-and-move game that simulates a traveler exploring the sights and tourist attractions of Kenya. Players start from a pre-chosen base in the capital city of Nairobi. They draw a variety of different-colored cards, each of which represents a different type of site or tourist attraction they must visit or an animal they must photograph on safari. They then roll two dice each turn to move around the board by a roads, trails, trains and airplanes to visit the required locations. The first player to complete all their photography assignments and see all their designated sights returns to his or her Nairobi base and is declared the winner. Special rules allow players to take flights or extra turns when rolling doubles.

Although this is primarily a roll and move game an element of strategy is introduced by the fact that players must visit a variety of sites in a variety of areas and may travel by various routes. Players who plan the most efficient routes from place to place may gain an advantage.
publishers: The East African Wild Life Society

name: Grave Robbin' Graduates
description:
You and your humble lab partner are competing in the 197th Creature Faire. To win this competition, you must rob graves and hospitals for body parts and organs to make your creation. But, don’t get to greedy - collecting extra body parts and organs will make the townsfolk angrier. If they get too angry they will storm the castle. Beware of your fellow competitors also as they can steal from you and anger your mob by spreading vicious rumors.

Be the first to complete your creature and bring it to life with electricity, proclaiming… It’s Alive!
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Arrezzo
description:
Arrezzo is played on 8x8 board with a green and a red set of 16 playing pieces with symbols on top. Each set has 2 monks (a cross ), 2 ladies (a circle), 2 lords (a star ), 6 farmers (a square) and 4 knights (a triangle).

These symbols hint on the direction of the slides and jumps every piece is able to make.
Slides are towards a free square in any ortagonal or diagonal direction.
Jumps are combinations ortagonal or diagonal jumps across your own or opponents pieces, depending on the type of piece. Multiple jumps are possible.

Starting from your own two base lines object of the game is to move all your pieces off the board on the opposite side and prevent the opponent from doing so.

name: Loonacy: Exclusive ThinkGeek Expansion
description: An expansion for Loonacy containing five new cards featuring Timmy the Monkey, ThinkGeek's mascot. This expansion was included for free in many packages sent to ThinkGeek customers.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time

name: Eldorado: La grande corsa all'oro
description: A game set in the Wild West at the time of the gold miners. In the first part of the game players turn to the cities to equip, after facing the journey to the mountain to climb and reach the large deposit of gold. During the journey will find gold and dangers such as Indians and bandits, who can overcome only with equipment cards collected before. Upon reaching the summit of the mountain by a player what he found most gold is the winner.

name: Catching Fairies
description:
Every year, the Royal Society for Folklore Studies, holds a meeting where its members can impress their fellows by showing the result of their efforts. To do so you will try to document the existence of fairies and leprechauns, supplying proof to support your claims. But be careful, for the rest of ladies and gentleman will do whatever it’s on their hands to debunk you and harm your reputation at the club while increasing their own.!

The basic mechanic consist in assembling sets of “proof cards” of the same type in order to get “recognition points” at the end of the game. Players can also try to debunk other player’s sets of cards.

This game entered the 24 hour contest - February 2015

name: Soft Fixers
description:
User summary:
Soft Fixers is a deck- building game that includes an identity-hiding mechanism. The game is quick and plays in around seven minutes.

Each player shall play one of the 6 Fixers, who dream of world domination. Players buy cards from the fixed supply of 6 cards, and try to either fulfill the victory condition or eject all the other players from the game. If your identity is revealed by an Attack, you are out of the game.

Publisher's summary:
正体隠匿システムを複合させた7分で完了するデッキ構築ゲーム。
プレイヤーは世界を自分の望むようにしたい6人のフィクサーの1人となり
6種のカードによる固定サプライを購入しつつ
自分の勝利条件を満たすか、他人を全員脱落させることを目指す。
ATTACKにより自分の正体が暴かれるとゲームから脱落させられてしまう。
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Ladybug Lunch: Ant Antics
description:
It's springtime in the garden. The sun is shining, the birds are singing and flowers are blooming. All appears well, apart from those pesky aphids. However, all is not quite as it seems. Other dangers lurk just around the corner - or should that be underground? The warmer weather is bringing ants, from their colony and into your garden, bearing gifts... aphid eggs; eggs that they have been keeping safe during the cold spells of winter. Now the time is right for the eggs to be brought to the perfect location, ready for hatching. Unfortunately, that perfect place just happens to be your beautiful flower!

As usual, the first player who clears his Garden of parasites is the winner, but this time the parasites are harder to eradicate... and there’s always a surprise or two in store!

name: But Wait, There's More!: Superhero Mini-Expansion
description:
From the Toy Vault website:

Add ten super hero themed cards to your But Wait, There's More game! The Superhero Mini-Expansion has four new Products, and Six new Features! Everybody needs a shield, that shrinks to the size of an ant!

name: Tell Me a Story: Volcano Island
description:
As the 6th set in the Tell Me a Story series, Alex Barrow's cast of characters including monkeys, elephant, tiger and more providing recurring characters, locations and props which encourage linking the cards in endless combinations for fresh, new stories every time it's played.

Instructions are included for various ways to encourage storytelling. One of these suggestions includes a simple draw and discard variation, where you build a collection of cards with the required elements for a story. The winner is first to tell a story with the cards in his or her hand.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational

name: By Hook and by Crook
description:
The year is 2035, players are megacorporations seeking to influence the world government for personal gain.

2 player area control game with a unique card flipping mechanic.

Gameplay is driven by a deck of 8 double-sided cards. A player may choose a stronger or weaker effect on each card, but when the stronger effect is chosen, the card flips to its other side where it benefits the opposing player.

Players must balance short term gains with long term benefits.

With 2 copies of the game, the game may be played with 3 and 4 players.

name: Sicilia
description:
Sicilia is a mid-weight strategy game for 2-5 players, with a 6-player expansion.

During the middle ages, Sicily was the melting pot of its day. Greeks, Italians, Arabs, French, and Spanish all mixed together on the island. Rarely did the ruling king live on the island. Instead, leaders, such as barons and dukes, were appointed to govern the island.

One such leader, the Baron Beneamato, governed the territory of Sicily. In his advancing years, he wanted to ensure that his people were governed by a good leader—a person they trusted and loved. So rather than pass his sovereignty to his evil son, he proclaimed that the people would decide who would become the next ruler. The island would now be governed as a democracy.

The players in this game are potential candidates for the throne, trying to earn a majority of support, by influence, strategy, or force. You must also learn to avoid or control the Innominato (the un-named), a secret society predating the modern Mafiosi, who will thwart any ruling power.

You all start out in your home village with minimal support and very little transportation. You must work to increase your transportation speed, out guess your fellow players to earn more support of the people, avoid duels with other players, and work out your strategy to succeed. Will you quickly try to grab the smaller villages through education? Or prove your dedication to larger villages with food and wine? Will you earn the trust of a certain region or try to please everyone in all regions? Or will you spend your resources for the benefits of Potenza cards?

name: Malifaux: Samurai
description:
Ancient warriors who live by a code of honour, trained masters in the art of death and massive gun toting Samurai.

These warriors belong to the crime family the Ten Thunders, who are a mystery to the residents of Malifaux. Their origins date back to the Three Kingdoms back on Earthside and are shrouded in secrecy and legend, though completely twisted and tainted most of their history is lies. Membership is exclusive to only those of the Three Kingdoms, sacrifice is demanded over capture then to reveal its secrets. Even the Ten Thunders' locally hired thugs do not know how their employers have been able to reach across the Breach.

name: Scramble
description:
"This is another of UPL's fascinating 'action' games. Ideal for players of all ages" - so says the cover.

Hundreds of slips are provided, each one being a match for another one. Each guest will receive a slip from the host and told if it is from a famous couplet, proverb, song or hymn. The other slips are piled on a suitable table. On the word "Go", the guests (all at the same time) must sort through the table slips until they find the match. If correct, they are given another slip and must go back to find that slip's match. The guest who pairs up the most slips in a given time will win.

Example matches:
Rank and File
Two plain and one purl
Love me, Love and my Dog

name: Into the Rabbit Hole
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver, Team-Based Game

name: Tryptic
description: Tryptic is a tile placement game involving bluffing. Players try to create multiple copies of their own (secret) pattern, without anyone else noticing, and try to determine which patterns other players are creating.

name: Kampfgruppe Von Luck: The Attack on Le Bas de Ranville June 6th 1944 – A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
Kampfgruppe von Luck is the second Pint-Sized campaign for Chain of Command. It is designed to be played using the campaign handbook At the Sharp End.

Thirty pages long, it contains an overview of the British airbrorne landings and the response of 21 Panzer Division on D-Day before then going on to present a mini-campaign covering the first counter-attack by Kampfgruppe von Luck, striking for the bridges on the Orne.

The campaign is a total of five game tables with the duration running between five and eight games. Briefings are provided for both sides, along with measurable objectives, period maps, force and support option listings and everything you need to play this campaign through to its conclusion.

Like all Pint-Sized campaigns, it is available for the price of a pint in the local pub of the publisher.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: A Guerra dos Tronos: Card Game – O Tempo para Corvos: Parte 2/2 do Ciclo
description:
With the onset of winter, the songs of ravens fill the sky. As the nights grow darker and the winds blow colder, the maesters and stewards of Westeros have taken to their castle rookeries, sending forth a flock of messenger birds with schemes and tidings that will shape the future of the realm.

The The Raven's Song, Refugees of War and Scattered Armies are 3 chapters, each of them with 60 cards (3 copies of 20 differents), belonging to the A Time of Ravens cycle, expansion for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game. These new cards were created to complement existing decks and add a thematic variety to the A Game of Thrones: The Card Game.
It's the second part of this selection, the first was A Guerra dos Tronos: Card Game – O Tempo para Corvos: Parte 1/2 do Ciclo


Com a chegada do inverno, as canções dos corvos enchem os céus. Conforme a noite ca mais escura e os ventos sopram mais gelados, os meistres e guardas de Westeros levam gralhas aos seus castelos, deixando partir um bando de pássaros mensageiros com esquemas e notícias que determinarão o futuro do reinado.

A A Canção do Corvo, Refugiados de Guerra e Exércitos Dispersados são 3 capítulos, cada um deles com 60 cartas (3 cópias de 20 cartas diferentes), pertencentes ao ciclo O Tempo para Corvos, expansão de A Guerra dos Tronos: Card Game. Essas novas cartas foram criadas para complementarem decks já existentes e adicionar uma variedade temática ao jogo A Guerra dos Tronos: Card Game.
Esta é a segunda parte dessa coletânea, a primeira foi A Guerra dos Tronos: Card Game – O Tempo para Corvos: Parte 1/2 do Ciclo
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Negotiation, Novel-based
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: The 19th hole
description:
The 19th hole is a Card and Dice Golf game for 1 to 2 players. It consists of individual course cards that depict sections of golf course holes; such as the green, the fairway, and the tee box. You put each hole together based on the course card section number on the score card or create your own course!

The cards also depict clubs [1W, 3W, 1I, 3I, 5I, 7I, 9I, Pitching Wedge, Sand Wedge and Putter]

The game is broken down in to two mechanics; clubs strokes and putting shots. You use club stroke actions until you reach the green then you change to the putting mechanic to complete the hole.

You decide the club to use and roll the dice for Power, Elevation, and Accuracy! 2D6 are rolled for each of the three main club actions.

There is a really cool dice mechanic for putting and takes into account the four different levels of play!

Beginner
Intermediate
Experienced
Professional


This game simulates golf as close as possible within a card and dice game! All golf rules apply!

You only need cut out 35 cards to play the game and use [10] D6 dice!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, Sports
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: CARRIER STRIKE FORCE: A Solitaire Game of Carrier Operations in the Pacific (1942-1945)
description:
INTRODUCTION
CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is a Game where you are a Commander of a Carrier Air Group (CAG) in the Pacific during World War II (1942-1945). Your Goal is to manage your aircraft to successfully search for and destroy Japanese Naval, Air and Ground Forces in order to bring victory to the allied forces.

OBJECTIVE
The Objective of CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is to score a pre-determined number of Victory Points (VP) by destroying Japanese Naval, Air and Ground Units. The US has up to 24 Turns to Control at least 150 VP worth of Bases OR have destroyed at least 60 VP worth of Japanese Ships and Aircraft. If the Player does not accomplish this, the Player loses and Victory is uncertain for the Allies.

GAME FEATURES
CARRIER STRIKE FORCE is a BIG Game with many counters and a 6-Sheet Map with large Hexes. Aircraft include F4F Wildcats, F6F Hellcats, F4U Corsairs, SBD Dauntless Dive Bombers, TBF Avenger Torpedo Bombers, A6M Zero Fighters, D3A Val Dive Bombers, B5N Kate Torpedo Bombers and G4M Betty Medium Bombers. Ships include Destroyers, Light and Heavy Cruisers, Battle Ships and Carriers. Ground units include Artillery batteries, Anti-Aircraft Batteries, and Convoys.

CARRIER STRIKE FORCE can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net/
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Poleaxed 2
description:
From the intro:

"The Poleaxed wargames system is designed to represent, as far as possible, the type of warfare that was waged in Western Europe during the 15th century.

The prime aim of the system has always been to wargame large battles, to get a clear cut result (pun intended) and to bring out the flavor of the period. To do this, the rule mechanisms have been made as simple as possible. Morale checks and book-keeping are kept to a minimum. The need to remove figures has been eliminated and all movement can be carried out by contingents on movement trays."

name: Hot Tin Roof: Home Turf
description:
This is an expansion for Hot Tin Roof. 4 Turf tiles are included that allow the player to claim a patio as their home turf, and whenever another player places a cat on the board from a Home tile on home turf, they must pay that player 1 can.

This expansion contains both the Turf Tiles and cans required for the expansion.

name: Le diner mortel
description:
A murder mystery dinner-style party game in which each player is assigned a role and players try to find out who the murderer is. Each player has his/her own information booklet, and five game rounds are spent discussing clues and inconsistencies until players vote on who to accuse of the murder.

Cognac, France, in 1938: The ladies and gentlemen have left the property for the weekend. The remaining employees are jumping at the chance to have a pompous dinner. Butler, cook, assistant cook, gardener, chambermaid and nanny - everyone is preparing for the occasion when a murder is discovered and the killer has to be found.

name: Speedy Recall: Double Take!
description:
From the pulbisher:

If you like Speedy Recall you'll LOVE Speedy Recall Double-Take! Take the extra challenge to give your funny bone a boost! Flip over a category card and a letter but wait... DOUBLE TAKE! Your answer has to start with "G" and it must also consider the Double-Take card! Easy? Maybe if everyone else wasn't also trying to come up with an answer at the same time. The giggles quickly turn to hoots and hollers when Speedy Recall-Double Take is on the table!

name: Heavy Hippos
description:
A cooperative children's game in which distinguishing the weight of objects is a central element.

Aim of the game: 6 wooden hippos (two light ones, two medium-weight ones, two heavy ones) have to be moved to the finishing spaces that correspond to their weights. If the players are successful, they all win together.

How it is played: Players take turn rolling the die and completing the corresponding actions (moving a hippo 1, 2 or 3 spaces on the board, switching two hippos, moving 2 hippos one space each). During each turn, they lift the hippo and comment on whether they think it is light, medium or heavy.
(The weight category is specified on the underside of the hippos' feet, but no peeking is allowed during the game.)

name: Battle Merchants: New Kingdoms
description:
Battle Merchants: New Kingdoms, an expansion for Battle Merchants, features an alternative Kingdom Card deck that replaces the game's existing Kingdom Cards. A few cards remain the same as originally published, but the deck includes many new cards and a few updates to existing cards.

This expansion also features a couple of new rules and Craft Tracker cards that allow all players to easily show the Craft levels of all of their weapons.

name: The Chronicle of Onin: The Great Onin-Bunmei War
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #23.

Covering the most important civil war in Japan from 1467 to 1473.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ōnin_War
This war was the start of long and chaotic era, Sengoku jidai (戦国時代).

The game focuses the battle in Kyoto area. But, also covers the country areas.
The game uses the abstract country area battles and detailed "I go, you go" system Kyoto battle.

The game is mainly decided by the control of most important palace areas in Kyoto. But, determined by accumulated victory points at the end, if no side can achieve the sudden death victory.

name: Scoundrels
description:
An Ameritrash, push-your-luck pirate game where players use a hand of Action cards (swords/sails/cannons) to gain as much Treasure and Infamy as possible! Sailing around a series of islands on a cloth map, players encounter ports, other players, and X's where Treasure may be buried.

There are a variety of Treasures to possess and Infamy tokens to be gained by fighting pirates and ports or completing various Quests.

The game plays in rounds, with each player receiving up to 8 random Action cards. They may Sail, Pillage, Board other ships, Shoot other ships, and/or Dig or Bury Treasure. Using their Action cards they may do as many of these actions as desired during their turn if they have the necessary cards. But players don't draw new cards until the end of the round. Bidding at the end of each round allows players to compete for who goes first, and which direction play moves.

When 2 pirates are dead (the first player to die remains in the game as the ghost pirate), all the Treasure cards have been pillaged, OR any Quests are complete, the game ends. The player with the most Infamy points (Tokens and Treasure) wins!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Svemirska patrola
description:
Rude Martians come to the Moon, but they don't respect traffic rules. Space patrol from the Earth comes to charge fines.

Players move figurines and collect counters by stopping on the field next to counter. The winner is the player who collects the most counters.

name: Plaža
description:
"The beach" is simple game for children.

Players move figurines along paths. There are several paths that are intertwined. Players collect counters by stopping on fields next to counter. The winner is the player who ends up with most points (counters).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: LEXI Card Game
description:
LEXI Card Game is a new word game. There are 55 cards in one deck of LEXI Card Game. There are 52 letter cards; the number of each letter of the alphabet in the deck is according to the frequency of usage for each letter in the English language. There are two WILD cards which may be substituted for any letter of the alphabet. There is one (shortened) Rules/Score card.

At the beginning of the game, the players set a goal of whatever score to be reached to win. (The winning score may be 100, 200, 500, etc.) Every player takes turns dealing. All players get nine cards each at the beginning of the game. One card is flipped open next to the deck, and both are placed at the center of play. The first player draws from either the deck or the opened card, but not both. He may lay down one or more words to be scored at the end of the round; he does not have to lay down any words. When this player is done, he discards one card. Play moves to the next player. All players will take turns playing. When it is a player's turn, he either draws one card from the deck or pick up card(s) from the open discarded pile. If the player draws from the discarded pile, he has to pick up all the cards from the card he wants to the latest discarded one and take it (or them) into his hand. This player has to play the bottom (oldest discarded) card he picks up and spell a word with it. He can, but does not have to spell words with the rest of the letter cards he picks up. When this player is done laying down words in front of him, he must discard one card. A player may add to an existing word he has laid down in a previous turn--by adding a prefix or a suffix--to form a longer word. For example: A player has laid down "ALL" in one turn, and has "E", "R" in his hand. In a subsequent turn, he picks up "T". This player may add to the existing word, "ALL" and form "TALLER". A player may only play and add to his own words and no one else's. For words to count toward a score, the words must be laid down in front of the player during his turn. If the words are not laid down when the round ends, those letters (forming a word) left in a player's hand will not count toward scoring. Moreover, one (1) point will be deducted for every letter left in a player's hand. All players must have taken at least one turn to spell words before the round may be ended. Only the player whose turn it is may end the round. To end a round, a player must use all his cards to spell one or more words, except one which must be discarded. Scores are added up according to the Summation principle:

1 letter word = 1 point; 2 letter words = 1+2= 2 points; 3 letter words = 1+2+3= 6 points; 4 letter words = 1+2+3+4= 10 points; 5 letter words = 1+2+3+4+5= 15 points; 6 letter words = 1+2+3+4+5+6 =21 points, etc.

The players play a new round and add up the scores. Rounds are played until the set score is reached. The first player to reach the set score wins.

name: Roll for the Tournament
description:
Roll for the Tournament is a quick Yatzee style DICE game about Knights competing in a Grand Tournament. Each Knight will compete in three "Events": Jousting, Melee with Swords, Melee with clubs on horseback. The winner is the Knight with the most victory points and will be crowned Tournament Champion.

Each of the three events earns the Knights victory points which will be tallied at the end to decide the Champion.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: ASL Comp: Afrikakorps – El Guettar Stakes
description: The twelfth and final portion of the North Africa collection is ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS: El Guettar Stakes and it brings those pretty green American bonus counters into play with actions that all take place in Tunisia. Almost all of the scenarios depict American troops in action (a couple depict British units vs. Germans) and once again the overlay collection is used to create one interesting battlefield after another in ways that just cannot be done with geomrphic boards. This set of 8 scenarios includes the namesake Battle of El Guettar, as well as action alongthe Gafsa-Gabes road and one of the final encounters of the War in North Africa, outside the gates of Tunis.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment

name: The Front Nine: Conference Facility of Excellence, Promo Card
description:
Single card to be included as an additional special card to increase game length or swapped in following the expansion rules for specials.

Obtainable from the A-Muse-Ment stand at UK Games Expo 28th-31st May 2015.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Zeppelin Attack!: Meddling Fools
description:
Add new strategic options and speed up the start of gameplay with this mini-expansion for Zeppelin Attack! With Meddling Fools you'll have a different opportunity each turn to bend the rules of the game, reveal a hidden ally, and strike at your enemies.

The Meddling Fools deck sits alongside the others, with its top card turned up and offering a different option each turn. Gain extra battle points with the Mad Bomber, shift your resources to deal with Heroic Meddling, or launch additional attacks with Methuselah's Infiniplane.

The skies shall be yours!

Includes 8 cards for use in play, plus two rules cards for tableside reference — which, conveniently, hits the "minimum of 10 cards to place an order" requirement. :)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Partisan Politics
description:
A game in which players vote their issues closer to the speaker of the house in order to increase their value before scoring. Players move issues by playing a copy from their hand to their constituency, or increase the constituency by polling and choosing an issue from the top 3 cards of the deck.

The goal of the game is to score the most over the course of 5 phases/hands. Each phase increases the number of things that are voted on by the players instead of being accomplished automatically.

Each hand ends when enough cloture motions have accumulated to force the vote. At the end of the hand, players choose a scoring method and then move on to the next phase.

name: Dragon
description:
User summary:
ドラゴン (DRAGON) is a doujin game by Japanese designer Kentaro Yazawa. In the game of DRAGON, players raise their dragons with the assistance of spirits.

You have four types of action cards to raise your dragon:
1)Pact: You make a pact with a spirit by spending money. The spirit raises your dragon's statistics (attack, health, or speed).
2)Pray: You pray to one of your spirits and/or one of your opponent's spirits, spending resources on them. The spirits use their own abilities for you.
3)Hunt: Your dragon goes hunting for food, and he can grow to the next stage by spending resources.
4)Rest: You gain money and resources, and retrieve all action cards you have played so far.

When the dragons have grown up, they fight each other by comparing their statistics. You gain victory points when your dragon defeats an opponent. The player with the most victory points wins the game.

Publisher summary:
精霊を駆使してドラゴンを育てるゲームです。
４種のアクションカードを使ってアクションしていきます。
契約アクションでは、精霊の獲得。
祈るアクションでは、精霊の使用。
狩りアクションでは、ドラゴンの成長。
休むアクションでは、使用したアクションカードの回収と精霊からの利益を得ます。
ドラゴンの能力値や、他のドラゴンとの戦いによって得点を得ます。
ゲーム終了時に最も多い得点のプレイヤーが勝利します。

name: ASL Comp: Afrikakorps – Frontier War
description:
FRONTIER POST, LIBYAN-EGYPTIAN BORDER, 12 JUNE 1940: The frontier wire was some 12 feet wide and 16 feet high; the Italians had built it along the Libya-Egypt border from the coast near Sollum to the oasis of Jarabub, 150 miles to the south. On 12 June patrols from the 11th Hussars and the KRRC quickly breached the wire. Attacking at dawn and out of the rising sun, the Hussars surprised and confused the Italian defenders, who watched as their machinegun posts were suppressed by British mortar fire and their tankettes destroyed by British armored cars and close-range machinegun fire from Vickers tanks. These raids continued through the rest of June and July of 1940, until the British 7th Armoured Division was recalled for a refit in Egypt. The raids destroyed many Italian vehicles, considerable supplies of ammunition and petrol, and significant water storage. Twenty-five Italian officers (including a general of engineers) and five hundred other ranks were captured. This series of raids also marked the beginning of an overall erosion of Italian morale, as the inadequacy of their tank armor and the scarcity of effective antitank weapons and ammunition became apparent....

ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS: Frontier War is a detailed new ASLComp VARIANT that tells the story of the War in North Africa. It's about time the desert warfare goodness that was spawned by Hal Hock's seminal work TOBRUK back in 1975... was brought to the gaming tables of ASLers. And now it is, in a big way.

The eighth portion of the set-piece is ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS: Frontier War and depicts the British push forward during the blazing hot summer of 1940. Italy had the meatballs to declare war on Great Britain as Mussolini decided to join his fellow dictators and gorge on Europe's spoils. Il Duce failed to take into account the fighting spirit of Tommy Atkins and his commanders. The result was anything but a massive offensive by numerically superior Italian soldiers in the Western Desert. Instead, British probes became attacks. Attacks became offensives. And the entire affair became a major problem for Mussolini's Italy and dreams of more easy conquests on the African Continent. This batch of 8 scenarios takes things from the frontier raid of 12 June 1940 through Graziani's offensive and the "first haul of booty of the desert war" along the coastal road west of Alam el Dab, Egypt some months later.

You receive a set of 8 scenarios, all depicting actions from the exciting offensive, rife with combined-arms actions. And yes, these are aimed at playability. Slap them down, bang them out, do it again. And again. Please do a little hooting and hollering while you're at it... at least when you roll 'snakeyes' (or the other guy rolls 'boxcars').
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: ASL Comp: Afrikakorps – Along the Via Balbia
description:
Near FUKA, EGYPT, 30 June 1942: All Axis supply traffic in North Africa moved eastward along the Via Balbia, the coast road that stretched from El Alamein to Tripoli. Rommel depended on this lifeline for his supplies, well known to the Allied command. For the first time, British fighter-bombers roar overhead looking for prey. As the Gazala positions crumbled, Rommel pushed his men and machines ever eastward along the Via Balbia, in pursuit of what he thought was a beaten enemy. Rommel's best troops raced forward in the van. Italian units followed behind. The Desert Fox knew the enemy was in disarray. Rommel also knew British supply lines and the ability to move units into the front line improved with every retrograde mile they retreated. The Italian XX Corps began moving east along the Via Balbia late on June 30, heading for participation in Rommel's last ditch attempt to reach Alexandria. Their trip would not go without incident as the British suddenly appeared from the desert flank, precipitating a vicious firefight. Their tormentors were units of the British 7th Motorized Brigade, sent forward to buy time for a new line to be formed at El Alamein. The quick-hitting unit handled the Italians roughly before pulling up stakes and moving off. The resulting Axis losses were not serious in terms of manpower. They were in terms of the time bought by tying up the coast road...

ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS: Along the Via Balbia is a detailed new ASLComp VARIANT that tells the story of the War in North Africa. It's about time the desert warfare goodness that was spawned by Hal Hock's seminal work TOBRUK back in 1975... was brought to the gaming tables of ASLers. And now it is, in a big way.

The tenth portion of the set-piece is ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS: Along the Via Balbia is a mixed date set of scenarios meant to depict the back-and-forth of the campaign with actions ranging from Fort Pilastrino to Fuka, with some additional Bir Hacheim and Bedja Pass in between. This set of 8 scenarios brings fort and village overlays into play, providing some interesting positional warfare to your wide-open desert gaming.

You receive a set of 8 scenarios, all depicting actions from the exciting offensive, rife with combined-arms actions. And yes, these are aimed at playability. Slap them down, bang them out, do it again. And again. Please do a little hooting and hollering while you're at it... at least when you roll 'snakeyes' (or the other guy rolls 'boxcars').
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Roma
description:
This book has 4 board games with some easy games used to explain Ancient Rome to kids. The book also has punchable hard stock counters and even a die.

The four board games are:

All roads lead to Rome. 1-4 players. You must reach Rome following a road full of surprises.

Duodecim Scripta. 2 players. A kind of ancient backgammon played over a Latin inscription.

Gallic War. 2 players. A basic tactical wargame representing an abstract battle between Romans and Gauls.

The game of the Seven Hills of Rome. 2 players. Players alternate rolling a die and placing tokens on the Hills of Rome. The player who takes the Palatine Hill is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spurs and Sprockets: Landships
description:
Landships is a stand alone game for 2-6 players. It includes 6 new Spurs and Sprockets decks and introduces a new set of rules that includes the Fire Away, projectile attack. Players may combine it with the basic Spurs and Sprockets decks or the Revolutionary decks. The game decks also include artwork used with the new Fire Away rules.

Spurs and Sprockets is a perfect information, abstract strategy game. Players each have the same eight tiles/cards that they take turns placing into a grid, in an attempt to link three or four in a row. There is no board in Spurs and Sprockets so the grid grows organically, based on the placement of tiles. The grid also varies in size and dimensions based on the number of players.

This Spurs and Sprockets game comes with 48 tiles/cards and rules for many different ways of playing, ranging from a simple Tic-Tac-Toe-like game where players gain 8 points for four in a row and 3 points for each set of three in a row, to a game where every placement of a tile/card may result in an attack and removal of another.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fighting, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Juist-Quiz
description:
Trivia game with questions related to the German island Juist. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each.

Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Don't Be That Guy
description:
Don't Be That Guy is a casual party-style card game which highlights the annoying natures of other people. Each card presents a situation that is found by most people to be irritating (Examples: Driving slowly in the left lane, Teaching someone's child to swear, etc).

Game play is as follows: (Normal Rules)
One player reads the card and shows it to the other players.
Each player votes to see which player is most likely to be guilty of this bad habit. The person with the most votes is "That Guy" and receives the card. The first person who hits 7 cards loses, as the game is called "DON'T be that guy".

Alternate Rules:
For groups where people are not as familiar with each other, before the first card is read, each player chooses a famous person (real or fictional, male or female, etc) and plays as that person for the rest of the game.

name: Meiji Restoration
description:
A late game in Series: SS (Sho-Kikaku).

Covering the Boshin War, the military phase of the Meiji Restoration.

The map covers from Satsuma to Ezo by areas.
The game is composed of recruitment, move, combat, control then redeployment.
The game starts just after the battle of Toba-Fushimi. The last Shogun Yoshinobu was still in Osaka.
Sattyo starts the game in Western part of Japan. But, they have more talented leaders than Edo-bakufu.

Victory is decided by victory points, collecte during each redeployment phases by controlling important areas such as Kyoto, Osaka, Edo, Nagasaki.

name: Waterloo 2015
description:
Waterloo 2015 is an abstract game about the battle of Waterloo in june 1815.
There are NO DICE and NO combat CARDS in this game.
You will only find Event cards, in order to ensure replayability.
You have to carefully plan your moves and assaults, like in the Chess...

This game uses hexagonal zones, and some zones are crucial : Hougoumont, Mont St.Jean, La Haye Sainte, etc...
In order to win, you have to control a certain number of crucial zones.

One player controls the Allied army (Anglo-Prussian), and the other controls the French army. Each army includes 3 types of units : infantry (normal and elite), cavalry (normal and elite), and artillery. You charge and pursue with the cavalry, you bombard and defend with the artillery, BUT you control the terrain with the infantry...
Each zone contains up to 8 units.

Turn sequence :
Allied Approach.
French Approach.
French Engagement.
Allied Engagement.
Reorganisation.
Victory conditions.

name: Golem Academy
description:
The goal is simple. Choose 1 of 4 unique characters, each with his or her own Golem companion, and beat the ever-loving bejesus out of your friends. The last player left with any bejesus being the winner!

Each character’s arsenal will include the following card types to help them achieve victory: Combat, Combo, Reflex, and Fusion cards. Most of the damage you’ll deal will be in the form of Combat and Combo cards.

name: Manuscripts: The Quest for Knowledge
description:
Manuscripts is a 3-dimensional medieval game. You lead a search party of three characters into a castle to retrieve your kingdom’s stolen manuscript. Your search party consists of a Warrior who is strong and fast, a Wizard who has three game changing magic cards, and a Princess who is responsible for retrieving her secret Manuscript that is on a face down card selected at the start of the game.

Each board you enter requires summoning a Monster that is controlled by the player on your left. You will face an Orc, Ogre, Minotaur, Werewolf, Knight of Doom, Dragon, or the Grim Reaper. Occasionally you will be confronted by a hostile search party. The monsters cannot follow you on to another board and your magic only works in the room you are in. You can battle with the strength of your character, use a magic weapon, use a magic spell, or run (honorably of course).

To win your Princess must acquire the correct Manuscript and your search party must have acquired the most jewels of all Princesses who escaped the castle. The game ends when all Princesses have exited the castle, dead or alive.

Manuscript's Castles are carved from blocks of wood and the Starter Pack 1 includes 2 boards, 7 monsters, 7 jewels, two search parties, and three Manuscripts.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: St. Kitts
description:
Some history. The vervets monkeys arrived from Africa to the Caribbean island of St. Kitts with slaves of the rum industry 300 years ago. The monkeys that escaped, acquired taste (and addiction) for alcohol eating fermented sugarcane.

These funny monkeys, good observers of man, they know, like the locals, that the easiest way to get your daily dose of alcohol is by distracted tourists in the beach bars. They love cocktails, daiquiris, caipirinhas, usually rum-based drinks.

In St. Kitts each player is a waiter who is held to be more cocktails (of each type) serving in a beach snack bar, trying to fill their tables of wealthy and thirsty tourists.

All actions are carried away and combining results of dice. Refer to vervets monkeys, bartenders and cocktails. If you get a result of blue, red, green or yellow refers to a cocktail. They come in four types: Daikiri strawberries (red cocktail), Caipirinha (green cocktail), Banana colada (yellow cocktail) and Blue Ocean (Blue cocktail). Place a record of your color in a table that asks that cocktail to indicate that you've served you, according to rules.

Each full table you've served more cocktails (you have most) awards (knizian) points to the end of the game. If you can add new tables to serve more tourists you will receive tips.

And if that were not enough, we must be aware of groups vervets monkeys in their usual "raids" in search of alcohol miss these tips will make acquired with sweat and tears.

PnP (spanish):
http://labsk.net/wkr/archives/15870/
http://labsk.net/index.php?topic=150531.0

name: Dieta Selvaggia
description: Roll and move a game where the aim is to decrease the number of pounds of weight decided by mutual agreement at the beginning of each game and achieve a healthy weight. Reaching it is not easy ... you'll have to have a lot of luck and when you get close to winning your opponents will tend countless traps and invite you to dinner and forcing you to eat more meals possible.

name: Alpens 1873, el joc
description:
[EN]
Alpens 1873, el joc will guide you back to the 9th of July 1873 in Alpens (Catalonia) during the Third Carlist War, which opposed the Carlist troops against the Liberal army. Your villagers must find their way out of town! Don't let the soldiers stop you!

[CAT]
Alpens 1873, el joc us portarà a Alpens, el dia 9 de juliol de 1873 durant la tercera guerra carlina, que enfrontava les tropes liberals contra les tropes carlines. Els teus habitants han de fugir del poble!!! Que no t’ho impedeixin les tropes!!!

name: Hatsu Koi
description:
From the publisher:

Inspired by Seiji Kanai's Love Letter and the Lost Legacy games, Hatsu Koi is a microgame that follows in such gameplay traditions with beautiful anime-style artwork. Rediscover the joy of puppy love in this simple and elegant card game.

This 18-card "draw a card, play a card" microgame focuses on winning and losing. Are you lucky enough to win? Or will taking your chances lead to a broken heart?

User Summary:
Most of the 10 different abilities on the cards provide ways to win the round or cause players to be knocked out of the round. If there is no card to draw, the lowest number on the cards is the winner. Win two rounds, and you can win the game.

name: Wombat Combat
description:
Long ago at the beginning of time, there existed only the Wombatonians and the One Wombat. The One Wombat gained his power by draining it from the Wombatonians. Eventually the Wombatonians launched their attack on the One Wombat to save themselves. In the end, the Wombatonians created six weapons called the Wombat Stones. When they used the weapons, the One Wombat split into many pieces, although its consciousness survived. The Wombat Stones became lost in six different pieces of the One Wombat. Eventually, these pieces became the planets we now know as Jupiter, Mars, Venus, Saturn, Neptune, and Earth. As time went on life began to grow inside them.

Every One Hundred Wombatonian Years a tournament is held, Wombat Combat. The evil Combat Croc has won the tournament for the past nine centuries--except suffered failure in the last Wombat Combat Tournament to the warrior known as West Wombat. Combat Croc ordered the Crocodan horde to attack the Island known as Australia on Earth. The horde raided and injured most of West Wombat's fellow warriors, including his Wombat Masters. This enraged West enough to re-enlist in this centuries tournament. He was not alone. Marauder Maus, Kaolin, and Major Waylin Bear, who was in search of his missing subordinate, Elizabeth Emu, were also following right behind West Wombat seeking revenge, and to compete in the next Wombat Combat tournament at the same time. But unbeknownst to West Wombat and the warriors, the tournament was a ruse, a diversionary trap set by the Combat Croc in an attempt to break the rules set forth by the Wombatonians, and in rescuing Elizabeth, Combat Croc's scheme was thwarted and the Combatants prevailed.

In retaliation Combat Croc has scheduled an unsanctioned tournament on Earth. He seeks revenge and to claim all Wombat Stones so that he may take the place that the One Wombat once held.

Each player is dealt one Wombatant and a Wombat Stone. Both of these cards will be laid face-up on the table in front of the player who holds them. Each Wombatant has a certain amount of hit points they can absorb before they are defeated. As attack cards are laid in front of Wombatants, the points will be deducted from the hit point total until they are expended. The object of the game is to use your Wombatant to take the Wombat stones from all the other Wombatants in the game.

Each player will be dealt five cards from the Combat deck. On their turn, a player has the option to play an Attack card against any opposing player, or to lay a Counter card against the Attacks already played against them. After playing an Attack or a Counter, the player draws another card from the Combat deck. When a player's hit points are consumed, their player is out, and the last Wombatant to Attack them takes their Wombat Stone. All of the Combat cards in a defeated player's hand or before them are placed in the bottom of the Combat deck.

The Wombatant who earns all of the Wombat Stones wins!
categories: Animals, Fantasy, Fighting, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Small Town Secrets
description:
Theme: "Every small town has its secrets. When a murderer is loose, and everyone is suspect, you never know what will be uncovered. Is the Quarterback dealing drugs? Does the town Doctor have Mafia ties? Is the FBI Agent assigned to the case actually the killer? Only by making use of your investigative team to find the evidence can you beat your opponent to the truth."

Game-play: Deck building game that uses a built in scoring mechanic that may slim your deck each turn. Scored cards have either positive or negative values, and can be played to reduce an opponent's score. In addition to buyable cards to make your deck stronger, there are also Secrets that star outside the deck, and give powerful effects once activated. Each player also has a single Dark Secret that can give a massive amount of points toward winning the game.

Goal: The first player to reach the point total on the "Premise" wins the game. Premise cards included have 10, 20 and 30 point goals, though the 10 point goal tends to be an hour long game by itself.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: La Belle Alliance
description:
Using the Napoleonic version of the March into Battle system, this game portrays the Battle of Waterloo in a furious, fast moving three turn game. Part of a group of mini-games on the battles of the Waterloo campaign, with Ligny, Quatre Bras, and (planned) Wavre.

In this system as in reality, units will become ineffective from fatigue and disorder long before they run out of men - unless you, in command, can manage them effectively and maintain their edge. A turn lasts as long as the typical historical time to arrange and execute an assault - every move counts.

Map scale: 1km per hex
Unit scale: divisions, 1000 men per strength point
Time scale: 3.5 hours per turn

name: Kamimusubi
description:
User summary:
カミムスビ (Kamimusubi) is a middle-ware game, to be used with other Trading Card Games (TCGs). This game is intended to let cards fight each other. You can play Kamimusubi as a stand-alone game, but by adding other TCG's cards as an extension deck, it is possible to produce a variety of play. The cards which are lying idle in your house get ready to fight for a battlefield never seen before. Let's create the strongest deck with your TCG cards!

You play a card from your hand and pay cost and send a character to the battlefield, like in the card game "San Juan". When you pay higher costs for your character, you can put an expansion card on the top of a character card, thereby transform a character itself into an expansion card.

Kamimusubi is a 2-player game and has 36 cards in the deck. Players let characters fight, and the winner is the first player to cause direct damage on their opponent five times.

The game uses artwork by the designer but also free artwork from an open source video game, ジュエルセイバー (Jewel Savior). The publishers of the video game wanted the widest possible use for their work, so turned it into open source. The artists for the video game are listed on their website.

Publisher's summary:
カミムスビは「異なるＴＣＧ同士を戦わせることを目的とした、ミドルウェアゲーム」です。
これ単体でも遊ぶことが出来ますが、他のＴＣＧのカードを拡張デッキとして追加することで、多彩な遊び方を生み出すことが可能です。
あなたの家に眠るカード達がまだ見ぬ戦場を求めて張り切っています。
目指せ、ＴＣＧ界最強のデッキ！

サンファン方式で、手札を捨ててコストを支払いキャラクターを戦場に出します。キャラクターはさらにコストを支払うと拡張カードを上に乗せることが出来ます。それによって拡張カードに変身します。
そして、キャラクター同士で戦闘を行い、先にプレイヤーへ5回直接ダメージを与えた方が勝利します。
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Stadt Land Spielt Limitierter Sonderdruck Tag des Gesellschaftsspiels
description:
A single punch board containing expansions for 4 different games - Castles of Burgundy, Rokoko, Helios, and Limes.

Expansions are:

The Castles of Burgundy: 5th Expansion – Der Lustgarten (Pleasure Garden)
Rokoko Erweiterung - Edle Kleider (Fancy Dresses Promo)
Helios: Riese und Ballonfahrerin Erweiterung
Limes: Der Leuchtturm (The Lighthouse)

It was released for the Stadt Land Spielt event that took place on September 14, 2014 throughout Germany.

Note that the Rokoko expansion is misprinted and thus unusable (see the relevant thread here)
publishers: ABACUSSPIELE, alea, Hans im Glück, Pegasus Spiele

name: Blood of Rome
description:
Blood of Rome is a board game of gothic horror in ancient Rome. Rome will burn, Rome will bleed!

In Blood of Rome, supernatural factions fight a secret war in the streets and catacombs of Rome. Vampires, Werewolves, Gargoyles, Witches, and Slayers form alliances and vendettas in their conflict over the soul of the empire. Each player secretly belongs to one of the five Factions, with the goals of dominating the most locations on the City Board, and slaying the agents of factions with which they have a Vendetta.

Players take turns placing cards from their hands onto the limited slots at the various board locations. Each card belongs to a different faction, and has special abilities which can: add new agents to a location, transform agents from one faction into another, trigger a combat vote, make an accusation against another player, and more. Any player can play a card from any faction on their turn, thereby manipulating their enemies into doing their dirty work for them. A Calendar of Auguries tracks the cycles of the sun and moon, triggering a location's bonus ability when the proper faction card is played.

name: Ide maca oko tebe
description: "Cat goes around you" is game for younger players. Each has one figurine. Player rolls dice and move figurine in direction of path. When figurine reaches circular part of path, it moves in any direction. The winner is the player who first reach the center, where is the mouse.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: The Chatsworth Game
description:
The game uses an illustrated plan of a garden to form the basis for a number of games, some of which are described on the games board. Using a die players move their pieces around the map using the basic rules of not retracing their steps and following the direction of red arrows when landed on. he designers suggest creating ones own games but some of the suggestions are below.

The Grand Tour: involves trying to visit all the main sights before anyone else and returning to the house.

Race: involves all starting from the Grotto and trying to reach the Orangery before anyone else

Afternoon Tea: 15 turns try and visit as many sights as possible each with their own point scores

Chase: Involves one player getting a head start and the others trying to catch them.

name: Z.R. III.
description:
The game theme is about the USS Los Angeles rigid airship, designated ZR-3, which was built in 1923–1924 by the Zeppelin company in Friedrichshafen, Germany as war reparation. It was delivered to the United States Navy in October 1924 and after being used mainly for experimental work, particularly in the development of the American parasite fighter program, was decommissioned in 1932.
Players are rolling dice and travels along the routes (two different routes in red and blue colors), which crosses Atlantic Ocean (from Germany to US). The first player, who cross the finish line, wins the game.

name: Scrapture
description:
Long after the collapse of our civilization, would-be cult leaders vie for influence over the masses. Discover mysterious relics from our time and use them to lead your cult to power.

Scrapture is a resource management game for 2-4 players. During the game players attract initiates, fill up their shrines, send their followers on missions, and discover relics. Players must adapt to their opponents’ maneuvers if they wish to claim victory.

To win the game, players must acquire and use relics to earn influence. At the end of a round if at least one player has 10 or more Influence, the game ends and player with the most Influence wins.

name: Der Russisch-Japanische Krieg
description: Typical spin and move game about the Russo-Japanese War (8 February 1904 – 5 September 1905). The first player, who cross the route first, wins the game.

name: Elephonkey
description:
From the box:

The hilarious and insightful game where... "Everyone has an opinion and every opinion counts!" - if you match!!!

Gameplay:
The object of Elephonkey is for teams of 2+ players to score points by matching their opinions with those of their teammates by listing and ranking the top 5 answers in each opinion poll. During each round, each team draws an opinion poll card and a category on the card is chosen by rolling the provided dice (one die decides the category while the other determines the point values). When the timer begins, each player begins listing their opinions (e.g. Top 5 Bruce Willis movies) on one of the provided pads. After 90 seconds, players compare their answers with their teammates and are awarded points for direct and indirect answers, unless otherwise stated. The game ends once one team reaches the pre-determined number of points.

name: McGuffin
description:
A hidden roles card game game. One player plays as the NASTI agent the others are Foundation operatives. One random player chooses to secretly place either treasure or bombs in the Maltese Falcon. The players then use the swap cards to move the Maltese Falcon from player to player. At the end of the round the player who has the Maltese Falcon may or may not open it. If they choose to keep it closed they gain 1 victory point. If they open it and it is treasure they keep the highest for themself and share the other two out (between 1 and 3 victory points). If there are bombs inside they take the highest hit and give the lower two to the players either side (between -2 and -3 victory points). After 3 rounds whoever has the highest victory points wins.

For now this is a playtesting copy of the new McGuffin.

name: Nation
description:
Nation is a great game of tactics and military strategies where the diplomacy and the ruse of each player take precedence over the chance and the stroke of luck.

The object of the game is to build 1 capital and 10 headquarters.
Each player starts with a Capital, represented by a hexagon with a star.

The game is played in turns:
1- Raising army
2- Moving armies
3- Fighting
4- Building headquarters

The Capital and headquarters are providing movement and force points (1 each to a limit of 6).

Movement points are used to move pieces (tanks, ships and fighters).

Force points are the force of a unit (including Capital and HQ) have to attack or defend. Units can be combined from adjacent hex, the force with the higher points total win, the defeated force must retreat according to specific rules. If a unit cannot retreat it is destroyed (Capital and HQ cannot retreat)

HQ are constructed if a player has at least one tank on a city hex.

name: Ground Pounders:  The STAR CORPS Card Game
description:
From the publisher's website:

Ground Pounders is a card game of STAR CORPS combat. It simulates the battles of the Corporate-Colonial Wars of the late 22nd Century. It simulates those battles on a scale much larger than the STAR CORPS miniatures rules normally allow, with most Force Cards representing a Company (which is 4-10 squads).

User description
The game is played with large Force Cards face up in front of each player. Each Force Card has both a Victory Point and Hit Point value. Once enough damage has been done to a card to equal or exceed it's Hit Points, the unit is eliminated and the player who eliminated it gains it's Victory Point value.

The players are also dealt a hand of smaller Action Cards which are not revealed when dealt. Action Cards are generally played to inflict damage to enemy units, although some activate other effects such as healing friendly units or allowing a player to draw additional cards.

Games may be played either until a player has reached a set Victory Point total, or until only one player has units remaining.

name: Oktro
description:
This is a game for 2 players.
Each Player has pawns in 4 Colors (1 Player large pawns the other small).
Each player has start fields for his pawns on one of the sides of the board. The players start regions are on the opponent sides of the board.
All fields are connected with horizontal and vertical lines.
The fields are colored (1 of the 4 colors of the pawns) or black.
On Players turn he can move 1 pawn in one direction as far as he wants and no other pawn is on the way.
The pawn can be moved on the position of an opponent pawn. This opponent pawn is out of the game.
Independent of this if a pawn is now on a colored field the opponent is only allowed to move the pawn with this Color in his next turn. If the player has choosen a black field the opponent may choose any of his pawns.
The player who cannot move the allowed pawn in his turn looses.

name: Malifaux: Take Back The Night – Molly Box Set
description: She just wants to play! A deranged girl and mother to all the undead children of Malifaux. Molly is a heavy summoning Master for the resurrectionists. Able to call, lead, and guide a variety of Undead monstrosities and children to her bidding. The only thing is she enjoys more than her pets, is the glee of the misery shown in the pain and death of her victims as she plays with their souls.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Santa Showdown
description:
In Santa Showdown, players take control of a wannabe Santa on a race to deliver to the neighborhood to become the next Santa Claus. Each successful delivery lets you raid the fridge, upgrading your Santa by making him fatter. The fattest Santa wins.

Each player has a Santa card with five stats that will be upgraded over the course of the game. These stats are number of actions, spaces moved per movement action, dice modifier, rerolls, and how many gifts can be carried. The players can deliver the "nice way" which takes more actions but is a sure thing or the "naughty way" which uses only one action per delivery, but requires you to draw from the Naughty Deck and pass the obstacles on the card through dice rolls.

Santa Showdown includes four different enemy figures that affect game play, forty single-use gadgets the Santas can employ to help them on their deliveries, and a modular board to allow for replay and experimenting with which mode of play works for you.

name: Dwójka
description:
Game about memories of graduates of II LO in Opole. Players try to collect specific kinds of memories (from different locations). To collect memories players activate places of school. Some of them can give memories, others allow to change different ones. After that they can create complete reminiscence - card with VP.

---

Gra o przywoływaniu wspomnień absolwentów II LO w Opolu. Gracze próbują zebrać okruchy pamięci (z różnych miejsc). Odwiedzając różne miejsca gracze zdobywają okruchy pamięci albo mogą je wymienić. Następnie mogą je połączyć w całość - zdobyć karty warte punkty zwycięstwa.

name: Quest Board
description:
The card drafting game of fantasy hero, item, and quest collection!

In Quest Board, players seek to stock their vaults with piles of gold. If you happen to help the common folk and save the world in the process, all the better.

The player with the most gold at the end of the game wins!

Quest Board is played over three rounds (Summer, Fall, and Winter). In a given round, players draft hero, item, and quest cards. Then players take turns resolving quests. After Fall, players attempt to complete a final quest for additional gold.

Good luck and godspeed to your intrepid and stalwart heroes!

name: Ascension: Dawn of Champions – Rys, Dark Muse Promo Card
description:
Came with pre-orders for Ascension: Dawn of Champions

Rys, Dark Muse

Cost: 8 Power

Trophy Monster

Reward: Gain 6 Honor.
While this is in the center row, all Heroes and Constructs have Rally for their faction(s)

Ongoing Trophy: During your turn, all Heroes and Constructions have Rally for their faction(s) and all Monsters have Rally: Monster
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Pile Poil
description:
Great drawing!

Who will find the word that fits?

5 drawings (all 5 at the same time) appear on the coloured backs of the cards. On the front sides, a number of squares and a number are present.

A card is turned over: the first to say something directly related to the picture takes the round. This word must consist of a certain number of syllables (number of squares on the card) or to a number of letters (numbers on the card). The fastest wins as many cards as squares.

At the end of the game, the player who has the most cards wins!
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Zebulon
description:
Zebulon is completely different from the 1997 game from Abacuspiele.

Cards have words written in a circle. The card is flipped up in the middle of the players... the first who reads the word aloud wins!

name: Seven Men's Morris
description: Seven Men's Morris is played in the same way as Nine Men's Morris, with two changes, the first is that each player has seven men and the second is that it is played on a modified board (which is similar to that used by Six Men's Morris, except it a cross in the center).

name: Le Tour du Monde a Bicyclette
description: A roll-and-move game for six players. The first player to reach the last space of the track wins the game.

name: In the Loop
description:
In In the Loop, you are a product producing company who must meet customer demands. Navigating through resource mines and unpredictable markets will involve making economic, social, political, and environmental trade-offs. You will have to make difficult strategic decisions: should you collaborate with your competitors, invest in mining new materials, or change your business model?

In the Loop gamifies the complex, global supply chain in less than 90 minutes. As the game unravels, players will learn about product lifecycle as well as resource efficient and effective solutions. And they will be ready to come up with their own resourceful strategies.

How it works:
In the Loop is a turn-based game. Players roll dice to move around the board in order to collect material tokens needed to make their products. Event cards occur at intervals throughout the game and hinder or help players' abilities to obtain material tokens. Players can choose to purchase strategy cards to combat these events. The first player to make three products wins!
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Alsace 1940
description:
Woodrow Wilson brought peace to war-torn Europe in December 1916, but many French politicians believed they had been robbed of the fruits of victory. Alsace remained under German rule, and in September 1940 the French Third Army surged over the border to recapture the symbolic city. The Second Great War had begun.

Spearheaded by well-equipped armored divisions and backed by plentiful air support, the French pressed hard against the Bavarian First Army tasked with defending this sector of the border. Would they be able to take Strasbourg quickly to show the French people that victory was assured in this new war, or would their offensive bog down into a replay of the First Great War’s horrors?

Alsace 1940 is a variant set of scenarios for our Alsace 1945 game, set in the same alternative-history background as our Second World War at Sea games. It is not a complete game: ownership of Alsace 1945 (and only Alsace 1945) is necessary to play all of the scenarios included. Alsace 1940 also includes 140 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces.

(from Avalanche Press website)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation

name: Alien Overrun
description:
An exciting cooperative game of mining, exploration, and killing aliens!

In Alien Overrun, you are a member of an elite repair unit operating on the edge of known space. Whenever major mining equipment breaks down your team gets the call.

Your mission: repair the damaged reactor core and clear the base of any alien presence before it’s too late.

Alien Overrun is a cooperative game that combines exploration, resource gathering, press-your-luck dice combat, and an escalating countdown timer. Your team has taken remote control of the robotic mining rigs of the mining facility and uploaded custom software that will customize your rig. Now all you have to do is pilot your rig to the reactor core. The only problem is the countless aliens that have overrun the facility and feed on the very radiation you seek to eliminate. Lucky for you that the facility is rich with resources, workshops, repair facilities, and even an armory that you can utilize to upgrade your rig but each facility has a different layout so you will need to explore to find them. Once you feel like you have all of the upgrades you need you can move on to the ultimate showdown with the alien queen herself. But be quick as the core will soon go critical and destroy the facility.

Move your pawn to explore the facility and uncover the random hex-based board. Draw encounter cards to find out what alien threat lurks in the dark. Roll dice and press-your-luck to defeat the aliens. Use your rig's special abilities to help your friends. And discover powerful alien artifacts to help you defeat the alien queen.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: On Air
description:
In On Air, players are building their own TV Network. They start new programs, upgrade and customize them, hire stars, use their staff in their optimal way. Acquiring fans and researching the audience is key to getting the best ratings. Ads and product placement are extremely important for making money but they shouldn't be overused because the viewers might get annoyed and change the station. The most delicate thing is to know where to stop your best TV programs. They can go into the archives at their peak and always be remembered or they can be prolonged for profit but go down by their age and be forgotten forever.

On Air is an action selection, resource and hand management board game that lasts for a certain amount of rounds. Each player has three slots for TV programs. Morning, Afternoon and Evening (Primetime). At the end of each round audience cards for the three time frames are revealed. Each one has different requirements for content. If a player’s TV program at that time frame fits their requirements the player win their attention and score ratings.

The players fight for victory points. Victory points are accumulated in three ways.

1. Rating scored during the game
2. Points for archived program
3. Points for secret objectives

Each game of On Air will feel different. Players choose their role at the beginning of the game. There are 4 roles with not only unique skills but unique mechanics that change the game. Also, every role itself has several completely different ways to play.

The game comes with plenty of staff cards that also break the standard rules of the game. Each card has multiple ways of using it, so players can customize their style even further.

Every program can be fully customized. For example, you can start a children puppet show but if you want you can change it by adding drama and 16+ content. Later on you could even change the type from being TV series to being a reality show or even a game show. You can get stars for the show or put a lot of absurd product placement in it.

Whatever you do, your TV Network is all up to you!

name: Rattrapez-le!
description: A horse is to be caught. Each player secretly decides with which character (playing piece) he wants to catch it. All pieces start at the farm with exception of the horse, which starts far away on the grass. the active player chooses a card from his hand and moves the indicates character. A special sign (+, =, -) on the card tells him if he has to move the piece the same number of spaces as the previous player or 1 less or 1 more. As soon as a player moves his secretly written character onto the same space of the horse or the horse to his character, he wins the game.

name: CHUCK-A-CHESS
description:
Chess married to Dice. The game consists of 8 dice, 4 in white and 4 in black. The dice are all identical, having the 6 chess pieces on each die.. You need a chess-set and board to play this game.

Four games are described:
Game 1: Kamikaze. Each player rolls 3 dice and may move any chess piece on the board that is shown on the dice. If a pair is rolled you may move that piece and throw again for a second move. If a triple is rolled, any piece can be moved and you get a further throw. If a player is placed in check, the opponent has up to three rolls to escape. If he fails to do so, it is Chuck-A-Mate.

Game 2: Pair-Fect. Same as above but only two dice are rolled. A pair rolled lets you move any piece. After a pair, the same player rolls again, even if his opponent is in check.

Game 3: Pair-Less. Four dice are rolled. Pairs in this game do not count and cannot move.Triples allow any piece to be moved and a second throw. If four of a kind are rolled, you may take any piece from your opponent and roll all the dice again. If four Queens are rolled, that is automatically Chuck-A-Mate.

Game 4: Four-Fun. Same as Game 3 but you may move any piece showing on the four dice that you roll. There are no extra moves. You may use the doubling die that is included in the game which works like in Backgammon. This is only sensible if you are playing for points over a set number of games.

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Go Time Action Game
description:
Test your balance like a ninja!

It´s time to test your Ninja skills! Balance your way along the path made of sewer grates, and try to get farther than the other players. The winner is crowned the ultimate Ninja master!

Players set up a path of 16 manhole covers (4 different colors) that lead to the green manhole cover, which is the door to the Turtles' sewer home. Each player spins the spinner to determine in which order he or she will move along that home to the finish line. Based on each spin, players attempt to negotiate the color sequence of manhole covers that are their path. Players must follow the sequence, moving foot, hand, foot hand as far as they can while maintaining their balance. Once each player is done with their turn, they place their foam "sai" or Japanese sword, at the last manhole cover successfully reached. It's from there that the player will begin their next turn. Be the first Ninja warrior to reach the green manhole cover 3 times and become the "ultimate Ninja warrior"!

name: Jeu de Tramway
description: Jeu de Tramway. Nouveau Jeu de Societe is about horsecars and was made in the early 1900's. It is typical roll and move board game. The first player who cross 63 stops, wins the game.

name: ASL Comp: Afrikakorps – Battle of Gazala
description:
(from the introduction:)
