Welcome to ASLComp AFRIKAKORPS, an ASLComp Variant series of scenario packs. All of the scenarios in this series are played on one or more copies of the 22" x 34" TOBRUK desert maps and using an all new set of overlays.

This expansion includes a map, counters and scenarios. Free bonus die-cut counters are provided in AK #1 and #7.

The collection of 100 historical scenarios depicts actions across the length and breadth of the Western Desert and Tunisia during World War II.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Thak!
description:
In Thak! You are a dwarf miner with the goal of digging. Landslides, Cave-ins and Explosions could happen at any time. Others players will want to stop you, bring the floors down beneath you, but you need to dig.Dig to become King of the Mine!

Thak! is a card game composed by 126 cards for 2 to 6 players, which can be played all vs all, in couples or in teams. A game lasts about 15-30 minutes.

During the game players will Dig (draw and show) cards from the Deck (The Mine). While players are digging, everything and anything can happen: from finding a precious Rune or Tool to suffering a bad Landslide. The strategy and abilities of players will let them to become rich, to defend theirselves from dangerous things and hinders others players and the best of them will become King of the Mine.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Farming, Humor, Print & Play

name: They Fight Crime
description:
In this co-op team versus team game, you are the heroes of a buddy cop movie. The captain has assigned you as partners, but you can't stand one another. By the end of the game, with luck, you will be best friends.

The goal of the game is to get all the glory in the department by taking down the crime kingpin. You do this by collecting 10 points of evidence before the other team.

Solving Crimes requires acquiring cards through draw actions, and special locations you can shape your hand of cards to aid you in the crimes to be solved all over town.

The city map has locations like The Docks, and The International District where crimes go down. The City Hall, and Police Station are where you can kiss up to the Police Chief, and Police Commissioner. And there are even a couple spots where you and your buddy can go for some entertainment to get to know one another.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Halo: Fleet Battles – UNSC Core Battle Group Upgrade
description: The contents of this boxed set can be used by UNSC players to either upgrade their Halo: Fleet Battles force with additional medium and small firepower or act as the foundation for a new force. At the heart of the upgrade box are four Marathon-class Heavy Cruisers and 24 Paris-class Frigates, a fantastic core addition to any UNSC fleet. Marathon Heavy Cruisers are the bulk heavy hitters for the UNSC, able to be deployed in either a standalone or supported role, and are commonly fielded in Battle Groups consisting of Paris-class Frigates in either Arrowhead or Trident Formation. Also in the box are Formation Bases and Ship Overlay Sheets for all models included.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Halo: Fleet Battles – Covenant Core Battle Group Upgrade
description: The contents of this boxed set can be used by Covenant players to either upgrade their Halo: Fleet Battles force with additional medium and small firepower or act as the foundation for a new force. At the heart of the upgrade box are two powerful CCS-class Battlecruisers and they are joined by 12 SDV Heavy Corvettes, acting as a fantastic core addition to any Covenant fleet. CCS-class Battlecruisers are a key part of any Covenant fleet, able to lay down devastating weapons fire when needed and capable of delivering bombers or interceptors directly into the heart of a battle. Also in the box are Formation Bases and Ship Overlay Sheets for all models included.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame

name: Masamune
description:
On behalf of the faculty and staff of Masamune Shining Forge Academy, it is with great pleasure that we inform you of your admission to Masamune. You were selected from an incredibly competitive and capable group of applicants, and showed an intense devotion to creating weapons worthy of legend.

Masamune is a game for two to four players, and takes place over the course of an academic year at Masamune Shining Forge Academy. As a pupil at Masamune Shining Forge Academy, you and your opponents will start the game with identical 12-card decks. Over the course of the game, you will forge sentient weapons called Chibis and teach them powerful special techniques to defend the Academy from attacking monsters. Alternatively, you can use Chibis to gain more powerful cards and bolster your deck.

Just like normal schools, Masamune Shining Forge Academy uses Exams to measure its pupils’ academic growth. Every time a new card is added to your deck, there is a chance that the next card drawn from the Academy deck will be an Exam, an intense battle staged by your instructors that lures the monsters teeming in the surrounding forest to attack the Academy! After the fifth and final Exam is completed, the school year is over, and the pupil who harvested the most monsters has won the game!

name: Village Royalty
description:
A Little Card Game for 2-5 Players.

After a particularly thorough round of assassinations in the capitol, the Monarch and the entire royal family are dead.
You are one of several despotic aristocrats in the tiny village of Lionsgate. You've heard some troubling rumors that the person next in line for the throne is a commoner from your village. This could prove problematic, since you've never been much of a friend of commoners. You lose sleep at night imagining your comeuppance.

At the start of a round of Village Royalty, one card is hidden away. This is the Monarch. At the end of the round, any villagers from the same guild as the Monarch are worth twice as many points.

On each player's turn, they first add a villager card from their hand to the Market in the middle of the table. They then have a chance to bribe a villager, either from the market, or from another player, for one more coin than the villager already holds. After bribing a villager, the player can use the villager's action, which might earn them more coins, points, or some other advantage.

Play continues until a player either has no cards or no coins. The Monarch is revealed, and points are counted. Continue playing rounds until someone reaches 20 points.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Bulwark: Harsfa the Silent
description:
Contains one Hero deck for Bulwark.

Harsfa isn't exactly mute, but you would be forgiven for thinking so considering how seldom she speaks. She has elevated being a bodyguard to an art form, being able to lead a terrified client through a hail of arrows unscathed and skewer two goblins with one thrust of her trusty spear. If you bring her into battle alongside you, you can concentrate on taking out the enemy without worrying about your own safety.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Klikt het?
description:
A game with multiple choice questions where you have to guess which answer someone else would give. A handheld electronic buzzer-object will tell you if the answer is correct or not. If answered correctly, you get to draw another card, and the first person to get ten correct answers is the winner.

So each turn, you draw a card and ask the question and answers on it (for example, "what would you take out of a burning house?" A my pet, B photo album, C diary or D hairgel and facial cream). The player to your left has one electronic object, you hold the other. Choose the letter that corresponds to the answer you think that person would give and hold the two objects together. If answered correctly, there should be a buzzing sound.

You get to know each other a little better, and the best "mind reader" wins.

Seems similar to The New Electronic Perfect Match Game, but without the board.

name: GrowthBreaker
description:
From the publisher:

GrowthBreaker. It’s here. The world’s second tabletop novel.

This is a card game for anyone to play alone. It contains whimsical items, enjoyable places, and helpful friends. Your heroes will be challenged in their quest to reach the goals of each season, which are broken up into several serialized decks known as episodes.

The game is also a story. The major plot of GrowthBreaker is always the same, but what you do during the game, and if your survive, is up to you. It can be played an endless amount of times, without ever experiencing the same game twice.

The object of the game is for the player to move a token around the PLACE PILE, acquiring cards out of the DECK as you travel. The more cards you acquire, the stronger your heroes will grow, allowing more powerful cards to be played.

But be warned, the more powerful your heroes become, the more powerful the enemies that will find them.

A game of GrowthBreaker ends when Starting HERO card(s) of the episode is/are Cycled.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Shattered Earth
description:
Shattered Earth is a tabletop war game set on Earth many decades into the future, after the world has been ravaged by an unprecedented number of natural disasters. The geology of the Earth has been forever changed, now cracked and broken, existing landmasses drowned in vast oceans whilst others have formed anew, created by the seismic movements of tectonic plates.

Each cataclysmic shockwave formed by extinction-level natural disasters pounded against the door of another world – a mirror image of our own – until eventually that door gave way. The resulting breach flooded the Earth with an esoteric power known as Ether, a volatile energy that is the very foundation of the Immateria, the world of dreams. And in return, the material world bled into the breach, corrupting and choking everything it touched.

Mankind now struggles to comprehend this new power, seeing in it both ruin and salvation. Scientists attempt to harness its energy to create wondrous new technology, whilst others practice dark rituals and worship strange new powers, using Ether to alter their surroundings and themselves, bending reality to their whim.

This is 30 A.E. This is Shattered Earth.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Godslayer: Halodynes Starter Box
description:
This Halodynes Starter Box contains 8 highly detailed metal miniatures for gamers and collectors.

The enclosed miniatures represent a fully playable warband of 160 points, and in addition you get a printed version of the Quick-Start Rules.

With this Halodyne warband and the Quick-Start Rules you are able to immediately start playing Godslayer – the fantasy miniatures skirmish game set in a bronze age world of sword and sorcery.

Get your starter box and start discovering the world of Godslayer!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Mythology, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Icarus Project
description:
The Icarus Project is a fast paced, narrative driven, sci fi skirmish wargame set over 700 years in the future. Players take control of small groups of elite soldiers, called strike forces, as they try to accomplish a variety of missions including assassinations, prisoner captures, and bomb disposals.

With a focus on narrative, cinematic gameplay, the Icarus Project is a game filled with water-cooler moments that will have you and your friends re-telling the stories for years to come.

Take control of the Galactic Alliance of Humanity, a utilitarian behemoth with the largest military in the galaxy, or command the Nexus, a brutal alien race that wants nothing more than to wipe humanity from the galactic stage.

With a variety of other factions and races, the Icarus Project has something for everyone. The Praesidians are a wise and noble race, and posses some of the most advanced technology in existence. The Ji'tar are iron-willed and don't take kindly to outsiders. And the Mercenary faction allows you to take control of the galaxy's criminals, outlaws, and guns for hire that can be added to any other strike force.

name: Traitor
description:
Traitor is a 2-player abstract strategy game. It is played with 10 wooden pawns per side on a wooden board.

Pawns move one square forward or sideways, and capture diagonally. The goal of the game is simply to land one of your pawns on your opponent's back line.

A pawn is chosen at random to be the Traitor. At a specific point in the game, the Traitor is revealed, and it changes allegiance. Your opponent's pawn becomes your pawn to control. But one of your pawns may still be a Traitor, waiting for the perfect time to reveal itself...

name: Quick Draw Card Game
description:
Quick Draw is a card came designed for 2-4 players whereby each player takes on the role of a Gunfighter in the old west. Each player begins the game with 30 life points, you can use glass beads or pen and paper to keep track of the life points. You will need a standard pack of cards that have 2 jokers, and around 10-15 six sided dice (less depending on number of players).

The game is divided into turns with each turn being made up of 3 rounds; Quick Draw, Aim and Fire. At the start of a turn the players are dealt 10 cards and then 5 communal cards are played face up in the middle of the play area.

For each round the players must use three cards from their hand to make the best poker hand they can. They place each round of cards face down in front of them (3 stacks of 3 cards). The left stack are the cards used for the Quick Draw round, the middle stack is used for the Aim Round and the Right Stack is used for the Fire Round. The last remaining card is placed to the very right of the Fire Stack.

When all of the players have made their selection all of the stacks of cards and the remaining card are turned over, spread out and revealed for all to see, then each player places 2d6 on top of their remaining card.

Starting with the Quick Draw Round, the poker hands are compared, players call out their best hand in turn giving the other players the opportunity to challenge their call. Once all hands have been called, the highest scoring player performs the action from the table below using the quick draw column and cross referencing it with his poker hand, once his action has been completed the next highest highest player performs their action in the same way, this continues until all player have taken an action.

Play moves to the Aim round which is repeated exactly as with the quick draw round and then the Fire round is performed.

When the dice are rolled in the Fire Round, their result is deducted directly from the player to the left or right of the active player who may choose either one. If a player ends with a negative results, then they take the damage themselves. When instructed to add or deduct dice in the fire round, just add or deduct the dice as directed to or from the remaining card of the player.
categories: American West, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Math, Print & Play
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Dino Hunt Game
description: Dino Hunt Game is a dinosaur-themed roll-and move game that comes packaged with a book and toy in Smart Kids Dino IQ by Priddy Books. Players roll a die to move their markers along a track. Some spaces move players forward or back or cause loss or gain of a turn. These spaces generally refer to a dinosaur, such as "Rammed by triceratops' horns--lose a turn." The first player to reach the end of the track wins.

name: Owzat T20 Cricket
description:
From the company web site...
Since its inception in 2003 Twenty/20 cricket has gained in popularity making it an important part of the modern game, batting, bowling & fielding techniques have become more evident in the longer versions of the game as more & more T20 games are played year on year.

Twenty20 cricket is currently the shortest version of the game with scores in excess of 200 possible on the (mainly) batsman friendly wickets used for this format of the game.

Twenty20 cricket emulates to reproduce the excitement & tension that draws such big crowds to the real thing, within this game are four batting grids for different types of wickets. Along with four batting & four bowling grades plus a few other charts that will enable the user to replay a full game in around 30-45 minutes when the rules have been mastered, this will ensure a statistically accurate scorecard with a wealth of stats (strike rates, economy rates etc.) and hopefully a nail-biting finish to boot.

Rating players is a simple task & although the grades are in themselves quite basic they will reproduce roughly what is achieved in real life (a T20 batsman's strike rate is regarded as a more valuable asset than his average and a bowlers economy is his main ˜weapon").

The game includes the following Ratings:

ICC World T20 (2014)

Friends Life domestic T20 (2013).

Big Bash league 2013-14

Indian Premier League 2014

Champions League 2013

Caribbean Premier League 2013

The game is played mainly with 2d6 and a d10, which is used occasionally. Batters score runs by rolling a die and moving up a grid, different ones are based on the condition of the wicket. Their starting point on the grid is based on their letter grade. Certain points of the grid will then reference the bowler's grade - you roll a d10 to determine if the batter is out or not.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tricky Pirates
description:
Tricky Pirates is a trick-taking, area control game. Players play cards in tricks that allow them to move their own pirate loaded ships, stab opposing pirates, or sink opposing ships. Pirates in ships fight for control over treasure kept on five islands. But watch out, pirate ships work on wind power and the wind will not always blow your way.

At the beginning of the game, the treasure on the islands is bonuses and play effects. But very quickly it becomes doubloons. The player that controls three islands worth of doubloons at the end of a trick wins.

name: The Three Pillars: Extreme Hauntings Expansion Set
description:
READY FOR MORE?

The stakes are about to be raised - the cases have gotten more dangerous as have the things that await you at each one. All-new card types challenge your team to the extreme! Entities appear when least expected to try and do more than just scare off your Pillars. Access the new Extreme Deck to search for Objects to help in the battle but there is a grave risk in doing so...the potential to be cursed! Perhaps your only hope lies in the new Clergy Pillar.

THE THREE PILLARS™: EXTREME HAUNTINGS expansion requires the Premiere Set to play. With 68 all new cards, you can add to your existing decks or freshen them up completely!

name: Bone Head
description:
Bone Head: the spooky little card game for 2-9 players.

The Bone Heads are on the hunt for roses!

Players take turns to add their Bone Heads to a forming chain by linking hands and avoiding other Bone Heads with the same colour top hat. If a player is unable to play a Bone Head they must collect another from the graveyard.

The first player to play all their Bone Heads successfully collects a rose from the graveyard or steals one from another Bone Head.

Domino+ mechanic with a spooky twist.

name: ATS Maxim Gorki II: The Siege of Sevastopol 1942
description:
ATS MAXIM GORKI is from prolific designer Mark 'Tank' Porterfield. Mark brought you the fruits of his massive military library and penchant for research with Panther Line + Berlin 1 and Berlin 2 (not to mention the Monster Berlin versions), all set on World War II's Eastern Front. Before that, almost 20 years ago Tank brought you Pointe du Hoc, with a healthy on-site assist from Steve and Rob Pleva, plus map work (and on site research too) by Phil Nobo. The TANK is back and this time he is modeling another uniiqe Festung, the Sevastopol bastion of Stalin's Soviet Union and this is a MONSTER MODULE to do his work justice.

Some of the interesting details you'll receive: Russian Naval Infantry, German demolition AFVs including Kettenkrad and Bren Carrier Demo vehicles; massive Naval Gun Turrets; Concrete Trenches; German Engineers, Fortress rules; and so much more. Plus a large map with healthy-sized hexes, more terrain variants, all using official ATS nomenclature for the SSRs while avoiding 5 point type and eye-watering verbiage bloat in what will be the largest Engineer-operation ever gamed at this scale.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Mors lilla Olle: Mitt första spel
description:
The theme for this game is based on a Swedish children’s song about the little boy Olle who went to the woods to pick blueberries. He then encounters a bear and feeds him the berries.

In this game you move your “Olle” on the trail while trying to collect blueberries for the bear. Movement is determined by the multi-colored die (blue, green or yellow) that shows you to which areas you can move. You decide if you want to move forward or backward. If the area is marked by a blueberry, you get to pick up a blueberry from the board. If you land on an area marked by a bear, you get to deliver one of the berries you’ve already picked up and feed it to the bear. The winner of the game is the first person to feed the bear three berries and then make it home to the cabin.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Four
description:
FOUR is a socially-driven, team-based card game of stealthy signals and quirky characters. Players snag cards from the table until one team member collects a Four-Of-A-Kind (4 Pandas, 4 Sharks, 4 Robots, etc.). Once you collect a Four-Of-A-Kind you must sneakily signal to your partner telling them to retrieve the Victory Token. But watch out! If an opponent catches on to your “secret signal” they can claim the Victory Token for themselves!

Each card in the deck has a super sweet POWER that can increase your chances of collecting Four-Of-A-Kind or disrupt your opponent’s chances of winning –say for example, by stealing their best card with a skivvy Pirate or trashing a card they need with a face-punching Shark.

Depth of strategy increases with each hand because players begin to discover and predict their opponents’ secret signals, often forcing everyone to adapt mid-game and create new ways to win. Teams unable to adjust quickly will be left on the sidelines watching their opponents ride humanoid pandas into a sunset of glorious victory!

name: Storming the Heights, The Battle of the Alma, Crimea 1854
description:
Storming the Heights, The Battle of the Alma, Crimea 1854 is a simulation of one of the first major battles of the Crimean War, fought on 20 September 1854. This game models for the first time in a highly-playable format the key elements of the battle — command control (lack of generalship), weaponry, and tactical formations — and aims to captivate players with its strikingly beautiful period map and counters designed by graphic artist, Terry Leeds.

GAME CONTENTS

• One 22" x 34" full-color, period-style map sheet
• One 1/2” full-color counter sheet
• One 5/8” full-color counter sheet
• One 3/4” wide full-color counter sheet
• Rules booklet with Designer’s Notes
• Two Player Aid Cards
• One 6-sided and one 10-sided die
• Boxed

GAME SCALE

Time: 30 minutes per turn
Map: 300 meters per hex
Units: infantry battalions, cavalry regiments, and artillery batteries
Complexity: Low to Moderate
Playing Time: 3–5 Hours
Number of Players: 1–2

Now available for preorder from Consim Press

name: The Red Zone Board Game
description:
For the casual fan and the football addict! The Red Zone is a well balanced fast paced football game that allows novice and experienced football fans to feel the excitement of Pro football. With a balance of strategy and luck, the experienced player can play wisely to put the odds in their favor, but it won't always guarantee the victory.

Two teams can go head to head in a single game or multiple players can set up a league to see who will be The Red Zone champion!

Choose what plays to run and how to utilize your star players at crucial times. Will you run the ball for a shorter but surer gain? Will you pass the ball inside and outside to throw the defense off? Or perhaps you're a risk taker who likes to throw the long bomb!

Knowing your opponents tendencies, calling the right plays and managing the clock could be the difference between winning and losing the championship!

Both teams will be engaged on every play as you battle it out in this classic, fast-paced game of head-to-head football. As time begins to run out, you may be forced to change your strategy to save precious seconds on the clock. It won't be easy, the defense wants to force you to keep the clock moving!

Use the stat sheets provided to keep track of rival matches, league records, sacks, and other stats for personal records and bragging rights.

name: The King's Armory: Robin Hood the Sharpshooter
description: This is a new playable character for The King's Armory. It comes with his character sheet, Reinforcement Card, 2 Equipment Cards and a d20 die.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Network and Route Building, Variable Player Powers

name: Zeppelins: Monsters of the Purple Twilight
description:
For I dipt into the future, far as human eye could see,
Saw the Vision of the world, and all the wonder that would be;
Saw the heavens fill with commerce, argosies of magic sails,
Pilots of the purple twilight dropping down with costly bales;
Heard the heavens fill with shouting, and there rain'd a ghastly dew
From the nations' airy navies grappling in the central blue;

‘Locksley Hall’, Tennyson

This was the world’s first strategic bombing campaign, the first time death rained from the skies onto an unsuspecting populace. Although seemingly ponderous and fragile, and filled with inflammable hydrogen, in 1914 the airships built by Count Zeppelin for the fatherland were a much more viable platform to bomb the English than the rickety wood and canvas aeroplanes that struggled into the sky at the time. Able to fly for days and cover thousands of miles, they were a true ‘airy navy’. However, despite the conviction of its champion, the Leader of Airships Fgtkpt Peter Strasser, this Teutonic leviathan was not a war winning weapon, and failed to deliver the hoped-for victory.

Any reading of the campaign will show that their greatest challenge was not the British defences, but just finding their way over the British countryside. In the dark (all raids were at night), it all looks much the same, and there were no radio beams to guide them like in WWII. This is reflected in the game; above all it is a game of navigation.

The Zeppelin's movement is governed by a system that limits what you can do depending on how well you know your location. The latter you can improve by using landmarks, such as towns, rivers, railroads and coastlines. Alternatively, you can ignore these and rely on dead reckoning, but then you might end up totally lost in the middle of nowhere. And of course, there's weather (clouds, rain, mist) to frustrate you too. However, there's a chance of opportunistic targets when towns randomly fail to blackout.

However, it wasn’t only the Germans who faced the problems of the night. British aviation struggled to develop the technology and practice to deal with night raiders. A warning system that could enable timely launch of aeroplane patrols was never really developed, and once in the air the airman was on his own not knowing where the raider might be, or even where he was. Of course searchlights were the essential item to make the air defence viable, but the wily Zeppelin commander did all he could to avoid them, including using cloud cover.

This is similarly modelled in the game. The British player makes a hidden set up for his airfields before the German player comes on. Once the raiders arrive, he can launch aeroplane patrols, but the number and location is restricted by how much activity the raiders do to reveal themselves. Once launched, the patrol remains in place until a searchlit Zeppelin is in spotting range, and then it can attempt to intercept and attack. In the early scenarios aeroplane attacks can be damaging and cause a Zeppelin to scuttle home with leaks, but after incendiary ammunition was developed in mid 1916 it became sudden death to the Zeppelin.

The British player also has anti-aircraft guns, which are distributed over the map and controlled largely by random rolls, except for the mobile guns which the British player can place at strategic locations and use to set up ambushes.

Combat is largely abstracted to die rolls, but the challenge is to bring the raider to bear. As the British, you plan your fighter patrols and move mobile AA guns to defend areas or set up ambush. But reveal a unit too soon and the German player will know its there and avoid it. As the German, use stealth to avoid combat. Hide in clouds; at all costs keep out of those searchlights. But in the end, you have to brave them if you want to bomb the good targets.

This game offers a definitive study of that unusual campaign, with a set of 20 scenarios (each being an actual historical raid), covering the entire 4 years of the campaign. The subject matter naturally lends itself well to solitaire play as well, and specific rules for this are included.

name: Yukimura's Last Battle: Osaka Siege Summer Campaign
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #24.

An operational level wargame of the battle of Tennoji, climax of the Osaka Siege Summer Campaign.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siege_of_Osaka
Yukimura Sanada was the dominating army leader in the Toyotomi army, and he was killed in this battle.

Players control either the Tokugawa army or the Toyotomi army. Each army has an initial morale level at three, and they can perform the operations of the same number as the morale level.
Toyotomi army has only one formation and they can perform either movement or combat in an operation. Tokugawa army has six formations and a formation can move and combat in an operation.

Winner is determined by the collapse of morale or breaking through the front line.

FE47 Aux Barricades! France 1944

18 scenarios compatible with the Advanced Squad Leader system.

This pack also includes two unmounted counters for an armored train.

Scenarios:

name: Admiral's Order: Algeciras 1801
description:
Admiral's Order: Naval Tactics in the Age of Sail is a simulation of naval engagements between ships-of-the-line and frigates in the Age of Fighting Sail. The focus of the game lies on the wars between Britain and France and her allies in the years 1775 to 1815.

Algesiras 1801, an extension to the Edition 74 or All Hands! versions of Admiral's Order, simulates the first battle of Algeciras at the 6th July 1801. While the French laid at anchor at the Spanish coast, secured by coastal batteries and gunboats, a British squadron attacked.

Algesiras 1801 includes many additional rules to simulate the batteries, gunboats and squadrons at anchor and the shore. It comes with a large map, showing "La Bahia de Algesiras" near by Gibraltar.
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Manimals: Loro Parque 1
description:
Sarah and Dinah are standing totally amazed in the zoo in front of the sea lions. Something is laying next to a rock with feathers on its back? "Does a sea lion have feathers like a bird or does it have fur like a dog?" Suddenly somebody claps their hands and the duck that was hiding behind the sea lions flies off quacking. Relieved, both of them laugh at each other after seeing that the sea lion doesn't have any feathers after all.

In Manimals: Loro Parque 1, players compete to find as many animals as possible with a certain characteristic. To start play, shuffle the animal cards, then spread forty of them on the table so that everyone can see them. Flip over one card, see the characteristic identified on this card, then race to pick up all animals that feature this characteristic. Once everyone has finished picking up cards, check all the cards collected to see whether anyone made a mistake; if so, that player must return the mistaken card and one correctly collected card.

Players repeat this process six more times, first laying out three more cards from the deck each time, then they see who has collected the most cards and won!

Manimals: Loro Parque 1 includes rule variants that allow for play with children as young as four.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time

name: Jomsborg
description:
Jomsborg is freely based on an ancient viking game.

The game board is made to symbolise the viking stronghold Jomsborg and the game is centred around the struggle between Harald Bluetooth (Harald Blåtand) and his son Sweyn Forkbeard (Svend Tveskæg). The player playing Sweyn starts at the center of the board with 1 king and 28 vikings. Harald starts as an outer rim on the board with 1 king and 47 vikings.

The players take turn moving one piece at a time. Pieces are moved horizontally or vertically - never diagonally - on the board. Vikings can move as many or few spaces as they want in one direction without crossing other pieces. Kings can only move one space at a time.

Kings can only be beaten by a king moving to the same space. Vikings can be beaten by having enemy pieces on 2 opposite sides of it. Beaten pieces are removed from play. A piece is captured if it is surrounded by pieces on all 4 sides and at least one of these are an enemy piece.

Sweyn wins by having his king reach the outer rim of the board or by capturing or beating Harald. Harald wins by capturing Sweyn or by beating him.

name: The Wizard of Wookey Hole
description:
This is a game played with 18 cards: each with a different value.

You play with only 2 cards at a time in your hand and manipulate other players to gather the best cards for yourself.

The object is to gain the most points.

name: Pop Goes A Million
description:
The object of the game is to become a successful Pop Group Manager, by gaining control of as many Groups as possible, and obtaining the cards for as many Cities marked on the board as you can. The ultimate success is to become a "Millionaire".

Imagine you are the manager of your favourite "Pop" group and that they are giving performances in the various cities where your counter lands.

Money is made from Group performance fees and 'Hire of Hall' charges, received when a player has the exclusive performance rights for a particular city. Fees are doubled if the rights for all four cities in a country are held.

name: The Little Big Game of Lexis Hold'em
description:
The Little Big Game of Lexis Hold'em transforms Texan Hold'em into a word game. Instead of forming straights, flushes or pairs, players spell words. The game ends when only one player has chips remaining. That person is the winner.

Each player receives an equal number of betting chips. The dealer deals 2 "hole" cards to each player and 5 "community" cards face down. Players must place a chip into the pot to play in the hand.

The Pre-Flop (Round One): After looking at their own cards, the players can check or bet. The following players can call (equal the last bet placed in the pot), raise (increase the last bet placed in the pot), or fold (sit out the hand and lose all bets placed so far).

The Flop (Round Two): The dealer turns over the first 3 "community" cards.

The Turn Card (Round Three): The dealer turns over the 4th "community" card.

The River (Round Four): The dealer turns over the last "community" card.

After each round players use their own cards and the community cards to form a word and a round of betting occurs. After the last round players secretly write down their words before betting.

The Showdown: After all betting is done, players who have not folded show their cards. The player that forms the word worth the most points takes all the chips in the pot.

name: The Card Tower
description:
THE CARD TOWER

Players: 2 or 4
Game time: 15 to 25 min
Age group: 10+

Synopsis
The Card Tower is a Dice/Card game where 2 to 4 construction companies are competing against each other to win a lucrative contract to build the next luxury tower in downtown Manhattan. During each turn the companies are trying to build each of the four construction zones of the building floor plan faster than their opponent. During the construction phase each company has a saboteur who is trying to stop the other companies from completing their job. As the tower rises, by placing a new tower card on top of the previous card with dice, it’s up to you to decide what’s more important; building a zone of the floor plan or sabotaging your opponent. If you build the most high quality sections of the tower, you will win the contact and the honor of putting your name of the tower.

As you play you are actually building a tower of cards with dice becoming the supporting structure.

Components
18 – Tower cards
18 – Sabotage cards
36 – d6 dice “9 dice each of four colors”
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Selectio
description: Climbing game using wooden tiles numbered from one to nine in four suits in descending order of strength: Suns, Moons, Stars and Clouds. There are also four Jokers. Tiles are divided evenly between players and everyone gets a Joker. The player with One of Clouds starts. You're playing singles, pairs, three of a kinds or straights of two or three. The first player to get rid of his tiles wins.

name: Triumph
description:
Lead Rome to greatness and become its first Emperor!

In Triumph, you want to turn the Roman Republic from a small city into a vast empire as the leader of a great noble family. Vie for dominance on every front of the Republic's life, and outmaneuver your rivals as you compete for power and prestige. Vanquish all external enemies and secure new provinces for the glory of Rome. Will you rise to the challenge and lead your family to ultimate triumph?

With a deck of cards representing your family's most illustrious figures, you'll bid to secure the offices of consuls, praetors, and censors. Those will, in turn, provide you with clients, gold, and legions to govern provinces, lead successful military campaigns, and control key sites within Rome itself – all to gain enough prestige to proclaim yourself the first Emperor of Rome!
categories: Ancient, Card Game, City Building, Dice, Negotiation, Political
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, King of the Hill, Map Reduction, Negotiation, Point to Point Movement, Voting

name: Scattered at Sea
description:
You were aboard the yacht "Northern Pride", which a small group of friends had chartered for a party that night off the shores of New England. The group asked the Captain to take the boat way out to sea, away from any lights so they could party under the stars and maybe see the Northern Lights put on a show. When the boat set out, it was a clear, pleasant evening and the sea was calm. The Captain did mention something about a possible storm front that was due to move in early the next morning.

For hours, the party aboard the boat had enjoyed themselves. Then someone noticed the stars had all disappeared, and the stillness of the sea was quickly turning into gale force winds. The storm front had moved in faster than anyone could have expected. A sudden microburst tore the boat to pieces, plunging you all into the sea.

Now you all find yourselves sitting atop a piece of the boat, bobbing in the water, somewhere in the Atlantic Ocean. Scattered in the water all around you, are pieces and debris from the boat. As it all happened so fast, the Captain had no chance to radio for help. You realize it may be some time before you are rescued, and you will need to survive until then.

To survive (and win the game) you must find a flotation device, a signaling device, a water source, and a food source. To find your survival tools, you will have to swim around searching the sea for floating parts. You might even have to might have to steal parts from others, or withhold parts from them to save yourself.

Survive being awash at sea by using deduction, hand management and memory.

This game uses cards as boat pieces, and floating debris. It comes with 6 player tokens to move from card (boat piece or swim card) to card. Each turn you have 2 strokes to move. As the game progresses it takes more strokes to move as the pieces are drifting further apart.

name: Franken-Monster Deathmatch
description:
Mix and match dragon, vampire, and werewolf body parts to create a fearsome gladiator that you will pit against your opponents' creations. Fight to the death against the other monsters in a limb rending battle that only ends when one heart remains beating.

The game has two distinct phases, first you draft all of the body parts between all players, and build your monster with the parts you've drafted. Then players take turns attacking each other using an innovative system where the limb you use to attack dictates which area (upper, middle, lower) of your monster will be vulnerable to the next attack aimed at you.

Combat continues as limbs take damage and eventually fall off. If an attack targets a space that is missing a limb it goes through to the torso, once your torso is destroyed you are out of the game.

Each body part has a thematic offensive or defensive battle effect which adds to replay value as you explore all of the possible monster combinations.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Chronicards: L'histoire à l'école primaire
description:
Description
Ideal for acquiring a good foundation, History in primary school is for young adults, but also looking for a family game or a cultural product for easily dive back into history.
Chronicards, a whole collection to mix !
Each card is unique!

Medal at the Lépine contest.

Contents
60 tarot cards formatted with instructions in French.

How to play ?

Chronicards is a card game played using 60 cards.
Each card depicts a historical event on one side with explanation and the year in which that event occurred on the other side.
Players take turns placing a card from their hand in a row on the table. After placing the card, the player reveals the date on it. If the card was placed correctly with the date in chronological order with all other cards on the table, the card stays in place; otherwise the card is put in the right place and the player takes another card from the deck.

The first player to get rid of all his cards by placing them correctly wins. If multiple players go out in the same round, then everyone else is eliminated from play and each of those players are dealt one more card for another round of play. If only one player has no cards after a bonus round, he wins; otherwise play continues until a single player goes out.


Description
Conçu en collaboration avec des professeurs des écoles pour une utilisation parascolaire, ce titre s’adresse à un large public à partir de 10 ans.

De Lucy l’Australopithèque (vers -3.000.000) à la mise en circulation de l’Euro (2002), les 60 dates traitent de la Préhistoire et de l’Histoire de France.

Idéal pour acquérir de bonnes bases, L’Histoire à l’école primaire s’adresse aux plus jeunes mais également aux adultes à la recherche d’un jeu familial ou d’un produit culturelermettant de se replonger facilement dans l’Histoire.

Chronicards, toute une collection à mélanger !
Mélangez les thèmes pour enrichir votre chronologie. Chaque carte est unique !

Médaillé au concours Lépine.

Contenu
60 cartes au format tarot avec notice en français.

---

Comment jouer ?

-Preparation de la partie -
Distribuer 5 cartes côté texte visible devant chaque joueur sans retourner les cartes. Les joueurs laissent les cartes posées sur la table. Déposer la pioche côté texte visible et retourner la première carte du paquet côté date sur la table. C'est le point de départ de la chronologie.

-Déroulement-
À tour de rôle, chaque joueur choisit une carte dans son jeu en énonçant à voix haute le titre de l'événement. Il la positionne ensuite chronologiquement par rapport à celle(s) déjà déposée(s). Il retourne alors la carte côté date pour vérifier s'il a raison. Si oui, il ne pioche pas de carte. Si non, la carte est repositionnée au bon endroit dans la frise chronologique et le joueur pioche une carte. C'est ensuite au joueur suivant. Si un joueur ne se souvient plus de l'événement correspondant à une carte déjà posée, il peut la retourner pour la consulter.

-Fin-
Le premier à se débarrasser de toutes ses cartes l'emporte. Si des joueurs terminent dans le même tour, ils continuent à jouer en piochant une nouvelle carte et sont éliminés en cas d'erreur. Le dernier encore en jeu gagne.

name: Bezzerwizzer Musik
description:
Bezzerwizzer Musik uses the same rules as Bezzerwizzer Kompakt but contains only questions regarding music.

The game contains 100 cards with questions in 12 music categories and therefor only 1.200 questions - less than previous versions. Both question cards and category tokens are kept in an orange color to make them distinct from the original BEZZERWIZZER game and BEZZERWIZZER Kompakt. This means that you can mix tokens from all of the games together and create your own game with precisely the categories you like.

The rules below are an exact copy of the ones from Bezzerwizzer Kompakt:

To start with the players are divided into two to six teams. Each team can consist of one or more players. Each team then gets a bezzerwizzer token that can be used once per round (see below).

Now the game starts: Each team picks a token at random out of the included bag. There are 20 tokens - one for each category in the game. The token must be kept secret for the other players. The first team to go then choose either to answer a question in the category on their token or to swap with one of the other teams without knowing what they will get. If they answer the question that they end up with correctly, they will receive 3 points - a wrong answer does nothing. Scoring is kept on the included pad. This continues till all teams have answered a question. The last team will not have the possibility to swap as all other teams have used up their categories.

Each turn each of the teams have one opportunity to bezzerwizze one of the other teams question. This means that if the team does not answer the question correctly the team that has bezzerwizzet has a chance to answer as well. If the first team does answer correctly however the others team will have wasted their chance to bezzerwizze. The number of points you get for bezzerwizzing and answering correct is dependent on at what time you choose to do it. If you choose to bezzerwizze after the category is revealed but before the question is read aloud you will get 2 points for a correct answer. If you do it after the question has been read aloud you will only get 1 point. If the teams that bezzerwizzet can not answer correctly either the original team will receive the points.

The turn order then switches one place and the process starts again. If there are fewer category tokens in the bag than the number of teams when a new turn is started all of the tokens are returned to the bag.

The game ends when one of the teams have 20 points (the round is finished to allow other teams to reach 20 as well). Alternately you can choose to only play until the bag is empty.

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Side Stories
description:
Science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering 3rd and 4th battle of Tiamat Star zone.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 6 to 14 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Manhattan TraffIQ: East River
description:
With 9 new tiles featuring the diagonal the ferry lines around Manhattan, the game gets even more strategic.

The East River borders Manhattan to the southeast. Famous bridges, including the Brooklyn Bridge, cross the East River. But also the ferry lines across the river are now to be considered.

In addition to red, beige, green and blue, there is now a fifth kind of tile edge: a dashed white line on blue (water) surfaces stands for a (passenger) ferry connection. In addition, a fifth symbol makes it clear that this tile side can only be attached to the same tile sides (with a ferry connection). Because of their small number, this is rarely possible and is therefore rewarded with a "free" draw of city tiles.

name: New Word Order
description:
To play, you consider several words and phrases, and determine the order in which they entered our language.
Each card has a word on front. Players try to put them in the correct chronological order. When they have finished, they flip the cards over to see how they've done. The year each word entered the language are printed on the back.
The game can also be played competitively, with each player passing a word to a competitor. The competitor must attempt to place it correctly in his personal timelime. If it is incorrect, it is discarded. First player to have 7 cards in their timeline wins.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Hamsterspiel
description: Simply vintage roll & move board game for children. The first player, who cross the finish line first, wins the game.

name: Bellwether: The Card Game
description:
After the great Madstone war your village must be rebuilt. You will be an important part of that. You are a wizard! You must learn new spells to accomplish this. With them you will hunt dark creatures and restore the town's resources and buildings to their former glory!
In Bellwether, the card game, each player starts with five cards in hand. There are two ways to gain points: The first is to build buildings and societal organizations. The second is to hunt dark creatures. All cards have a magical energy (color of the boarder of the card), a magical artifact, a creature to hunt, and civilization advance or building to build. When a player chooses a study action all players gain more cards--the player choosing the action gains an extra card. When a player chooses to hunt dark creatures he uses the magical artifact on a card or combination of cards to target the creature on a card in his hand or the top of the discard pile. Again all players have the opportunity to hunt, the player choosing the action gets bonus damage. When a player chooses to build he chooses a combination of cards from his hand or from creatures previously killed, the player choosing to build gaining a bonus.
Points are also gained by having a variety of different types of creatures killed and buildings built. If a wizard builds or kills all of the same order, he becomes obsessed and loses points for being a dark wizard.

name: Snapstories
description:
Tell me a story.
Not the usual made up kind, but one from real life - your own real life!
We are all full of stories, and Snapstories brings them out into the open.

All you have to do is draw a card, and get inspired by the text ... it could be "That scared me" or "I felt loved" or any of 98 other cards. Turn the sand timer, and start you story.

It doesn't have to be a great story or a long one, just tell it like you remember it. After 3 minutes at the most, you are done, and the next player is up.
Did you get stuck? No panic, we have cards to help you out, so just draw one of those.

What do the other players do during your story?
They Listen!

If you want to add anything to a story, or hear more about it, you will have to play one your tokens - and you only have two for the whole game.

Snapstories brings people together across generations, across cultures and across the table. The game can engage anyone, anywhere, because the subject is life - your life!

name: The Front Nine: The Municipal Golf Club
description:
The Royal Golfing Association were heavily criticised after the 'Augustus' campaign for promoting golf as an elitist sport. Many argued that golf should be available to all, not just those who could afford top flight membership fees. Bowing to this pressure the RGA have launched the 'Municipal Golf Club' initiative and challenge local authorities and councils to redevelop their suburban and brown field sites in a competition to design and build the best golf course that will be accessible to all members of the public.

As Chairman of your local council parks and recreation department, you must do all you can to secure this coveted prize for your borough. However with your neighbouring districts equally driven to win, you might have to resort to underhand tactics to sabotage the opposition's plans. Perhaps by the construction of a disruptive by pass through their course or even funding a sewage treatment facility a bit too close to a fairway. Perhaps the winner may not be decided by which course is the best, but which is the least worst!

Eighteen new 'urban' course cards to be spliced into the original deck. New Market and Club House cards along with special cards focused on making the design of your opponents courses as difficult as possible. Not to mention those dastardly fly tippers dumping rubbish all over your lovely fairways! This second expansion for The Front Nine requires a more ruthless attitude for the prospective golf course designer. Not for the faint hearted!
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Masters of the Tourist Trophy
description:
Masters of the Tourist Trophy is a motorcycle racing sports replay game simulating the Isle of Man Tourist Trophy. The Isle of Man TT has, for many years, been regarded as the most prestigious and oldest motorcycle race in the world... and also the most dangerous motorcycle road-race in the world!

Summary

The game is typical of Lambourne's sports replay simulations in that it takes place on tables and charts (no board or counters) with minimal player decisions required.

The simulation has been developed to capture the confused progress of the Isle of Man mountain bike races. With drivers setting off at different times, the system is able to record both the positions on the course from a spectator viewpoint as well as keep track of the actual driver times for determining a race winner. As in the actual Tourist Trophy, crashes and mishaps are common and not all riders can be expected to finish.

The game includes race control sheets for six different classes of race, from the ultra-lightweight 125cc bikes to the Formula One 1200cc monsters. The famous TT sidecars are also represented in a class of their own.

The drivers represented and rated are drawn from the "all-time greats" from over 100 years of Tourist Trophy events.

Brief outline of the Game System

The race is set up on a Race Control Sheet that lists Driver Name, Driver Rating and Start Time. For each stage of the race every driver rolls two pairs of dice (red and green) to advance their progress.

The difference between the green "+" and red "-" dice, when added to the driver performance rating, determine whether the driver performance improves or degrades on each stage of the lap. Comparison of the driver performance ratings will reveal the order of the drivers on the circuit as they pass each checkpoint on the circuit.

Rolling doubles on either pair of dice may improve or degrade the driver performance rating, but rolling double "6" requires a further roll on Rider Mistakes or Mechanical Trouble charts. Such problems usually result in a performance loss, but can also cause retirement through a crash or serious mechanical failure. Game charts will determine the precise location of each such accident on the circuit.

Drivers must also elect to Pit Stop at least once during the race. This can be dome at a time decided by the player and requires a die roll and chart reference to determine the effect the pit stop has on race time.

At the end of the lap the cumulative performance for each of the four lap stages can be cross-referenced against the game charts to determine the lap time and average speed for each driver on the circuit.

name: Rainbow Brite: A Color Matching Game
description:
Players spin & move around the board, collecting different color sprinkles and trying to fill their rainbow card with each color. Beware of Murky Dismall, who will take your sprinkles away. The first player to fill his rainbow card with color sprinkles, wins the game!

Comes with 4 Tokens, Spinner, 24 Color Sprinkles, 4 Rainbow Cards, Gameboard & Instruction Sheet.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Alemungula
description:
From Mancala World:

Alemungula is a mancala game played by the Wetawit (formerly spelled Wetaweat) in Ethiopia, around the towns of Asosa and Beni Sangul, towards the Sudan border. Wetawit is an ethnic group in Ethiopia and Sudan. They speak Berta, a Nilo-Saharan language. The population of this group is about 248,000.

The game is played mainly by youngsters, though sometimes also by adults in their leisure time. It is closely related to Um el Bagara ("the cow game") which is played by the Baggara in northern Sudan. However, Alemungula offers bigger challenges because singletons may also be moved.

Alemungula was first described by the ethiopist Richard Pankhurst in 1971. The game was implemented by Arty Sandler for online play at igGameCenter on December 19, 2010.

Rules

Alemungula is played on a wooden board which consists of 2x5=10 holes known as tisiya alemungula ("alemungula wood"), while the holes are called ful alemungula. Play is begun with five stones in each hole.

At his turn, a player picks up all the contents of one of his holes and then distributes, one by one, the stones into the following holes, the direction depending on the hole chosen. Moves from either of a player's two left-hand holes are made in clockwise direction, moves from either of the player's two right-hand holes are made in an anti-clockwise direction, and moves from the center hole may be made in either direction. The move is finished after a single lap.

A singleton which is played into an empty hole of the opponent's side, that is either the last or the first hole of the opponent's row), may not be played back in the next move.

If the last stone is dropped in one of the opponent's holes and makes a two or a four, these stones are captured. Should one or more of the opponent's holes immediately preceding this on the line of play, also have been increased to two or four stones these will likewise be captured.

The captured stones are removed from the board and stored.

The game ends when a player has no legal move. Each player then captures the stones remaining on his side.

The winner is the player who captured the greater number of stones during the game. If both players captured the same number the game is a draw.

name: モリヤウォーズ (Moriya Wars: Episode II)
description: モリヤウォーズ (Moriya Wars: Episode II) is a hidden identity game in which each player has different victory conditions. To keep it from being too easy to determine who is which character based on what you do in the game, players need to select actions based on the dice rolled in the game, so feel free to blame the dice when you "have" to do something that seems like it's leading someone toward victory.

name: Tempest: Shards of the Gods
description:
In the world of Tempest: Shards of the Gods, the apocalypse has come and gone. The world as it once was has been shattered into countless shards of reality. The only things that remain are the gods and what pieces they could salvage before the end came.

Take the place of a god of ancient myth:

Anubis: leading the Egyptians
Athena: leading the Greeks
Inari: leading the Japanese
Heimdallr: leading the Norse


Tempest: Shards of the Gods features a number of unique mechanics:

Discard any card for resources. Resources do not build each turn; instead, every card you play comes at the sacrifice of another.
Tailor your deck to your opponent as you play. Split your resources between modifying and building your deck, or playing cards to fight your opponent.
Tell the best story to win. Demigod and Tale cards have Labors that can be completed to score Victory Points. Reach 5 points first to win the game.


Fight for dominion over what is left, conquer enemy shards to piece together a universe for yourself, fend off attacks from rival gods and set your name in myth.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Storytelling

name: Sangin Despatches No.2
description: This 76 page supplement includes additional scenarios and rules for the Skirmish Sangin miniatures game. The book includes six new scenarios, additional rules for JTAC’s, Helicopter, Drones and Combat Engineers. It also contains a new 16 page Taliban ORBAT (order of battle) that includes everything you need to know about building a Taliban Insurgent force, including Chechen allies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare

name: Clinic Expansion: Medical Dossier 3
description:
Clinic Expansion: Medical Dossier 3, the third expansion for the CliniC base game, contains:


5 Virus + new orange and red cubes
Public works tiles
Pregnant women
Satellite dish tiles


The ICU PnP tiles and rules are included in this last dossier as well as an official solo variant.
categories: City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game

name: For Queen and Planet: The Imperial Wars of Earth and Mars 1845 thru 1930 – The Compendium
description:
The sweep of the red Sudanese desert, scattered with thorny trees and pierced by black basalt outcrops is the setting for this cinematic rule set. The whirling dervish, the fanatical Ansar and the lonely British foot soldier far from home are the combatants.

With these rules, you can take the role of the British commander tasked by the Queen with maintaining crown rule in distant, inhospitable lands or the local emir, committed to exercising his own free will over the natives who will fight with all their blood, sweat and tears.

For Queen and Planet is designed to balance the mass and ferocity of the local peoples against the technology and training of the Colonial powers and to provide a fair and reasonable struggle for both imperial General and local Emir.

For Queen and Planet - Making Colonial Wargaming fun!
This rule set includes:

All rules necessary to play either a colonial or VSF version of the game.
An alternative timeline for VSF genre play.
Unit lists detailing British, British-colonial, Ansar, Beja and Cephalopod forces.
A nine-scenario campaign that will allow you to play your way through the Mahdi’s initial rebellion against Egyptian garrison forces all the way through to the siege of Khartoum.
A quick reference sheet for most common information.
A one-page how to do things to help you get comfortable with the rules.
A blank unit command sheet.

CAMPAIGN SCENARIOS

Each of the scenarios in this rulebook is written to be fought as a pure colonial battle, but it is very easy to add a VSF flare to any scenario or battle you fight with this rule system. I have included an addendum (in italics) to each ‘colonial’ battle to allow you to make it a VSF battle. Play balance will not be affected by converting colonial battles to VSF battles.

The Rise of the Mahdi Scenarios:

1) First Battle of El Obeid - Dec 1881 Egyptian vs. Ansar
2) Second Battle of El Obeid (or Hick's Folly) - Nov 1883 - British lead Egyptians vs. Ansar
3) First Battle of El Teb (or Baker's Teb) - Feb 4, 1884 - British lead Egyptians vs. Beja
4) Second Battle of El Teb - Feb 29, 1884 - British vs. Beja
5) Battle of Tamai - March 13, 1884 - British vs. Beja
6) Siege of Khartoum - ~May 1884 - Ansar sieging British lead Egyptians
7) The Battle of Abu Klea - Jan 17, 1885 - British vs. Ansar
8) The Battle of Kirbekan - Feb 10, 1885 - British vs. Ansar
9) The Battle of Tofrek - March 22, 1885 - British vs. Beja/Ansar
categories: Book, Miniatures, Post-Napoleonic, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Norfin Troll Treehouse Game
description:
This is a Colorforms game where the object is to be the first to completely fill your Treehouse with all four missing Norfin Trolls. The trolls are Colorforms that stick on the Treehouse. Comes with 4 Treehouse cards with stands, Board with built-in spinner, and Colorform pieces.

Player spins so the spinner points to one of the four Norfin Trolls. Player adds the matching troll to their Treehouse. If there is no matching troll or they already have the matching troll, play moves to the next player. The first player to fill their Treehouse wins.

name: Car Wars: The Card Game – Out of Control Promo Card
description:
A Promo card that was released as part of the Car Wars Arenas Kickstarter Campaign. It was a reward to the $40 and higher pledge levels.

The card's ability is this:

Out of Control

Play against an opponent IMMEDIATELY after they play a Spin, Swerve, or Bootlegger Reverse. That player loses their next turn.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Car Wars: The Card Game – Body Armor Promo Card
description:
A Promo card that was released as part of the Car Wars Arenas Kickstarter Campaign. It was a reward to the $40 and higher pledge levels.

The card's ability is this:

Body Armor

Play at any time, up until your driver takes damage from an Attack card. This acts as Armor (3) against the first such Attack played against you. If played IMMEDIATELY after the attack, it also works against that attack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Racing, Science Fiction

name: Stras
description:
Here are the rules...

Give each player 10 cards (1 pack of card needed)

The winner is the one who get rid of all their cards first (jokers are free cards and are best to keep until the very end to surprise the other players)

You moove one dice at a time. Not like a combination. This will make you end up on 2 different square.

Avoid the "C" spot, if you end your move on one, You'll have to take another card in your hand.

If you end up on a square with a drawing of a dice, you have to moove your pawn by that number of square in any direction you want.

You can only moove one direction with the first dice no come and back. But you can choose to move back with the second dice in any direction. Or even use a different pawn for the second dice.

You need a 6 on one dice or on a combination of the 2 dices to put a pawn into play. You have tree role to get it otherwise you loose your turn.

If you got a 6 on one dice you can move your pawn by the number of the other dice. You can move on any direction.

You get rid of a card by ending your moove on a card symbol identical as your card. The card symbol count as a square. You can only enter that card symbol square by the exact number and by the only way make with an arrow. This is a safe square and the only place your safe to be eaten by an another player.

You get eaten by a player if they end up their moove on the same space as you.

name: Pack of Lies
description:
Description from the publisher:

Pack of Lies takes place in a "noir fantasy" world that is based around lies and deceit. Each player is on a grim quest to clear their name. They must gather a gang of characters that will either use treachery and deceit or bash some skulls until they get to the truth.

The gameplay of Pack of Lies lets players choose to either work with or against other players to clear their name throughout the game; whatever best suits their purpose at any given time. The characters in the game can also help out a number of players at once. Be careful though — the fate of a character within the game is sure to affect multiple players in the game.

Work with or against the different factions within the city including The Church, The Cops, The Syndicate/Mob, Enchanters, and Dragonclan.

name: Escape from T-Rex Island
description:
Four exploration teams are racing to get back to their base camp on an uncharted island. Behind them is a furious & hungry T-Rex. The teams must get the crews to the base camp as soon as possible before they become dinner of the beast. They also need to get enough food to feed the survivors or people will start to fight for food.

Escape from T-Rex Island is a quick family game for 2-4 players. Each player controls three teams of survivors but only two actions may be taken each turn, so a player must choose which team to move. On the way back to the camp, players may encounter other fearsome dinosaurs like raptors & pterosaurs. Players must avoid the dinosaurs while collecting food & weapons dropped from the victims. Besides, players may take valuable dinosaur pictures for bonus scores.

In each turn, a player has two actions. You may play an action card to move a team or to take a picture if available. You may also spend an action to draw a card from the deck. But beware. No more than four cards can be held in hands.

The game ends when a player has 3 teams back to the camp. Then players score VPs for survivors & dinosaur pictures. The player who scores most VPs wins.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Jiji-Nyago
description:
The cat leaders who live in the city decided to use Cat Racing to settle the endless fights on territory, and so they have come to the forest. The mouse henchmen heard rumors of the race, and so they have schemed to use the fights among the cat fellows, who have always tormented them, to make money. Then……the usually quiet forest stadium, where cats’ and mice’s hot battles and gambles are unfolded, becomes a Cat Stadium.

You are a mice boss. Let’s lead the henchmen wisely to influence the cats as you please, and make magnificent amount of money.
publishers: イマジンゲームズ (imagine GAMES)

name: Among Nobles: Promo Character Cards
description:
Alternate versions of some of the character cards (different backside). A single cards was given out for free with each game bought at Spiel'15, or they could be bought there as a complete set. They are sold out since.

The new cards include Sybille of Cleves, Charles IX de France, Charles de Solier, Mary I of England, Isabella d'Este, Isabel de Portugal, Edward VI of England, and Felipe II de España.

This is what Among Meeples published as an update during their Kickstarter campaign:

Everybody loves promo-cards! So we naturally decided to create some for game fairs, as "thank you's" to the people who have helped us etc. We ended up creating 8 new Character cards and a silly alternate artwork first player card with our faces on - the last one only in 14 copies, they are for family and friends.

While including them in the game was not an option, we really wanted to give something more to the backers. While people attending game fairs and buying the game can get one or two cards, we now bring you the option of getting them all as PnP. We will release them all in October, but we will also add one to the PnP files each time the number of likes (thumbs) on the big Essen preview list rises by 5 (it is currently at 74 likes, currently making it the 13th most liked game - out of more than 1.000!)! You can find links to the latest PnP edition in this backers-only update.

The cards all substitute other cards in the game. If you play using sleeves, simply swap the original card with the promo card before playing. If you do not use sleeves, the best method is properly to wait for the original to be turned over and then substitute it with the promo card.

Please notice, that this "Kickstarter mini-expansion" is designed as promo-cards, they are not perfectly balanced or nearly as thoroughly tested as our regular cards are. We do not recommend to use them in the first few games, but for experienced players, especially the ladies add more complexity during the first rounds - and alters the tactics immensely. Have fun!

name: State Smarts: The Card Game of National Intelligence
description:
From the publisher:

State Smarts is a U.S. geography card game that is both educational and fun for children yet is also entertaining and challenging enough for adults. In addition to state specific facts, kids will also learn unique characteristics about each region of the country. The game also teaches state and landmark location as well as state abbreviations.

State Smarts is more than just a game of learning, it’s also a competitive game of strategy that the whole family can enjoy. Experienced players that have familiarized themselves with the facts will quickly appreciate the element of probability that makes playing State Smarts™ so much fun.

State Smarts is a simple card game that is easy to learn and a game that can be played anywhere. There are 100 cards in the deck with about 70 different original illustrations. A game of State Smarts should last about 15-20 minutes.

name: Usagi no Ougon Jidai
description:
User summary:
ウサギの黄金時代 (Usagi no Ougon Jidai) means Rabbits' Golden Age in English. The publisher gives it as PaxUSANA, a pun on Pax Romana.

PaxUSANA is a game of administration in the world of rabbits during their golden age. Effectively use your three actions to collect the resources, meet the demands, and aim to achieve 6 points. It can also be played solo.

Publisher's summary:
ウサギ世界の最盛期を舞台とした執政ゲーム。
３回のアクションを駆使し資源を集めて需要を回し6勝利点を目指す。
ソロプレイにも対応"

name: 73 North
description:
A solitaire game covering the Battle of Barents sea.

A player controls the JW515B convoy transporting supply to Murmansk. The German submarine and air raids are controlled by the system through the playing cards.
publishers: Kokusai-Tsushin Co., Ltd. (国際通信社), Sho-Kikaku

name: Second World War at Sea: South American Navies
description:
From the publisher:

Our Second Great War setting is based on the premise that the First World War came to a negotiated end in late 1916, leaving the great empires intact but planting the seeds of renewed conflict a generation later. Second World War at Sea: South American Navies looks at the involvement of Latin America's leading powers: Argentina, Brazil and Chile.

Each of these fleets has undergone the expansion and reconstruction allowed by strong economic growth and relative political stability - without a German economic collapse to fuel it, the Great Depression is no more than a world-wide recession. Political and especially economic ties have aligned the Latin powers with their European partners: Argentina with Italy, Chile with Britain, and Brazil with the Central Powers of Imperial Germany and Austria-Hungary, while maintaining a strong trade relationship with the United States.

Their fleets reflect this: the Argentine battleships have been re-built along the pattern of the Italian Conte di Cavour class, the Brazilians much like American battleships, and the Chilean ships like their British near-sisters. And each has added new ships and aircraft from those sources in pursuit of a balanced fleet. Of course, there are airships as well.

South American Navies is a supplement for the Second World War at Sea series, based on battles that never happened. There are 12 new scenarios in a story arc following the participation of the South American fleets in the Second Great War. It is not a complete game: Ownership of Cone of Fire (and only Cone of Fire) is necessary to play all of the scenarios included.

South American Navies includes 90 laser-cut and mounted playing pieces: 50 "long" pieces representing major warships and 40 square ones representing aircraft.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Taking Food from Bears
description:
In Taking Food From Bears, each player takes the role of a hiker trying to take food from a bear

At the beginning of the game, each player receives a set of seven cards, with numbers from 1 to 5, 1 whistle, and 1 bear trap. The Bear cards have values 3, 5, 7, 9, 11, 13, and 15. In a round, players attempt to steal from the target bear by playing his cards in sequence. The first player secretly looks at the target bear (the top bear card) and plays one of his number cards face up. If he plays a "3" card, it means that the player intends to steal 3 food from the target bear. Next players have two options: 1) look at the bear card just as the first player did and play a number card face up; or 2) play a number/whistle/bear card face down, take a multiplier (x2) card from the pool, and put the multiplier card on his face down number card.

After all the players played their cards, the Bear card is revealed. Beginning from the player who played the lowest card, add up the value of the number tokens. Suppose that the Bear is "9" and Josh played "3", Becky "5", Lupita "2", and Samuel "3" with "x2" multiplier on it, Lupita (2), Josh (3), and Samuel (3) are entitled to receive 2, 3, and 6 (3x2) food respectively. However, Becky will receive a wound (worth -2 food at the end of the game), since she fought the bear and lost. 9 is bigger than 2+3+3 but it is smaller than 2+3+3+5. Becky triggered the Bear's wrath. Playing the Whistle card will startle the Bear and trigger each other player to be wounded, but the player playing the Whistle card will receive no food this round. Playing the Trap card will keep the player safe against being wounded, but the player playing the card will receive no food this round. The player that received the most amount of food the last round, going clockwise from the starting player, starts the next round.

Play continues in this manner for a specified number of rounds,or until all the food is depleted, or until one player receives 5 wounds. The player with the most food at the game end is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Imperial Harvest: Quest Deck Expansion
description:
