From the publisher:

8 UNIQUE QUESTS! Each one designed to challenge your tactics and entice you to explore new strategies as you seek to harvest those fabulous strawberries.

name: Starship Deathtrap
description:
Stuck on a dying world, a handful of people take their only chance at survival, a junked space ship. All they need to do is keep it together and working to reach their new home. How hard can that be?

Starship Deathtrap is a cooperative game that can be played solo or up to 5 players. Players will control the movements and actions of one or more of the 5 crew members, each having their own unique expertise.

With the ship starting damaged, the crew is already behind. Each turn consists of 4 phases: Crew phase, disasters spread phase, new disaster phase, and advancement phase.

Crew Phase: Each crew member uses their allotted actions to move, activate ships systems, or fight disasters.

Disaster Phase: Any unstopped disasters will spread causing more problems for the crew.

New Disaster Phase: Each turn a new disaster will be determined (where and what type) randomly by a die roll.

Advancement Phase: Advance your energy level and distance to destination meter.

name: Sosab
description:
Description: In this print & play game, players become paratroopers under the command of General Stanisław „Sosab” Sosabowski. „Sosab” and his commandos participate in his operations: from creating the 1st Independent Parachute Brigade in Scotland, through participation in Operation Market-Garden, to the post-war period and efforts to raise awareness of the general’s achievements. Taking part in historical events appearing on cards, players shape their character and develop the four cardinal virtues: courage, justice, prudence, and temperance. The winner is the player who gains the most from the historical experiences on the cards and emerges from the turbulent times with the strongest character.

The aim of the game is to build the character of our paratrooper. Players take part in events which let them develop their virtues: courage, justice, prudence, and temperance (C, J, P, T). Players collect appropriate sets of events and earn points for them, moving their markers on their individual virtue tracks (C, J, P, T). It is important that none of your markers falls too far behind. At the end of the game, a player’s marker with the lowest value (the least developed character trait) is that player’s score. The player with the best score wins.

GAME COMPONENTS
– 1 game board
– 1 paratrooper card
– 52 event cards
– 4 player boards, representing military service books
– 20 coins or other markers

name: Starlight Stage: Expansion Card Set 1
description:
User summary:
スターライトステージ拡張カードセット1 (Starlight Stage Expansion Card Set 1). This expansion includes 7 idol cards, 7 event cards, and a storage box. The Crown (all-rounder) icon the new cards expands the game's flexibility.
publishers: シュレディンガーゲームズ (Schrodinger Games)

name: Barbarossa File:  Deep Battles in Russia, 1941-42
description:
Corps to Army level, 36 mis/60 kms per hex, 20-day turns, no Finnish front.

Russian units start face down, and there are 3 different order of battle possibilities:

1. Historical - 3/6 chance, as I remember.
2. From Budyonny's Stables - 2/6 chance: What if the Bolshevik traditionalists *had* completely overthrown Tukhachevsky's modern, mobile doctrine *and* equipment, leaving the Red Army strong in infantry and artillery, and having only weak cavalry/mobile corps, with the one exception of Budyonny's KonArmiya.
3. The Tukhachevsky Twist - 1/6 chance: What if Tukhachevsky had not been purged and had seen through the reorganization of the Red Army into the mobile, "deep battle" forces he and Isserman had envisioned?

Moreover, there are 3 different possible replacement rates, so the German player not only does not know what kind of monster he is attacking, he also doesn't know how strong it is - historical is the maximum. The easier his opponent is, the more and sooner victory objectives he must achieve. PRESSURE ... to over-extend?
categories: Dice, Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: The Row
description:
The Row Sushi is a PNP game for 2 players.

It's a fast and easy to learn (15+ min) cardgame for all kind of people.

In this brainteaser you score points by matching the cards in the row with the same sushi's on the order card.
The game ends when you score 10 point.

Easy to learn but not easy to win !!!
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: The Assault on Goblintown
description:
The Assault on Goblintown is a strategy dungeon crawling game for two players. The first player runs the adventurers - skilled, armored, magically enhanced, and freshly bathed. They are invading Goblintown to capture their treasure and drive them from the countryside. The second player plays the Goblins - sneaky, tunnel-digging, weak and utterly lacking in the social graces. They make up for it by their unending numbers and ability to make new tunnels to attack the adventurers from any direction!

The game is made from laser cut wood - 20 Goblins, 4 Warriors, 2 Archers, 1 Wizard and 1 Priest. It also comes with 4 laser cut isomorphic boards that fit together in many ways to create a new Goblintown for each game! It is all contained in a hand made, laser cut red plywood box that looks outstanding on any game shelf!

name: Dagome Iudex
description:
Dagome Iudex is a game that implements early Polish history into the card play.
It's based on traditional card game Rummy with few minor changes and different scoring.
It features historical places like Biskupin or Giecz and historical figures i.e. Mieszko I or Otto III.

name: Tramcar
description:
Players act as tram drivers, whose task is to carry passengers skillfully through Olsztyn's tram network. The driver who carries the passengers to designated stops within the shortest time is the winner.
The players have four tickets to realize this. Every single ticket has different set of passengers who must be at this stop on time. Then ticket is complete.

Each players have 5 action moves on his turn. In these five movements they can move trams, place a passenger on a tram or remove a passenger from a tram.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Picmi Monsieur Madame
description:
Be the first to catch the good character!
Players look carefully at the card and identify the character Mr. Men or Little Miss that appears most often on it. The first player to catch the miniature corresponding to the character card wins! The winner is the player with the most cards.
The game adapts to the age of the child with its 3 levels of difficulty with varying numbers of characters on the same card.

Sois le premier à attraper le bon personnage !
Les joueurs observent la carte et identifient le personnage Monsieur Madame qui apparaît le plus de fois sur celle-ci. Le premier joueur à attraper la figurine correspondante à ce personnage remporte la carte ! Le gagnant est le joueur qui a le plus de cartes.
Le jeu s'adapte à l'âge de l'enfant grâce à ses 3 niveaux de difficulté avec plus ou moins de personnages sur une même carte.

name: Fette Ernte
description:
Fette Ernte is German and means big harvest. It is a simple and fun card game for the whole family. It teaches about vegetables, farming and healthy nutrition in a playful way!

Who will harvest most vegetables?

The goal of the game is it to win most cards. Each vegetable has its own strengths in different categories (eg. period of storage, vitamin c etc.). One player chooses the category for the current round and all player choose one of their five hand cards simultaneously. The player with the best vegetable card in the respective category wins against and collects the inferior vegetable cards.

However, weather, pests and illness cards are executed first and trump specific vegetable cards. For instance leaf blight would win against potatoes. So weather, pests and illnesses might ruin your plans.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Farming
mechanics: Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Skullduggery
description: A quirky, low-key, role-playing game where you must achieve a secret goal while plotting and describing your nefarious actions. Each action requires a "reality check" that decides whether or not you "get away with" whatever action you dream up and describe.

name: Dawn: Rise of the Occulites – Ignis Tribe Expansion
description: An expansion for Dawn: Rise of the Occulites. Contains a new tribe of five figures as well as the cards and dials needed to play them. Also includes some new terrain tiles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Dawn: Rise of the Occulites –  Nimbus Tribe Expansion
description: An expansion for Dawn: Rise of the Occulites. Contains a new tribe of five figures as well as the cards and dials needed to play them. Also includes some new terrain tiles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Dawn: Rise of the Occulites – Floris Tribe Expansion
description: An expansion for Dawn: Rise of the Occulites. Contains a new tribe of five figures as well as the cards and dials needed to play them. Also includes some new terrain tiles.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Rähinä Alias
description: New version of Alias which challenges players to a rap battle! Two teams go against each other and try to beat each other with the power of words. Alongside with traditional Alias, Rähinä Alias also includes a Battle phase where players attempt to figure out rhymes from the given words.
categories: Educational, Party Game, Racing, Word Game
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game

name: No Quarter Presents Forces of Distinction
description: No Quarter Presents: Forces of Distinction compiles all the “Forces of Distinction” articles from No Quarter magazine through issue #56 in one volume—over thirty theme forces with original fiction. No Quarter Presents: Forces of Distinction also includes two all-new theme forces unique to this product.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Było Sobie Życie: Łowcy Bakterii
description: In this game based on the animated series players attempt to collect since, toxins, viruses, and bacteria matching the colors on their player board. During their turn a player spins a spinner and takes the corresponding color of standee.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Fahrt ins Muhltal
description:
Orig. - "Fahrt ins Mühltal", eng. - "The trip to Muhltal (a municipality in the district of Darmstadt-Dieburg, in Hesse, Germany)".
The game consists of a board with holes in. Each hole scores a certain number of points. At the back of the board, a three-dimensional 'slides' is erected. Into the top of these slides, a player in his turn, drops a ball. The ball will bounce around the 3 separated slides and come out at the bottom and score points when it settles into one of the holes.

The points available range from 1 to 10.

The one who earns the most points, wins.

name: Krypton Factor Interactive DVD Family Board Game
description:
The Krypton Factor Interactive DVD game is a mind-bending fun filled challenging board game the whole family can play.

Use all your powers of Mental Agility, Observation, Intelligence, Physical Agility and General Knowledge to answer questions, solve puzzles and take physical challenges in order to progress around the infamous Krypton assault course.

Gain Stamina tokens on the way to overcome the 13 course obstacles that await you. Will you be the first across the finish line and be able to call yourself the Krypton Factor Champion?

name: Sporttable Box
description:
Sporttable Box is a fusion between boardgames and Physical Activity.

On the board, you have the possibility of playing three different games: pursuit race, tug of war, and team sports. The gameplay is much alike that of party-games: the rules are easy to follow but, in order for you or your team to make strategic progress on the board, the players need to perform some active challenges (physical challenges with different levels of difficulty, by the way). These were carefully designed to create fun moments of challenge either against a goal, the timer or the opponent team.

There are more than 60 challenges divided into 4 categories: strength, dexterity, speed and mime (this one also provides a funny moment as it is about sports). So... roll the die, pick a card and let's get started! We are... SPORTACULAR!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Educational, Party Game, Sports

name: Shigarami
description:
User summary:
シガラミ (Shigarami), meaning "bond" or "shackle" in Japanese, is a boardgame about the business world.

The players, as well-established businesspersons having strong connections with various industries, move between 5 areas, including the government office district, business district, and bay area, and invest in enterprises to gain "performance points".

The game's most distinctive feature is the system whereby "the players have various special abilities at the start of the game, but they must discard them in order to gain points."

Among the 10 types of special abilities available for the players, only 7 of them are used during the game. The game development is also influenced by the abilities applied in the game.

This game is recommended for relatively heavy-weight gamers.

Publisher's summary:
「シガラミ」は、ビジネスの世界をテーマにした本格ボードゲームです。
プレイヤーは、社会的に成功を修め各業界と太いパイプを持つビジネスマンとなり、官庁街・商業地区・湾岸地区など５つに分かれたエリアを行き来しながら、事業に投資して「業績ポイント」を稼ぎます。

最大の特徴は、『プレイヤーはゲーム開始時に様々な特殊能力を持っているが、得点を稼ぐためには、特殊能力を捨てなければならない』というシステムです。

プレイヤーが持つ特殊能力は、10種類用意されていますが、ゲーム中には７種類しか使いません。どの能力をゲームに採用するかで、ゲーム展開が変わってくるのも魅力の一つ。

本格的なボードゲーム好きな方にお勧めの一品です。

name: Dubai
description:
Dubai is a fast set-collection game of speedy economy, tall towers, and savvy investments for 2 to 6 Architect Investors building and trading their way to be the wealthiest tower builder in the booming city of Dubai!

There is a board where each colour's value is tracked, as well as a 5-card face-up Market.

Each turn, players will either Take or Trade from the Market, Build a set of same-colour cards into a tower, which gains points but erodes that colour's value, or Invest in a colour by playing the colour cards in front of themselves, which increases that colour's value, and fights for share ownership of that colour. At the end of each phase, when towers are open for business, players with the most investments in the most represented colours are awarded ownership of the tower, and gains it for points.

A tower is considered complete if it has three different colours, and an existing colour can't be built into a tower.

The game is over after three phases, with one, two and three towers' completion to end each phase.

News Event cards appear from the deck that change up the game, but they don't resolve as surprises from the deck, but rather stay in the Coming Up pile until the next one is drawn, possibly giving time to prepare for the coming event. Or not! News is a fickle beast!


The full Print & Play & discussions can be found here:
https://boardgamegeek.com/article/21108398
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: The Way to Heaven
description:
The Way to Heaven is based on "The Pilgrim's Progress" the development of games. Player is fleeing from the City of Destruction, to the Heaven's Gate. The journey is called "The Way to Heaven". This road will be marked on the game board. In each location, the player must fulfill certain conditions to be able to move forward to the Gate of Heaven.

Each player has six cards and use. Card has three attributes given set camp, resources and ability.
1.Camp: Saints or Sinners
2.Resources: Faith or Hope or Love
3.Ability： Camp ability or General ability

Players must select the camp, collect resources, the ability to use. Camp can be converted for use camp ability. Help them get the victory, or stop other players advance.

No certain strategy, allowing the player to choose the camp. For sinners also possible to obtain victory. Everything depends on interaction between players and choice.

name: Talismanoj
description:
Talismanoj is a 2-player card game (with cards and rules in Esperanto) in which each player draws from their own deck and plays cards to create two sets of 3 cards (each set must share a common attribute but have different colors) and a legend card, while surviving attacks by the opponent which can remove their previously played cards. Combat is resolved by playing cards from one's battle reserve (where the cards must have been previously placed in anticipation).

The 2 player decks have different themes and art: one deck has a "Don Quixote" theme (with Gustave Doré art) and the other deck has various Esperanto authors ("Verdaj Donkiĥotoj").

With multiple sets, it is possible to play with more than 2 players.

name: Durch Nacht und Eis zum Nordpol
description:
"Durch Nacht und Eis zum Nordpol. Im Zeppelin mit Dr. Eckener".
One of several roll-and-move games that came out between 1890 and 1910 as the public was enthralled with expeditions to the arctic.

The board features illustrations of the trip north, by ship, dogsled, and skis. The dice rolling journey covers the journey north and the return home.

name: Soldier Kings: The Potato War
description:
Description from the publisher:

The last war of the Enlightenment broke out in July 1778, following the death of the Elector of Bavaria. Austrian Emperor Joseph II sought Bavaria for himself; Prussian King Frederick II wished to block this acquisition. Their conflict became known as the War of the Bavarian Succession or, more colorfully, as the Potato War. Armies of both sides marched about Bohemia, scouring the landscape for food (potatoes in particular) while the diplomats hashed out a solution.

Soldier Kings: The Potato War brings this worldwide interlocking conflict to Soldier Kings, as Britain struggles with a growing insurgency in her American colonies, France fans those flames and supports Austria, Prussia seeks to block the annexation of Bavaria and Russia supports Prussia. Happy Austria has once again married her way to more territory, but still has to take possession.

The Potato War is a 64-page book supplement for Soldier Kings, a multiplayer game of the Seven Years' War. In addition to the new Potato War scenario and its pieces, there are new pieces (with optional rules for their use) for the Seven Years' War scenarios of Soldier Kings, plus some additional options.
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Poseidon's Warriors: Classical Naval Warfare 480-31 BC
description:
Poseidon's Warriors: Classical Naval Warfare 480-31 BC is a set of war gaming rules for large-scale naval actions between fleets of classical galleys from the Greek and Persian clash at the battle of Salamis to the battle of Actium that decided the fate of Rome. With so many of these battles taking place around islands or in narrow channels and shallow waters, sneaky tactics and cunning maneuvers are a hallmark of warfare of this era, and the rules use an integrated turn system to allow a commander to position ships to go in and ram without being rammed in return, or to employ feints and traps to tempt the enemy out of position and leave his ships vulnerable to a follow-up strike.

With data for ships throughout the period, rules for famous admirals, historical scenarios, a campaign system and a brief historical summary for those who wish to refresh their memory of the era, Poseidon's Warriors offers everything players need to bring to the tabletop the battles and campaigns of the first great age of naval warfare.

name: Emprise
description:
Emprise is a multi-player fast-paced, real-time card game where players race through dungeons looking for treasure and glory. While only one player can hold the top spot, they must rely on their teammates in order to succeed or all will fail.

The object of Emprise is to have the most experience points after a series of levels, culminating with a boss battle.

Each player has a deck of cards with their own crest on the back to play plus their character cards which represent individual powers they can use while playing.

At the start of each round, the players flip over a new level, read the appropriate rules (if any), and deal out the indicated number of monsters for the start of the round. The players then deal out there focus pile and stamina cards, leaving the remainder of their cards as their luck deck.

To clear your focus deck, players simultaneously play with four zones gaining experience points and treasure. These zones are the level (where the monsters are milling about, ready to fight along with the level cards), their focus, stamina, and luck decks.

When a players focus deck has been cleared, unless otherwise noted by the level, the round ends. Players count up the cards played into the field, subtract any remaining focus, and take their hidden treasure which is revealed at the end of the game.

The player with the most experience points at the end of the game, including their hidden treasure, gains bragging rights until the next time the adventures play.

name: Shaun the Sheep Travel Compendium
description:
This is a collection of three games intended to be suitable for playing while on a journey.

Game 1 "Lost Sheep" is the classic SOLITAIRE (1697) played with magnetic sheep.
Game 2 "Battle Sheeps" is the classic BATTLESHIPS (1931) on a 10×10 board with different size groups of sheep instead of ships.
Game 3 "The Ewesual Suspects" is a sort of WHOSIT? (1976) played with a set of 24 (sheep) character cards where any question with a YES or NO answer may be asked.

name: Threads
description:
In the knitting game Threads, you collect yarn in your stash, trade with other's destash, and turn that yarn into the best knitting patterns possible.

In more detail, players collect yarn and use it to knit various projects. Each time they complete a stitch, they are rewarded with victory points, with additional bonus points coming upon the completion of each project.

Complete the most valuable projects and you will win, being honored as the best knitter in your group!

name: Fun to Go: Auto Lotto
description:
Description from the publisher:

Where is a red car, a blue bus or a yellow truck driving? Whoever finds the sought vehicle first gives a yell and scores points for spotting the target. Whoever watches most closely and spots the most cars in Fun to Go: Auto Lotto will win!

name: Shadowfist: Boom Chaka Laka
description:
Boom Chaka Laka was an expansion set sold as boosters for the Shadowfist game. The set perfectly captured the style, movies, and music of the 1970s.

Blurb from the booster box: "The 1970s. It's cool! It's hip! It clashes! And the Secret Warriors find themselves clashing in a big way. Superfly martial artists, dirty cops, nefarious hoods - it's one big throwdown in San Franciso's Chinatown. So strap on your Saturday Night Specials and boogie on down to the fight, cause the Jammers are about to take Disco Inferno literally!"

name: Vaudeville
description:
Players are theater owners in the Vaudeville circuit circa 1890 – 1910. They will book acts from the booking agent or the circuit to earn cash and fame. Cash buys more acts, and fame progresses the player on the fame track and unlocks bigger shows and allows more acts in the finale. Act category values are manipulated by the player during the game in the attempt to make their acts more popular and their opponent’s acts less popular.

The Finale is triggered when the turn token reaches the final space on the turn tracker.

Earn the most fame in the Finale to win.

name: Halo: Fleet Battles – UNSC Punic-Class Supercarrier
description:
The Punic and its sister ships were the first of a new breed of warships drafted to fight a new style of colonial war in the waning years of the 25th century. Officially designated Space Control Vehicles, these massive carriers could transport and sustain entire Colonial Military Authority (CMA) expeditionary and interdiction campaigns in the remote Outer Colonies for months at a time, crushing dissent and terrorism before it could fester and spread. At least, that was the intent before Covenant fleets threatened humanity with extinction.

Punic-class supercarriers have served the UNSC well in numerous campaigns and holding actions during the Covenant War, including the heroic last stand above Estuary and as base stations for the decisive counterinsurgency and evacuation operations on Charybdis IX. Unfortunately, the destruction of each supercarrier also means an irreplaceable loss of elite crews and materiel that slowly erodes the UNSC Navy’s overall effectiveness. By 2552 only a handful of Punics’ remain spaceworthy, including the Trafalgar, pride of Reach’s defense fleet.

1 resin Supercarrier
1 Medium/Small Sprue
1 custom Formation Base
1 Formation Sprue
4 UNSC Token Sheets
1 bag of 10 Halo Dice
2 Statistics Sheets
A5 Formation Overlay Sheets
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bukkake!
description: Bukkake! takes a classic fetish and turns it into a fun card game that mixes strategy and luck. It's weird, addictive, and makes for a very interesting game night. The goal of the game is to "come" on the player in the middle of the circle and get them out. If you're the last player standing, you win! Despite how it sounds, Bukkake! is not erotic and does not require anyone to literally ejaculate. While the theme of the game is clearly sexual, that's about as far as we take it. None of the cards are pornographic-all imagery is euphemistic. For example, the genital named "the spicy pepper" is just an image of a chili pepper. The only exception is the vagina card, which depicts an anatomy textbook-style vagina. It's not pornographic. We felt society is underinformed about female anatomy and wanted to educate in a weird way.

name: Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing – Shadow Beholder Expansion Pack
description: The Shadow Beholder Tlaxamar is the grand prize for the Dungeons & Dragons: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, Rage of Demons. The prize includes one pre-painted miniature and numerous upgrade cards and tokens.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Anno 3000
description:
From the box (translated from Italian):
Go to the outer limits of the Solar System with your spaceship, between asteroids, spaceship wrecks and pirates. An ideal 'First Contact' with Space for the young generation that, soon, will really navigate in it.

User summary:
Anno 3000 is an Italian game published in the '70 about travel and commerce in the Solar System. The players must tour the Planets (still nine: the game is from waaay before Pluto was "downgraded"...) to collect as much cargo as possible, and sell it returning to the Earth. The game include a deck of Monopoly-like cards with random events (pirate encounters, asteroid rains, wrecks salvage, etc.).

At the end of the game the richer player is the winner.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: S.U.E.T.: The Card Game
description:
S.U.E.T.: The Card Game is a competitive card game for 2-4 players, ages 8 and up, in which you play the role of an evil genius (and we use the term genius loosely) trying to get accepted into the Society of Ultimate Evil and Terror. To get into this nefarious organization you must be the first to construct a doomsday device with which to blackmail the world!

Your doomsday device is represented by four different colored component cards which you need to play into your secret lab. Other cards are played not only to help you construct and defend your device, but also to stymie your opponents.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Taking Food From Bears: Bear's Revenge Expansion
description:
In Taking Food From Bears, 3-4 hikers will play a bluffing game to see who can take the most food from the bear. But, you must be wary of your hiker companions because they might try to startle the bear with their whistle and cause you to be wounded during your daring heist. You have a trap to keep the bear at bay, but you only get to take one food. How will you out bluff your fellow hikers?Who will live to tell the tale of Taking Food From Bears?

This expansion allows for play up to 6 Hikers. Also in this expansion, the bears will fight back using cards unknown to the Hikers who are trying to take their food. Will the Hikers be able to bluff their way into taking all the bear's food? Will the bears make the hikers wish they had never thought of this stupid game?

name: Down The Canal
description:
Learn about the birthing process in a fun gaming fashion!

Created by a career postpartum doula trainer, whose mission is to transform the fear-based culture of birth, Down the Canal is a unique, revolutionary game designed to easily connect the learner to accurate information about childbirth. Explore choices and models of care, while engaging in play.

name: Chosen Men: Military Skirmish Games in the Napoleonic Wars
description:
Chosen Men is a set of fast-action skirmish rules detailing the bloody skirmishes between light troops in the Napoleonic Wars. The primary focus of the game is on soldiers and NCOs in light "flank" companies, as they scout ahead of larger forces and take part in man-to-man actions against enemy skirmishers.

Although the game allows for the formation of accurately sized companies of light infantry and cavalry if you wish, these formations are broken down into small groups of up to a dozen men. For the most part, officers are not swashbuckling super-heroes, but staunch commanders who rally and direct their men to achieve the battlefield objectives. Although the games uses an alternating action turn sequence, officers can use their influence to multiple units at the same time in an effort to steal the initiative. With all rolls resolved using standard 6-sided dice, this game combines a classic wargaming feel with modern wargame mechanics.

name: Tinga Tinga Tales: Swinging Monkey Race Game
description:
Join the Tinga Tinga Tales Monkeys as they swing from tree to tree and be the first monkey to reach the finish line.

Create your own game path of trees - make it straight or curvy. Roll the dice to match the fruit to swing from tree to tree. Land on another monkey tale and hold them up a turn. First monkey to swing through all 15 trees wins.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Agents & Operatives
description:
Agents & Operatives is a board game of epic conflict between the world's most covert powers: The Agents, The Operatives, and various deadly Mercenary groups for 4-8 players!

NEWS FLASH: Global intelligence indicates imminent international safety threats! In response, leading nations convened to combine their top spy agencies' forces into a single elite counter-terrorism Agency Faction [Codename: WATCHDOG], their Agents’ mission -- identify and eliminate all Operative threats to mankind.

In response to this alliance, leading evil Operative organizations agreed to collaborate under a single terrorist umbrella Faction, S.H.A.D.O.W. Their plan -- infiltrate vital international Zones to eliminate Agents for global control. The combat stakes are at an all-time high as both the Agents and the Operatives seek to eliminate each other.

Meanwhile, skilled Mercenary Factions operate in the shadows of strife, seeking to strategically maneuver within the embattled Zones for their own gain. However, what is unknown yet to all is that all lines of communication within the Zones has collapsed, so no one will know who their allies or enemies are upon entry...

Control your Faction’s field Units, retrieve vital Intel to discover your Allies and Enemies, and enter restricted Zones to gather Weapons, Gadgets, and trigger Location effects with major Global ramifications. Agents & Operatives is a unique combination of secret team/social deduction gaming and worker placement design featuring spatial strategy and upgrade management to create a thrilling, combative, and unforgiving real-time espionage experience from your chair.

Danger has never been higher and trust never lower.

name: Pirate Kings
description:
The classic party game of kings with a piratical twist.

Players take turns drawing cards to reveal their fate. Will it be a singin' contest, or a walk o' the plank? If ye be lucky, ye might add a rule to the Pirate Code and force your crewmates into all manner o' silliness, but beware being Keelhauled and don't forget the Mop Bucket...
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Pirates

name: Ordo Ab Chao
description:
In this board game the players are not playing against each other. Instead they collaborate and play against the rise of an occult, worldwide dictatorship that is ruled by an evil elite hierarchy. Up to twelve players can participate in the resistance against the rise of evil. By playing the game the players will become informed and mentally prepared to resist the push for a New World Order.

The game is played by throwing a common dice and moving around a board on a path called the path of the astrological ages. Players have a chance of overcoming the rise of the evil hierarchy by answering question cards correctly.

If a player steps on a square marked with the all seeing eye, the evil hierarchy will move up one step on the 'rise of evil ladder'. If on the other hand the player steps on a square marked with an 'I', 'P' or 'M' symbol, the player has the chance of ascending the 'resistance ladder' by answering a question correctly. If the elite moves to the top of its ladder first, the game is lost. If the players manages to move to the top of the resistance ladder first, the game is won.

If you have a printer you can download and print the game.
categories: Ancient, Educational, Mythology, Political, Print & Play, Religious, Renaissance
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Personally Incorrect: Red Expansion
description:
From the publisher:

Our designers have done it again! Reaching into the most horrendous and disgusting parts of their minds and the internet to bring you our first expansion!

One player reads a Question Card out to the group, replacing "Insert Name" with the name of a person at the table.

The other players then pick a highly-offensive answer card from their hand to give to the reader. The reader then reads the card again, one-by-one, filling in the blanks vwith the provided answers.

Once everyone is done p******* their pants laughing, players then vote on the answer they want to win! No dictator B.S. here; every one of the terrible people playing the game gets a say!
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Atlantis: The Lost Empire – The Great Adventure
description:
Who will manage to get first into Atlantis?
To achieve this, players will have to travel across the dangerous underground river in order to get supplies and get into the lost empire. But watch out! The titans are lurking.

Players roll the die and move on the board accordingly. When a player lands on a block with a picture, draws a card from the "direction cards". When a player collects the 3 special cards needed, he can open the gate of Atlantis. Then, he chooses and flips one out of the seven cards from the center of the board. If the card shows Atlantis, the game is over and the player is the winner. Otherwise, the game continuous until a player finds the card with Atlantis.

name: Junk In My Trunk
description:
Junk In My Trunk is a casual game based on the classic Swedish card game Vändtia, an ancestor of the card game Palace.

The circus grounds are a mess after a great show. Clean up duties fall to the elephants, and using their trunks like vacuums, they suck up all the junk. The first player to get rid of all of their "Junk" (cards) wins. Special action cards also add to the fun by allowing you to peek, swap and flip.

name: Cosmoscacchi
description:
"Cosmoscacchi" is a chess/checkers-like wargame that utilize the 5" characters of the Galaxy Series, produced by Atlantic in the '70s years of the last century.

The players can move their pieces on the board in different ways based on the type of Character used (no dice rolls involved). The Characters can shoot each other if there is a direct stright or diagonal line between them. The shooting is resolved revolving the "Fire Wheel": if the wheel shows a number equal to the distance between the Characters, the round hit the choosen target, otherwise it miss. If the wheel stop on a space with no number the shooter's weapon jam.

name: Twizmo! Cards
description:
From the manufacturer:
Twizmo Cards is all about creating poker-style hands using a combination of the “cards” on the cube and the cards from the deck. This combination of the 2 sets creates a new card playing dynamic that allows for a come from behind win. It’s poker in 3 dimensions! Invent variations of your favorite games with this new paradigm that allows for endless possibilitiesupply.

In each round players compete to create their best hand using the 3 cards they have been dealt from the deck and any 3 “cards” on the top face of the cube. Cards used on the cube must be 3 in a row either vertically, horizontally or diagonally.

Players now use the cards they’ve been dealt as betting chips. The player with the best hand collects all the cards that have been bet for that round. Careful which cards you bet and how many lest they fall into the wrong hands!

When all the cards from the deck have been dealt and won, players use the cards they’ve collected to create one final hand for the win. It’s entirely possible to come from behind to take it all!

name: Kircholm 1605, Kokenhausen 1601
description:
Game covers two battles fought between Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth and the Kingdom of Sweden during the Polish–Swedish War (1600-1611). Both battles were famous because of the use of the Polish heavy cavalry known as Winged Hussars.

The battle of Kircholm was decided in 20 minutes by the devastating charge of Polish–Lithuanian cavalry, the Winged Hussars.[3] The battle ended in the decisive victory of the Polish-Lithuanian forces, and is remembered as one of the greatest triumphs of Commonwealth cavalry.

During the battle of Kokenhausen Polish forces defeated the Swedish relief force and captured the besieging force, relieving the Polish garrison. The battle is notable as one of the greatest victories of the Polish hussars, who defeated their numerically superior Swedish adversaries.

name: Iron League Junior
description:
Iron League Junior is a version of the Iron League first Edition board game for kids.
This version was made for parents and kids who have never played with board games before or parents and kids who have thought that the Iron League First Edition rules were very difficult.

Year 2100, the world industry has focused on war machines called IRONS and countries compete to have the best robot Iron teams.
Laboratories look for the best weapons and clubs look for the best pilots.
Countries fight in the famous and hardest league in the world: the IRON LEAGUE.
And there are hundreds of teams that fight in each country to compete in the Iron League.
You are an Iron team coach and you have been hired to take the team to victory and win the Iron League title.
Management and sponsors place their trust in you; we know you are the best and you will take the team to victory.
The decisions related to the selection of your team and of your cards, together with the luck of the dice and of the events cards will be decisive to be able to win or lose.
Score more times with the plasma ball than the opposing team; you can also damage all the rival Irons or hit them with the plasma ball to win points.

The game is for 2-6 players.
Recommended for 2 players; if you have 2 Iron League games you can join them together and create a fantastic game.
Recommend age: 7 years up.
Objective of the game
The aim of the game is to have fun! To win the game you must score higher than the opposite team.
The team that manages to put the plasma ball into the goal area 3 times will win.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Sports

name: Ienomi
description:
User summary:
イエノミ (Ienomi) in English literally means "Drinking at home", and the designer suggests "Come over for drinks!".

You have a drinking session in someone's home. You fall asleep if you have drunk more than your limit, but you don't know how much it is. You have to estimate your limit by opponents' limits, and score points by pacing your drinking.

The session ends when all players have fallen asleep, and the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary:
誰かの自宅を会場にして飲み会を開きます。
自分の体力を超える酒量を飲んでしまうと強制的に寝落ちしますが、プレイヤーは自分の体力だけ知りません。
他のプレイヤーの体力を見て推定しながら、酒を飲んで得点を増やしていきます。
全員が寝ると飲み会が終わり、そこで最も得点を持っている人が勝利です。

name: Adobe Wells
description:
User summary:
In the year 1977, Atlantic produced, inside their 15 games-line called “Il Gioco delle Battaglie” (The Game of Battles), 5 "board-wargames" of the Old West/Indian Wars theme (code numbers from 1456 to 1460 in their catalog).

Each set included 1/72-HO scale toy soldiers, vehicles and accessories from Atlantic production, plus a different playing field game-map, related rules and historical introductory notes for every battle.

The game-maps (large pieces of paper of 68 for 68,5x49 cm) were photographs from above of 3D dioramas of hypothetical battlefields of the battles represented. On the back of the game-map sheets were shown the assembly diagrams for the parts contained in the package and the game rules, in four languages, with numerous illustrations for clarification.

The main fight rules were checkers/chess like: the player pieces must enter the enemy squares to eliminate his soldiers, with some hierarchical precedencies: e.g. no foot soldiers can eliminate horse-mounted ones. Non dice were used anywhere in the games.

From the publisher (translated):
Adobe Walls - June 27, 1874 – n°1458
The village of the Canadian name Adobe Wells in Texas served as centre for goods exchanges with the Comanches and Kiowas. The spreading of the buffalo hunting that menaced their life-style enraged the Comanches, Kiawos and Cheiennes so much, that they attacked the village under Quanah Parker's orders, on June 27, 1874. After a ten hours battle the Americans had 3 fallen and the Indians 80. The assault had failed, since the buffalo hunters were all sharp shooters.

RULES
HOW TO START THE GAME
One of the two players keeps the Americans and the other keeps the Indians. The American player moves first, but initially the soldiers are placed outside the west side of the playing map. The Indians player goes second, but start with his pieces already on the squares on the east border of the map.
HOW TO MOVE
A) On each square the players may place from 1 to a max. of 4 soldier pieces.
B) Each piece may be moved l square at a time.
C) Each piece may move in a straight line only, never diagonally.
D) Each turn each player can move only the pieces that start the turn on the same square: i.e., at each turn can be moved only the pieces of 1 square (one or more of them).
E) Foot soldiers only (i.e.: no vehicles or horses) may enter the squares where there are houses.
HOW TO ELIMINATE THE ENEMY
A) In order to eliminate the enemy pieces it is necessary to enter the square where they stand.
B) Foot soldiers con eliminate only other foot soldiers (e.g.: no horse mounted ones).
C) All the enemy pieces in a square are eliminated even if only a single adversary piece enter the square.
WHO WINS THE BATTLE
The player who succeeds in eliminating all opposing forces is the winner of the battle.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid

name: Loot Quest
description:
Loot Quest is a family-friendly table-top board game for 2-6 Players, ages 8+. Players use the dice to move around the board, taking on Quests as they go. Quests are small stories, often involving choices for the Player to make. Will they Lose a Turn to gain a bit of extra Gold? Will they be virtuous, moving back spaces to help a commoner in need? It's all up to the Player!

But Players must beware...lurking on the board are Monsters who are just waiting for a snack! Monster Cards are ferocious beasts which can cause Players to Lose Turns, move back spaces, and many other nasty effects! The closer the Player gets to the goal, the stronger the Monsters become!

But Players can fight back! For a bit of Gold, they can purchase Item Cards. Items allow Players to change how the Game plays. Potion of Might cards can make the Player more Powerful for a Turn, while Flask of Agility allows them to Add to a dice roll.

But Items aren't just for helping. The other Players are out for victory, too! Items can also be used to force other Players to Lose a Turns, or fight a Monster, or to re-roll a dice roll! It's all fair in the great quest for the Dragon's Loot!
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling, Take That

name: Battle Monkeys
description:
Battle Monkeys is a 2-4 player strategic combat card game, with Monkeys! Players build their army of Soldier monkeys with one goal in mind....Complete...World....Domination!

Players build their "Army" of 4 soldiers that are used to both attack enemies and defend their general. Soldiers are placed face up in front of each player and have varying power levels.

On your turn, you draw a card, have the option to place a soldier in your army, attack an enemy player. Attacking/Defending is similar to most TCGs. Players also have spell cards that allow them to perform a variety of task such as stealing soldiers from another army, drawing more cards, destroying everyone's hand or army, and more.

Each player starts with 20 total life and the game continues until there is only one player left alive.

name: Palette Swap
description:
Palette Swap is a 2-4 player logic puzzle game in which you are given a 'palette' of primary colors that you mix, match, and swap with your fellow artists in order to complete your schemes to win the game. If you're clever you can complete multiple schemes in a single turn, and close attention is rewarded if another artist creates the scheme you were after when it's not your turn.

On your turn, you may spend two of the five colors in your palette for their effects. Red allows you to match the colors your opponents have, yellow lets you mix your colors and theirs together, and blue lets you swap a color from your palette with one of another player's colors. Playing two primary colors gets you a secondary color, which simply combines the effects of the two primaries. Playing two secondary colors get you a black, which you must use on your next turn and costs you your secondary colors.

As you change the colors you possess and your opponent's, you will be able to complete your goals, all of which are based on actual color schemes such as split complimentary and analogous schemes. Accomplishing all five of your schemes first makes you the victor.

The game also includes cooperative rules for playing with younger children and rules for solo play.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: BLOKD
description:
Your new favourite game to play with friends and family

BLOKD is an easy to play board game, the rules are simple, you have to block your opponent to win, at each turn, the player has the choice to move his cube or to block a square, the cube can be moved like the 'queen pawn' in chess game, any empty square can be blocked.

You win the game when you block your opponent, in other words when all the squares around the opponent's cube are blocked and he can't move his cube any more.
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure

name: Mechanized Warrior
description:
From the designer:

You are the pilot of a top of the line Mechanized Bipedal Combat Platform, commonly referred to as a Mech. You will customize your 25' tall Mech with a selection of weaponry and upgrades, and then hunt and engage the enemy.

This solitaire game is played over a series of turns where you may engage randomly generated encounters. Attacks are made through die-rolling that can activate a variety of weaponry and standard attacks. While you dish out damage to the enemy, you must balance the desire to rack up victory points against the damage and heat that your Mech will accrue.

All that you will need to play this game are 6 standard dice, 2 printed sheets, a pencil and an eraser.

A gracious nod to Drew Chamberlain whose DELVE: The Dice Game was a strong inspiration for this game.

name: Stacks on Stacks
description:
Stacks on Stacks is a card and dice dexterity game of making stacks on top of stacks.

After setup of the the base card, each player will draw a base card, roll a die, place the die on the corresponding segment on the card, and then attempt to stack the card/die on top of the stack. After successful placement of the base card, the player may attempt to place their cubes on any non adjacent segment of the card. You can win by getting rid of all your dice or all your cubes. If a player knocks over the stack, the player who placed the most dice wins the game.

name: Antarctica: Penguin Expansion
description:
Originally available in the 2016 Easter Basket (Brettspiel Osternest).

A small expansion consisting of 8 penguin islands and rules to play.

name: Sea Giants
description:
In this new game you travel the world with your own fleet of cointainerships and manage large seaports. You want to be the biggest but there are many dangers in the way: storm, clashes, pirats,... You are in direct conflict with other shipowners, these are your competitors.

A smart strategy, making decissions fast, choosing the best routes, buying new ships and seaports, buying-out another shipowner, reacting on a crisis ... A nose for business and a dose of luck will determine if your fleet will win this game.

Sea Giants is a game for 2 to 4 players, you roll dice and move your ships forward on the course they are traveling, you get money if you end on a harbour spot and have the opportunity to buy the harbour, if no one else owns it yet. You can also spend your turn buying new ships for different courses. The game can end either by setting a time limit or by buying all harbours from other players so you are the monopolist.

Have a nice course !
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Sinking Island
description: In Sinking Island, players are survivors of a shipwreck who have to a deserted island. Players must try to gather resources and find food on the small island to keep themselves alive. The player who manages to build the most useful tools and stay strong will stand the best chance to survive as a castaway!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Time Wars: Supreme Command – Core Set: Humanity
description:
Arm your Time Travelers and duel for control over the Timeline. Stack the deck, bluff your foes, orchestrate your strategy, and take your chances as you take command in the TIME WARS.

Gather a Strike Team of Time Travelers. Arm them with high-tech weapons and tools. Duel for control over the lives and events in the Timeline. Achieve your Goals… or foil those of your foes. Bluff your opponents, and bide your time, waiting for the right moment to strike, and collapse the Timeline. As one version of the past crumbles into oblivion, another will rise in its place. The battlefield is history. The stakes the future. Which future will you fight for?

In Time Wars: Supreme Command, you will become the Supreme Commander of your own Time Corps. Assembling your Strike Team allows you to dictate the flow of history, so that it meets your Goals, or thwarts the attempts of your foe. Time is your only currency. Each turn, your one choice will make or break your strategy.

As the world’s first Deck Stacking Game, there are no discard piles in this card game. Instead, when something is discarded, you decide whether it goes on the bottom of your deck, or your opponent’s. Streamline your strategy by removing cards from your deck that you can’t use. But be careful, as everything you give up could be used against you.

Engage your opponents in deep strategy over and over again with a game that only takes minutes to learn and play. Two players can play right out of the box. With each additional Core Set, you can add another two players to the experience in team battles.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting

name: Torii: Otokodate Starter Box
description:
Torii is a skirmish wargame set on Feudal Japan, created by Miniatures and Wargames to use Zenit Miniatures’ range of miniatures (specifically Kensei’s)
In Torii you’ll have to lead a group of about 8-12 warriors that will have work together to accomplish their clan objectives.

Every game is different. Scenery, main and secondary missions will change, so you’ll never get bored of playing Torii.

Torii is quick to learn, with great tactical and strategic depth, with a duration of about 45-60 minutes.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Trivial Pursuit: Emergency Medical Services Edition
description:
Based on the classic Trivial Pursuit game format, this game specializes in the ambulance/paramedic field. The six categories are; trauma, illness, cardiology, anatomy & physiology, toxicology & environmental emergencies and special patients. The round wedge holder pieces still hold the six wedges found in the original game, however, the board is 12"x12" making it easier to be portable. Included are 50 cards [300 questions], six pawn movers and a die.
There are two card expansions also available, each with another 300 questions, one for BLS [basic life support] and ALS [advanced life support].

name: Fart Juice: The Card Game
description:
A cheeky fart-themed card game. Tactical. Fun. Family friendly. Easy to learn. Hidden complexity.
The winner is the first person to fill his or her Location Card with the required Fart Cards.
You can "drop" two Fart Cards per turn, and play one Action Card.
Gameplay involves:


"Dropping" Fart Cards into your Location Card.
Stealing Fart Cards from other players’ locations.
Stealing cards from other players’ hands.
Blocking the actions of other players.
Using combinations of cards (to great effect)!
Trying to manipulate the actions of other players.

name: Ready Check: Guild Smashers
description:
Inspired by fast paced tabletop games and chock-full of jokes, references, and stereotypes that anyone who has ever played a massively multiplayer online game can appreciate, Ready Check is a card based game where players take over the role of leading their guild to become the biggest, baddest, and most popular guild in their realm.

Ready Check boasts very simple and streamlined game mechanics. Your job is to recruit gamers to your guild and use them to raid dungeons. Dungeons are worth victory points and the first player to 20 VPs is the winner.

Each turn consists of two phases.


The Guild Management Phase is where gamers (those found lurking the Forums eagerly awaiting to join your guild) are recruited to your guild and loot is added to your Guild Stash (your collection of the most epic bounty and claimed dungeons).
The Dungeon Phase is where the raiding happens. Loot cards and victory points are earned by successfully raiding Dungeons. Harder dungeons offer more VPs and, of course, a better shot at getting that epic loot!


You can download a complete copy of the rules and free-to-play Print-n-Play from our web page.

name: Dien Bien Phu
description:
Dien Bien Phu is an operational level simulation of the battles between the forces of the French Union and the Viet Minh in the Dien Bien Phu valley in 1954, with the emphasis on supply and the application of air power. The game features three different CRTs and a die-roll correction table to show the effect of different unit types. One hex equals 500 meters and the tactical phase one day, real time. The unit counters represent the various units taking part in the historical battle.

Published in Combat! Vol 1 No 3 - Aug/Sep 1977

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 1 day
Hex: 547 yards / 500 meters
Units: Platoon to Battalion

Game Inventory:
One 22 x 34" full color map
One single-side printed countersheet (120 1/2" uncut paper counters)
One 10-page rulebook

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2 or more
Playing Time: 1-3 hours

Note: Players will need to provide two 6-sided dice for game play.

name: Town Squares
description:
From the publisher:

“Four noble houses compete for land in a struggle of power and glory. Strategically claim your territory while obstructing your enemies as you fight for reigning dominance. Use the grid to your advantage and become victor in the game of Town Squares.”

Town Squares is a card game for 2-4 players. It’s a fun, easy to learn, competitive strategy game in which players take turn placing cards to earn points while at the same time taking points away from others.

As the decks are shuffled each time, and you get to decide where you are placing them in the layout of the game, every game is different and individual. You will never play the same one twice.

Games with 2 players tend to be fast and furious - about 5 to 10 minutes in length. More players add to this time and games with 4 players can be from 10 - 20 minutes in length. You could have a quick game anywhere you like as it’s highly portable: on a table at a cafe, on a coffee table at home, or on a blanket at the beach.
mechanics: Enclosure, Pattern Building, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Lamokrady
description:
From the publisher:

Who you are? You're a breeder! Become a llamaherd of your llamas, alpacas and guanacos - choose animals by their common characteristics and herd the flocks to get the points! Beware of malicious ducks - they will gather to hinder you in achieving the goal. Use the help of benevolent Dalai Lamas and cunning llamarustlers - but beware! - Your opponents may try to use them against you!

The title Lamokrady is a neologism, which comes from Polish words "lama" (llama) and "kraść" (to steel). It's catchy and familiar because of the similarity to word "koniokrady" (horse thieves).

In the game players try to collect sets of llamas with common characteristics. Every llama features 4 characterstics and players want to play sets of 3 llamas with 1/2/3/4 common characterstic in order to gain 1/3/7/13 points. Other than llamas the deck of cards consist of disturbing ducks and helpful Dalai Lamas.

On a turn a player choose one of these actions:
1) Play and score set of 3 llamas (with optional help of Dalai Lama) and draw 3 cards
2) Play a set of 4 ducks and draw 4 cards
3) Draw two cards from the deck and propose two cards from hand to next player

If a player was proposed with cards from previous player, instead of doing a normal turn she must do the following:
4) Discard them at the beginning of her turn and perform a normal turn
5) Accept the cards and propose two cards from hand to next player (this will count as a turn)
6) Accuse the giver of proposing a duck
6a) If the accusation was right, the current player receives 2 points, draw two cards from giver's hand, give her back the cards proposed, may perform action 1) or 2) and propose two cards for next player.
6b) If the accusation was wrong, the giver receives two points, the cards proposed are discarded and the accuser loses her turn.

The game ends when the deck is depleted. The player who gathers most points is the winner.

name: Italy
description:
Test Series Game 1 ('strategic') and/or maybe TAC 20 ('tactical')? Also referred to as 'Italy, 1944'.

Contains a small 'strategic' divisional game (played over 6-8 turns) representing the early 1944 German "Winterline" position in Italy, and a large 'tactical' regimental game (played over 12-24 turns) representing two Allied invasion options at Anzio and Civita Vecchia. With the use of optional rules and/or playing a combined strategic/tactical game, up to six different games are possible.

Victory is determined by destroying enemy units and by holding key areas of the map(s).

From an ad:

Described by Avalon Hill as "the one that got away"; ... covers the 1944 ANZIO/WINTERLINE campaign in Italy using two boards, a 'tactical' one for the beach head and a 'strategic' one for the WINTERLINE fighting.

Rulebook has Simulations Corp, as the publisher (?)

name: Plot Twist: A Storytelling Card Game
description:
Plot Twist is a storytelling card game for four to six players. All players are Storytellers and stitch together Plot Cards, combined with a little imagination, to tell short stories prompted by Trope Cards.

Trope Cards provide a familiar story prompt inspired from all over fiction, media, and history. Storytellers use this information to tell a story using their hand of Plot Cards.

Plot Cards contain tired clichés, action beats, random events, and hilarious happenings. Storytellers stitch together as many Plot Cards as they need to tell their version of the selected Trope Card prompt, making up the events between cards as they go. Stories can be simple tales, outrageous romps, or outright-insane cartoons – as long as you can justify the Plot Cards you use in your story, you can use them however you'd like!

After all Storytellers have told their stories for the round, they cast votes for their favorite stories of the round. Votes in Plot Twist are weighted – you get three Story Point Cards to use each round and you can give them out however you want. Feel free to spread your votes around to multiple Storytellers, or give all three to your favorite story!

The story with the most votes at the end of each round wins that round's Trope Card as a point. The Storyteller with the most points at the end of the game is crowned the Master Storyteller – and the winner of the game!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Real-time

name: KopFit
description:
KopFit is a Game which includes 10 Games to sharpen your mind. It is a trainer for mental fitness.
When you play KopFit, you have to go through 10 Competitions to get points. The one with the most points at the end is the winner.
The ten games are:
WORTWECHSEL: You have to change a word into another, letter by letter in four steps.
MEMODEMO: It's a Memory-Game where you must find the cards in a given sequence.
AUF EIN WORT: You must complete letters to words.
SUMM SUMM: You must try to get the biggest or smallest amount by connecting numbers by making different calculations (+/-/x/:).
WIMMELBAR: You must try to keep objects in mind.
LETTERATUR: You must sort objects depending on their 1, 2, or 3 letters, after the cards are removed from the table.
MONOVIEL: You must find words with the same starting letter for as many categories you can manage in 30 seconds.
LÄNDERSPIEL: You have to sort countries depending on Population, size of area and inhabitants of their capitol city.
SAG SELBST: You must complete quotes in your own way.
STARKE SPRÜCHE: You must vote for quotes, and try to vote, how your opponents vote.
The points are marked with colored wooden pins into the brains of the players mats.
A counter clock, which is needed for some games is added.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Educational, Math, Memory

name: VERBA: English
description:
VERBA is the new language learning card game developed by The Pericles Group. The concept is incredibly simple -- one player (acting as a judge) draws a random card containing a fill in the blank sentence in the target language and the other players play a card containing a noun from their hand. The player who has played the sentence card then chooses the best card played and that player scores a point. Play continues with that player as the new judge.

All VERBA players benefit from seeing high frequency words, with many repetitions, in a context that fosters authentic learning and comprehensible input. As with all of The Pericles Group's educational games, the play objectives and the learning objectives are one in the same. Players win by making comprehensible sentences, scaffolded by the cards, the images, and the helpful hints included on the sentence cards. We always want to ensure that the learners are seeing correct forms and those forms are continually reinforced by the mechanics.

Core Set: Includes 50 sentence cards and 146 noun cards. Designed for the novice learner. of English as a second language. VERBA: English is also great for younger native speakers of English as they begin to expand their use of language.

name: Dust Tactics: "Otto"
description:
The AufklärerLäufer KV 47 (r) "Otto" is a new addition to Axis forces on the Eastern front. After the sixth liberation of Kiev, they captured a whole battalion of brand new SSU KV-47 before these could even enter battle.
The “Otto” has been refitted with latest-generation Panzerfaust and Grenade Launchers. It can now destroy soft and hard targets with ease.

The Deluxe Edition models are not just “pre-painted”. What we offer is the exact replica of Vincent Fontaine’s work, Dust Studio’s Master Painter.

name: Charm
description:
Players are princesses who want to charm the Prince.
For this they must create the perfect love potion by collecting the most secret ingredients with the same color in the player's cauldron, while spoiling the potions of the other players with differently colored ingredients.

Players roll die and may choose and put ingredient with the same color to the cauldron with the same color so that other players can´t see the color of this ingredient. If someone thinks the ingredient is incorrect She may cry out: Charming. If You were correct You may put any of Your ingredient to the cauldron of this player. If You lied She may put any of Her ingredient to Your cauldron.

Player who runs out of ingredients may announce that the love potion is ready. The player with the most ingredients matching the color of her cauldron wins.

name: Big Bad Overlord
description:
Big Bad Overlord is a card and dice game for 3-6 people in which players assume the roles of evil Dukes vying to take over the world. Players gather minions great and small, ranging from Riff-Raff to Horrible Monsters, battle each other, and fend off attacks by occasional do-gooders (such as adventuring bands and small children). The game takes about an hour to play.

The goal is to eliminate all other players and become the Big Bad Overlord. Players start with six cards, half of which they can keep face-down. The face-up cards serve as the players' armies and can be used to attack other players. Each turn, players draw a new card and add it to their army. (Unless they draw a do-gooder, in which case the player has to fight it off!) There are three combat abilities - Mind control, Magic, and Melee. Most cards have at least one ability, and some have more. A successful Mind-control attack allows you to capture an enemy card; magic blows things up (especially cards weak against magic, such as the otherwise powerful Machines-O-Death); and melee allows you to chop things up.

Players fight each other using all available attacks, rolling 2 six-sided dice to determine the winner of each battle. Die rolls are modified according to the relative attack and defense strengths of each side's army in each combat category. But even the most lopsided of battles isn't in vain - a natural 12 always wins, no matter what the modifiers, and a natural 2 always fails.

In addition to the evil minions and do-gooders, the deck contains two magical artifacts. They're important because players need them to survive the endgame. When all the cards are drawn from the deck, only players who have an artifact survive. At that point, if two players are still in the game, there's a final battle in which the evil Dukes use the artifacts to smash each other's troops.

Players can gang up on each other, help each other defend against attack, backstab each other, and more. Defeat your foes, play them against each other, hoard a precious artifact or obtain one at all costs - Big Bad Overlord is a game where it's good to be bad.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Slaughterville: The Dream Demon Expansion
description: You hear stories of people dying in their sleep and think nothing of it. Then more and more start dying in gruesome ways that seem to defy logic and physics. Your friends warn you not to fall asleep but exhaustion takes over and you drift off. Can you make it back before death claims you? The Dream Demon is an expansion to Slaughterville allowing you to introduce this Villain into your town to cause havoc on the citizens whether they are awake or asleep!
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: B-Sieged: Sons of the Abyss – Promo Pack 2016
description: This is a promotional set of cards given away at Cool Mini Or Not's 2016 CMON Expo. These four cards offer different abilities for your characters.

name: Triomphe
description:
Triomphe (French for triumph) is a card game dating from the late 15th century. It most likely originated in France or Spain (as triunfo) and later spread to the rest of Europe.

This game is the origin of the English word "trump" and is the ancestor of many trick-taking games like Euchre (via Écarté) and Whist (via Ruff and Honours).

name: Dice Bazaar: Monkey Mini Expansion
description:
Components Included:

4 Dice
4 Monkey Cards


Shuffle a Monkey Card into each Product Card stack and set aside the 4 extra Player Dice when setting up the game.

If you can purchase a Monkey Card, you can now roll a 7th Player Die on your turn.

Note: You cannot trade for or with a Monkey Card. Buying multiple Monkeys does not grant you more dice. However, you cay buy multiple Monkeys to block an opponent from buying it. Monkeys are not worth any points at the end of the game.

Pre-Order a copy at dsrp.tv/shop
categories: Arabian, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trading

name: Fejm
description:
FEJM is a quick humorous card game for 2-4 players. Main objective is to create the most popular profile in a social network.

Full of offensive interaction game with really simple rules, takes maximum up to 5 minutes to learn. For people which have at least a small portion of sense of humor.

In your turn player use ‘action cards’ to get time needed to prepare topics for their blog. Time is the main currency in a game - more you have it - better topics you make.

What is our goal? It’s very simple, we want to gather the best topics and ‘post’ them on our board. Winning player is the one who gather the biggest amount of likes from posts. Additionally topics were divided into 3 groups: PC games, esport, funny clips.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Nordguard: Tribes of the White Land
description:
Nordguard: Tribes of the White Land contains 36 cards (including 2 new canon Nordguard characters from the graphic novels).

An expansion to Nordguard: The Card Game, this pack not only allows for additional players, but balances out the impact of larger teams.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Exploration

name: Mars-Odyssee 2010
description:
2-4 players race to the red planet of Mars. This game comes packaged in a deluxe wooden crate. Most game materials are wooden, along with some hand silk-screened cards. Each player has a rocket with several wooden parts, including a capsule, fuel stages, tail section, and drive.

In a twist, the playing area is vertical. Three long poles for the trajectory to Mars, which is a red sphere placed at the top. Play cards to blast off from the launch pad, and race to Mars. But you must contend with your fellow voyagers, asteroids, meteorites, and even a black hole.

name: Lone Star-Opoly
description: Lone Star-Opoly hits the highlights with some of the province’s most interesting landmarks. Full of buffalo, crops, and parks, this game is truly about the Lone Star state. So choose your token and roll the dice. You may be competin’ in a Chili Cook-off... or wheelin’ and dealin’ in the big city.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Yacht Sea!
description:
This release includes rules for Yacht Sea!, a maritime-themed game (specifically the scoring sheets and gold "treasure" dice) based on Yahtzee and additional rules for playing Ship, Captain, Crew.

From the publisher (both descriptions):

Yacht Sea!: The object of the game is to collect as many points as possible by rolling certain combinations with five dice. A player may throw the dice up to three time during their turn. After each roll, the player chooses which dice to keep and which to roll again. The player must put a score or a zero into a score box after each turn. The player with the most points at the end is the winner!

Ship, Captain, Crew: Played with five dive, the object is to roll a Six (Ship), a Five (Captain, and a Four (Crew) while trying to get the highest score possible by adding together the sum of your remaining two dice (The Ship's Cargo).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Eldritch Express
description:
This game is an express dice game adaptation of Eldritch Horror similar to the Arkham Express dice game. It borrows ideas from Eldritch Horror, Arkham Horror, Arkham Express and Elder Sign. The goal is to make a short and small game that could fit into a small fantasy flight expansion box.

As all lovecratian games, the goal is to prevent an ancient one from awakening by moving around the world to close gates and solve mysteries. You use the “dice express” mechanics to perform your actions and encounter hazards. You will gather clue, items, spells and artifact to make your quest easier and give you a chance to fight monsters. The combat system is deterministic, so you know for sure if you are going to die or become insane. So you might consider an injury or a madness instead, it's hard to live with it, but at least you remain alive.
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fantasy, Horror, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Wizard's Tower Solitaire
description: Wizard's Tower Solitaire is a Tarot card game based on the playing card solitaire game Spider. The game begins by laying out all 78 cards face up in 13 rows of 6. Cards of the bottom column are exposed and may be placed below any card of the next higher numerical value or overlapping the next higher numerical value of the same suit. Overlapping cards may be moved as a unit and removed from play when it is complete. Trump cards may be placed under any other Trumps of a higher numerical value or overlapping a Trump of the next higher numerical value. When the Fool is exposed it is transferred to the top of the tableau to form the foundation of the Wizard's Tower and other Trumps are placed on it in ascending numerical value. Any exposed card may be transferred to an empty column and weaving may be used to overcome a blocked game. The goal of the game is to remove all but the Wizard's Tower of Trump cards which remains mysteriously suspended in the air after the cliffs below it have been blasted away by magic.

name: Personally Incorrect: Yellow Box Expansion
description:
Expansion Numero Dueco (That’s Mexican for expansion two). Yes, yet again we have tons of horrendous content jam packed into this box. Its official, our designers are now all signed up for the express bus to hell.

If you don’t own the main game, buy it, you will love it! If you want to know exactly how this game plays check the back of the big black box next to this… A.K.A the Personally Incorrect original game. If you don’t see it tell the store manager to order it ASAP…
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Voting

name: Sergeants: Hell on Wheels – M4A1 Sherman
description:
The Sherman M4A1, M4A2 and M4A3 where the workhorse vehicles of the US Army. Capable of engaging enemy guns, infantry and buildings with equal ease, the Sherman 75 saw a great deal of action.

The Sergeants Hell on Wheels Vehicle Modules are playable with either Sergeants D-Day or Sergeants Miniatures Game. The M4A1 Sherman Vehicle Module requires Sergeants Hell on Wheels for play.

Average Vehicle 68 VP
Number of Crew 5
Average Crew Total 18 VP

The M4A1 Vehicle Module comes with:
•Vehicle Tactics Panel - cut into 6 parts for easy storage.
•64 cards for the 5 crew with their action cards and special training cards.
•32 cards for the vehicle itself and various tactics cards as options
•Vehicle Flats - to use for play with Sergeants D-Day: In Action, Burning and Knocked Out
•Sighting Markers for the vehicles crew sighting targets.
•Status Markers for "dismounted" crew and "unbuttoned" hatches
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Sergeants: Hell on Wheels – PzKw IV H
description:
The bocage countryside in Normandy favored defense, and PzKw-IVH inflicted very heavy casualties on Allied armor during the Normandy campaign, despite the overwhelming Allied air superiority. At the reduced ranges no allied armor was safe from its powerful fire.

The Sergeants Hell on Wheels Vehicle Modules are playable with either Sergeants D-Day or Sergeants Miniatures Game. The PzKw-IVH Vehicle Module requires Sergeants Hell on Wheels for play.

Average Vehicle 64 VP
Number of Crew 5
Average Crew Total 22 VP

The PzKw-IVH Vehicle Module comes with:
•Vehicle Tactics Panel - cut into 6 parts for easy storage.
•48 cards for the 4 crew with their action cards and special training cards.
•16 cards for Combined Arms Tactics
•32 cards for the vehicle itself and various tactics cards as options
•Vehicle Flats - to use for play with Sergeants D-Day: In Action, Burning, Knocked Out and Tracked
•Sighting Markers for the vehicles crew sighting targets.
•Status Markers for "dismounted" crew
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Sergeants: Hell on Wheels – Marder-IIIM
description:
The Marder-IIIM a.k.a Geschützwagen 38(t) Ausf. M was a German Tank Destroyer that saw heavy service throughout the war. The open-top armor made them vulnerable to indirect artillery fire. In defensive operations the Marder was superior at sighting and rate of fire.

The Sergeants Hell on Wheels Vehicle Modules are playable with either Sergeants D-Day or Sergeants Miniatures Game. The Marder IIIM Vehicle Module requires Sergeants Hell on Wheels for play.

Average Vehicle 43 VP
Number of Crew 4
Average Crew Total 18 VP

The Marder-IIIM Vehicle Module comes with:
•Vehicle Tactics Panel - cut into 6 parts for easy storage.
