•48 cards for the 4 crew with their action cards and special training cards.
•16 cards for Ambush Tactics
•32 cards for the vehicle itself and various tactics cards as options
•Vehicle Flats - to use for play with Sergeants D-Day: In Action, Burning, Knocked Out and Tracked
•Sighting Markers for the vehicles crew sighting targets.
•Status Markers for "dismounted" crew, mines and MG42.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Sergeants Miniatures Game: Manoir de Normandie
description:
The Manoir de Normandie is a collection of X-Terrain that expands 3D terrain play with a large double building Manor house - Manoir de Normandie, new cards, and new scenarios. Also included is a small lean-to Le Hangar and a Corner trench that is compatible with the Prepared Positions.

CONTENTS: •X6A Manoir de Normandie
•X6B Le Hangar
•X6C Corner Trench
•1 Equipment Card
•12 Landmark Cards
•3 Order Cards
•9 Scenarios
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Nachod-Skalnitz-Svinistany 1866
description:
Game covers three battles of the Prusso-Austrian 1866 war: battle of Nachod, battle of Skalnitz and battle of Svinistany. All of them were won by the Prussians. Game uses modified "Napoleon" system rules.

Game was published in the 41 issue of the "Taktyka i Strategia" magazine in both Polish and English editions.

name: Panduiki
description: In Panduiki, you're charged with appeasing a dark panda god and rescuing as many of your sacrifices as possible. Win a trick and gain the boon on your card, ranging from drawing cards to pushing your opponents ever closer to the waiting maw of Panduiki.

name: Barbarossa 1941
description:
Game covers central and northern part of the German invasion of the USSR.

K-2 system rules, division scale. Map covers western part of the Belarus, Lithuania, Latvia and Estonia along with a eastern Poland and East Prussia.

Game was published in the 31 and 32 issues of the Taktyka i Strategia magazine.

name: Super Hazard Quest: Warp Pipes
description: The “Warp Pipes" expansion also features 5 new Dungeon Cards to expand the board. These cards put a clever twist on navigating the Dungeon through Warp Pipes. If two or more Warp Pipe Dungeon Cards are out on the table, the player can jump into one and come out of another, no matter where it is on the table. It's a whole new way to get around.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Maze, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Take That, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Incredible Courage 100 Days: Ligny
description:
Incredible Courage 100 Days – Ligny is the second installment in a 4 game set that explores Napoleon’s 100 Days campaign that ended his reign and finished his aspirations as emperor of France. This was Napoleon’s Last Victory and he managed it against an enemy force that was larger than his own. The best part of this game is that the French Imperial Guard is located at this battle. Incredible Courage 100 Days – Quatre Bras is required to play this game.

There are 7 scenarios included in this game and 3 of them are on the small side in terms of unit density. These scenarios include "The Battle of Ligny", "The Battle for the Amand’s", "The Fight for St Amand", "The Battle for Ligny", "The Guard Assault on Ligny", "Pinning the III Korps", and "Boignee". "The Battle of Ligny" scenario takes you into the fight for the entire battle. With all its intricate details and nuances that show how the Prussians kept feeding the II Korps Reserves into the I Korps battle for the Amand’s, and the battle for the town of Ligny proper. In "The Battle for the Amand’s" both players will be faced with how to take or hold a series of villages that are crawling with Prussians. The tight terrain makes the fight extremely hard and yet the French force more and more of the Prussian II Korps reserves to be moved to this area. A smaller scenario that focuses on this area is "The Fight for St Amand" which has one French division making its attack and seeing the Prussians respond.
In "The Battle for Ligny" the French are assigned the unenviable task of pushing a brigade of Prussians out of the town. In "The Guard Assault on Ligny" the French player is making the final attack of the day with the Imperial Guard. This is their last success. "Pinning the III Korps" is the situation on the French right flank and holding the Prussian III Korps in place as the other forces fight the main battle. The last scenario is a hypothetical. In "Boignee" the Prussian player is forced to make an attack on the French right and see if he can change the course of the battle by making Napoleon react to that.

There are a couple of interesting options for inclusion into scenarios in this game.
The French VI Corps arrives earlier
The Prussian III Korps is Pinned and can't cross the Ligny Stream

This game features the final map artwork of Rick Barber. The map for this Ligny game can be connected to the maps for the Quatre Bras battlefield. Together they make a clean, connected, battle space that will leave you with your jaw hanging open as you see just how close to the Ligny battlefield D’Erlon was and how easily he could have made an impact on either battle had he been able to march to one place or the other undisturbed.

Key Features

(20) 11" x 17" Full Color Map Sheets of the Ligny Area Seamlessly Able to Connect to the Quatre Bras Maps
Variable combat strengths
Reduction by Levels of Order
Ligny Rules Supplement with National Doctrinal Rules
Approximately 2600 Die Cut Unit Counters and Markers
Infantry and Cavalry units at the company and squadron level and artillery at the section level
Battalion level infantry and Regiment level cavalry units
(7) Scenarios that allow play on smaller parts of the battle or the entire affair
Excellent Solitaire Play


(from Grognard sim's website)

name: Halo: Fleet Battles – UNSC MAC Platform Upgrade
description:
From the publisher:

Magnetic Accelerator Cannons of unsurpassed lethality were used to defend the planet of Reach. These devastating orbital defence platforms will add a new element to the game of Halo: Fleet Battles in the form of fixed fortifications that form defensive lynchpins behind which players can rally their fleet. A cool feature of these models is that it can be mounted both horizontally and vertically.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Starships Assembly
description:
Societies in the 28th century roam the galaxies in continent-sized starships. Captains of these starship societies gather to negotiate peacefully in the Starships Assembly. While the peace holds you will recruit captains to your side and deploy a fleet of starships. But after a declaration of war there is no course left except to engage your opponent's fleet and triumph!

Starships Assembly is a two-player strategy game played with 20 cards, each with a captain on one side and a ship on the other.

The Assembly phase is a peaceful political arena. A card from your hand could be played as a recruited captain, where captains cast votes and have special abilities. Spend your votes to recruit more captains and also to play cards from your hand using the other side: a deployed ship.

Eventually one player or the other will cause a declaration of war. Then every card that is not a ship gets shuffled together and your fleet of ships is all you take with you to the final Open Warfare phase.

War has been declared! There are no reinforcements! From here on out you must defeat the enemy fleet, ship by ship. Be the last player with a ship to win the game!

name: Who Finds it First?
description:
Hvem finder det først? ("Who Finds it First?") - an action Board Game for all ages.

Very easy to learn - using four picture tiles at time, just match up each picture tile with photos of the same object on the board. There are 500 different objects to choose from so it is not quite as easy as it sounds!

The first player to spot and shout out the item, wins the tile........however......the fun does not stop there. Some of the tiles have "Action Flags" on them so during each round you can:

Steal picture tiles from your opponents
Win extra tiles from the big bag, to add to your pile
In addition, some tiles are worth extra points at the end of the game - so keep them safe


This is a loud game and requiring fast actions and reactions! Keep your wits about you and don't take any prisoners. Brothers and sisters you have been warned!

name: Too Schuss à Tignes
description:
Too Schuss is a boardgame that takes place in the Ski Resort of Tignes in France. The board represent the map of the ski resort.

Goal: Be the first player to end your skying day with the higher score.

Game is a race where you need to finish the day as quick as possible while optimizing your path down the ski trail to score points.

A lighter version of the rules is available for kids or player that want an easyer game.

name: Crisis
description:
From the publisher:

Crisis is a modern game with many innovations like a virtual, generic map, no general certificate or money limits, rounds instead of operating rounds and stock rounds, structure purchases, and signals but without some traditional elements like off-board connections, terrain difficulties, small cities, empty big cities, or privates. This gives the game a new feeling already on the surface. Square tiles are used to simulate subways in a downtown megalopolis.

While once 1830 could be called the premier game of stock manipulation and 1841 is the game with the greatest speed of technological development, now Crisis is the toughest, most complex, and most unpredictable game of business strategy. Measuring complexity is hard but years of testing have produced counter-strategies for every strategy and not enabled me to foresee just one round, what is possible in 1830 or 1841.

So what makes Crisis so tough? First of all, companies can purchase unlimited numbers of foreign shares. This creates complex combines. Second, companies are forced to own more and more foreign shares, what makes good shares scarce. This is an extra duty besides buying a train. Third, foreign assets may only be bought from the or as a director. Fourth, all shareholders can be responsible for under-endowed companies while some might avoid supports and let the director lose his shares even though having supported. Fifth, other shares in such companies may not be given away and can cause more supports. Sixth, half the companies have only certificates that already allow a director change. Seventh, trading many old or new certificates quickly restructures combines, depletes companies, or inflates money. Eighth, the stock market and the round order, which involves players and companies, are particularly flexible. To conclude, dividends are paid only to owned foreign shares.

While the game has a balanced start and good route construction remains important, it becomes more and more essential to excel at wheeling and dealing. Clearly, Crisis is the game of devious business manipulations.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Stock Holding, Tile Placement

name: Lab Wars: Collective Power
description:
Promo Card given out to players at UKGE 2016.

'Gain an extra 4 impact points if you build 15 lab items in your lab area.'
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: Ludothèque
description:
Ludothèque is a game of games collecting and club development. It uses Games Cards system. Players are owners of the game clubs trying to buy good games, organize game tables in order to acquire the most prestige points.

On your turn, you may (1) sell and buy games, and (2) add 1 game to make game table more attractive for gamers. New game on a table must has the same or wider player range, that a previous game's one. Game tables with 3 games are considered completed and give income to their owner.

Game table with easy games gives 1 prestige point, with medium weight - 2, and with heavy games - 3 prestige points. In order to win the game, you must reach 15 prestige points before your opponents do.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Trading

name: When Pigs Fly: A Card Game for Cincinnati Cynics
description:
Inspired by the famous game for terrible people everywhere, Cards Against Humanity, this card set will have you laughing and crying about our beautiful and horrible city.

This is not a Cards Against Humanity expansion deck, nor is it meant to be mixed in with your Cards Against Humanity deck. With 60 question cards and 240 answer cards, there’s more than enough content to play a full game using only this deck. Every single card is Cincinnati-themed, so this game will give you and your friends hours of local laughs.

Disclaimer: This game is intended for players 18 years or older. We do not recommend this game for minors. In other words, do not buy this game for your children unless you want to corrupt their innocent minds.

Legalese: We have absolutely no affiliation with Cards Against Humanity nor is this an unofficial expansion deck. Cards Against Humanity is a trademark of Cards Against Humanity LLC, and is completely unaffiliated with this site and its contents. Price includes sales tax.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Catan Geographies: Kennessee
description: Special map given out by Mayfair at conventions and special events. Must have the base game - Catan - to play this map.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Trading

name: Mein Friedberg Spiel
description:
Mein Friedberg Spiel is a collection of games related to Friedberg (hometown of Pegasus) to celebrate the 800th city anniversary in 2016.

Contents


Loveletter version, themed around the visit of the Tsar in Friedberg
Roman circular (3 Mens-)morris
Snakes&ladders, themed around the Friedberg main street, Kaiserstrasse
Advanced Mau Mau, themed with local arms and special Friedberg features
Mindmaze, with questions from the history of Friedberg
32 standard playing card deck, illustrated with Friedberg pictures
Memo game with Friedberg illustrations
2 different sized puzzles showing Friedberg views

name: In Business
description:
In In Business, players have to trade goods from one continent to the other. Starting off with a loan from the bank, players have to earn money to pay back the loan and finally make a profit. The first player to own a certain amount of money (depending on the number of players) wins the game.

In order to do so, players have to make the most profitable bargains by buying cheap and sell expensive. Each country has its own prizes.

At the start of the game each player gets a goal-card, which shows:

The type of good which have to be traded
Purchase area
Sell area
Purchase and sell prizes


Players move along the board by rolling two dice. For each continent they can choose whether to walk the long- or short route.

During the game, players can get additional goals, loose or win money at the stock market, or get additional smaller bonuses or losses. Also players can lose their cargo by a casualty during transport, unless their goods are ensured.

The additional rules for experienced players involve a more extensive stock market.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Loans, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Necker
description:
Necker is an abstract strategy game published in a limited 120 handcrafted production. It’s gameplay is based on abstract classic Backgammon. The board uses Necker Cube optical illusion giving the players the sense of each climbing a pyramid though they are all moving in different directions.
Each player starts with 5 pieces on the base of the pyramid, having to climb to the top in order to win. First player reaching the top of the pyramid wins the game. Each turn players must roll 2 dice which can show “advance” or “change” 1 or more pieces. Then the player must choose one of them and perform the actions. Advance mean going “up” in the current pyramid the pieces are on, change means the piece will move in other color pyramid, being then able to take other player pieces but not climbing to win the game. A taken piece goes to the base of it’s color.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Gamer Deck 1: Mechanics
description:
Gamer Deck is a series of card decks that appeal to gamers and game designers. Each deck will be more like a card system then a standard deck of cards. A card system has multiple elements to be used to play and design many games.

Deck 1 is similar to a standard poker deck with different suits and a game mechanic on each card. Those of you who don't know what game mechanics are, they are certain skills and techniques highlighted in a game. The deck has dice on each card representing the value of the card.

name: Zurrumurru
description:
Storytelling game based on BasqueNavarre mythology
Zurrumurru is a game in which the players create a story together, using cards that can show items, actions or characters from BasqueNavarre Mythology. One player is the Storyteller and creates a story using the ingredients on her cards. He tries to guide the plot towards her own ending. The other players try to use cards to interrupt her and become the new Storyteller. The winner is the first player to play out all her cards

First edition contains one deck of 55 cards.

Cards name are in Basque but it can be played using the image on the cards.

name: Ready or Not
description:
Description from the publisher:

"Players create numeric patterns (sequences and series like 1,2,3,4 or 2,4,6,8 etc.) much like they would create words while playing Scrabble. There is an amazing number of possibilities, a lot of fun and all players compete equally while receiving play money as they show off their creative ability."

Each player starts with $1000 and 7 numeric tiles. On a player's turn they must create a numeric pattern using at least 3 of their 7 tiles. Points scored are equal to the sum of the numbers played, multiplied by the number of tiles played. Additional tiles can be purchased with game money. Additional money can be earned by creating a pattern where the sum of the numbers is equally divisible by the number of tiles played. The game ends when no more tiles are remaining. The player with the most points is the winner.

name: Mein Zombie! Core Rule Book
description:
Description from the publisher:

Mein Zombie is a flexible and expandable 1:1 rule system for recreating the massive Zombie infection. Designed to be used with miniature scales from 15 up to 28mm, it is based around out innovative Drop-In game system. Players from novice to veteran will find it easy to customize the game to their particular gaming style.

This player-friendly approach to war gaming builds around solid and easily learned basic rules, which present an excellent balance of playability and historical accuracy. Once you quickly learn the core rules, you simply "drop in" additional rule modules as you see fit. Each Drop-In utilizes the same terms and mechanics for entirely seamless integration into a full-featured game system.

name: Rainbow Roll
description:
Description from the designer:

Rainbow Roll is a push your luck dice game for 2-4 players. Players roll a pair of dice with numbered and colored faces. They must then flip over a tile corresponding to one of the numbers or colors shown. Each tile has sushi on the backside. The more sushi showing the more points earned!

name: Miombo Wackelturm
description:
This is a variant of Jenga, published without rules, but including a wooden six sided dice.

Each building block is either blank, features the WWF panda logo or is painted with the fur patterns of either giraffe, cheetah or zebra. The dice has coresponding sides to the blocks and therefore supposingly is to be rolled to determine, which type of block is legal to take away.

Contains 48 wooden blocks and 1 dice.
mechanics: Physical Removal, Single Loser Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: 3D Pawn: Checkmate Expansion
description: The Checkmate Expansion introduces a king and queens into 3DPawn, bringing new possibilities and new strategies to explore.

name: Tablaaza
description:
Two neighbouring tribes, attracted to each other by a mixture of friendship and rivalry, decided to found a new City. A checkered system of plots was marked out around the lakes of Indigo and on the isthmus between them. The tribes were to take alternating turns in occupying these plots — and, in the process, play a game which would decide which of these plots would be given over to public buildings, which, for convenience, we call "Pavilions." Within the rules of the game, a special way of surrounding a plot belonging to the other tribe would oblige them to donate what would have been their own living space as a site for a Pavilion. As a mark of respect for their public-spiritedness, the losing tribe was to be accorded the honour of naming the city. After a close game, the losers named the city Tablaaza.

In Tablaaza, players take turns placing a piece on one of their own squares.

A player places a pavilion on one of the opponent's playing squares (provided it is, as yet, unoccupied), if, after the move just played, all the squares of his or her own color that share a "corridor" with that square are occupied. A "corridor" means a row or column of two or more playing squares. Sometimes more than one pavilion can thus be raised on a turn of play. Once a pavilion has been placed on a square, there is no further play on that square.

The objective is to be the last player able to play a move. Once a player no longer has a space to play into, s/he has lost.

name: Le Docte Rat Bouffe
description: Le Docte Rat Bouffe is a trivia game on the words and pleasures of eating, not on cooking. Through humorous questions, it covers themes such as food, dishes, national dishes, health, food labels, food vocabulary and expressions, eating and singing, eating and cinema, etc.

name: By Savvy & Steel: A Gentleman's Life in 17th Century Europe
description:
Descriprion from the publisher:

One For All... Well, you know the rest.

By Savvy and Steel takes the player back to 17th Century Europe. Everyone’s heard of the Three Musketeers and the Cardinal’s Guard, and yes, By Savvy and Steel will work for that, but we’ve taken it a bit farther. How far? Glad you asked! Instead of tying you into Paris of the Musketeers we let you travel the countryside in a generic country called Edenstein. It’s based on the Europe of the 17th Century and it could be France or England if you want, but it doesn’t have to be.

You have the choice, it’s your story!

In By Savvy and Steel you can choose to be a Guardsman, Rogue, or Civilian. Civilian? Yes, you probably won’t want to be a Civilian but you could be if you wanted to. So why are they there? Because it’s not all about dueling every day, in *By Savvy and Steel*, it’s about the adventure and Civilians make for good story lines.

Maybe you have to rescue a kidnapped daughter of a wealthy Noble. Or maybe you’ve decided to be a Highwayman and rob coaches. It’s all about the story and that’s what* By Savvy and Steel* is about, the story, your story.

In By Savvy and Steel you’ll find:


A complete area to adventure in.



Multiple scenarios.



A variety of Classes for you to play.



A fun and interactive Dueling system (well it is in the Musketeers time period!).



A light book keeping campaign to track your character’s progress and link your adventures together.


You’ve received a message from the King. He requires your services but there’s still time for a mug of ale if you hurry. As you enter the Drunken Stallion, a foot is extended and causes you to trip into another man. With a curse he turns on you and tries to slap your face. You grab his hand, and he pulls away. You see him grab the hilt of his sword. “You sir, are an oafish pig and I demand an apology or satisfaction! “, he shouts. The tavern is suddenly quiet. Which will it be? Do you risk looking foolish in front of all, or do you accept his challenge. And who was it that tripped you? Welcome to … By Savvy and Steel
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: Rabbit Match: The Game
description:
Players take the role rescue shelter managers, seeking victory by placing rabbits in quality homes and enhancing their reputation within the animal community.

With each turn come more rabbit cards (the "roll for bunnies" command inspiring our sister game) as well as cards with potential adopters, crises, and opportunities. Players grow their victory pile and point total matching rabbits with adopters according to adopter preferences, gaining bonuses if the rabbit is difficult to place (Is it sick or unfriendly? Does it disdain the litter box or other bunnies?) or part of a bonded pair--bunny-to-bunny bonding forming the other matching activity.

Too many bunnies for the available space (on an individual's tableau) and too few (or finicky) adopters at turn's end demand players negotiate with competitors who may have space, or get creative with bonding lest they have to send bunny foo-foos to paid foster care (with its victory point penalties).

Cards for personal assistants (with issues and assets), Easter, dump crises, media fads, rich and fickle benefactors are among the items that provide variety within games and between sessions.

This game is designed, tested by gamers under the oversight of the Los Angeles Rabbit Foundation, a chapter of the House Rabbit Society.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Freebooter's Fate: Mystic Spirits
description:
The 112 page book includes:


the new crew of The Cult with 10 characters
rules for a total of 26 new characters for the crews Pirates, Goblin Pirates, Imperial Armada, Brotherhood and Amazons, as well as three new female Mercenaries, two of which are also Mystics.
the new game mechanic of Loa invocation, new traits and actions
4 new mystical scenarios like The Ritual or Attack of the Zombie Octopuses
The Return of the Culti - mini camapaign with 4 more scenarios
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Pirates

name: Time Rift
description:
As Agents of the Temporal Protection Agency, you and your partner are tasked with removing Anachronisms from the Timeline and sealing the Rift, even if it means sacrificing your Temporal Cohesion and risking your own existence... because the alternative is to allow the Rift to fracture, which will result in the destruction of the Universe itself!

Each turn, you will
1) Build inventory (optional, spend Temporal Cohesion to draw Device Cards)
2) Use Device cards (optional, spend Temporal Cohesion to play Device Cards) on any Anachronism in the Timeline.
3) Move your agent pawn along the timeline (optional)
4) Remove Anachronism (optional, roll dice to attempt to remove one Anachronism from the Era where your agent pawn is located.
5) Draw Anachronism. You must draw and place one Anachronism
6) Housekeeping. You must end your turn with no more than 8 unbroken device cards in Shared Inventory.

There is only one way to win the game: Seal the Rift. At the end of any Agent's turn, if the Rift Marker is on O (Sealed), the game ends and the players win (from the rulebook)

name: Hockey Cup
description:
Hockey Cup is a game about building a hockey team. It is inspired by Baseball Highlights: 2045 by Mike Fitzgerald. It uses Games Cards system.

Hockey Cup is like watching TV highlights of hockey games. In this quick and interactive game, two coaches build their teams as they play, combining both strategy (building the team) and tactics (playing the game) without any of the downtime. During each "mini-game", each coach alternates playing six cards to simulate a full game's highlights – 3 defensive and 3 offensive actions. Whichever team wins the most mini-games in the series takes the cup!

Coaches start the game with a team, which consists of 15 1st level players. On his turn a coach sends one offensive player to make 1 trick, and the other coach sends one defensive player to prevent the trick. Next, both players may use one of their special actions. An unprevented trick leads to goal. At the end of third period, if the score is tied, they play overtime, which is followed by a penalty shootout. After every game, a coach uses 3 experience points to raise the level of his players. A 2nd level player can make 2 tricks, 3rd level - 3 tricks.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Fahrenheit 420
description:
Roll it. Spark it. Score it. Do you have what it takes to get the HIGHEST score?

Rules:

1. Roll it. Roll this paper into your best interpretation of a jazz cigarette; score side on the inside.

2. Spark it. Light it on fire. Literally. Be safe. Or don't. Whatever.

3. Score it. You can put out the fire whenever you choose, however you choose. Score the burn line furthest from the start. HIGHEST score wins or play multiple rounds to 420.

Note: Don't be a moron and actually set yourself or your stuff on fire.

Part of the Prettiest Princess Games Consumable 1-Sheet line.

name: Game of the Gods
description: 2-3 player strategy game with a 2 team 4 player cooperative variant. Set in Ancient Greece, players try to reach the Golden Fleece and bring it to any of the 4 cities at the corners of the board. Opponents try to trap or land on the player with the Golden Fleece. Trapped players are teleported to the corner squares minus the Fleece. The winner is the first player to get the Fleece to a corner square / city.
categories: Ancient, Children's Game, Maze, Miniatures, Mythology, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Pick-up and Deliver

name: Das kleine Gespenst: Spuk auf Burg Eulenstein
description: Every night in Das kleine Gespenst: Spuk auf Burg Eulenstein, the little ghost awakes at the witching hour to run through the castle rooms to play. Its favorite game is cannonball bowling — but where did it hide the cannonballs last time? Who can help the little ghosts find them again? Who has been paying attention to which chests hide which cannonballs?

name: Ostfront: Fast Play WWII Wargame
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Ostfront is the result of 5 years of research and play-testing. Its a comprehensive World War 2 system aimed at historical accuracy, balance and fun. The rules have been streamlined over the years, and we would consider it "fast play" - Its quick, brutal and rewards bold commanders with sound tactics.

Ostfront covers Infantry, Light Vehicles, all varieties of Tanks and Self-Propelled guns, Artillery in the form of Field Guns and Howitzers, Air Support and Air defense, as well various other forms of support and fortifications. It can be played in any theater of WW2, from North Africa to the Pacific. Aimed at 1/72, 1/100 or smaller scale miniatures. It would also work fine for 28mm.

The Ostfront system is all about combined arms - it plays at a Company to Battalion level, with the smallest unit being the Infantry Platoon. Infantry are deployed in bases, each one representing about 25 men for regulars, and about 10 men for the veteran Assault Infantry units. At 1/72 scale we usually use 3-4 miniatures per base, meaning you can make a large amount of bases from any cheap infantry box - one airfix box of 48 miniatures would give you 10 bases.

Tanks are of course a large part of Ostfront battles, with the average game fielding anywhere from 1 to 20 of them per side, sometimes more in larger games. Light vehicles play an important role, and reconnaissance has a tangible effect in-game - he who scouts out the area first can gain a tactical advantage.

We Split WW2 into 3 periods, allowing balanced battles to be fought and still capture the feelings of operations like Barbarossa and Operation Torch. Its not always about who has the most heavy tanks - in fact heavy tanks are somewhat expensive in the points system, due to the difficulty with which they were produced, maintained and transported. During early war players will need to rely on light tanks, Infantry, Artillery and air strikes to secure their objectives. Mid war covers Kursk style battles - with the Tiger, Panther and Sherman all making an appearance, but before heavier Soviet tanks like the IS-2 or T-34/85 had come into action. Late war covers all the late war toys, from the JagdTiger and Tiger II to the Pershing, to the aforementioned IS-2, among many others.

Ostfront also has a campaign system for combination map-and-tabletop play, allowing you to get that glorious combination of grand strategy and tabletop tactics. The campaign allows up to 5 players to go head-to-head on a map of Europe and North Africa, from Spain to Russia, Scandinavia to Egypt. Each faction fights to control production centres - where they produce more forces each turn, and to spread their supply lines out to the places they need to conquer. A technology race is also implemented, with players who control Tech Centres able to produce slightly more advanced units - even extending to post war tanks if the game is currently in late war - ever wanted a good reason to use a Maus or IS-3? Well here's your chance.

Every time forces make contact on the Campaign map, an Ostfront tabletop battle is fought, with the amount of points on the campaign map dictating how many points you can use in your table top battle. After the battle the results are applied to the Campaign: if you lost 50% of your forces during the game, your force on the Campaign map will also lose 50%. If you were able to win the objectives and cut off your enemies supply train on the table, you will be able to force him back on the campaign map.

This connectedness makes each tabletop battle have a purpose, and adds a lot of flavor to the game as a whole. You might know you're horribly outnumbered, but you need to give the enemy force a bloody nose while you wait for your main force and your allies to come to your aid, and so you will build a specific list for that game, and that purpose. The campaign also allows for combined attacks, out-flanking maneuvers, encirclement and cutting off of supply lines, and a free-form diplomacy system is also implemented.

Two Campaign maps are available for free download, one is a balanced map for a slightly ahistorical but balanced campaign. The other is a realistic map for a more accurate WW2 campaign.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: CreaCity
description:
INTRODUCTION TO THE GAME
A stormy period of the election to the City Council has just finished. The current model of managing cities has been hugely criticized. Many of the changes that took place in Poland and in the world resulted in the search for new ways of dealing with the problem.

The project CreaCity takes place in a number of big and small places scattered all over the world. Your city has become one of the participants of this great plan aimed at fixing the world.

The project assumes forming a Small Council for one term of office, which will deal with critical issues and those demanding immediate action. Your task will be to take decisions which satisfy the residents and indicate the direction of the development of the city, and at the same time avoid bringing it to bankruptcy.

This experiment may reveal new future leaders, so, even if you do not succeed, this game might be the beginning of something fantastic, both for you and the entire world.

CreaCity is a live action board game, during which players take on the role of councillors during the meetings of the Small City Council.

Each player will receive their character card stating their objectives and the committee they belong to. Each round of the game means very intense 45 minutes, during which committee members will be entrusted with Small and Big Challenges. It is these Challenges that CreaCity will be based on and, depending on the decisions taken by the players, the situation in the city will be changing.

The city is symbolized by a map divided into 8 regions. There are two dice placed in each region: a satisfaction dice (blue) and a dissatisfaction one (red).

Every time players take a binding decision, its effects will be transferred onto the board – satisfaction in the region will change (by changing the values on the dice), general satisfaction in the city and the available budget will change as well, and special buildings will appear.

Players start with a high degree of social trust and their decisions are aimed at gaining the largest general satisfaction possible. Af ter 5 rounds the game ends and the players check who accomplished the greatest number of objectives. Depending on the condition of the city, the entire Small Council receives appropriate number of victory points

GAME OBJECTIVES
For a period of 5 rounds you must not let the city go bankrupt. It happens when:

on the board, there will be 5 region bankruptcy tags.
The Dissatisfaction Tag will cross field number 30.


What is more, fight for your personal result and accomplish your objectives.

name: Flotti Karotti
description:
In Flotti Karotti, the orange carrot Karotti sits in the (plastic) green hill and plays music. The young players hop about like rabbits until they hear a command from Karroti, e.g., "Seek my friend Bruno Broccoli!" at which point the children race to find Bruno Broccoli amongst the face-down tiles. Players also need fast reactions as sometimes Karotti will rocket into the air, rewarding whoever grabs it first.

In the end, whoever collects the most carrot chips wins!

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – I.K.S. Toral Expansion Pack
description: This ship is the competitive prize for Month 3 of the Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play tournament, Klingon Civil War. It is a B'Rel Class ship.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Buy the Rights: 80s Action Expansion
description:
The 80s Action Expansion Pack - 30 cards in a foil pack reminiscent of old movie trading cards, packed full of cards that will make your pitches sound like awesome 80s movies. 10 new Hero Descriptor, Hero, and Plot cards (plus a bonus 80s Action Genre card) increase the number of possible combinations in Buy the Rights to over 133 Million!
—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Reformanda
description:
Reformanda is a collaborative, educational and fun card game for 2-6 players. The players, as pirates, will hone their discernment skills and strategically collaborate, countering heresy with Scripture, using their abilities, weapons, loot and spiritual gifts to rescue those who have been infected with heresies. Let no man deceive you.

The Players win if at the end of the last Round at least 1 Pirate and 1 Church are standing. Each round has 3 Phases: Heresy, Dogma and Reckoning Phases. During the heresy phase, churches lean heretical(you flip over cards with symbols on the bottom and must play cards with matching symbols to discard the flipped over cards); during the dogma phase, the pirates battle the heresies(you play cards and draw back up); during the reckoning phases, any church or pirate containing three heresies becomes heretical. There are 12 rounds in total.

name: Platoon Commander: India-Pakistan War 1965
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Version 2 of the Platoon Commander series, with improved art and thicker counters, Tiny Battles introduces India-Pakistan War 1965. India-Pakistan War is a Platoon Commander module simulating the conflict during August and September of 1965 between India and Pakistan in the Chawinda region of Kashmir. The module designer, David K. van Hoose; has brought to life some of the largest armor battles since the Battle of Kursk. The module includes five scenarios that will take the gamer from small skirmishes to the slugfests that produced what has become known as the Grave Yard of Tanks. Fight with Chieftains, Easy Eight Shermans, Pattons, and AMX-13 tanks, insert Guerillas behind the enemy’s lines, and call devastating artillery support. The historically accurate forces are at your command. Can you lead them to victory?

Platoon Commander is a Mark H. Walker designed, platoon-level game system depicting armored combat from 1936 into the near future. The counters represent everything from tanks and infantry to armored personnel carriers and, as the technology progresses, even missile teams. The game uses an innovative sequence of play; a card-assisted system that is partially impulse driven, partially turn-based, and all fun. Morale plays a decisive role, and the period’s equipment is understandably depicted with colors and numbers on each counter. From the designer of Lock ‘n Load, World at War, and Night of Man, Platoon Commander is an exciting, accessible game of strategy and tactics.

name: Holy Roman Empire Expansion 2: Battles of the English Civil War
description:
Game description from the publisher:

The English Civil War (ECW) Scenario Pack is intended for use with the tactical battle map and Battle Board Rules that come with Holy Roman Empire. Just like its cousin, the Thirty Years War Scenario Pack,this expansion is designed to allow players to set up and game historical battles from the period. This is a game, not a simulation, and while intended to provide an insight into the struggles of the era it is meant to be fast, fun, and challenging rather than an in-depth recreation of events. This pack covers selected battles of what is known as the First Civil War, from the first major engagement at Edgehill in 1642 until the kings decisive defeat at Naseby in 1645. The designer hopes that playing these scenarios will generate interest in the history of the period and will encourage gamers to read more about the era both for education and entertainment.

A half sheet of die-cut mounted playing pieces is also included, as is version 1.5 of the main Holy Roman Empire rule book.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Pike and Shot, Wargame

name: Shadow World: Arena
description:
Description from the publisher:

Cards and dice board game half-cooperative, based on the Shadow World universe.

Vampires, werewolves and unusual humans fight to gain control of Dark City. To achieve that they should cooperate to overcome the adversities of the environment and compete with each other in order to become the first to complete its mission. Collect a balanced band, arm them with sophisticated equipment or powerful spells and face any kind of danger. Use the other players to your advantage. Prove you're worthy of being the leader of the dark city.

MECHANICS AND TYPE OF GAME
Shadow World: Arena is a game of cards and dice, mixing the dark world of the Shadow World universe with a complete but flexible system.
In it, players will create their bands through the Character cards, Allies and Accessories. The dice are your resources, and limits what skills can use each turn the members of our band, providing a random point in the game.

Then everyone will try to accomplish the mission being assigned. To do this they will face unexpected events, and controlled by artificial intelligence enemies of the game itself and the interests of other players, because in the dark city, only one can claim victory.

name: The Beast at the Gates: Drewry's Bluff 1864
description: Beast at the Gates is a hex and counter brigade level game simulating the Battle of Drewry's Bluff, published in Yaah #7. It uses old school mechanics but features leader personality ratings, a streamlined activation system, random events, and simplified artillery rules. Six scenarios allow players to explore the possibilities of this often overlooked battle.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: Alestone
description:
A strategy board game of thinking and drinking. This game plays on an old world tavern theme where you try to capture an opponents glass of ale using a set of stone game pieces. The players can utilize augments such as the sword, shield, horse, and war ram in order to gain an advantage.

On your turn you may move any two stones up to a number of spaces equal to that particular stones designation. The Fate stone's maximum movement is determined by rolling 1d6 at the start of each of the players turn. Once two stones have been moved, play moves clockwise among the players.

On their turn a player can attack an opponents stone, sending it back across the board to it's starting position within it's stockade. However, this causes the attacking stone to become knocked prone and vulnerable to being pinned by an opponent moving on top. The pinned stoned cannot move until the start of a turn where it is not longer pinned.

Using augments such as the horse or the shield gives you a bonus to movement or defending against attacks, receptively. Use of the war ram and sword give offensive bonuses.

The game ends once a players moves three of his five stones into the stockade of an opponent, effectively capturing his glass of ale and winning the game.

The game incorporates optional rules for playing with your favorite beverage.

name: Kabuki
description:
A game based on mimicry for two to four teams of players.

In each team's turn, one of the team's players attempts to silently mimic a specific thing, with the goal of enabling their team partners to guess which thing it is before the timer runs out. The things to be mimicked fall in one of four categories, each one of which has an associated mask to be worn by the player that will attempt the mimicry: actions (mime mask); places (Indian mask); animals and things (tiger mask); and school (teacher mask).

Teams advance their tokens along the game board by rolling one die, as long as they keep succeeding in guessing the mimicked concept after each throw of the die.

The goal is to be the first team to reach the last space in the game board (number 36).

Game contents:
-Game board.
-Hourglass.
-4 masks.
-144 word cards.
-12 joker cards.
-4 team tokens.
-1 die.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Deduction, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Deduction, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: El gran juego de Hobby Consolas
description:
Players attempt to buy famous video games for several contemporary consoles, and also the consoles themselves. Income is gained by other players renting games and consoles from them, and money is spent when they rent games and consoles from other players.

Gameplay
On their turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned game, they have the opportunity to buy it and add it to their collection. If a player owns all the games for a specific console, they may then buy consoles to rent with each game, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If they land on a game owned by another player, they must pay that player a rental price according to the value of the game and any consoles coming with it. There are other places on the board which cannot be bought, but instead require the player to: draw a "News" card and perform the action on the card; draw a "Question" card and answer a question about video games in order to win a prize; collect income; or fix a broken console (which can keep them from moving for as long as three turns).

Player elimination
If a player does not have enough money to pay for a debt, not even by selling all of their video games and consoles, they will be bankrupt and out of the game.

Goal
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.

Background
This Monopoly-inspired game was gifted to readers of Spanish video game magazine Hobby Consolas with their numbers 54 and 55. Publication of the game was sponsored by Spanish video game retail chain Centro Mail.

Game contents:
-Game board.
-26 video game cards.
-26 console cards.
-20 News cards.
-31 Question cards.
-310 point notes.
-10 Centro Mail discount coupons.

(Additionally, two dice and one token per player are required to play the game.)
categories: Economic, Negotiation, Trivia, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Minikorona
description:
Description from the publisher (translated):

Minikorona is a space-saving version of its big brother Korona. With just a 30 cm × 30 cm playing area, players need to have pinpoint accuracy to be able to get the discs into corner pockets and thus win the game.

Unlike the original Korona, this mini-sized version is only for two players.

name: The Game Room Part 1: Mr. Boddy
description:
The Game Room by Black Toad Games is a live-action puzzle adventure you host in your own home. Your guests compete against each other in a furious race to solve puzzles, open locks, and claim their reward.

Step into the shoes of hot-shot news reporters racing to solve a maze of clues and puzzles in order to earn an exclusive interview with a notorious mad-man! Only the winning team will land the story, so brush up on your favorite board games if you hope to win.

You become the Game Master by using the online Game Master Portal to customize the game to your space and players. You choose whether to print puzzles or use your own props. Use real locks or the virtual locks provided online.

Tear-n-Play version available which requires no Game Master.
categories: Deduction, Murder/Mystery, Party Game, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: Monsters in Motion
description:
When some of the most dangerous monsters are captured, they are sent to dungeons all over the world, but some of those dungeons's keepers might be even more dangerous than the monsters themselves as they are part of an evil organization of Dungeon Overlords, and like every dark entity, all they want is to be in possession of the meanest and angriest monsters they can get. That's why when they receive weak monsters, they always try to send them to other dungeons. Who will be the last true Overlord?

Monsters in Motion is a fast paced party game for 3 to 8 players. Each player will have a limited set of choices during the game; the amount of strategy, deception and push your luck will start building up as the game goes on.

Each player will receive 4 monster cards and 3 power souls which represent the live points.
On each turn, each player has to choose a monster card and put it face-down in front of him.

Starting from the Overlord with the Soulstone (first player token) and following in the direction previously selected, each player will have to choose one of two actions:

1.KEEP: The player will keep the face-down monster.
2.SWAP: The player will swap the monster with the next player in turn order, the said player having to accept the swap unless his monster ability indicates differently.

After that, everyone is required to reveal their cards and other monster abilities will trigger. Finally, the weakest monster will make his overlord lose one power soul.

When a player loses all his power souls he will become a ghost. Living players (that still have power souls in front of them) cannot talk with ghosts, if they do, the ghost will be able to steal a power soul from them. The only living player that can talk with ghosts is the person in charge of the Soulstone.

When a ghost is in charge of the Soulstone he will be able to play that round, and during that round he will get one card from the monster deck. Ghosts are still ghosts, even if they are playing a round, so living players cannot talk with them.
If a ghost succeeds in stealing a power soul from other player or revives thanks to a monster ability, he will be completely back in the game and so he will draw the same number of cards as the other players.

Each monster will have powers that will trigger at different moments during the game. As the game goes on, each power will be crucial to win the game. The winner will be the last Overlord alive.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Make 'n' Break Architect Mini
description:
Make 'n' Break Architect Mini follows the familiar Make 'n' Break formula of players being given a challenge — typically a building or constructing challenge — then racing to complete it first in order to claim the card or score the points for the challenge.

In Make 'n' Break Architect, each player has a colorful folding ruler, and the challenges demand that players create particular shapes with the ruler or (more difficultly) create particular shapes with specific colors in specific locations. Whoever does so first can slap the card to claim it, and whoever claims six cards first wins.

Make 'n' Break Architect is a miniature version of the original Make 'n' Break Architect with components only for two players and with twenty cards showing forty tasks that was available with a McDonalds Happy Meal during September 2016.

name: Förbjuden Zon: brädspel efter undergången
description: Förbjuden Zon is a dystopic semi-cooperative board game, with a Stockholm setting. From the start of the game is good for the players to cooperate with the other players, but in the end of the game it is better to steal items from them. The board has four special sectors: Tunnels, Junkyard, Ark, and Mekano. You can only visit those one time in each game. The players need to pass through all of these. A player can be one of five characters in the game, who is better or worse at the four abilities (negotiate, habit, technology, and combat). The players roll two D6 and moves, draws Ruin card, one event cards and then a item card. Each item card has a "treasure value" from 1-3. If a player lose of lifepoints he is out of the game. The winner is the player that can escape "the zone", the board, with most total value on item cards.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Krypte
description:
The game was invented by Marino Carpignano in 2016.
An 8x8 unchequered game board is used with a certain number of bi-colour counters, white on one side and black on the other, like in Othello. At the beginning, the board is empty. Black moves first.
The Black player's first move is obligatorily on one of the 8 squares along the North side of the board.

After that, each player will choose an entry square for their counter, placed along one of the two next side rows (clockwise) with reference to the last piece played.

A counter slides (also jumping over any other counters already present on the game board) along the line perpendicular to the selected side, and stopping on the first empty square encountered.
Ambiguous moves are forbidden: that means you are not allowed to place your counter on a square that may be reached from both sides where you can play in your turn.

In this game the counters are captured by flanking them; the result of a capture is instead the same as in Othello.
The aim of the game is to be the first to complete an orthogonal or diagonal line of at least four counters of the player’s colour, avoiding a simultaneous alignment of four or more of the opponent’s counters.

name: The Elect
description:
The Elect is a fast-paced humorous card game of politics, elections, and the monsters which populate them.

The object of the game is to be the first player to match your Candidate's priorities to that of the Political Climate established at the start of the game - or to be the last viable Candidate in the race.
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Kosmium
description:
Kosmium is a space corporation handling whatever it’s needed thru the galaxy. They have just deployed 6 Space Station around the Solar System and have chosen you among other famous pilots to build the first cosmic highways in this part of the galaxy.
You compete against each other at navigating your ship thru the outer asteroid belt to collect minerals and then transform those into pieces of highway at the Space Stations from where you also deploy them.
Be careful: Kosmium is a ruthless company and to test your skills they might send you coordinates where you lose minerals, but also with each instruction card you get a special power to use when necessary. You can choose to disobey their coordinates and navigate to richer spots by bluffing, but be advised: the pilot behind you can contest your move and try to steal your minerals.
Be the first to complete the cosmic highway on your mission and win the game!
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Royale
description:
Royale is a board game for 2, 3 or 4 players and a “game” consists of one “hand” per each player with a maximum of four hands per game. Scores for each hand are accumulated and the player with the highest grand total wins the game. Players can draw equal and it is possible for them to end a hand, or even a game, with a negative score.

Having been dealt a hand of twelve cards, players, in turn, move their marker round the board, discarding cards, picking up cards, scoring points, deducting points from other players, and from themselves. The maximum number of points a player can score in any hand is ‘50’ but they can score extra points if having “declared” (played all their numerical cards), they are left only with Kings, Queens, Jacks (Court Cards), provided these are ALL of the same suit.

Players move their marker and score points according to the value of the cards which they play. For example; a ‘1’ of any suit is worth one point and allows the player to move their marker forward one space; a ‘2’, two points and two spaces; a ‘3’ three points and three spaces, and so on, up to ‘10’. Players must always play a card of the suit matching the suit on the space which their marker is in.

Court Cards follow a different rule. Players move their marker forward for the number of spaces indicated by the value on the particular Court Card played but, they DO NOT score any points. Instead they DEDUCT from their score, points to the value of the Court Card played. Only when a player “declares” do Court Cards take on a positive value….

(The cards for this game are specialized: The “Ace” has been replaced with a ‘1’; the “King” has a caricature of Robert the Bruce; the “Queen” is Mary, Queen of Scots; the "Jack" is Bonnie Prince Charlie (Charles Edward Stewart), and the “Jokers” are Crowns. An extra Joker/Crown card has been added for a total of 55 cards per deck.)
publishers: The Highland Games Company of Scotland Limited

name: Le Franc Tireur #5: Battle for Authion
description:
Includes 5 color scenarios on cardstock inserts and one hilltop/building overlay 'FT1'.

The scenarios focus on the battle for Authion. Two are large in size, one is medium sized, one is small, and one is very small.
All are in English (except the titles).

FT13 Cabanes Vieilles / Old Huts. France 1945 (Free French vs. German)
FT14 Les mille fourches / The Thousand Forks. France 1945 (Free French vs. German)
FT15 La forca / The Fort. France 1945 (Free French vs. German)
FT16 Les 3 communes / The Three Communes. France 1945 (Free French vs. German)
FT17 Patrol / Patrol. France 1945 (Free French vs. German)

An expansion for the Advanced Squad Leader (ASL) game system.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board

name: Initial Quest
description:
The fast-thinking, quick-listing game.

Given four initial letters, can you think of a fish, a sandwich-filling, a boy's name and a board game, one beginning with each initial letter. How hard can it be? It sounds simple but, with time rapidly running out and everyone else doing the same thing, can you come up with a fish, a sandwich-filling, a boy's name and a board game that no-one else has written down? Not quite so simple now is it?

name: Human Interface: Nakamura Tower – Motoshige Drones
description:
MOTOSHIGE SPECIAL PURPOSE DRONE (“THE TABLE” IS THE UNOFFICIAL BUT VERY POPULAR NICKNAME FOR THIS MODEL) I LOVE THIS CHILD. NEVER LETS ME DOWN. SAFE, EFFICIENT AND CHEAP. THE INTERFACE IS SIMPLE, EVEN TO A CHILD. MY 8 YEAR OLD SON VISITED ME AT WORK. URCHIN WAITED UNTIL SOMEONE CALLS ME INTO THE HALL AND LAUNCHED DRONE WITHOUT AUTHORIZATION USING THE SERVICE EQUIPMENT. MY GOD ALL THE ALARMS STARTED RINGING IN THE BUILDING ...

MOTOSHIGE MODEL IS VERY POPULAR BECAUSE OF ITS RELIABILITY. MICROMACHINES PRODUCED THEM IN THOUSANDS. IT’S PROBABLY 12 VERSION OF THE SOFTWARE. EVERYONE BOUGHT THEM ... UNTIL NOW WHEN NAKAMURA ENTERED ALL THE NEW DRONE MODELS. BUT I WOULD NOT BE TURNED. AS I SAID THEY NEVER LET ME DOWN. AND YOU CAN SIT ON IT LIKE A TIRED MAN.

PATRICK CHASEN - RAID44 SENIOR TECHNICIAN
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement

name: Tanto Cuore: Private Maid – Ursula Fassbender
description:
Promo card for the game Tanto Cuore

At the end of the game:
When you have 4 or more beercards in your private accomodation, you get +3SP.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That

name: The Cat Pack
description:
The Cat Pack is an educational game designed to help to practise early maths skills, including ordering, sorting, counting, matching, bigger, smaller, greatest/least, and same/different.

The Cat Pack includes 75 blue Cat cards, 24 orange attribute cards, and 27 green value cards. They are used for a variety of games:

1. Catnapping - Collect 6 Cats by either taking them from the Pound or stealing them from other players, to match your green value cards.

2. Cat Herding - Be the fastest to herd your Cats according to the different Attributes on the orange attribute cards. This encourages other Cats to join the herd.

3. Cat Adoption - Be the first to place your Cats for Adoption by getting rid of all your Blue Cat Cards according to the green value cards turned over.

4. Cat Collections - Collect sets of 5 Toys or Attributes with Cats that fit the criteria on the orange attribute cards.

5. Now Where Did That Cat go? - Be the first to find a Cat for each of your Green Value Cards by remembering where the cats are in the grid.

name: Starlight Stage: Expansion Card Set 2
description: This expansion includes 6 Idol cards, 6 Producer cards, 15 Event cards, 3 Initial Idol cards. Using this expansion set means you can now play Starlight Stage with 5 people.
publishers: シュレディンガーゲームズ (Schrodinger Games)

name: Escape from Enigma
description:
You have all been trapped in a room by the psychopath Enigma. There’s only one means of escape and you must get the correct tool to unlock the exit. Only one person can escape while the rest will perish. Beware as you do not know the other players’ identities and Enigma might just be one of them.

There are 2 ways to win in highly-addictive game of strategy, deduction and deception from the creators of Mystery Manila:

(1) Be the first person to escape
(2) Be the last person left alive

If you are playing the character of Enigma, the only way to win is to kill everybody else.

Each game box contains the following components:

- 7 Character Cards
- 7 Exit Cards
- 7 Tool Tokens

To start the game, each player is handed at random a Character Card with a specific ability. An Exit Card is randomly drawn and placed faced down in the middle of the table. This card is now the Escape Card.

All remaining Character Cards and Exit Cards are placed in two separate piles near the center of the table. All Tool Tokens are also placed individually at the center of the table.

Everyone closes their eyes. While one person counts loudly back from ten, the player holding the Enigma Character Card opens his eyes, looks at the Escape Card, and places it back to it's original position.

In every game of Escape from Enigma, players take turns doing one of the following actions:

- Take an Exit Card
- Take a Tool Token
- Do Character Card's ability
- Bluff and do another Character Card's ability
- Change your Character Card (except if you are Enigma)
- Attempt to escape (except if you are Enigma)
- Pass

To Escape, a player must call out a Tool Token he owns and peek at the Escape Card. If they match, the player wins the game. Otherwise, that player is eliminated.

When a player is eliminated, all his Exit Cards and Tool Tokens are returned to the center of the table, and the game resumes.

A second way to get eliminated for the game is through bluffing. When a player bluffs and is challenged, the defender and the challenger must show each other their Character Cards. Whoever loses the challenge is eliminated and gives the winner all his Exit Cards and Tool Tokens. The winner may also assume the loser's Character Card.

Will you be the survivor of Escape from Enigma?

name: Concerto MAFIA
description: 2 to 4 players compete to build strong orchestras and earn reputation points by playing concert pieces successfully. The game requires players to balance the need to strengthen different sections of their orchestra with the desire to score points. Concert music pieces reflect difficulty levels required to play successfully. Card drafting and hand management are the primary mechanics in this game.

name: Pocket Proliferation!
description:
Pocket Proliferation!, the Civilization Simulation, is a slimmed down solitaire version of the base set, which is available to play on Vassal Engine. A player begins with an emerging culture, moves its members into social arrangements, and rolls a die to reproduce the next generation. The object is to populate the game board in as few generations as possible.

Proliferation is an abstract social experiment combining both strategy and luck, for one player.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Heroes of Phlan
description:
This is a solo game based on the old CRPG Pool of Radiance from the 80s made by SSI.

The mechanics are card/dice based and not the traditional Dungeons & Dragons d20 game.

Your party moves around Phlan, clearing zones, unlocking new zones, leveling characters, collecting treasures and powerful weapons, and solving the mystery behind the corruption of Phlan.

You win by defeating Tyranthraxus in Castle Valjevo before accumulating too many corruption points.

The game is a pencil and paper, role-playing, card and dice game that should take around 180 minutes to play.
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Luftstreitkrafte Dieselpunk
description:
Description from the designer:

Luftstreitkrafte Dieselpunk is a dexterity card-throwing game that won several prizes in the 2015-16 Wargame Contest.

The game is easy to assemble, consisting of 18 cards with stunning dieselpunk art.

Work alone or cooperatively to shoot down enemy aircraft before they reach your battleship.

The game follows a storyline mirroring WWI but set in the future where your squadron of Dieselpunk Fokkers are assigned to provide air support for the battleship Von Spee in it's six mission campaign high above the clouds of Saturn.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game

name: Steampunk Admirals
description:
Description from the designer:

Steampunk Admirals is a skirmish card game where two people duel in steampunked WWI ironclads. Each player manages three dreadnoughts that are fighting over the dominion of the solar system. The rules of engagement from the Treaty of Venus after the First Worlds War limit acts of aggression to one-to-one ship combat. Ships that are badly damaged or out of energy often have the option of warping away and allowing another dreadnought take its place. But if your opponent anticipates it, she can block your escape. However, if she tries to do that and you did not try to Swap Out, her turn is wasted. Thus the main mechanics of this game are rock-paper-scissors, bluffing, and energy/damage management.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Print & Play, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tol Trarell
description:
User summary
トルトラレル (Tol Trarell) has players as Fairy chiefs, collecting Twinkleberries on a magical midsummer's night. The game is for 2 or 3 players, or 4 players in partnership.

Played over two rounds, players lay Fairy cards face-down, trying to win Treasure cards one by one. The game is a mix of bluff and bidding, with victory points on both the Treasure cards and the players' cards. The winner of each turn collects the Treasure card and the losers' cards, so some deviousness is required. Some victory points are only unlocked if the player secures a key symbol too.

The game itself is language free with English rules offered online but only JP in the box. The rules sheet has deep background on the various Fairy leaders and their activities. There are some Variants included in the game rules.

Publisher's summary
夏至の夜の妖精たちの魔力比べ。魔力の強い方が魔法の果実を手に入れられるでしょう。このゲームはブラフ要素の強い競りカードゲームです。より巧みに味方の妖精たちをプレイすることで敵を出し抜き、うまくすれば敵の果実さえ奪い取れるでしょう。よりたくさんの魔法の果実を手に入れられればゲームに勝利できます。
publishers: ガーデンゲームズ (The Garden Games)

name: Global War 1936-1945: Netherlands Fights Back
description:
Description from the publisher:

This set adds the plastic pieces and the rules necessary to allow the Dutch to now be played as an independent country. Special units include oil derricks and commandos. For Japan, capturing the Dutch East Indies will now be a slightly harder task than previously.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Simulation

name: The Guild 3: The Card Game
description:
The goal of The Guild 3: The Card Game is to build a powerful family dynasty through skillful management, scheming, intrigue, a little luck and then, finally, to either be elected Mayor of the city or - as an alternate objective - be the first to attain the title of Count.

---

In The Guild 3: The Card Game, each player starts by choosing one of the 6 professions and drawing 8 cards from the card pile. In addition everyone receives 12 coins of starting money.

Each game round starts by the players receiving their income. Players then draw a new card from the pile and play cards from their hand. Many cards have certain prerequisites and most cost coins. Lastly players may discard a card at the end of their turn and may have to redraw new cards.

In order to win the game players collect votes for the mayoral election from districts, people and other cards. The person with the highest number of votes wins the mayoral election and thereby the game. The second way to win is for a player to attain the title Count by collecting 120 experience points through playing out cards.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Video Game Theme

name: Łowcy Talentów
description:
Łowcy Talentów ("Talent Hunters") is a board game based on Christian values.

The player rolls the dice, moves through the hexagonal board, visit chosen by himself locations and collects them tokens of talents. After collecting five talents receives a efficiency card, which helps him later in the game. There is also a virtual player in the game represented by characters evil spirits that force the player to take the temptations card and increase difficulty of a final victory.
The game is won by the player who collects the most talents.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Set Collection

name: Popdoku
description:
Popdoku is played on a 9 by 9 Sudoku style board using 9 sets of 9 tiles each tile in a set has the same colour and number on it but each set is a different colour and number (1 to 9)from the others. The rest of the components consist of 4 tile racks, a timer, a tile bag, a score pad and pencil and a rule book. The rule book contains a number finished Popdoku layouts together with the starting tile layout for each.
One player becomes the "host" and they select one of the layouts and set up the board with the shown starting tile layout for it, typically 20 to 30 tiles.
Each of the other players now draw 9 tiles to their rack. The timer is started and the first player then adds as many tiles to the layout as they like but as soon as they lay an incorrect tile their turn stops, that tile is returned to them and their turn is scored, being the total sum of the tile values that they have added. The player makes up their tile rack to 9 tiles again and the turn moves on. The earlier they get rid of all their tiles the larger the bonus they get (15, 10 5 and 0)
A player may give up his turn to change the tiles on his rack with a random lot from the bag.

name: Scourge: A Game of War
description:
SCOURGE: A Game of War is an extremely strategic card game designed for 2 - 4 players. Each player commands an army, consisting of Infantry, Magicians, Heroes, and Strategy Cards, with a single goal in mind - eliminate all enemy armies!

Each game consists of 2 decks - a Red Deck and a Blue Deck. Each deck is balanced, with soldiers, archers, sorcerers, healers, and much more. Players take turns sending out troops from their hand onto the battlefield - if the opposing army cannot counter or defend, he or she must take damage.

Players can capture and sacrifice prisoners of war to unlock new abilities, upgrade already learned abilities and more. While some cards attack an opposing army, other cards can attack an opponent's King directly.

If Army Health or King Health reaches zero, that player loses, and the last surviving army wins!

name: Archipelago
description:
Players: 2-4 players, ages 6 and up

Playing time: 15-30 minutes

Materials: A "hexhex" board, i.e. a hexagonal shaped board composed of hexagonal cells (various sizes are possible; 6-8 cells per side is recommended); and playing pieces in two to four colors. (To play all permutations of player numbers and board sizes would require approximately 75 pieces in one color, 75 pieces in a second color, 50 pieces in a third color, and 40 pieces in a fourth color.)

Basic idea: In Archipelago, players try to create more islands (i.e. groups of two or more adjacent pieces) than opponents create.



RULESA group ("island") is a connected set of two or more same-colored stones. (Thus, single stones do not count as a group.) Each player is the owner of one color of stone. A group in a given color will count toward its color-owner's score, regardless of whether the color-owner or an opponent created that group.

Players are allowed two stone placements per turn, with one exception: the first player plays just one stone on his/her very first turn. A player’s two stones can be ANY color (i.e. on your turn, you needn't play any of your own color of stones if you don't wish to; you can play any set of colors or any mix of colors in a single turn).

Additionally, a player is permitted to play an extra stone (of any color of his/her choice) for every opponent who is strictly ahead of him/her in the current group score; each player's "group score" = the number of distinct groups currently on the board in his/her color.

When the board is full, or when all players have consecutively passed their turns, the game ends. The player with the most groups wins. In case of a tie, the winner is the tied player with the highest bonus score total. (Bonus scores are awarded on the game's scoring track; arriving earlier than one's opponents to a new group score grants one a higher bonus.)

For games with 3-4 players, the following "Frozen Irrelevance" rule is recommended:

o Frozen Irrelevance: When the board arrangement is such that a player's current rank (e.g. 1st, 2nd, or 3rd) is unalterable by any further play from any player, then that player's rank has assumed its final form, and he/she is "frozen" from further play. That is, he/she takes no further part in the game, and the game play continues on with just the non-frozen players.

For a complete set of rules and examples turns, see the Files section of this webpage.

name: Choosy
description:
Choosy is a set collection game featuring 100 dice.

The game starts with all the dice placed in a 10 x 10 grid. Each turn players may choose a matching pair from the outside of the grid, if they have enough dice to make a set, they may bank their set to score points.

The game continues until there are no more matching pairs of dice in the center pool. The player with the most banked dice is the winner.

name: Sita
description:
A quick co-operative adventure game set in ancient India!

The goal of the Sita Adventure game is to earn 5 Rama Victory cubes before the sun marker travels off the last location. To do this you must earn cubes to spend resolving encounters. Managing cubes requires planning and careful manipulation of the Dharma bag.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: For Sale: Hebrew Promo Cards
description:
These cards were produced as part of a crowd-funding project to create a localized Hebrew edition of the game.

They include two house cards of values 17.5 and 26.5, and two checks of value 16,000.

The house cards feature well-known Israeli landmarks.

name: Legend of the Five Rings: Gen Con 2014 L5R Experience
description:
Special collectors' box that was made available at Gen Con 2014. The box is similarly sized to the Smash Up Big Geeky Box and contains the following:


L5R Themed Version of Seventh Hero
L5R Edition of Lost Legacy
L5R Edition of Guildhall
4 booster packs of the "A Line In the Sand" expansion for the L5R CCG
6 booster packs of the "Ivory Edition" base set for the L5R CCG

name: Pokémon TCG: HeartGold & SoulSilver Expansion
description:
The HeartGold & SoulSilver Expansion was the first expansion in the HeartGold & SoulSilver Series for the Pokémon Trading Card Game.

HeartGold & SoulSilver Expansion included 123 Cards (+1 Secret Trainer card).

HeartGold & SoulSilver Expansion is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion HeartGold Collection & SoulSilver Collection.

Products included three Theme Decks of fixed cards (60 each), Booster Packs of 10 Cards Each, and a Trainer Kit.

Theme Decks for HeartGold & SoulSilver Expansion (60 Fixed Cards Each):

Ember Spark Theme Deck
Growth Clash Theme Deck
Mind Flood Theme Deck


Booster Packs for HeartGold & SoulSilver Expansion (10 Randomized Cards Each):

Ampharos Booster Pack
Donphan Booster Pack
Ho-Oh Booster Pack
Lugia Booster Pack
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers
publishers: The Pokémon Company International, Wizards of the Coast

name: High/Low Farms
description:
High/Low Farms is on the surface a trick taking game, but it's heart is in a classic Euro-style economy game. Over three rounds, players take tricks with cards that have duo values.
