Depending on the round, they will try to be the highest or lowest in value and then choose how to use the card they win.

Players may choose three ways to use the card they win by either choosing to use it as a farm, turn the card in for a resource to put on their farm, or turn the card in for money. After each round, players may trade between themselves for the goods they need or with the farmers market to make the best use of their goods for points.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Farming, Negotiation, Number

name: Gaffer's Call Soccer
description:
Free Print and Play solo soccer replay simulation with rules for pitting two historical teams against each other, generating commentary describing the events of a match.

The game consists of 18 pages of rules and tables. A player needs to provide two six-sided dice. Each turn the dice are rolled and the Action Table is consulted. A team strives on each possession to accumulate enough Advances to attempt a shot on goal. They begin each possession with 0 Advances and typically may shoot after reaching 3 Advances, at which point a roll is made on the Shot Table.

Each possession continues until a team either manages a shot, or loses the ball due to a result on the Action Table.

A Gaffer's Call Soccer match will provide the narrative of a game, including substitutions, rare plays, yellow and red cards, goal scorers and assisters.

name: Highlight Maker Football
description:
Highlight Maker Football is a quick-play game which produces an action reel filled with an NFL contest's most critical plays and moments.

In The Spectator's Game, you can watch your favorite team play out its entire season, or the entire league, or even sit back and witness a single dramatic game unfold.

In The Gambler's Game, you take an active part in the proceedings by measuring your skill at predicting the outcome of a specific slate of games, winning or losing by your own decisions.

The game is played out through a series of highlights rather than alternating possessions. Each team's highlight is resolved by rolling two six-sided dice and consulting one of 16 Highlight tables.

name: Lasermaster
description:
Laser Master is based on the traditional chess with added aerial tactic, using simulated laser feature to reflect the 21st century space age 3-D board game because the units can shoot only in the direction chess pieces can capture.

The Laser Master game is very interesting because each unit is equipped with a simulated laser charge on it. This laser can be shot at targets on the board. The laser can only be shot in directions of traditional patterns of chess but the Laser Master game unit when shooting does not have to move. Also each game unit has the choice to move, only moving in the same patterns as chess. However, when units move captures, the capturing unit up-loads captured laser charges to provide more shots.

name: Crisis In The Caucasus: Struggle For Nagorno-Karabakh
description:
Description from the publisher:

Crisis in the Caucasus: The Struggle For Nagorno-Karabakh is a game representing a modern day war between Armenia and Azerbaijan. The game takes 90-120 mins to play. This is the third release in the Modern Crisis Series. In this game we are releasing updated system rules that will include a new system for logistic management of your forces. This allows for more realistic gameplay as well as better representing the harassment of enemy supply lines during war.

The game is divided into game phases, such as movement, combat logistics, and the consolidation phase. The conclusion of these phases marks 1 game turn. This is a great intermediate war-game meant to bring new players to the hobby as well as being a challenging play for the veteran wargamer.

name: Literati
description:
Description from the back of the box:

Literati is a new word game that combines obscure words and quotations with your own creative and often hilarious definitions. No genius is required, merely the ability to outwit your opponents. Advance around the board by simply identifying correct definitions and/or tricking your opponents into believing bogus definitions which you have created…"

Literati contains 400 word cards with categories and sample words, including: GENERAL: uxorious – excessively fond of one’s wife; SCIENCE: piblokto – a psychic disturbance seen chiefly among Eskimo women marked by attacks of hysteria and running naked through the snow; FOREIGN: kater (German) – hangover; SLANG: dismal ditty – a song sung by a criminal just before his death at the gallows; and, QUOTE: "...And I don’t like parties of any kind." ~Dick Clark

Game play is similar to Balderdash, and other Fictionary/Dictionary-type games.

name: Caudillo
description:
Description from the publisher:

A multiplayer (2-5) card game on power politics in the fictional Latin American country of Virtualia, after the departure from power of its strongman leader Jesus Shaves (pronounced “hay-sus sha-bezz“)... actually a thinly-disguised post-Chavez Venezuela (though when first designed in 2013, it wasn’t post-Chavez yet).

The game is semi-cooperative and semi-competitive, and plays up the constant tension between these urges. As players vie to create the largest and most durable personal power base (scored periodically throughout the game), the card deck delivers more and more crises that players must deal with collectively (and collect small rewards immediately), or the country will collapse. Coups d'etat provide another quick way to score!

Offered both in free print-and-play and assembled versions. The free PnP version consists of 90 cards, 230 counters, and the usual rules and play aids; the assembled version has 90 cards printed on coloured cardstock, 120 die-cut, pre-punched counters, and 120 wooden cubes.
categories: Card Game, Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Total War Cards: Punic Wars
description:
Total War Cards: Punic Wars is a two-player card game which takes place in the ancient Punic Wars between Rome and Carthage.

Gameplay: Both players pick an army and fight over different regions to gain score cards for the end of the game. Every turn you can overpower your opponent in a region by placing better army cards than them or gain distinct bonuses by advancing through the technology tree to gain an edge.

Winning the game: Points are scored according to the combinations of Territory each player captures. After six turns of play, the scores are added up, and a winner declared.

The game features a little bit of strategy, bluffing, foresightedness and luck and is very simple to play with children.
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Territory Building, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Closing In
description:
This is a 2-player paper and pencil game played on a grid of 6 squares by 6 squares. The first turn is slightly different from the following turns: on the first turn the first player writes his initial in any square, as does the second player (though this could not be the square initialed by the first player).

On the second and subsequent turns each player 1) fills in the square in which he had previously put his initial and 2) initials another square which is a queen's move from the square which he has just filled in (initialed and filled in squares are barriers to this process).

A player loses when he is no longer able to play.

name: Das Vermächtnis des Maharaja: Rabatt
description:
Das Vermächtnis Des Maharaja: Rabatt is a promotional collection card for Das Vermächtnis Des Maharaja where the player that owns the card gets a 1-rupee discount when purchasing antique cards. The requirement to take the card is to have at least one card in each of the six colours.

Designer Michael Schacht released this promo as one-half of his 2016 Christmas card, thereby making the promo available before the game itself was published.

name: Schnapp die Nuss!
description:
In the high treetops, bedtime was long ago, but the small squirrels are still jumping from tree to tree to gather as many nuts as possible. Now the squirrel mother is finally jumping after them to send them to bed.

Whoever gets hold of the most nuts in Schnapp die Nuss! by the time mom catches all of the little squirrels wins!

name: Der Landvogt und die frächen Lügner
description:
The card game is based on Frank Bebenroth's Drecksau. It's settled in a small historical Swiss town a couple of centuries ago. People want to have fun playing games, but games are forbidden. You're trying to play secretly at home. If the reeve knocks on your door, you better send your mother to prevent him from coming in. But if it's the priest, he'll come in anyway...

You have 3 or 5 two-sided character cards in front of you. They start on the grey (not playing) side. If you are the first player to turn all your cards to the coloured (playing) side, you win the game.

You have 3 activity cards on your hand. They allow you to turn your or the others' character cards, to protect your cards, or to remove protection from the others.

name: Williams Pokémon Game
description:
The goal is to gather the most Pokémons of different sets, for an example grass, water, or psychic Pokémons.

You do this by taking turns throwing a 1d6 and a 1d12 die. You sum up the result and take an avaible Pokémon card from a grid of cards with that number.

Once per turn you can evolve your Pokémons if you have the criterias to do so, which means you can swap your Pokémon card for a more powerful version.

You do this until the draw piles are depleted. Then, each player sum up each set and compare. The winner of a set gets a point. The player with the most points is the winner.
categories: Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Time Management: The Time Management Game – Department Of Company Time Or Relativity Promo
description:
A set of 2 promo cards for the Time Management draw deck included as part of the Meta Games II Kickstarter campaign.

The cards are both wild backs (so can be past, present or future). When picked up, they are immediately played to the office, the player gains an hour and a new card. Any project completed using the wild office cards are worth 1 hour less.

name: をかしや (Okashiya)
description:
User summary
をかしや (Okashiya) in English is a 'Confectionery Store'.

In the game of Okashiya, you are running a confectionery store, and your goal is to score the most victory points by delivering confectionery to customers.

In a square grid board (town map), there are several wholesalers and customers. In order to deliver confectionery to customers, you first visit wholesalers to buy ingredients, then visit customer and spend required ingredients, and finally you can score victory points.

Each turn, you have five action points. You may spend one action point to
1) Move: Move to adjacent square.
2) Buy: If you are in a wholesaler square, spend 2 gold to buy an ingredient.
3) Deliver: If you are in a customer square, spend required ingredients to deliver your products, then gain victory points and some positive effect.
4) Build a shop: Spend some gold to build a shop. It grants you some movement advantage, and you score mid-game bonus if you have built the most shops in a certain district.
5) Income: Gain 3 gold.

At the end of game, the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
「をかしや」は、手番で限られた数のアクションを行い、
材料を購入して和菓子を届け、勝利点を得るボードゲームです。

手番では下記の中から複数のアクションを組み合わせて行うことができます。
・移動・材料の購入・注文の達成・店コマの配置・収入

これらを実行し、和菓子の材料をあちこちのお店を巡って集め、公開されている共通の注文カードを他プレイヤーよりも早く達成すると、ボーナスや勝利点がもらえます。
また、ボードに自分の店コマを置くことによって、ゲーム中に3回ある決算での勝利点の獲得や、プレイヤーのコマが移動するときに一気に移動できたり、臨時収入を得るチャンスがあります。
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver

name: I Can't Even With These Spectacular Supers
description:
I Can't Even is a series of card games that all share one rule: The player with the highest odd score wins! For example, if the game ended with players at 9, 16, 20, and 22 points, the player with 9 points would win! Each game can be played as a standalone item or shuffled together with one or more other games in the series.

I Can't Even With These Spectacular Supers has 49 hero cards: Crusher, Dr. Chance, Ra, Reactor, Scrapper, Sensor, Vigilante, each appearing seven times.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: I Can't Even With These Marvelous Supers
description:
I Can't Even is a series of card games that all share one rule: The player with the highest odd score wins! For example, if the game ended with players at 9, 16, 20, and 22 points, the player with 9 points would win! Each game can be played as a standalone item or shuffled together with one or more other games in the series.

I Can't Even With These Marvelous Supers has 49 hero cards: Dash, Faultline, Gargoyle, Mega-Mite, Obsidia, Silver Star, Sun Spear, each appearing seven times.

name: Swordpoint: Ancient and Medieval Wargames Rules
description: Swordpoint is a “big battle” miniature wargame for fighting actions in the ancient and medieval periods. It employs multi-figure bases, various sizes of figures can be used. Games fought with Swordpoint involve between 100 and 250 miniature figures per side arranged into between 6 and 12 units. The game is designed to play out in about 2 hours after set-up, and gives a large battle feel. Swordpoint encourages the use of historical tactics and emphasises the need to maintain cohesion in the army’s battle line, without being prescriptive. Swordpoint is divided into four game phases per turn. Morale Phase, Shooting Phase, Movement Phase and Combat Phase. Combat results are decided by dice rolls with added modifiers, such as unit special rules and terrain.

name: The Big Switch
description:
A fast-paced bidding boardgame designed by Balangay Entertainment.

The Big Switch is a real-time bidding and tile-flipping dexterity game about energy conservation. In each round, players try to outbid each other in 20-second auctions to buy efficient appliances for their homes, while simultaneously doing energy saving habits.

Players compete to have the most Energy Stars which they get from buying appliances and doing habits. The player with the most Energy Stars after 7 rounds is the winner!

name: Hogar
description:
Be the first player to possess 5 sacred camels.

The 16 tiles are mixed and arranged on the table to form a square of 4x4 boxes. The players choose one of their pawns (storm or Tuareg) and reveal it simultaneously.

name: World At War 85: When the Lion Roars
description:
Description from the publisher:

When The Lion Roars is the SEVENTH volume in the World At War 85 Series of games of fast and furious platoon-level combat. The series is set in 1985, in an alternate history of World War III. With the Warsaw Pact armies driving deep into Western Europe, and as China simultaneously decides to take advantage of the global distraction to settle some old territorial scores, the Middle East erupts as well. Israel launches a pre-emptive strike to deflate yet another attempt by the Syrians to re-conquer the Golan Heights. But the Syrians have rebuilt their army in the three years since they were defeated in Lebanon by these same Israelis. And the Syrian High Command has anticipated such a move by the Israelis. They have developed a counter-strategy with a simple goal: drive the Israeli Army into the Mediterranean Sea.
The World At War 85 system features a unique combat system that involves die rolls by both attacking units and defending units, which keeps both players engaged throughout the game. Die rolls are compared and hits applied quickly, as all the information you need to fight your units is on the counters. No combat results table is necessary. Initiative, formation activation, random turn length, close air support and air cover are all smoothly integrated.

It’s all here:


Basic, Advanced and, for each Volume, Optional Rules.
Units include:
ISRAELI Merkava-2 Main Battle Tank
ISRAELI F-4E Close Air Support Aircraft
SYRIAN T-72 Main Battle Tank
SYRIAN MIG-23 Air Cover Aircraft
SOVIET AIR ASSAULT Infantry
SOVIET MI-24E Attack Helicopter
US MARINE CORPS M-60 Main Battle Tank
US NAVY F-14 Close Air Support Aircraft
…and many more.

name: Northampton 1460
description:
Description from the publisher:

Northampton 1460 is a 1-2 player game of the Battle of Northampton that took place on the 10th July 1460. It is a play-at-home version of the very popular participation game of the same name used by the Northampton Battlefield Society on its display stand at game shows and conventions.

The games has similar mechanisms to W1815 but with added non-military options. The players take alternate turns using one of their character cards. These enable the players to take historically plausible decisions whilst still retaining the ability to influence events to go in a different direction to the historical outcome.

The game enables the players to develop a clear narrative of the course of the battle , understanding the options available to the commanders, why the battle turned out as it did and how it might have had a different result. The victory point system also gives an explanation of how history would have changed if the battle had ended differently.

The game usually plays in less than 30 minutes and it is expected that players will alternate roles and compare their relative performances. Following the hard copy book selling out, the game has now been made available as a pdf download from Wargames Vault.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust 1947: Steel Guard Battlegroup
description:
Steel Guards are some of the most formidable fighters on the planet. Their half-robotic bodies makes them very hard to kill, allowing them to gain incredible combat experience. Thanks to their inhuman strength, each one carries weapons a team of three could barely lift.
The Steel Guard Battlegroup contains the following units:

Steel Guard Command Squad
Steel Guard Sniper Squad
Steel Guard Anti-infantry Squad
Steel Guard Assault Squad


Everything you need to start a new glorious Steel Guard Faction Army is included in this Battlegroup!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Hora de Aventura Caça-Vilões
description:
User summary:
Players use sets of heroes cards in order to defeat villains that come from a separate villains deck. There is also a joker and two trump cards.
An optional companion app keeps interrupting play, asking players to make impressions and find specific cards. All cards have printed codes to accomplish this.

Description from the publisher:
"Os vilões do Reino de Ooo estão à solta! Ajudem Finn, Joke, Beemo, Princesa Jujuba e Marceline a capturá-los. Enfrente vários desafios e descubra quem é o vencedor.
Junte seus amigos e divirta-se com essa nova experiência!"

name: Dust Tactics: Spetsnaz Observer Squad – "Observers"
description: The Spetsnaz have infiltrated the Middle-East! Nothing as efficient as a good artillery barrage to keep the enemy on its toes... Thanks to these observers, regimental and division artillery pieces can deliver the most powerful punch to crush the enemies of the SSU.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Rising Sun, Tumbling Bear: A Solitaire Game of the Russo-Japanese War (1904-1905).
description:
BACKGROUND: RISING SUN, TUMBLING BEAR is semi-historical simulation of the Russo-Japanese War (1904-1905) at the dawn of the 20th Century. The Game begins shortly after the Japanese surprise naval attack on the Russian warships docked in Port Arthur. The Russians are now building up their forces and gathering their fleets to kick the Japanese out of Manchuria and Korea. The Japanese must capture a number of key Russian controlled settlements before Russia is able to effectively mobilize an overwhelming force into the region or the United States President, Theodore Roosevelt, signs the Peace Treaty of Portsmouth.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of the Japanese Naval and Land Forces, you must gather your land and naval forces to capture a number of Key Russian Controlled Settlements before the Russian Baltic Fleet reaches Port Arthur or President Theodore Roosevelt signs the Portsmouth Peace Accord. The Japanese must control all 7 of the Key Russian Settlements in order to win. If the Baltic Fleet reaches Vladivostok, they win.

RISING SUN, TUMBLING BEAR features many colorful Unit and Ship Counters and fast and furious Combat systems for both land and naval combat.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Poker-Go
description:
Poker-Go is based on the rules of normal go.

At the beginning of the game both decks are shuffled and put on the table face downward. During the game the players can choose at each turn between making a go move or drawing a card.

name: Dust 1947: Ranger Attack Squad – "Death Dealers"
description: The Ranger Attack Squad carries a deadly range of weapons. With these they can destroy anything in their path: tanks, walkers, bunkers, etc. Nothing can stop them. They are rightly feared as one of the deadliest unit on the battlefield. A Ranger Attack Squad includes three soldiers armed with a Shotgun and two armed with a portable Flamethrower. They are presented here in their Cerberus Camo pattern, as used in Great-Britain and Northern Europe, circa Winter 1947.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Archaeologia: Patate d'Or Promo
description:
Promo for the game Archaeologia, as handed out at Paris est Ludique 2015.

1 New discovery tile with the title Patate d'Or.

name: Mibu Rōshigumi
description:
Wargame Japanese History game #27.

The game uses a worker-placement system and abstractly covers the period from the start of the Mibu Rōshigumi (1863) to the end of the Boshin War (1869).

In start, only mild preparing missions can be conducted such as recruiting, financing, connection making. Then, each turn a new mission is revealed and can be selected. The most VPs are awarded for assassination of enemy roushi and/or success of military campaign.

The game ends after 5 or 6 turns. It can be played with 2,3 or 4 players and within 2 hours.


The Mibu Rōshigumi (壬生狼顛末記) was a police unit formed from many samurais in 1863 to protect the Shogunate government. It was an organization which precede the famous Shinsen Gumi. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinsengumi

name: Shell Beach
description:
Shell Beach is a treasure trove to the Hermit Crabs that live there, and the bravest crabs scramble between waves to collect the most desirable seashells to bring to the Market. Some shells are even big enough to make a home out of! Each player is a daring hermit crab scrapping seashells for sale, trying to upgrade their own shell, keeping one eye on the competition, and even taking each other’s old shells. Make the most of each tide, before the Market closes for the season!

Shell Beach is played over a series of Rounds, which have a Collection Phase, where cards are dealt and drafted, and a Market Phase, where sets are sold and special shells can be used.

Sets of shell cards can be turned into the Market for tokens, but the biggest ones can be lived in by the Crabs, which will allow them to carry more and better sets back to market. There are also 4 Magic Seashells that hypnotize a crab into abandoning their home shell, initiating a unique new game mechanic based on real-life crab behavior.

When the market runs out of tokens, each player remaining finishes the current round and the winner is revealed.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Dust Tactics:  NDAK Mortar Squad – "Sandstorm"
description:
Axis field commanders know how to recognize when something is good. No matter where it comes from. And after receiving so many shells on their heads from the SSU's 120 mm heavy mortar, they decided that it was time to also have such an efficient weapon in their arsenal. The 12 cm Heavy Mortar - Granatwerfer model 1947 is the latest variation based on the soviet design. It's in use all over the planet by Axis forces and has proven its value countless times both as a defensive and offensive weapon.

A deadly unit, the NDAK Heavy Mortar Squad can attack any type of target. The unit really shines when paired with an observer team: it can then stay out of harm's way and still be as deadly as ever. These two unit combined can block whole areas of the battlefield, threatening to blow up anything that comes in sight. The soldiers are presented here in their desert fatigue, as used by the Neue Deutsches Afrikakorps (NDAK) circa 1947 in North Africa and the Middle-East.

These miniatures come with their own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust 1947: Fallschirmjäger Tank-Hunter Squad
description:
Death from the skies over Babylon! The Fallschirmjäger Tank-Hunter Squad deals with any armored target the Luftwaffe ground forces might encounter. Thanks to their Bazooka and Panzerfaust, they can engage any walker or tank and blow it to pieces in seconds. The squad is presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.

These miniatures come with their own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dust 1947: Fallschirmjäger Anti-Aircraft Squad
description:
Death from the skies over Babylon! The Fallschirmjäger Anti-Aircraft Squad deals with any flying target the Luftwaffe ground forces might encounter. Thanks to their Fliegerfaust (Rocket Launchers), they can engage any aircraft and blow it to pieces in seconds. The squad is presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.

These miniatures come with their own unit card, to use with Dust Tactics and Dust Tactics Battlefield rules and provide new tactic opportunities.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Dicecapades! 2nd Edition Expansion Pack: Movies
description:
Dicecapades! 2nd Edition is the same great game as the original version but now with more cards! Think you can stack dice on your face? Will you dominate in arm wrestling? How about obscure facts? With a mixture of dice games, physical challenges, artistic creations, and trivia questions that will exercise both sides of your brain, you'll see why DICEcapades isn’t just the luck of the dice - it’s the smarts of the roller!

Need more cards? No problem, get the DICEcapades Expansion Packs. Each expansion pack comes with 45 new cars to boost your Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.

Expansion pack 2 is movies themed and includes 45 more cards for Dicecapades! 2nd Edition game.

--description from the publisher:
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Trivia

name: Labyrinth: Ersatzplatten
description: 2 new mazes to put on top of the base game to introduce an "easy" and "advanced" difficulty level, but both easier then the base game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Maze

name: Sword of Kings: Paladin Promo Card
description:
A Knight promo card for the game Sword of Kings
.

Card details:

Knight Name: Paladin

Power 2
Skill 2

Ability:
"As the Paladin, you may pray for your God's assistance at the start of your turn. Roll one die to see if your God has answered your prayer; 1-4 nothing happens; 5-6 add one to your Power or Skill this turn; 7-8 remove a Tunnel Delay from your tunnel and place it on the Rubble Pile."

This promo card can be found in Game Trade Magazine issue 204 (Feb. 2017).

name: Habeamus
description:
Description from the designer:

The year is 1492. It is Sunday. The old pope is dead and now the race is on for the election of the new pope. You’re one of the hopefuls in this election, however, not everyone is on your side… yet. But don’t worry, they’ll come around once you show them a little financial appreciation. After all, everyone has a vote, and everyone can be bought. And once the new pope is elected, the richest player wins—just like in real life.

The goal in Habeamus is to amass more money than the other players, while electing a new pope. Every player has one vote, and there are three non-player cardinals with a vote each as well. During their turns, players can place bribes face-down on the non-player cardinals in the middle of the playing field. These cardinals will vote for whomever promises the largest bribe when the vote starts.
Each player also has a vote that they can use for themselves, or sell to other players. Every player can make hidden or open bribe offers to other players. If, during the vote count, a player accepts an offer by another player, that bribe goes into their account. However, if they do not accept the offer, the player making the offer gets the bribe into their account. In this way, players will have to balance their offers to other players and make sure they themselves sell their vote for a good price. To shake things up a bit more, a player can increase the papal salary, or play actions to change the bribes already on offer.
Once all cards have been played, the votes are counted. If a pope is elected, he will receive a salary bonus into their account. Then, every player counts their money and the richest player wins.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Negotiation, Religious, Renaissance

name: ATS: Warfighting Guide 3 EAGLEBOOK
description:
This is ATS Warfigthing Guide 3 EAGLEBOOK, a 36+ page magazine with a compilation of all known ATS Q & A, formatted and answered by the awesome efforts of Scott 'The Eagle' and Drew 'ATS Guy' Dorman (dec.) A pile of information, fun to read ... just ... so ... much ... info for info junkies!

Also included ATS QUICKSTART BASIC GAME 1 (Ger vs Am1), a complete game for newcomers to ATS with a mini map, three half countersheets of playing pieces and a four sheets of rules. Only one ten-sided die is needed to play a squad-level combat during World War II.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Lightning and Steel: The Battle of Piotrków Trybunalski, September 4-5, 1939
description:
The German attack on Poland, codenamed “Case White,” on September 2nd, 1939 was a gamble on Hitler’s part. He wagered Poland’s allies of France and Great Britain would once again cave-in to his demands and not oppose his invasion. Even if they did, a lightning-fast war (blitzkrieg) would make mote any of their objections once the rival to the east was subjugated. That a mutual defense treaty stipulating an invasion from the east by the Soviet Union only “sealed the deal” and further secured Hitler’s risk.

Lightning and Steel is a war game simulation of the climatic battle fought near the town of Piotrków Trybunalski during the 1939 invasion of Poland by Nazi Germany. Taking the crossroads town was crucial to the German’s XVI Corps offensive. The Poles ordered their 1st and 2nd Tank Battalions, along with elements of two infantry and one cavalry divisions, to counter attack and cut off the Germans. The result was the war’s first major tank battle, and one that nearly thwarted the German’s plans. Can you do as well or better than you historical counterpart? Learn and enjoy!

Each copy of Lightning and Steel is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 inch hex map sheets
One sheet of 108 double-sided, unmounted counters
One Players' Aid Sheet
One 7 page set of rules

name: Akin
description: In Akin, players use suction cups to suction up cards on the table that are related — a.k.a., akin — to the card revealed at the start of the round. The first person to suction up two related cards wins the round, and whoever has won the most rounds after ten rounds wins the game.

name: The Quick and the Dead: Coastal Actions in WWII
description:
Description from the publisher:

The Quick and the Dead (Q&D) is meant to replicate the sharp, short actions involving coastal forces during World War II. More specifically, this set of rules and cards is focused on the fighting between coastal forces in the Mediterranean Sea, but if the rules prove popular, expansions for the English Channel and the Pacific theater are planned. It is important to recognize, however, that these rules focus on only a part of the operation of coastal forces. Coastal actions are characterized by patrolling and stealth, usually at night, punctuated by a quick, violent engagement at close quarters, often less than 500 yards.

Quick and the Dead features a unique diceless and turnless system in which players delcare and play action cards as fast as they can. This creates an unusual tunnel vision phenomenon in which players are focused on the actions of their small craft and can be surprised when an enemy comes alongside and opens fire. Games usually last between 30 and 45 minutes, so you can play two or three in an evening.

PT-boat actions are generally divided into three phases. There is the stealthy approach phase in which one force lies in wait, trying to get an advantageous position on the enemy. This phase can last several hours, beginning from the time the boats leave port until (and if) contact is made with the enemy. There is the assault phase, in which the boats battle each other, typically at fewer than 200 yards, and nearly always at night. This phase usually lasts between 20 and 40 minutes. Finally, there is the aftermath. Typically one side or the other affects a disengagement and both sides head from home.

The Quick and the Dead focuses on the middle phase. Games last about 40 minutes. There are no turns and no chart cards. Players use cards to control the movement and firing of their boats. All the needed information is on the cards. When a player has exhausted his cards, each of his boats makes a morale check, draws more cards, and continues playing. At the end of a game, players feel exhausted, as if they've just been through a fight.

If you like your naval games pedantic and chart-ridden, The Quick and the Dead is not for you. If you want to feel as if you've actually been in a PT fight, these are the only rules that give you that feeling. The game plays very different than most game you've played. Some players get the hang of the fluid, no-turns system quickly. Others have difficulty. I have found that by a player's third game, they get the hang of it. Many don't like the game the first time they play, but after playing a couple more times, really enjoy it. During play tests some have suggested that I should include an optional standard-style turn sequence. While players would be free to do so, I've decided not to include a tradtional turn sequence, because then The Quick and the Dead would be just another game, and I wanted it to be unique.

The Quick and the Dead comes with a rulebook, the cards to play the game, scenario cards, and boat record cards for most of the German, Italian, British, and American boat types in the Mediterranean. I usually play on a 4'x6' table, but that's for a six-player game. You could certainly play on a dining room table. The basic set of cards is for that size game. The advantage of the .pdf format is that if you want to player larger games (more players) you can print another deck of cards.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Bushido: Takashi Retainer
description:
Samurai culture has both military and feudal culture. Everyone fits into the social pyramid where a leader had his trusted supporters under his command. They in turn had their own respective supporters under their command, and so on and so on. The Takashi retainers are all capable warriors in the service of a Takashi Samurai of a higher rank, willing to lay down their lives in service. A high ranking lord will always have at least a hand full of retainers watching and guarding them at all times, constantly scanning a crowd or appraising a seemingly harmless peasant seeking council.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Bachiko Takashi
description:
Bachiko is as loyal and devoted to her lord as any can claim to be. She lives and breathes to protect the Takashi line as her father and his father before. A masterful swordswoman, hours spent in the service has given her a sixth sense for danger and she alone has foiled many cowardly attacks against her masters.

This model can be used as a unique profile or as the second model for the Takashi Retainer Profile card.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Takashi Samurai
description:
From childhood, the Samurai train to have self-discipline and a sense of duty, together with contempt for material goods, fear, pain and especially death. When combined with an unshakable devotion to their clan and lord they are the epitome of those who truly follow Michi.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Iiju Makoto
description:
A ward is a member of a noble clan who has been taken in by another clan to be raised for a time. The practice varies, with it sometimes being undertaken voluntarily - to help prospective heirs learn the customs of other clans as part of their education. It can also be involuntarily, with the "ward" actually being a "hostage" for his or her clan's good behaviour or until a ransom is paid. Sometimes, as part of marriage alliances, one of the betrothed is taken as a ward so he or she can get to know his or her future spouse. IIju is not Dragon but Hare, although his loyalty to the Takashi is unquestioned, he is the head of the Takashi household guard whom follow his orders without hesitation.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kenta Takashi
description:
Kenta is a true samurai in every sense of the word. As a boy he knew his path, the one he has walked for many cycles in service to his family and the name Takashi. A veteran of countless battles and campaigns, he is a master swordsman, no foe able to outflank him due to practised footwork and deft movements. Many times enemies foolishly thought they had struck the killing blow but the ancestors favour Kenta amongst all others. Though quietly spoken his presence in battle banishes any fear in his troops, steeling their hearts for victory.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Das Vermächtnis des Maharaja: Reichtum
description:
Das Vermächtnis des Maharaja: Reichtum is a promotional collection card for Das Vermächtnis des Maharaja that earns a player eight rupees for any two antique cards.

Released as one-half of a postcard with the other half being Blindes Huhn Extrem: Tauschen.

name: Wall to Wall
description:
WALL TO WALL – BUILD YOUR VICTORY BRICK BY BRICK!
Two players, one wall, opposing sides, different colours. Who will place the most bricks of the same colour in a row, diagonally and touching?
The bricks and the die of Wall to wall are made of wood coming from eco-friendly forestry in respect of the natural and social environment. (100% FSC®)
Wall to wall is a safe, eco-friendly game realised with nontoxic paint and made in Italy.

COMPONENTS:
42 wooden bricks with colours on two sides
1 wooden die with 6 sides
1 instruction sheet

INSTRUCTIONS:

HOW TO BUILD THE WALL
The bricks on the bottom row - the one touching the playing area – must be placed adjacent to one another, with a maximum of 10 bricks being used. From the second row up, each brick must be placed half over two different bricks. Unlike the first row, bricks do not need to be placed adjacent to each other. Only bricks that have no other bricks above them can be moved.
RULES
Goal: Place as many bricks as possible in your colour on your side of the wall in a row, diagonally and touching.
PREPARATION AND STARTING
The two players must sit facing each other, with the bricks placed to one side of the playing area in a pile. Each player choses one of the colours: green, fuchsia or light blue (the colour that is not chosen is neutral). Thefirst player to go is the one that, throwing the die, throws their colour first. After this, the players alternate turns. The wall is built between the two players. The bricks are placed such that the two coloured sides of the bricks face the players.
TURNS
The player whose turn it is throws the die and performs the corresponding action:
- Green brick: Take a brick from the pile that has AT LEAST one green side and PLACE IT on the wall.
- Fuchsia brick: PLACE a new brick that has AT LEAST one fuchsia side.
- Light blue brick: PLACE a new brick that has AT LEAST one light blue side.
- Little girl: PLACE a brick that has NO SIDES in your colour.
- Grey brick: Take a brick from the WALL and MOVE it to where you want on the wall, or simply TURN IT AROUND.
NB: Once a brick has been picked up, that brick is the one that must be moved or turned. If the wall hasn't yet been started, then you forfeit your turn.
- Little boy: CHOOSE one of the actions from the five options. NB: If the action indicated on the die cannot be done (e.g., the die shows fuchsia, but all the bricks with at least one fuchsia side have already been used), then you forfeit your turn.
END OF GAME
The game ends when all the bricks have been placed on the wall. Points are awarded as follows: 10 points for the longest diagonal (in a player's colour on their side of the wall); 8 points for the longest row; 6 points for the most touching bricks. If there is a tie, then thepoints are shared (e.g. if both players have 8 touching bricks, then each one gets 3 points).

name: Ever After: Twisted Realm
description:
Description from the designer:

Ever After: Twisted Realm is a unique objective based Board game where player takes a role as a character from one faction between “Dawnguard” and “Eclipse”. Each player is secretly assigned a team at the start of the game.

There is no player elimination in this game. Player wins or loses with the team by comparing team victory points. Player gains VP (Victory Point) by completing quests, controlling areas and bonus power from identity skill.

The game starts by dealing character card secretly to each player as Identity Card. Then randomly select leftover character cards to make a draft pool for Partner Cards. Each player will have 1 secret Identity card and 1 Face-up Partner card. The partner card will have its ability during game play while the identity card will define your team and guide your play style by its extra score condition.
Player plays the game by moving around the map to complete the quest, conquer more areas, attacking other players or killing world boss. Player will get to know other players identity through rumor system which will let you know some information and guess from their actions.
At the end of the game, all victory points gathered from each player will be summed up as team score and the team with higher score wins the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Silent Hill: The Card Game
description:
Silent Hill: The Card Game is a cooperative game for 3 to 4 players of pushing your luck in an attempt to uncover the mysteries of the town of Silent Hill. Each player takes on the role of one of the protagonists from the Silent Hill movie and must survive through six major scenes from the film in order to win the game. However, the darkness is constantly coming, filled with terrible nightmares, and the creatures that lurk within it are a danger to you all. If more than one protagonist is killed during the course of the game, or if the protagonists encounter the fearful Pyramid Head, then all players lose.

Gameplay is divided into two main phases: during the Story Phase, players must silently pass location cards to each other along with a clue as to how dangerous those locations might be. During the Exploration Phase, players push their luck by pulling cubes from a bag to travel along their locations, then push their luck further by flipping the location cards to reveal what they encounter there. If too many dark world locations are revealed, then the players will face horrors from the encounter deck, where the dreaded Pyramid Head lurks...
categories: Card Game, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: どうぶつれんさ (Animal Chain)
description:
User summary
どうぶつれんさ (Doubutsu Rensa) in English means 'Animal Linker Card' and is in the position between being a card game and being a board game. While simple rules make it playable for children from the age of four, the game also has strategic aspects that make it just as enjoyable for adults.

Before beginning the game, place cards face-down in rows to create the board. Arrange each row to start and end at the halfway point of the starting and ending cards of the rows above and below in a double pyramid pattern.There should be a total of 7 rows, but players are free to arrange these rows into any shape they please (doesn't have to be a straight line).

Deal four cards to each player to form their hand. The player who doesn’t go first is dealt one additional card. The remaining cards serve as the deck.

The players may then proceed to freely exchange the cards in their hand with cards from the row on the board closest to them to form their own “base”. After the cards making up the base have been chosen, these cards should be placed face up.

During a player’s own turn, they may play a card from their hand that connects with the characters drawn upon one of the cards previously played faced up on the table.

If a face-down card is available where the player places their card, this card is taken into the player’s hand. If a face up card is already placed where a player wishes to play their card, the player simply places their card on top of this card.

A player may chose to either place a card or pass and draw a card from the deck. The first player to place a card on top of their opponent’s base is the winner.

Publisher's summary
「どうぶつれんさ」は4歳から遊べるシンプルなルールながら、大人も楽しめる戦略性もあるカードゲームとボードゲームの中間のようなゲームです。

ゲーム開始前にカードを裏向きに並べてボードを作ります。
列ごとに半分ずつずらすように並べ、おおむね7列で線対象の形であれば自由な形が可能です。

プレイヤーに手札を4枚ずつ配り、後攻になったプレイヤーに1枚手札を多く与えます。残りを山札とします。
次にプレイヤーは自分に一番近いボードの列のカードと、手札を自由に入れ替えて「ベース」を作ります。「ベース」を決めたら表向きにします。

プレイヤーは自分のターンに、手札のカードと既にボードにある表向きのカードに描かれたキャラクターが繋がるようにカードを出します。
　そこに裏向きのカードがあれば、裏向きのカードは手札に加え、表向きのカードがあれば、そのまま上に重ねます。

カードを1枚出すか、出さずにパスをして山札から1枚ドローしたら相手にターンを回します。

先に相手の「ベース」の上にカードを置いた方の勝ちとなります。

Game Features
1. A system like card game and board game intermediate
2. Even small children can play simple games, and adults can enjoy it.
3. The board to use can be set freely.

The player draws an animal drawn on the card Put cards on board to connect,I aim to reach the opponent's position earlier than the opponent.
Board games in which hand weights and read ahead are important,
Card games where luck and strategy decide victory and defeat,
It is a game that combines both good places.

Game flow

① Two people determined the shape of the board to be used this time,I will arrange the cards and make the board.
If the shape seen from the two people is the same, if it is within 45 total
It is decided freely. (If you get lost,Please choose from "board card" and decide.)

② Hand each 4 cards to each player.
I will leave the rest as deck piles.

③ The row closest to you on each player board
Look at the card (base), exchange freely with your hand
Decide the base.

④ Once both players have decided the base,
Turn face up at the same time.

⑤ Mix the card at the top of the deck with the card "Final card"
The one who pulls by two people and pulls the "second card" is the first
The game starts. Those who ordered a normal card
Just add it to your hand.
(You will have 1 more cards in your hand)

⑥ In the player's turn,
I will do one of the following AB activities.

A Cards are put out so that animal is connected.
Look at your face-up card already on board, To connect to a small left and right animal.
I will put out the card. Take it out to a card face down.
If it is, replace it and add it to your hand.
If you put it out on a face-up card, leave it as it is
Overlay. (You will have 1 card less.)
At this time, if you put a card on the base of your opponent
It is a win and the game is over.

B pass and draw 1 card from the deck
When I can not or can not withdraw my card
Draw 1 piece from the deck and turn the turn to the opponent.
If you do not have a deck when you pass, the back of the board
Select one from the card and draw 1 piece. Draw
Where cards are gone,I can not put cards in the future.
Without cards facing the back of the board, It becomes "no drawing without draw".
When two persons are "success without draw" in succession,
The game ends with a draw.

⑦ If you connect the same animal with two cards,
The connected card is called "double"
You can not put your opponent on.
If either of the two foundations is overwritten
"Double" is canceled.
(Double can be used without the age to play)

name: Boneyard
description: Players take turns rolling the dice to try to achieve the winning goal. For example, one of the cards wants you to look for any one's but no sixes. That gets you two points. You can keep rolling to build up your score. A losing throw loses you all of your points. Neither winning or losing throw gets you one point.

name: Boss Monster: The Lost Levels
description: This 5-card Boss Monster: The Lost Levels mini-pack includes Boss Anererak, Monster Room: Wight House, Monster Room: Room 1-1, Monster Room: Shocksquid Pool, and Monster Room: Piranha Tank.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Prohibition
description:
You are running a gang in New York in 1921 at the dawn of Prohibition competing to gain the most Prestige by 1926 to earn an invitation to shape the organization of crime in America at the Atlantic City Conference. You can gain Prestige by expanding your Turf, building a bootlegging empire, earning Headlines, and completing devious Schemes.

Success will require balancing running your gang like a business and being a ruthless criminal. You can earn Gs with Buildings that produce and sell Booze, or you can collect Extortion from the hapless denizens of your Turf.

Alternately, you can generate Headlines by ordering your Goons to attack your competition, Steal their resources, Torch their operations, or take over their Turf.

Crushing your foes is going to require that you choose between focusing on completing complex Schemes, or getting a Tactical advantage during Conflict.

However, everything you do will generate Heat. As Public Outrage grows, the more often, and more severely, the Feds will disrupt your operations. You can reduce the pressure by generating goodwill, or when you get busted choose whether to pay a Bribe, Face the Consequences, or Do a Bit in jail.

Good luck!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Disgruntled Decks: Marine Corps Edition
description:
Disgruntled Decks is a card game for military service members and grizzled Veterans who enjoy laughing together about their time in the service. With a unique blend of descriptive language and military themes, Disgruntled Decks gives one more reason for service members and Veterans to talk about their shared experiences while having fun in the process.
Our message is simple: Humor through healing, and some Veterans still have a good amount of healing left to do. We hope to provide some of that humor with Disgruntled Decks. First to 7 cards wins.

This is a Cards Against Humanity style game targeted at veterans and members of the military.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: On The Slopes
description:
On The Slopes is a fast-paced skiing adventure for 2-4 players. Each player is a skier or snowboarder racing around a mountain, trying to be the first to visit every lodge.

On The Slopes was one of five finalists in the 2016 Hasbro Game Design Challenge.

On your turn, you have three actions, which you can use to go up a lift, ski down a run, or pick up a stone from a lodge. But runs and lifts only work in one direction, you must carefully plan your route for the day.

Whenever you pick up a stone, you also get a Snow Card, which can give you benefits like extra action tokens or a one-time-only ability. Some Snow Cards let you help or hinder other players.

When going down runs, you can choose between easy green runs, intermediate blue runs, or advanced or expert black diamond runs. The more difficult runs are faster, but you might fall and have to take a Wipeout Card, which can cause bad things to happen.

Advanced players can play with special characters that give each player a unique ability they can use throughout the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Piłka w grze
description:
Here is the football match Poland v Germany. Quite small size but has very high rank! The table becomes a stadium, cards—turf and players—team.

Piłka w grze is a simple pattern recognition game combined with very simple soccer match simulation. The game consists of deck of large cards with images associated with football and wooden ball token. Five of these cards laid on a table produce small board—football pitch—combined of five spaces.

The aim of the game is to score three goals. In order to score a goal the player have to move the ball to the utmost space in front of his or her opponent and win the decisive duel.

To move a ball or win a duel players compete, one trying to identify pairs of common symbols faster than their adversary. Ball may be moved from its space to adjacent one only if a player recognizes and names the only image, which these two spaces have in common. Before each move new card is played on board, putting new symbols in play.

Whoever scores third goal, wins the game. Teams may also determine that the game lasts until one team reaches a different, mutually agreed outcome or score more goals in the allotted time.

name: Gem collectors
description:
Two people dueling to try to get the most gems.

Pick cards and steal gems from your opponent to win.
But remember, don’t let the greed take you over.

Gems may be collected several ways, one, play a collect one gem card, or collect 4 gem fragments which you can pick up randomly in the deck.

If you have four of one kind of gem fragment, you can play them to get 6 gems, if you have four different kinds of gem fragments, you will make 4 gems.

You can also steal the enemy gems with cards that your pick up randomly.

You pick one card on the beginning of each turn, you may also play a pick two cards card, then you pick two cards from the deck.

You are only allowed to play one card a turn, but there are cards that you may play in addition to your one card your allowed to play,
such as, skip opponents turn, Pick two cards, Switch hands, etc.

the most important thing is to keep your opponent from getting gems, or he might win when your not paying attention.

name: Cuál?
description:
From the box:

Cuál? Is an intriguing boardgame of observation and deceiving.
Will you be able to reach victory with your secret piece before your opponent finds it? Which one would be the secret piece of your opponent?

Overview:
Cuál? (translated as “Which one?”) is an abstract strategy game for 2 players in which each one controls 8 pieces in 4 different shapes each shape having unique movement patterns. At the beginning of the match each player choses 1 of their 8 pieces as the secret piece using a deck of 8 cards. Winning may be achieved by reaching the adversary end of the board or by discovering which one is the opponent secret piece.
During the game pieces may be captured but they don’t leave the game, instead they are positioned by whom captured it. By revealing one of the remaining 7 cards, any player may move 2 pieces or 1 piece 2 times in their turn.

name: Trilobite Dice
description:
Description from the designer:

Trilobites are among the most successful animals to ever live on Earth, lasting for over 250 million years and spanning the globe. They mostly lived on the sea floor in shallow oceans, but some varieties lived in deeper water and on land in tidal regions. They were highly diversified in physiology, habitat, and behavior – ranging from inches to feet in length, some foraging, some hunting, some filter feeding, and some grazing. Their closest living relative is the Horseshoe Crab, but all true trilobites went extinct by the end of the Permian.

Trilobite Dice recreates competition between different strains of trilobites as they populate the ocean shallows. It is a cross between connection games (like Hex, Twixt, or Gonnect) and tactical dice games (like Roll Through the Ages, Octo Dice, or Pandemic: The Cure). It can be played competitively with 2 players or solo against an automated ‘imposter’. Trilobite Dice is a print-and-play game, using consumable sheets of paper each game.

Players take turns rolling and rerolling special dice. The results of the dice provide resources to be allocate towards various special effects, including once-per-game bonus effects, ongoing special powers, and additional dice to roll on future turns. The players use these effects and powers to populate a hex map with their species, aiming to connect two opposite sides of the board before their opponent does so. Some effects, such as buying extra dice, increase a player’s hunger rating, which must be overcome before the player can win, so players must balance multiple objectives. The primary form of interaction between players is on the hex board, but some special powers create additional forms of interaction and alternate win conditions. The game can be played in basic form, with just 20 special effects available, or advanced form with over 50 special effects to choose from (including more complex powers that combine to support additional tricks and strategies).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Animals, Prehistoric, Print & Play

name: Mats Carlson's Night & Day
description:
Description from the designer:

In Night & Day the players try to earn points by occupying fields with their tokens. They do this by rolling a die, moving their pawn and placing tokens.

The board consists of 16 squares. Each square is divided in two fields,dark and light. You get one point for each of “your” fields

The game ends as soon as one of the players get four tokens in a row.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: Kid Kong: The Ape Escape Game
description:
Kid Kong is captured and wants to break away. Setup involves turning the dial on the back of the base of the Kid Kong unit. This randomly selects a specific hole which will eventually trigger Kid Kong when the appropriate peg (from the chain) is inserted.

Players take turns trying to chain Kid Kong by inserting both pegs, from the chain, into any of the 8 holes located on both sides of the ape.

If the chain holds, play passes to the next player. If not, Kid Kong breaks out of his chains and that player is eliminated. Repeat this process with the remaining players, when only one player in left- they are declared the winner.

name: Spellfire: Booster Pack, Set 11 – Nightstalkers
description: September 1996 - This was a very unique set. First and most odviously, every card in the set is a photo card, as opposed to just the usual chase set. This set focused on two things. Like the previous set, this booster focused on the old undead and made them fearsome again. New unarmed combat cards for undead, and other boons to the previously alive are found through the set. The other major theme is the two new card types: Thief champions and thief skills. This made yet another card type to deal with (are rarely counter), but overall, it wasn't a huge effect yet. Landmark Cards: Nelanther (#4); Falknovia (#5); Cromlin (#7); Assassin's Guild (#14); Cavern of Ancient Knowledge (#18); Complete Suprise (#25); The Guildmaster (#28); Jacqueline Renier (#32); Julio, Master Thief of Haslic (#34); El-Hadid (#40); Orcus (#44); Trumpet of Doom (#53); Herald of Mei Lung (#54); Use Poison (#63); Nemon hotep (#67); A Sure Thing (#74); Level Drain (#97); Bag of beans (c#11); Gib _________ (All designers, c#18-23); Den of Thieves (c#24); and Mad Scientist's Laboratory (c#25).
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Championship Formula Racing: The Mansell Add-on
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Variable Player Powers

name: This Is Not a Test: Wasteland Essentials 1
description:
Wasteland Essentials 1 is a companion product for the main This Is Not a Test rulebook and features 32mm printable figures, counters, and templates to enhance the scenarios in This Is Not a Test.

The paper miniatures are designed for use with scenarios where you need extra miniatures beyond just your warband, such as Pest Control and The Caravan, Wasteland Essentials 1 has you covered with rad zombies, irradiators, lightly armed caravanners, and cargo animals. Full color instructions are included with clear demonstrative pictures.

Beyond just miniatures, Wasteland Essentials 1 also has templates and counters for all of the hazards of the wastes from the This Is Not a Test main book such as ripwinds, emberquakes, poisonous gases, and more.

A bonus scenario is included to showcase all of this great material in Wasteland Essentials 1. In the Lost Caravan your warband must recover the remnants of a destroyed caravan train while braving dangerous and unpredictable wasteland phenomena. All for profit of course.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: This Is Not a Test: Mutant Cannibals
description:
The Mutant Cannibals supplement adds a ghoulish new twist to your games of This Is Not a Test. This supplement fully re-introduces the terrible mutant cannibal family as a fully playable warband, as well as a host of extra material.

The mutant cannibals are a nightmare come true. Living in twisted family clans, they raid wasteland settlements and seek the flesh of their foes. Led by the matriarch or the patriarch of the family, a host of gruesome family members are at your command. Whether it’s the deceptively lovely Petunia, the simple, but gargantuan Tiny, or even the blood-crazed psychos who hold torture as an art form. The cannibal mutant warband also feature the ability to access to wasteland critters such a great rats, rad roaches, or the powerful psychic husk.

The mutant cannibals bring with them an array of deadly weaponry and deviant equipment. With everything from new vicious close combat weapons, to guns that literally boil the enemy alive with blood, and armor made out of the skin of their poor victims, the armory in this supplement is a true terror to behold. But don’t lose all hope, other warbands can also use most of these weapons!

This supplement introduces two new scenarios: The Night Has Eyes and Snack Attack. Favoring the mutants chosen form of attack, these night raids feature the two most common cannibal themes, attacking your enemy while they sleep and raiding a settlement for a little nourishment. Of course these scenarios are definitely playable by other warbands and don’t necessarily have to be about blood and guts, but why would you want that?

name: Merchants of Araby: Tribute promo card
description:
1 Djinn "Tribute" Card - Kickstarter Promo

Card Text

Each Opponent gives you one card or one coin.
categories: Arabian, Card Game, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Negotiation
mechanics: Hand Management, Trading, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Commissioner Victor: Case of Missing Alfred Worthapenny
description:
Another quiet day at the precinct — but not for long. A woman, covered in tears, bursts through the door, crying that her husband went missing. It seems that Mr. Alfred Worthapenny did not show himself at home for two days. He didn't show at work either, and friends report no sightings. After sending the woman home, you place a quick phone call to Commissioner Victor. After a short investigation, it turns out that the case is much more complicated that it seems. Lots of mutually exclusive evidence and a lack of connection between them — this looks strange. The Commissioner gathers his most trusted detectives. Time to solve the mystery of missing Alfred Worthapenny!

In Commissioner Victor: Case of Missing Alfred Worthapenny, players try to find out what happened to Mr. Alfred. They do so by placing evidence tiles in four colors on a grid. Each player has a different pattern to form from tiles of the same colors. Also, each player gets a tip that crosses out one possible outcome, which means that players cannot win with one of four colors.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle

name: Lion of Sinai
description: "Lion of Sinai" is the fourth game of Kilovolt Design's tactical mini-wargame series "Winning or Losing". The theme is tank combat in the Sinai Peninsula, 14-16 October 1973 during Yom Kippur War. The game is basically played by two players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Simulation

name: Xiang-Yong
description:
Xiang-Yong was a type of regional army that emerged in the 1800s in the Qing dynasty army, which fought in most of China's wars after the Opium War and numerous rebellions exposed the ineffectiveness of the Manchu Eight Banners and Green Standard Army. The Xiang-Yong were created from the earlier tuanlian militias.

In the game Xiang-Yong, players play cards from their hands, trying to figure out which opponent might be able to help — but the one willing to help might not be without personal purposes for doing so. Choose your friends wisely, or you might not have the cards to join the game — and sometimes keeping yourself out of the other players' business is a better way to win this game...

name: MoonQuake Escape: Mug Shots!!!
description:
Mug Shots!!! is a promo card for MoonQuake Escape which forces the player to "stops [the] game and post a picture" and then replace the drawn card with a new one. The card is mostly for fun and to promote the game.
It was released as part of a three card promotion pack called the All Access Promo Pack, which included the Mug Shot card, Access Card card, and a bonus rules card. All three cards were packaged in a single card sleeve.
mechanics: Action Points, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Gibraltar of the West: The 1863 Vicksburg Campaign
description:
From the publisher:

It is early May 1863. Ulysses S Grant and over 40,000 Union troops have crossed the Mississippi and now threaten both Vicksburg and the state capital of Jackson. Will Grant cut free from his river-side supply base? Can Pemberton unite with the relief army assembling near Jackson?

"Gibraltar of the West" is a free campaign supplement, allowing players to re-fight the pivotal three weeks of the Vicksburg campaign. Players maneuver their divisions across a large theater map with the potential to fight a series of interconnected battles. Our simple rules are only 10 pages, but still include logistics, supply, weather, variable map movement, asymmetrical victory conditions, and historical random events. Did we mention it's free?

A color copy of the theater map is included in the rules, spread out across two pages, which you can cut out and tape together into an approximately 10"x 15" map.

The campaign requires the use of ten event cards, representing random events such as bad weather or new reinforcements. The cards are sized as standard poker cards, which could be slid into plastic protective sleeves if you so choose.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Humanity Hates the Holidays
description:
Description from the publisher:

Whether you celebrate Christmas, Hannukah or Chrismahanukwanzakah, most can agree that “the most wonderful time of the year,” is often the time we’re least thankful for. Between fighting families, re-gifted fruitcake and Black Friday frenzies, most of us end up on the naughty list once the holiday antics are over… Don’t get your tinsel in a tangle anymore! Introducing the gift that keeps on giving, Humanity Hates The Holidays: The Adult Party Game Santa Won’t Bring You.

Humanity Hates The Holidays is the perfect distraction that will take you away from holiday hell this year. Compatible with Humanity Hates Trump, Humanity Hates Hillary TOO!, Cards Against Humanity and other similar party games, this hilarious expansion pack will have the family in stitches. Humanity Hates The Holidays pokes fun at cliché Christmas music, Jewish Christmas traditions and Thanksgivings that even the Pilgrims would cringe over. Play it around the Thanksgiving table or at your holiday parties, heck, you may even bond with your crazy aunt over this!

Similarly to Cards Against Humanity, each player is dealt 10 white cards, each including a word or phrase. Each round, players take turns serving as the judge, drawing one black card containing a question or fill in the blank sentence. Players answer the question or fill in the blank sentence by choosing their favorite white card to fill it in. Each player takes turns judging, choosing their favorite option and the funniest answer wins the round.

Humanity Hates The Holidays includes one Ultimate Yule Log Card. The lucky player who has the card in their hand automatically wins the round.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: This Is Not a Test: Eat, Prey, Live
description:
Eat, Prey, Live is a set of three playable scenarios for This Is Not a Test designed to test the mettle, strength, and survivability of your warband. Each scenario introduces a new wasteland creature or hazard and provides additional depth to the history and (de)evolution of the Tri-State Wasteland.

Eat, Prey, Live features the following:

New Scenario (Eat) – Your warband will need more than a rod and real to bring these fish home. Look out for giant mutant crabs.

New Scenario (Prey) – Mutant turkeys are on the menu, but things may get a little explosive.

New Scenario (Live) – This is playing TNT on hard mode! Can your warband survive fall out from the fallout!
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Keep Ahead
description:
Players are aiming to get their secret wagers to earn the most points. It is played with a deck of 56 cards consisting of 2's to 7's from two packs of cards. Plus 1 King of each suit and 4 Jokers. Finally add the layout cards of 1 Ace of each suit and another Joker.
The layout is placed on the table in this order from left to right:
Club Ace, Spade Ace, Joker, Heart Ace and finally Diamond Ace

Each player is dealt 12 cards. From these he selects two cards which will be his secret 'wager'. He may choose two of the same suit or one each from two of the suits. His chosen cards are kept face-down in front of him.

The remaining 10 cards that a player has are used to influence or deter cards in the layout to get as far left as they can. Being a Knizia game the card play is quite novel and a little complex even.

When each player has used up his 10 cards, that ends the game. The secret 'wagers' are revealed. If the suits you picked are in the first 3 positions you get 3, 2, or 1 point (for 1st, 2nd and 3rd) if the black suits or Joker are in those positions. You score double points for red cards that get into the first 3 spots which reflects their 'start' at the back of the order from the Start. If a suit you bet on comes last you lose 3 points regardless of the colour.

The designer suggests that you play one hand equal to the number of players and the player at the end with the most points, wins.

name: The Greater Debate
description:
You’ve been there for the great debates among your friends: Which player is better than which? What political party is really causing all the issues? Which superhero is better? Is a certain band legit musically or completely overrated?
You’ve had a few laughs and some really good debates, but so often you have just agreed to disagree. Now is the time to test your powers of persuasion. Now is the time to settle this once and for all… or for at least tonight!

The players will take turns debating various topics from serious to the zany. The players will vote on who wins the argument based on the merits of the debaters.

This is a standalone expansion to The Great Debate. This contains all new arguments and enough vote cards for 15 players.

name: Pointed Words
description: Each card in a deck displays a letter that is worth from one to three points. Nine cards are arrayed face-up in the playing area, and three more are dealt to each player. Players simultaneously try to find the word with the most points and announce the word's value. When no one can exceed a value, the player who announced it provisionally collects all the cards and keeps them if he survives a challenge to the word's validity or spelling. The nine community cards are replenished, and play continues until the deck is exhausted. The winner has the most points.

name: Malwarium
description:
Description from the publisher:

Malwarium is a Dixit-inspired competitive storytelling game. The active player secretly chooses a card from their hand and makes up a word, sentence, or quote that might describe it. Other players contribute cards from their hands to produce a pool of candidates (along with the active player's card). Players then choose which card was the active player's and points are awarded. Some spaces on the scoring track provide restrictions on how the active player may describe their card (if they are on such a space).

name: Burst My Bubble
description:
Burst My Bubble is a family strategy card game. The artwork creates a classic feel, like card games of the 70's. The goal is to score the most points by bursting soap bubbles to collect sets or surviving as the "Bubble Player". A game typically plays in 45 minutes, but can be made longer or shorter by changing the victory point total.

This is a Multi Phase game. In the beginning you play in the Bubble Up Phase, which allows you to draw and play action cards. You are trying to improve your hand to build the most points in the next phase. If you feel like you have a chance to survive as the Bubble Player then Say "Burst" and bring the game into the Burst My Bubble phase (this is where the most points are accumulated).

name: Great War at Sea: Spoils of Victory
description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

At the end of the Great War, the German High Seas Fleet was interned at Scapa Flow at the northern tip of Scotland as a guarantee of the November 11th Armistice. Within weeks, French leaders were demanding that at least a portion of the ships, if not all of them, be handed over to France as compensation for the destruction wrought on French soil during the war. The discussions came to an end in June 1919, when the German sailors still aboard the ships scuttled them rather than see them flying enemy flags or worse, displayed in victory celebrations.

Victoire is a variant for U.S. Navy Plan Gold, in which the French have successfully received the most extreme of their demands: all of the most modern German battleships, battle cruisers and light cruisers. Newly refitted and ready for action, these vessels join the French fleet projecting the Republic’s naval power into the Caribbean basin. With the addition of 14 formerly German dreadnoughts and six cruisers, the Marine Nationale is now a match for the U.S. Navy. The Monroe Doctrine is about to become a dead letter.

The Harvest 2015 Golden Journal includes twenty new laser-cut, mounted pieces depicting these ships in Great War at Sea format. They bear French livery and new names, and revised artwork. It’s a good-looking set. Plus you get scenarios for their use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Roll for the goal
description: In this children's dice game, players roll dice and then use mathematical operators including addition and subtraction to try to reach the goal number. The theme is bear soccer.

name: Guild Ball: Alchemists Starter Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

Alchemists’ play style is one of force projection. They utilise a lot of AOE to control space and deny their opponents manoeuvrability. Their combo play comes from layering AOEs and generating huge areas of danger across the pitch.

They are quick on their feet and capable with the ball, but not as resilient in combat as other teams. They excel in the early to mid-game due to their ability to cover a good amount of space.

Alchemists will reward players who can anticipate their opponent’s plans and block them through good placement and positioning of models and effects. On offense, Alchemists can use their AOEs almost as additional models in order to restrict the counter play options of their opponent. No one wants to charge the Alchemist with the ball if you have to go through an acid cloud!

What nature provides, man can improve. The Alchemists know this well and it is reflected in the scientific marvels they bring to the Guild Ball pitch. Watching the Alchemists play is part carnival, part fireworks, part illusion. The crowds cheer in awe at the visual spectacle as fireballs, smoke clouds, and slick oils dominate the field of play, delighting the children, decimating the opposition.

Flexibility is the watchword of an Alchemist's Guild coach. In Midas, Calculus, and Mercury you have all the ingredients for the purest of alloys, a team that can be much greater than the sum of its parts.
