Whether you are blinding the enemy with oil or turning them into little more than human candles, the Alchemists will always have a response to any play; their vast knowledge putting them one step ahead of the rest of the pack with every kick of the ball.

This set provides you with all you need to start playing the Alchemist's Guild.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Guild Ball: Mortician Starter Set
description:
Description from the publisher:

Morticians’ play style is about planning and execution. They control play with a huge amount of influence at their disposal, along with the ability to steal more from their opponent. Their play feels very much like setting traps, triggering the snare and then punishing their opponent. Mid-game is where they really shine - once well laid plans have turned to mush, Morticians can begin to dictate the play.

Morticians provide an interesting take on ‘force projection’ by making their opponents consider how and where they’re going to position models.

Morticians will reward players who like to dominate and control the game by playing mind tricks on their opponents.

They say that form is temporary; class is forever. The Morticians may not have a lot of class but it feels like they have been peddling their peculiar mix of malice and tradition forever. Armed with the experience earned from decades on the pitch, playing against the Deadheads can be an exercise in frustration as teams find themselves demotivated and inexplicably surrendering the ball.

If mind games are your stock in trade, then the Mortician's Guild have a coaching role for you. Through Obulus you will be controlling not only your own team but also that of your opponent; in Graves and Cosset you have the power and the means to quickly finish those that your insidious captain has moved into position.

This set provides you with all you need to start playing the Mortician's Guild.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Chocolate Academy
description:
Description from the designer:

Become an artisan chocolate maker by attending the finest Chocolatier school in Paris. Work with world famous chocolate chefs to create signature recipes starting with raw cocoa beans and the finest and most expensive natural ingredients. Prove your chef, marketing and management skills to earn the title as the finest chocolatier in the world.

As a master chef, you will have sous chefs and assistants to help create your masterpiece chocolates. Each day, you will choose alumni instructors that have specialties that can give you advantages. You will need to manage your money by selling your chocolates so that you can buy better ingredients and gain the highest marks for your recipes. With limited space and equipment, you will need to plan actions wisely. Crowding a work space will damage your reputation but sometimes it's necessary.

Using your chosen instructor(role card), sous chefs(workers) and assistants(temporary workers) players will attend classes to increase skills, create chocolate from cocoa beans, choose ingredients at the market to create artisan chocolate recipes and then sell them in the shop.

With 24 different instructor cards, over 100 distinct recipes, variable customer meeples and more than 50 achievement tiles, Chocolatier provides huge replay value. Each game will require new strategies and tactics.

name: Bushido: Tadao
description:
The Kairai are a cruel and mocking reminder to the living of the dark and twisted powers of the cult. The vile predicament forced upon the living soldiers of the Jwar isles as they are ordered to hack down their brothers, sisters, fathers and mothers. Transformed into mindless puppets of Yurei. Tadao stands apart from most Kairai; in battle he displays startling speed and agility for an animated husk, some report him seeming almost alive, not demonstrating the usual awkward gait of the un-living. In death, just as in life Tadao wields a solid steel tetsubo synonymous with his former clan, cracking bone and breaking the spirit of the living with grim satisfaction.

Blister contains one miniature, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Penanggalan
description:
The Vampiric Yokai is yet another nightmare made flesh by the weakening of the balance. These parasitic monsters only purpose is to move from one victim to the next, draining the host of blood whilst riding the body in search of its next prey. From a distance it is hard to work out the unnatural, jerky movements of the poor soul’s body the Penanggalan uses to get close. By the time danger is confirmed the Penanggalan has either trapped its victim in its stare, or uncoiled from its host with shocking speed and wrapped its long tendril around the hapless soul, incapacitating them and allowing it to feed and then inhabit the body, wearing the corpse like a cheap kimono so easily discarded when its use is served.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Souta and Sloth
description:
Of the orphans lost to the void Souta is the perfect example of the physical manifestation of the spirit squatting within him, twisting and corrupting its host. Some say the children were already on the path to destruction others that they are merely innocent victims, lost like so many in the battle between good and evil, life and death. Souta is the embodiment of Sloth even when the spirit is not invoked. The Sloth is as slow and inevitable a killer as the void from which it came, victims held helplessly in the grip of fear or some unseen tether, those brave enough to confront the horror find themselves enveloped by its nothingness.

Blister contains two models, one 30mm base, one 40mm base and two full colour profile cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Latari Elves Infantry Command – Unit Upgrade Expansion
description:
Description from the publisher:

Enhance your Latari Elves army with the Latari Elves Infantry Command – Unit Upgrade Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game. Rally your forces with the Latari Champion, Herald, Sorceress, and Starling, all of which allow you to customize your Latari Elves army with powerful upgrades.

The Latari Elves Infantry Command – Unit Upgrade Expansion includes four new figures to be added to infantry units, as well as 18 new upgrade cards. Customize your army and lead the Latari Elves to victory!

name: Bourse: Le jeu de la finance
description:
Bourse is a stockmarket simulation with some real french brand names from the 1970ties where the price of the shares are reacting differently depending on the economic situation (expansion, crisis, recession, recovery) the game currently run through.

Beside of purchasing market shares, the players can also buy stock options or go to a bank and get a loan to increase their working capital.

To win the game, you simply need to doubble your initial capital of 200k.

name: Wall Street App
description:
Wall Street simulates, in a relaxed way real situations experienced by the stock market. Players, acting as major investors, are continually driven to make decisions based on economic behavior, corporate performance and speculative trends. Buy or sell? What actions? When? The answers to these questions may make you a millionaire, but one thing is certain: your smart leisure will always be on the rise!

Buy and sell stocks at the right time to get the best yield and get to the end of the game by being the most successful player!

APP
All the stock market thrills with real simulations!

+ INTERACTIVITY

+ ACTION

+ EMOTION

+ WAYS TO PLAY

2 in 1
Play with or without the app

name: Story Master
description:
Airplane, Boat, Tent, Skull, Soap

Ever wonder what kind of story someone could make out of these random words?

Well stop wondering and check out this game!

A simple game with endless amounts of fun. Test your skills at making a short story within a couple of minutes that will leave your friends in awe! Be the Story Master!

Story Master is an improvisational story-telling party game designed to be played anywhere with as few as 2 people, and as many as you can fit in a room...

name: Polemic: Adult Topic Pack
description:
Polemic is a game about guessing your friends' opinions. Each round focuses on a different "topic". Each player chooses whether they like or dislike the topic, and then guess how many other players like it. Finally, all players reveal their opinions, and everyone who guessed correctly scores a point.
The Adult Topic Pack adds 40 new decidedly-NSFW topic cards, selected by certified sex coach Myisha Battle.

name: Delivery Duck
description:
Description from the publisher:

You're a duck, in a truck, delivering packages.

Unfortunately ducks aren't very good at doing deliveries.
Crates fall of vehicles and other players can steal your cargo!
Delivery Duck is a strategic family game for 2 - 6 players.

Gameplay centres around picking up and delivering cargo. Depos are placed around a dodecagon shaped board. Each turn a player picks up cards that determine the starting location and destination of cargo. Then they place a terrain tile to help them traverse the board or stop others, before moving their vehicles.

The goal of the game is to earn 10 victory points. Cargo comes in multiple types, each with its own monetary and VP value. Strategy comes in deciding which vehicle to use considering terrain, resources on the board and other players actions. Action cards further modify the gameplay.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Gori x Muchuu
description:
User summary
ゴリ×夢中 (Gori x Muchuu) is an abstract 2-player strategy game by 楠本舗 (Kusunoki Honpo) that was released at the Game Market 2017 Spring in Odaiba, Tokyo Japan.

As the name suggests, Gori x Muchuu is themed with Gorillas and Bananas. According to the publisher it is inspired by the game Geister.

The game doesn't come in a box. The components are a grid sheet, representing the forest, and gorillas chips, which comes in 2 types: square and triangle, 4 of each.

The textbook only feature Japanese but no knowledge of Japanese is required to play the game.

You win if you either:
- Reach the banana square of your color inside your opponent's zone.
- Capture 5 of your opponent's gorilla chips
You loose if you either:
- Capture 4 or more gorilla chip of your opponent of the same type (triangle or square).
- Get your player chip captured

Publisher summary

name: Police Precinct: Richard Austria Character Board
description:
Was available through Police Precinct - Online! kickstarter campaign as well as part of a reward from the Dice Tower 2016 (Season 12) Kickstarter.

Text:

Rapport: As a trained experience Community Resource Officer you can impact situations others can't:
At any time you can turn in a donut to add or subtract a pip to any die rolled in relation to your location if any punk tokens are also present

Respect: They look up to you, so interviewing juveniles when they are away from their cohorts works well:
At the end of your turn you may draw an investigation card from any deck if you are parked next to a lone punk token
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Safe House
description:
Description from the publisher:

Dusk is falling. Wind is howling. Will you survive the night? It’s possible, if only you can make it to the Safe House. Grab your friends and dash across the neighborhood. Duck in and out of rundown houses, hiding as best as you can. The house at the end of the street is almost in sight. You can make it, just keep running. You can make it. Just. Keep. Running.

In Safe House, players are attempting to cooperatively save survivors. It’s a real time game that demands good teamwork and great communication. It’s frantic fun for all participants.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Tentacle Bento: Maid Service
description:
Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento

Card Details
Discard up to three cards and then draw an equal number of cards from the school pile.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult

name: Final Round Fighting Card Game
description:
Final Round Fighting Card Game is a two-player card game which emulates Arcade Fighting Games of the 90s.

In Final Round Fighting Card Game, players play cards to simulate attacking and defending against their opponent as they attempt to deal damage to one-another, removing cards from their opponents deck as damage is done. The players deck is made up of cards, each of which represent a move the character they are playing as is able to perform. Cards lost from the deck through damage become a resource from which players draw.

As with Arcade Fighting Games, there are Basic Attacks (simple 1-button punches and kicks), Special Attacks (more complicated or specialized moves, frequently unique to a character), Basic Block and Special Blocks (Basic Block is reusable throughout the game, Special Blocks have an additional effect) and Ultimate moves (the big, flashy finishers).

Cards/Moves in Final Round Fighting Card Game are balanced by i. Attack Speed (how fast a card is), ii. Combo Speed (the maximum Attack Speed of the card to follow it in a Combo), iii. Damage (the number of cards your opponent loses from their deck when they're hit with the attack alone or in a Combo), and iv. Card Abilities.

Gameplay consists of playing cards defensively to your own High, Mid, and Low zones, or playing a card aggressively to Attack your opponent in one of their three zones (the zones are largely thematic, to represent the "spacing" aspect from fighting video games). Attacks are successful when they are faster than the card in the zone they were played to, with Blocks being an automatic success for the defending player, and ties being broken by revealing the top card of players' decks and using the Attack Speed of the revealed card. On successfully attacking the opponent, players have the ability to play additional cards, making a Combo, with each successive card in a Combo requiring having an Attack Speed which is equal to or less than the Combo Speed of the last card which was played. During a players turn, they have two Actions, in which they can play defensively to draw cards and reset their defenses, or to attack.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Thief's Market: WUT
description:
Promotional Card for Thief's Market.

Used in the B-Deck.

name: Thief's Market: Purported Curse
description:
Promotional Card for Thief's Market.

Used in the C-Deck

name: Psi-Paladins and Techno-Barbarians
description:
Psi-Paladins and Techno-Barbarians is a mini sourcebook for the Mutants and Death Ray Guns post-apocalyptic miniatures game. In its 32 full color pages, you will find:

Rules for Psi-Paladins, wielding the power of the all-encompassing mystic force known as the Animus and their deadly forceblades.
Stats for the Techno-Barbarians, a party of three unique heroes of the radioactive wastelands: Lady Azura, A.K.A. The Blue Sorceress; Dashar, barbaric wielder of the Photovoltaic Sword; and his brutal companion Ferragg, the Lion of the Wasteland. 
Stats for the enemies of the Techno-Barbarians: ComBots (solar-energy powered combat droids), the evil warlord Pharag, the teleporting assassin Skarra, and the mutant brute Graul Granite.
A new scenario, “A Cartload of Trouble”
Color cards for all characters in the book
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Zelda Wind Walker
description:
A card game for 2-4+ players based on the Video Game: Zelda the Wind Walker.

Players share a common deck. All cards are of 2 basic types: Quest Cards and Hero Cards. There are 7 types of hero cards: Weapons, Items, Defence, Actions, Friends, Special, Tricks. There are 7 types of quest cards: Location, Treasure, Enemy, Boss, Monster, Obstacle, Objectives. Each card has a point value ranging from 1 to 10 and a special effect (e.g. search deck, bonus, draw card).

To start each player is dealt 5 cards to form their hand. Players then take it in turns with each turn comprising 5 phases.

1. Destiny Phase
- Draw 2 cards and place them in your hand.

2. Adventure Phase
- First, play 1 card to your own tableau (the area in front of a player) or discard 1 card.
- Second, play 1 card to an opponent’s tableau or discard 1 card.
- There are 14 types of cards. A tableau can contain a max of 14 cards - 1 of each type. A card may be placed so as to replace a card of the same type already in play in a tableau in which case the replaced card is discarded.

3. Option Phase
- You may do one of the following 4 Options:
• Side Quest: Gain 1 Upgrade
• Mini Game: Draw 1 Card
• Picto Box: Gain 1 Quest Point
• Missing Link: Gain 2 Exploration Points

4. Quest Phase
- You may complete a quest. To do this, you must have at least 5 hero cards of different types present in your tableau. You must also have at least 5 quest cards of different types present in your tableau. Also, the total score of your hero cards must equal or exceed that of the quest cards.
- Score Quest Points equal to the total value of the quest (nor hero) cards played
After a quest is scored, discard your tableau and take an extra turn immediately.

5. End Phase
- Max hand size is 5 cards. Discard extras.

The first player to acquire 100+ Quest Points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: CESSPOOL
description:
User summary
CESSPOOL is a Japanese game with a serious crime theme for adult players.

The publisher says "Cook, Sack, Trick, and rake in. Turn your table into a thrilling crime TV series."

You are the boss of a drug syndicate who competes for the rights of this city. Players purchase three types of raw materials and can develop six different types of drugs, combining the ingredients freely. Refining and selling the drugs, fighting for territory in each round, the player that manages the biggest amount of money at the end will be the winner and will become the new drug traffic King!

Players can negotiate at their will. Thanks to deal making, a player can turn the tables and pull themself out of a disadvantageous situation. However, you can expect someone to betray the pact at any time. You should keep in mind that probably those deals could be thrown away.

User summary
Cook, Sack, Trick, and rake in.

あなたはこの街の利権を争うドラッグシンジゲートのボスです。プレイヤーは３種類の原材料を購入し、自由に組み合わせて６種類のドラッグを作り出すことができます。ドラッグの精製と販売、領地争いをラウンドごとに繰り返し、最終的により多くの所持金を獲得したプレイヤーが勝者、新しい麻薬王となります。
プレイヤーは思いのままの交渉をする事が許されています、不利な状況でも交渉次第で大逆転も夢ではありません。しかし、交渉には裏切りがつきものです。約束を反故にされるかもしれないと頭に入れておきましょう。

スリリングなクライムドラマをあなたの卓上に。
categories: Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Mafia, Mature / Adult, Negotiation
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Trading, Worker Placement

name: Storming the Citadel: Grossdeutschland Attack at Kursk – A Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command
description:
This Pint Sized Campaign for Chain of Command is the first covering the attack of PanzerGrenadier Division Grossdeutschland at Kursk. The action here covers the build up to the attack, with actions in no-man’s-land as the Germans attempt to seize observation posts and clear minefields, followed by the first day of this epic battle as the Germans storm through the Soviet outpost line and the first line of defences.

Six battlefields provide a campaign up to ten games long, by which point you’ll have a clear winner and be set up for the next campaign in the series which is already being prepared and follows Grossdeutschland into the second line of Russian defences and attempting to break into open ground beyond.

This classic Pint Sized Campaign is designed to be run using the campaign rules in At the Sharp End and with Chain of Command rules. Can you breach the Russian defences and seize the initiative in the East, or will you defeat the fascist invaders and restore the safety of the motherland.

Twenty-seven pages long, this Pint Sized campaign provides the background history to the campaign with situation maps. Uses period maps to show the location of the actions and then provides a complete campaign with forces for both sides, support options for players to select from and full victory conditions for all six battles and the campaign as a whole.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: 7 Desires
description:
A simulator of karma. Magical game with dices and cards.
That is a unique game about rebirth, desires and karma. As a bonus, a solo mode for fortune telling and cooperative mode without conflicts.

Brief description of the game

The ancient sages have said: “we are alive only if we have desires”. Someone has a lot of dreams, other has only one dream, but everyone who lives in our world constantly wants something. It’s a pity, but accomplishment of desires is not a simple thing. Sometimes we need to do any serious actions. These actions can be as good, as bad. And our actions develop karma, which can be as light, as dark due to our desires...

In the game 7 Desires''we become souls embodied in our world. There are many disadvantages in this world. For example, illness and death. Therefore, every player wants to leave this cruel world as quickly as possible. We would like to liberate the soul, and, of course, fulfill all the desires which have brought us here.

The world is multilevel. Souls rise, and then fall, because they are so different! There is a plan of being for each level of consciousness.
In the beginner of the game everyone starts at the level of human being.

To win the game 7 Desires, you just need to move from the level of human being to the level of angels, then to the level of the gods. And when all the desires of the divine level are accomplished, you can go home, away from the world of births and deaths. We wish you good luck with that!

In summary, every turn looks like this: a player draws a card, fills his hand with three cards, and then plays one card, placing it in the discard deck face -up. This card becomes an active desire. Next step, the player chooses whether he wants to accomplish this desire. If yes, then he discards the crystal (s) of desires indicated in the upper left corner of the card, and if he does not want to accomplish the desire, he adds to his avatar the item which is indicated in the upper right corner of the card. If it is more than one crystal on the left, you do not need to reset all the crystals. You can have any number of crystals indicated on the card. For example, accomplishing of "A cherished Desire" you can reset 1, 2 or 3 red crystals.

If you have accomplished the desire, then karma comes for the actions you have taken to. This karma is described at the bottom of the card. All the received karma is placed under your avatar. Clearly pointed crystals (white and black) of karma are simply added, and undefined karma (tricolor crystals) is played with 3 dices of dark, light and red colors. The result is determined by the largest value of the dice. If the largest number falls on a light dice, light karma is added, if it is dark on the dark one, and if the red cube "won", then at the value of 5 and 6 - you add an additional desire crystal, and for 1, 2, 3 or 4 – one crystal of desire is removed. If two of three dices have the same value, the third is always considered to work, even if it has a lower value than the other two. If the same value falls on all three dice - this is a big luck, and you can choose any action you want: to add light karma, or remove the dark, or remove the desire crystal, or add a crystal of desire.
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Hearts Blazing: Melodramatic Sci-Fi Adventure
description:
Hearts Blazing is a casual storygame for 3 to 5 players who have a love of episodic fiction and about 1 to 2 hours. After generating a fiction setting together, players take on the roles of dynamic but recognizable spec-fic archetypes.

Drawing episode frameworks from a plotline deck, players collaboratively create an episodic epic of conflict and romance. By bidding clichés on each episode they capture keywords associated with their hidden motivations and compete to see who has final say on the fate of their story.

While there is no winner, per se, the character who secured the most of their keywords reveals the post session denouement of their character last, getting final say on plot outcomes.

name: My Bear Wears... Game
description:
Bears love to dress up and are playing with their box of dressing up clothes today.

There are socks, hats, gloves, waistcoats, ties and scarves in all manner of different colours to play with. Can you roll the foam dice and match the outfits shown to those the bears are wearing on your playing cards? Be the first to make 3 matches to win.

name: Railway Rivals Map T: Middle Earth
description:
An expansion map for Railway Rivals and Dampfross. It has been sold at various conventions.

The map covers Middle Earth, as described by J.R.R. Tokien (Lord of the Rings; The Hobbit).
mechanics: Crayon Rail System, Network and Route Building

name: Climax or Bust
description:
First decide who will begin as the Narrator. All other players blindly draw three white Story Cards. The Narrator draws a scarlet Starter Card and reads it aloud to begin the storyline.

Each player then submits a Story Card face-down. Shuffling before reading, the Narrator selects a favorite to continue the storyline and reads it aloud.

If your card is selected to continue the storyline, re-up to thee white Story Cards with the option of swapping out one or both of your remaining cards. If your card is not selected, tough s#*t, you'll have to make do with only your remaining cards.

Repeat this for (at least) one more round. The card selected to complete the storyline on the final round (providing its fantastic conclusion) earns the scarlet Starter Card as a point. Congratulations, you've climaxed!

Pass the Narrator role to the next player. All other players re-up to three new white Story Cards and continue.

The first player to have a threesome wins! Collect three points with scarlet Starter Cards, that is.

—description from the publisher

name: Noble Armada: 3rd Edition
description:
Noble Armada is a tactical, miniatures based, space fleet battle game designed to deliver a game experience that balances deep tactics with cinematic action.

Players create fleets for one of the five Royal Houses from the Fading Suns setting and wage war using a ruleset that focuses on fleet command. Careful positioning of ships will enable a fleet to unleash devastating weapon barrages. Targeted attacks and flanking actions can sever lines of communication, hindering an opposing commander’s ability to issue orders to their fleet. Boarding actions allow you to capture opposing ships, and add their resources to your own fleet.

Format: 6" x 9", Spiral-bound Softcover, 288 B&W Pages
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Hexaract
description:
A solitaire game for the decktet.

Kingdom is facing the biggest threat ever! Dark, ancient forces have returned and are unleashing their evil and terror causing destruction and mayhem. You are Jacynth's most famous adventurer given an important task - you must retrieve 6 pieces of an ancient artifact and bring it to the place where the ritual will be performed in order to destroy the source of this evil. Its minions will try to stop you along the way.

On your turn you roll five six-sided dice in order to defeat enemies or overcome dificult terrain ahead of you. Every turn there are three cards in your path that can be one of three types: enemy, location or event. When you roll the dice you can assign pairs of dice with total value that matches exactly the rank of the card in order to overcome it. Undefeated enemies deal you damage and so do the locations that are in your path more then one turn due to fatigue. Unresolved events make you lose resources that you can gain when defeating enemies. You can also spend your resources to travel easier through locations. When you make it through the whole deck (there are no more cards in your path) and you have one of each type of resource you win the game!
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Print & Play

name: Medieval Microcosm
description:
A card game for 2-4 players with a general Medieval historical theme.

Players share a common deck of 60 cards of 4 card types: Character, Holding, Group and Event. Cards have a points value between 1 and 5 and 1 of 2 types of abilities (cards used in combination with each other or cards that initiate an event/activity). Abilities activate as soon as the card is played.

Each player starts with 2 cards and then take turns to draw 1 card from the deck and play 1 card from their hand. When a card is played it is placed face up on the table in front of the player. If the card has a non-combo ability (e.g. discard 1 group, steal character, draw 1 card etc.) this gets used immediately. All the cards in front of you are known as your Fief.

When the last card is drawn the discard is shuffled and cards drawn from it (cards only ever go into the discard pile when another card sends them there). When there is no deck or discard left, players continue taking turns, playing one card at a time from their hands until all cards are played. At this point scoring is undertaken.

Cards score their basic points value but if they are combo cards may score extra points if the player holds the right combination of cards. The final scores are based on all the cards in your Fief and the combos they make. The winner is the player with the most points at the end of the game.

name: Bomber Command
description: BOMBER COMMAND is a module in the battle over Britain game series, that adds multi-crew bombers to the system. This module does not contain rules, it only comes with game components (specifically, the Bomber Command counter sheet (32 planes), Dogfight Display, Reference Card, Battle over Britain counter sheet (32 planes), and 4-page folder)
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Ancient Civilizations
description:
A dice and record keeping game for 2-4+ players with a Civilization building theme.

Each Civilization has 14 stats: Cities, Infrastructure, Ideas, Victory, Points, Population, Stability, Territories, Food, Resources, Culture, Military, Gold, Zeal and Wonders. These stats can go up and sometimes down with each player keeping track of the development of his civilization on a record sheet.

There are 13 common tracks, one of which (the Pre-History track) is used in the pre-game, the other 12 during the main game. Most tracks are 13 spaces long, including the start space, and circular in nature so that players can move their markers round them in a continuous loop. The 13 tracks are:
Pre-History Track (for pre-game only)
Knowledge Track
Military Track
Cultural Track
Agriculture Track
Industry Track
Building Track
Wonder Track
Religion Track
Government Track
Leader Track
Trade Track
Naval Track
There are also several charts which are referenced from various points on the tracks.

Players start the game with 5 points in Population, Territory, Food, Stability, Zeal, Military, and Culture. They also receive additional starting stats through the pre-game phase.

During the pre-game phase players place one pawn each on the start space of the Pre-History track which has 23 spaces (including the start). Players take turns rolling the die and moving their pawns forward along the track. When a player lands on a space they get the indicated boosts to their stats. They also put a marker on the space. If a player lands on a space that already has a marker they move to any space of their choice. When every space on the Pre-History Track has been marked the pre-game ends.

During the main game turns are conducted over a series of 16 phases, with players taking turns within each phase. During most phases each player will roll one die and move along the indicated track (i.e. during the leader phase, players move on the leader track). Players gets the stat bonuses as described in the space they land on. Certain phases allow players to increase population size in exchange for resources, trade with other players, or declare war on other players in an attempt to steal territory from them.

The game ends when anyone reaches 20 or more territories. If a player ever goes to zero territory or population he automatically loses. At the end of the game, the player with the most Victory Points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bulletproof
description:
Description from the publisher:

Bulletproof is a game for 2-5 players that blends tactics, strategy and luck as players compete to build criminal empires. Characters use corruption, bribes and many other secret weapons to interfere with other players, acquire territories and put money in their safe. Action cards can be used to finish jobs, steal territories, call in favors or stored in your safe to pay off debts. Territory cards and the sets that they form include special abilities that are activated by “Finish a Job” action cards. Make sure to visit the Black Market, it might have the territory or action card that you need to build out your empire and beat your rivals. Finishing a job allows players to create unique and clever combos for stealing territory, filling your safe or ruining another character’s plans. While building your empire be sure to fill in your safe with action cards or you might be forced to give up your territories.

name: Tanks: Honey Tank Expansion
description: Lightweight and fast, the Honey was classed and operated as an armored reconnaissance tank. It saw early combat in N. Africa as a scout vehicle while still providing good infantry support.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Tanks: Grant
description:
The Grant was a US tank used by the British in N. Africa. It was rushed into production to support Britain's need for an armored vehicle early in the war. It's high profile with a 37mm gun provided some infantry support and its main 76mm gun was later upgraded to be capable of armor piercing.

Comes with cards so you can pick your tanks and crew, upgrade them to your specifications, defeat your enemy (or die trying), and be ready for the rematch!
categories: Collectible Components, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Battlefront Miniatures Ltd, Gale Force Nine, LLC

name: Mega Man: The Board Game – Boss Pack
description: This boss pack contains all the cards that you will need to modify the decks found in Mega Man: the Board Game to customize your battle against the evil Robot Masters.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Mad Max
description:
A card game for 2-4+ players based on the Mad Max series of movies.

Players share a common deck comprising 7 different card types (with 10 different cards in each suit): Max, Leadership, Foe, Vehicle, Aid, Survivor and Location.

Each player is dealt 7 cards and then take turns, with each turn comprising 3 phases:

Drive Phase
- Fill your hand to 8 cards.

Fight Phase
- Discard 1 card to produces an effect dependant on the type of card:
• Max = Look at an opponent’s hand
• Leadership = Look at next 7 cards in deck
• Foe = Opponent must discard 1 random card
• Vehicle = Search discard for 1 card
• Aid = Steal 1 random card from an opponent’s hand
• Survivor = Draw 2 cards
• Location = Draw 3 cards and discard 2 cards

Survive Phase
- Discard down to 7 cards.
- If you have 1 card of each type this is a meld and can be played (discarded)

The first player to make 3 melds is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: War Games Rules 1000 BC to 500 AD
description:
Description from the rulebook:
These rules are the result of some six months discussion and testing, embodying research and experiment covering over two years. We regard them as a step forward in realism and interest, and are confident that the can cover Ancient Wargaming needs in the period, approximately 1,000 B.C. to 500 A.D. We do not regard them as the last word by any means, and will always be glad to receive criticism and suggestions based on a reasonable amount of playing experience.

The rules have been adopted by the Worthing Group for the 1969 Wargamers Championship, and references to the particular requirements of the Championship will be found in the text. We recommend that the basic points values system be adopted for choosing forces, without course keeping to the 800 points maximum which is the limit for the Championship armies only.
- From the Rules Intro

User summary (for the second edition):
The Second Edition was published immediately after the first edition, titled War Games Rules 1000 B.C to 500 A.D (1st Edition) and were updated during the Worthing Group for the 1969 Wargamers Championship to expand the applicable eras and associated armies for use in the 1970 and 1971 National Wargames Championships.
Most of the changes are minor rules changes and clarifications for army unit types in the expanded eras (notably the Egyptian and Assyrian).

name: Arcade Fighter
description:
Description from the designer:

Arcade Fighter is a 2-6 players tabletop game. Players select a fighter and corresponding data sheet. Players draw symbol cards from the same deck and place them onto their data sheets. Players progress the position of their cards to match combinations on their data sheets to perform attacks. Players can also hinder an opponent's strategy by striking away cards. Arcade Fighter is a versatile game. You can play one-on-one or play tag team matches. While the basic mechanics remain the same, the game also allows for arena cards to be used to add more attacks and effects that make the game unique every time.

name: Guild Ball: The Alchemist's Guild – The New Age of Science
description:
Description from the publisher:

“This woman isn’t like Midas, or what we have known before. She is a true scientific breakthrough, not some loon trying to prove the impossible”
— Calculus, Alchemist’s Guild

Master of alchemical destruction, Smoke controls the field by drifting her teammates corrosive and fiery blasts around to trap the opposition. Merciless in how she slowly saps the strength of the enemy players, incomparable in boosting her own teams output.

Truly terrifying to encounter on the field, these alchemists will cripple their opposition’s health and momentum with poison and fire to reduce their mobility, whilst enhancing themselves with powerful abilities. Experienced coaches will enjoy having a varied, challenging playstyle – and opponents will enjoy the challenge of trying to overcome them!

The cutting edge of scientific advancement, this set includes: a ball, 6 player cards, bases, and 6 players: Smoke, Naja, Veteran Katalyst, Venin, Compound, Crucible.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Medieval, Miniatures, Sports, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: PT 109
description:
PT 109 is a solitaire game depicting John F. Kennedy's exploits in the South Pacific during WWII as the skipper of a PT Boat. This game is part of a three Game series (Profile in Courage) which will cover various episodes or crises in the life of John F. Kennedy. The other two games in the series are Election 1960 and DEFCON 1: The Cuban Missile Crisis.

The Game is played over a period of 4 Rounds, with 10 turns per Round. The solitaire player, takes the part of Kennedy as he tries to successfully complete missions against the Japanese in the Solomon Islands in 1943. Each Round has several phases, which include drawing cards which represent Random Events, Missions, and possible contact with Japanese military units, such as Barges, Destroyers, Aircraft attacks, etc. If Contact is made it leads to a Combat phase.

Once the player knows what his orders are (his Mission he must complete), he must prepare his PT boat for the mission. This includes a series of decisions as to the amount of fuel, ammunition, medical supplies, etc. that he will need to increase his chance of success. Victory Points are accumulated over the four rounds to determine if the player has scored enough points to win the game.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling

name: Anaconda: Naval Warfare on the Mississippi and Gulf Coast 1862-1863
description: Civil war era naval miniatures rules.
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: QCD
description:
Description from the rulebook:

QCD is a game based on the rules of how quarks combine to form particles of matter and anti-matter... A QCD deck contains 24 quark cards and 24 anti-quark cards"

The deck has 6 suits with each card having a negative counterpart. There are multiple games that can be played with the deck. Listed in the rulebook are "Quark Rummy", "Disintegration", and "Annihilation"

name: Dust 1947: Type 47 Heavy Tesla Walker
description:
Description from the publisher:

The People Liberation Army (PLA) fights a relentless war against the Imperial Japan in China and South-East Asia. But as part of the grand SSU Bloc, its forces can be found all over the World where the Revolution is fought. The Type 47 is a new walker that has been recently issued to the SSU Army, starting with the PLA. For years its armored regiments received second hand vehicles but this has changed recently. Thanks to its two massive Tesla guns, the Type 47 is a threat to even the heaviest vehicles on the planet.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: MyStory Phase 1: Awakening
description:
Four individuals wake up in a run down room in an abandoned apartment building. Their memories have been wiped clean, with not even a recollection of their own identity. They do however possess a strange ability to sense each others thoughts. It quickly becomes clear that they have been deposited in that particular place, and time, to accomplish a task on behalf of a mysterious controller. They must now venture out into an unfamiliar world with no choice but to help.

MyStory is a 1-4 player, co-operative board game. Built as a living-novel, game operators will progress through an immersive, custom story deck that will reward success by directing them to specific chapters in the story book. As the experience progresses questions will be answered, but even more will be presented, until everything comes into focus in the final episode.
Determine your objectives and solve them on the game board by strategically placing location tiles, encountering the stories characters and manipulating assets you discover along the way. Everything will have to come together perfectly for those objectives to be accomplished.
Space and time, this world and beyond, faith and creation, and finally, reality. Join in My Story, help solve the Mystery.
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Storytelling

name: Cave Pilot 55: Stay Frosty Expansion
description:
The goal of this ice themed expansion is to fly the cave, collect reputation points and destroy or face the flying Ice Skeleton.

The flying Ice Skeleton is accompanied by an Ice Mummy and an Ice Ghost, whereas you can also end up in an Ice Storm or been fired at by an Ice Ray.

In a game of Cave Pilot 55 that makes use of large beasts like the flying Ice Skeleton, the cave is slid outward to create a small corridor. This corridor can be used to place the large flying beast in the center of the cave.

On top of the regular 'static' challenges, the flying Ice Skeleton presents an extra moving obstacle affecting its surroundings.
Each turn the beast moves 1 or 2 positions through the cave. Based on the strengths and weaknesses of the beast, players need to strategically plan and time their route through the cave.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Market-Garden
description: Market-Garden (September 1944). Montgomery’s plan to breakthrough to the Rhine. US, British, and Polish airborne forces attempt to seize key bridges while British 30th Corps attempts to punch through to Arnhem. Smaller scenarios would cover portions of the campaign. Three to four maps, 12-16 counter sheets

name: Inspector McClue: Designer Shoes and Handbags
description:
The tiny, quaint town of Little Hosbawm in Essex seems to be attracting all the celebrity icons and all the media that comes with it. However when one of the residents is killed, the town of Little Hosbawm is rocked to its core. Ronaldo Razzi, the owner of a number of accessory shops called Papa Razzi is the victim of this horrific act and has been found with a white stiletto heel pushed into his temple. The question is who killed him? It's clear that it is one of his neighbours or friends, but who? Well with the help of Inspector McClue it is your job to find out who the murderer is.
For lover's of the popular Murder Mystery series this is the perfect game to play with a group of friends. All you have to do is choose which of your friends play's what character and create a shopping list for the food you want to serve at your party. Then after your meal you have a tricky murder to solve.
This game includes a DVD with narration to guide you through the mystery. This game is guaranteed to be drop dead fun, and is ideal for lovers of the murder mystery series of games. This game is for 6-8 players and suitable for ages 13 and up.
Box Contains:
Party Planner with rules, receipts, music and decorating tips
Character booklets including their roles, background information and a few tasty secrets
Place cards
Party invitations with envelopes for each character
Six secret clues
CD with introduction, scene setter, summary of events and solution to the crime
Characters include:

Jenni Johns – Mainly known as Terry John’s second wife, she is also a designer in her own right
Gemma Overtan – Jenni’s stepmother used to be a cabaret singer and prides herself on being regularly mistaken for Jenni’s sister
Nikki Nice – Made her name as a glamour model, but is now a successful entrepreneur with her own production company and chain of shops
Krystal – A style advisor, lifestyle coach and healer, who tends to the spiritual and fashionable needs of the rich and famous
Bryan Biggs – Razzi’s business partner, a man with his fingers in a great many pies
Terry Johns – A recently retired footballer whose colourful personal life made him even more famous than his exploits on the pitch
Stevie Scowl – A television producer, responsible for the highly successful new-talent series The Y-O-Y Show, which has at least made him a star
Reverend I-Prayer – One of Stevie’s discoveries, a charismatic young clergyman soon to star in his own series, Never Mind the Cassocks

name: Halo: Fleet Battles – UNSC Phoenix Class Support Ship
description:
Description from the publisher:

Fans of Halo will undoubtedly recognise the unmistakable profile of the Phoenix-class Colonial Support Vessel, the most famous of which is known by the name Spirit of Fire. Replete with its Pelican Boarding Craft our version of the Phoenix-class brings UNSC players a new Large size model with which to assemble their fleets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Video Game Theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Robo Diner
description:
"The test is about to begin. Gather the correct combination of food items as they move on the conveyor belt and deliver it to the organic test subjects. Execute the right subroutines to serve them what would keep their squishy meat components operating within their optimal parameters. The robot model that performs the best will be selected for mass production. Ensure that it is you."

Robo Diner is a fast-paced family card game featuring set collection and simultaneous action selection mechanics for 2-4 players ages 12 and up. Players start the game with a robot waiter character card that is placed in front of a specific section of the conveyor belt. When a round begins, players will secretly choose whether or not they will move the belt by one step.

Food items on the belt can be manipulated with the use of power cards. Players pick up the card that is located in front of their character in order to fulfill customer orders. At the end of the game, the winner is the player that has managed to please customers the most by grabbing the right cards from the belt, completing orders, and avoiding mistakes.
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: NYX
description:
NYX is a highly portable asymmetric card-lapping game for two players or for four players. With four players, NYX plays as two partnerships.

In NYX, you assume role of an immortal Scion locked in an eternal struggle to influence mortal thoughts. Take the side of Morpheus, God of Dreams and bearer of prophetic visions. Or take the side of Morpheus’ menacing brother, Phobia, bringer of phantasms and nightmares. Use your powers of prophetic dreams, nightmarish phantasms, powerful rifts, and enchanted cloaks in a clash for control of the ancient realm known as the Dream Plain.

The goal of NYX is to gain the most Victory Points. You earn Victory Points by composing Divinations to collect Poppies and by building connected territories on the Dream Plain of either Nightmare or Prophecy. Final scoring is based on the amount of area controlled and the number of Poppies cached.

The game of NYX is inspired by the legend Morpheus and Phobia. They are brothers and scions of ancient gods:
Their father is Hypnos, the gentle, black-winged God of Sleep; twin to the Lord of Death; and ‘balm to the mortal soul.’ Their mother is Nyx, the frighteningly fierce and powerful primordial Goddess of Night borne of original Chaos, her overwhelming might revered and feared by all other gods...even Zeus himself.

The sons of Nyx and Hypnos dwell within an immense cavern buried in the deepest chasm of the Underworld. Each night, Phobia, always envious of Morpheus’ renown, wages a great war with his formidable brother. Since the beginning of time, while mortal men slumber, the two scions have been locked in an eternal struggle vying for absolute control of mortal visions and dreams. At sundown, the two race from the depths of the Underworld as a cyclone rising like a smokey mist of bats. The two brothers hurtle towards their battle and their destiny on the Dream Plain.

name: Great Pacific War: Co-Prosperity Sphere – A Scenario Book
description:
Description from the publisher:

In late 1941, Imperial Japan embarked on a suicidal course by launching an aggressive war against the United States. Outmatched in every meaningful category of economic, political and military power, sometimes by astronomical margins, Japan never had a chance to win a military victory in the Second World War. No amount of battlefield valor could change the final outcome and the Empire's defeat was only a matter of time.

Co-Prosperity Sphere is an expansion book for our Great Pacific War game that studies what circumstances might have given Imperial Japan an opportunity to match American power. It’s part of our Long War naval game setting, which includes Second World War at Sea: Plan Z. In this alternative history, Japan has greatly increased her power and rules an Empire of 153 million people while holding firm political and economic dominion over the puppet Chinese Empire as well.

Co-Prosperity Sphere includes six new scenarios and 90 new playing pieces to bring this setting to Great Pacific War. This is not a complete game; ownership of Great Pacific War is required to play these scenarios.

name: Dice Age: Eggstinction
description:
The Ice Age is approaching! The Dinos must gather as much food and supplies as they can to grow and thrive. But watch out for the volcano looming over the island...it might destroy everything!

Dice Age: Eggstinction is an entry level strategy game for 2-5 young/new game players and families to introduce them to contemporary game concepts like player asymmetry, resource collection, tech trees, and victory points. Players chose from a variety of dinosaur species and move around an island gathering goods in order to produce eggs...the first to produce 6 eggs in their nest wins the game! On your turn you'll roll a bunch of giant dice to populate the island with resources like insects, ferns, ginko, meat, and fish. Then you'll move around the island (possibly using your dino's unique ability) and gather up those resources to feed and grow your broods to produce more eggs. As you nest fills up, you'll gain new and enhanced skills to help you on your journey. But be careful when you gather goods from the dangerous areas of the island, as the volcano might erupt laying waste to valuable goods and scaring you back to safety.

Double-sided components are designed to enable competitive play between gamers and non/early-gamers at the same time and let young kids grow into the game by watching and learning from older players.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Variable Player Powers
publishers: (Looking for a publisher), Black Straw Games

name: Voyages of the Space Beagle
description:
A card game based on the Science Fiction novel by A.E. van Vogt. Players meld cards to complete adventures.

Players share a common deck. The deck has 10 suits: Ship, Crew, Location, Alien, Power, Politics, Trick, Equipment, Investigation, Naxialism. There are 20-23 cards in each suit. Each suit has a unique ability which can be activated during the action phase. For example a Ship card can be used to draw 2 cards from the deck, a Crew card allows you to search the discard for 1 card etc.

Players take turns with each turn comprising 4 phases:

Encounter Phase

Draw 2 cards from the deck and put them in your hand.


Action Phase

You may play (discard 1 card from your hand) to activate its ability.


Resolution Phase

If you have 1 card from each of the 10 suits in your hand, you may make an adventure meld. Place the meld in a pile beside you.
If you made a meld draw 10 new cards.


Logistics Phase

Max hand size is 10 cards. discard excess cards.


The first player to complete 4 adventure melds wins the game.

name: Renge Shogi
description:
Inspired by Kyoto Shogi, Renge Shogi, designed by Michael Sandeman, is played on a 7x7 board. Each player has seven pieces, from left to right along the back rank: Silver, Pawn, Gold, King, Gold, Pawn, Silver. Whenever a piece moves (except the King), it alternately promotes and demotes:

Silver - Lance
Gold - Knight
Left Pawn - Bishop
Right Pawn - Rook

As in Shogi, players may drop captured pieces on any empty space, but with either side facing up. There are no restrictions on where players may drop pieces; for example, you may mate with a pawn drop and have two pawns on the same file.

Players may also drop pieces from the opponent's hand. The only restriction is that you may not mate by dropping from the opponent's hand.

name: Wargame The English Civil War 1642 to 1651
description:
A series of books that provide wargame rules and colour photocopiable figures for miniatures battles. Each book tackles a specific time period of history.

Wargame The English Civil War 1642-1651 covers the English Civil War in the Seventeenth Century. Simple rules are provided written by Andy Callan, noted wargame designer. The rules can also be used with other miniatures.

The miniatures are drawn and coloured by Peter Dennis, the well known face behind Osprey books, many illustrations and Martin Wallace's games. The buyer photocopies or scans the images provided, folds and cuts them out to make armies.
categories: Miniatures, Pike and Shot, Renaissance, Wargame

name: Code Name: Nova
description:
The first supplement for the modern miniatures wargame Merc: Dogs of War.

The 34-page rulebook and double-sided pull-out reference sheet cover statistics for small arms, artillery, tanks, APC's, helicopters, and other weapons used by Russia and Warsaw Pact countries. The rules also include TO&E's, communications capabilities, and expanded armor rules.

Description from the rulebook:

"This booklet is a supplement to the Merc-D.O.W. set of rules. It is to incorporate the weapons used by the Russians and Warsaw Pact countries. Also it will have expanded rules for armor and armored combat."

name: Dice of the Dead: Tokyo Armageddon
description: A board game based on the tabletop RPG "Dice of the Dead" by SNE/Cosaic. It is based on the same world however it takes place about 6 months after the RPG timeline, just before a nuclear bomb is going to be dropped on zombie dominated Tokyo. It is here that the half-zombie players must throw themselves, as the last hope of saving Tokyo, into stopping the nuclear missle from being detinated, while fighitng zombies. It is a cooperative story game in which your companions one after another fall into the horde of zombies while trying the accomplish the mission.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Storytelling

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Ozrik's Powerale
description: This additional drink card came as part of the SlugCrew Minor Reward for 2014.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Party People: Sexy Edition
description: All Party People name tags can be combined to make larger sets. Each set includes a game for 2 or more players. All name tags and beads are plastic. Sexy Edition is a game of improv where players begin by describing how their character would seduce a famous person and then try to avoid elimination by talking in character about the scenario a judge describes. The last remaining player wins the game.

name: Lost World Lunch
description:
Description from the publisher:

Lost World Lunch is a quick-play card game for 2-6 players. Each player takes on the role of a Dinosaur (the deck has three carnivores and three herbivores). Your goal as the Dinosaur is to get as many Victory Points as possible by Biting, Clawing, Stomping, and Smashing the pesky, trophy-seeking Victorian Hunters as they sip their tea and eat their lunch.

A game takes about 15-20 minutes to play. Each player is dealt three Hunters that they are racing against their opponents to complete. You complete a Hunter by matching (in order) all of the symbols on the Hunter’s card with your Attack cards, while trying to use the best Victory Point card on each Hunter.

Each Hunter is also looking to catch a specific Dinosaur (that upper left hand corner image of the Dinosaur on Sergei’s card). If a player completes a Hunter that was looking to catch them, they earn double points.

But watch out! There are special cards that allow your opponent to steal your Attack Cards or even swap your Hunter with theirs (getting all the associated Victory Points as well)!

Team Play and Simple Play (for young kids) As there are three Carnivores and three Herbivores in the deck, players can split into two teams and compete together, rather than playing a free-for-all. Also, if you ignore the VP and specials, you can use the game as a simple color/symbol matching game with younger children–work them up to Victory Points after they learn math skills and finally teach them the Special Rules when they have mastered Victory Points.

name: Konito ? 2
description:
Konito? 2 can be played individually or in teams, the idea being to complete the fill-in-the-blank statements on the game cards as fast as possible.
Song, sport, literature, everyday ... find in team the end of the most famous phrases and phrases extracted from all domains.

This game can be used to renew the basic game Konito or without a board using only cards, hourglass and a new rule.

name: Adventures in Zombiewood
description:
Description from the publisher:

Adventures in Zombiewood is a card and dice-based game that pits you and other unfortunate actors against a horde of Z-lebrities. In a world where the undead have overrun mankind, the only form of entertainment we have left is reenacting movies of times gone by. Now it's your turn to shine as you remake your favorite zombie classics.

Adventures is Zombiewood is a cooperative game where players each command a different actor each turn. They use the actor to take on the Z-lebrities that spawn during each Scene they are shooting. They roll dice in an attempt to match the symbols required to defeat the Z-lebrity. Anytime a player is unable to defeat the Z-lebrity, their actor is zombified and joins the growing horde to be faced in the game's final scene. Combat must be fast (as you are trying to conserve film reel) so each combat phase is timed, and all players must be finished with their attack rolls before the timer signals the end of the scene. Team strategy and quick thinking will give you a chance to survive to the end of your movie. How many stars will your film earn... and will you survive to find out?

name: The "Science-Mad Kids' Club" Treehouse Building Game
description:
User Summary

A simple two-player children's game inspired by the spirit and exploits of The Mad Scientists' Club book series. The object of the game is to be the first player to build a treehouse.

The players each have their own team of four kids who are members of the Science-Mad Kids' Club. The players assign various actions for their kids to perform, including finding a suitable tree, gathering tools, and constructing various parts of the treehouse. The kids can be assigned to work alone, or in teams of two to four. The more kids assigned to a task, the greater the chance of success. There is no direct player interaction, just a competition to finish the task first.

The Treehouse Building Game was originally designed in 2003, in conjunction with a re-reading of the Mad Scientists' Club stories, and was first released as a print-and-play design in 2017.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection, Stat Check Resolution, Worker Placement

name: Bobina
description:
Bobina is a game for two players, played on a hexhex board. The goal is to form a loop with your stones, and prevent your opponent from doing the same.

One player plays black stones, the other owns the white, and both players may play grey.

Rules

Setup: place one grey stone on each of the 6 corners of the board.


The players take turns. On your turn you must either place 1 grey stone or 1 stone of your color onto any empty space.
The first player to form a loop of her own color, possibly including grey stones, wins. If the board fills without a loop of either color forming, the player who was the first to play a stone of her own color loses.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Boss of the Board
description:
Boss of the Board is a game for family and friends, and ages old and young, which combines classic board game elements, whilst creating solutions to problems that were so often overlooked.
Multiple ways of making money, multiple directions to choose and a portfolio of different businesses that can be opened at any location with as many employees as you can afford.

Develop your strategy to ensure you will be the first to make a Million.

A basic monopoly like game set in thw orld of business.

--description from the publisher

name: Rallye Do Portugal
description:
The race is divided into four leg. Two Types of tests are possible: Time Controls (CH) or Special Stages (SS).
Each tests has a pre-fixed number of turns to be executed. But work differently: CH rewards regularity. SS rewards speed.
The movement of cars is made by token 1-6 numbered. Each leg distributes a predefined number of token.
The board is divided in cases, where only one car can stand in each case. It's a wide two lanes with narrow points to one lane.

Wins who in the end counts less penalties, in the number of turns set on the itinerary cards, separately for each CH and each SS.

In CH, you receive one minute of penalty for each missing case on arrival, or two minutes for each case over the arrival.

In SS, instead, you add +1 minutes at base time (predefined) for each missing case on arrival, or -1 minutes at base time for each case over the arrival.

name: Les campagnes de Domitien
description:
Published in Vae Victis magazine 68s, add a new scenario for Optimus Princeps: La campagne du Principat de Domitien (81-96).

Also adds new rules and counters for the scenario: German Civilians, Roman Fronts, Off Map Boxes, and rules for Quadii, Marcomanii and Sarmats.

name: Dust 1947: Luftwaffe Fallschirmjäger Hero Pack
description:
Death from the skies over Babylon! The Fallschirmjäger Heroes have arrived to lead their forces to victory during Operation Kondor. All three are members of the Fallschirmjäger, the Axis paratroopers, part of the Luftwaffe (Air Force) and are superb leaders of men in battle.
Galeazzo belongs to the Folgore Division, the elite paratrooper formation of the Italian Army. Kurt and Rolf are veterans that have been part of countless airborne operations. The heroes are presented here in Babylon camouflage pattern, as used in the Middle-East circa 1947.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board

name: Bushido: Bobata
description:
Description from the publisher:

Bobata the bell ringer's awesome weapon is at the disposal of the Savage Wave. As Bobata swings the mighty bell around his head he is equally inspiring to allies as he is fear inducing to his foes.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Wu-Zang
description:
Description from the publisher:

Only the shrewdest and cruellest Sho-Bakemono survive to become a Hexer. Wu-Zang manipulates the fates, cursing opponents before disappearing into the shadows.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Waka
description:
Description from the publisher:

Waka finds happiness in the smaller things in life. In fact nothing delights him more than lobbing his favourite toy, a huge stone Buddha head, at anyone unlucky enough to get in the way of his rampages. Those that attempt to get in close, find him just as satisfied to bring it violently, crashing down on their heads! Many foes’ last moments have been filled with the bass rumble of Waka’s chortling.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Okina & Oto
description:
Description from the publisher:

The mischievous, lazy pair have tied their war drum to the back of a slave. They ride into battle charged with getting the best out of their companions, the pounding rhythm of the drum drives the Bakemono on to achieve their full potential.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Oni Slave
description:
Description from the publisher:

It is unknown when the beasts of the wave started taking captives. These are no hostages though, they are put to work or put to the sword by their less than benign captors. The blood of the Oni sends the slaves into a rage on the battlefield, allowing them to achieve feats of strength they would not have dreamed of back in the fields.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Jun
description:
Description from the publisher:

Those who taste the blood of a demon are driven mad by the raw alien power coursing through their veins, warping their senses and souls. Jun was already mad. An evil and impure man the Oni’s mad dog to set upon their enemies, savage and loyal to his masters he will do anything for the next taste, putting himself in harm’s way without a thought for his own safety.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Giant Cave Bat
description:
Description from the publisher:

Deep in the belly of the world in the dark places the Bakemono tribes call their own the bats grow large. Whether it is through the consumption of the rare and toxic fungus that the bats in the warrens grow to such size or because the Sho Bak Shugenja are not opposed to the occasional Bakemono snack to help with the diet no one could comment. Those brave explorers who have ventured deep enough into caverns where the bats dwell don’t live long after hearing a strange clicking. As in battle the bats sweep in from the skies, driving their targets to the ground, their suffering only ended then the bat has had its fill of their blood or when the noxious toxics the bats carry in the mouths have overwhelmed their bodies.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Zung Fu
description:
Description from the publisher:

For so long have the Shugenja of the Bakemono tribes lived and worked with darkness and shadow that they seem to see it almost as a living breathing entity. They whisper, listen and learn from the deep blackness in which they dwell. Where others see emptiness they see power and an ancient knowledge. So long have they lingered there that in battle the Shugenja are able to harness the endless dark strength of the shadows to grip enemies in place to be hacked to pieces, or to shroud ones very soul obscuring it from the light. Those who have lived to tell the tale are never the same and many seem lost after, the light behind their eyes extinguished forever.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Xi-Han & Zoo
description:
Description from the publisher:

It is hard to tell if Xi-Han had lost his mind before or after he consumed every unusual mushroom he could find. The exact purpose of this pursuit remains a mystery. What is clear is that bizarrely he has managed to develop the ability to focus and force his body to replicate the effects of these rare and potent fungi. Sending his body into spasm and unleashing the deranged and violent “Zoo” for a short while to wreak havoc on his enemies. He also still maintains a constant supply of mushrooms on his person that he can throw in battle to Blind, Frighten or enrage anyone unlucky enough to inhale the spores.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Scheibenkleister!
description: Each of the up to 4 players has to move (options as in Halma) 6 of the 10 pawns to the opposite side of the board. Once a player successfully reaches the goal zone with one pawn the center disc of the game board is rotated 90° left or right. The first player to bring 6 pawns to the goal zone wins.

name: Peninsula: North Korea Crisis
description:
Peninsula is a 2-player asymmetrical strategy card game capturing the tension of the 2017 North Korea Crisis. One player controls North Korea, the other the United States. As the crisis unfolds, players will try to use a combination of diplomacy and military posturing in a bid to claim victory without the situation devolving into a conflict that could leave both sides in ruins.

Players attempt to reduce their opponent's resolve and control regional tension by playing diplomacy and progress cards. When tension rises above certain levels, players receive more progress cards and the crisis develops, yet these cards are the most powerful way to reduce opposition resolve. Each decision could have far-reaching consequences and the challenge is to claim victory in the crisis without both sides destroying each other.

—description from the designer
categories: Modern Warfare, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management

name: Westhope
description:
In the near future, humanity suffers an existential threat in the form of a highly negative first contact with an alien race. The result is the Seeding – an alien invasion, but not a normal one. The invasion comes not in high-tech assault, but in a massive injection of foreign species, many only semi-intelligent.

Westhope centers around the actions of eight main characters who, through your actions, attempt to survive and resist.

Westhope is not simply a board game. It is a cluster of multiple games containing a common core mechanic called the Plan. For example, during a period the characters may be attempting to search for refugees over a wide area. They play a Journey mission. They search, evade or face enemies, working to survive while journeying over a large area. The next mission may be penetrating a facility, and they instead play a Tactical mission, where play style is more tactical RPG game with the Plan at its core. During Interludes, a specialized form of choose-your-own-adventure sets the characters and their allies on different paths, and pulls you into their lives so that they are far more than simply stats.

Westhope will have nearly every style of play available. Its core is an ambitious campaign where you truly begin to empathize with the characters and their allies (and enemies). However, players can engage in separate solo, cooperative, or competitive modes in each of the individual board game elements.

The campaign spans months and years, and expansions continue the story, some adding new board game methods to play.

—description from the publisher

name: Fotosafari
description: The board has a square grid on the four sides, numbers 2 to 12. In the middle, 10 wooden trees are randomly placed and, at random, one pawn per player. Then each player rolls two dice, sums them up and places on one of the four boxed number one of the 10 wooden game animals. At this point you have to move the animal with the result of either of the two dice. With the other die you can do one of the following: cancel it and do nothing; move his pawn orthogonally, in the desired direction; move another animal already on the board, in the direction of the head. At the end of these movements, if the pawn of the turn player is orthogonally within 4 boxes from an animal (or even more than one) without the line of sight being obstructed, he can "snap a photo" by picking the corresponding card from the deck . The first one who manages to collect ten photos of the ten different animals won the game.

name: DC Comics Dice Masters: Speedsters Promo Cards
description:
You'll want to get your hands on these 3 Dice Masters cards - and fast! Tap into the speedforce like never before with Jay Garrick, The Flash, and Professor Zoom. Corresponding dice separate.

This promo card set for DC Comics Dice Masters contains three cards:


Jay Garrick: Leadfoot (Blank Art/Sketch Card Alternate for card from DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash)
Barry Allen: Fastest Man Alive
Professor Zoom: Thief


All three use the dice from DC Comics Dice Masters: Green Arrow and The Flash.
categories: Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Piper & Ava Go Hiking
description:
In this solo adventure, you, Piper, will travel the five regions of the United States with your little doggie Ava. You must plan the trip using your vast organization skills and then hike the trails using your dexterity of mind and body.

Obstacles and adventures will surely arise during your trip. You will have to weather the storms, find a lost sheep, meet friends along the way, or you may find gold while hiking.

Adventure awaits on this trip of a lifetime!

During each of the five rounds(US regions) you will construct a hand of cards to go hiking by discarding cards from hand to gain the cards needed. After assembling your hand, you will have to assemble the cards in a card tower(trip) using the dice (Piper/you), black cubes (Ava/dog), and possibly other objects depending on events drawn during your hand assembly. You must complete all five regions of the USA using this set collection and dexterity before the deck runs out or your tower(trip) falls more than twice to win the game.

Contents:
50 State Cards
14 Events
5 D6 Dice (Piper/you)
1 D6 die (Ava/dog)
5 Black Cubes (Ava/dog)
12 Other Wooden Event Pieces
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: DIG: The Chef
description: The Chef is a cross-promo card for DIG depicting the chef from Feeding Zombies. This companion allows you to cancel an attack, whether it comes from a player or a gallery, by discarding ten crystals.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Video Game Theme

name: Treasure Hoard of the Cold Drake
description:
Treasure Hoard of the Cold Drake was a Lost Worlds Adventure Set that used the same plastic "cavern" terrain set originally used in Adventure Set II: The Dwarf and Goblin Wars. The rules specify that the adventure set is intended to be used with 3-4 human or humanoid Lost Worlds characters. However, no metal miniatures or character books were included with this adventure set, so those items would have to be provided by the players.

Both editions of Treasure Hoard of the Cold Drake include a 12-page booklet containing the background story and four scenarios; the plastic cavern terrain set; a printed diagram of the terrain with scenario-specific locations marked; four plastic chips; and a six-sided die.

In addition to the above, the Nutmeg set also included an illustrated cover sheet, 24 treasure cards printed on cardstock (required to be cut apart by the player), and a double-sided card with reference charts and tables.

The Greysea set included two of the new Lost Worlds fantasy cards, an eight page booklet titled General Rules for Miniatures Play in Lost Worlds Scenarios, and a sheet titled Special Charts & Tables for Lost Worlds Miniatures Play.
