The Greysea rules specify that 24 treasure "fantasy cards" are required, but as it does not appear that this many cards were included with the expansion, the players would have to purchase the additional cards to use the Greysea set.

—User summary

name: Bushido: Zenkibo
description:
A legend amongst the Zephyr guard, Zenkibo is a nimble and ruthless fighter. Swift on the wing and skilled in the Suzume yari, he makes a strong addition to any Tengu warband.

Blister contains one model, one 30mm base and one full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Kotenbo
description:
The Haiatake are the third of the warrior caste of the Tengu. Strong, loyal and fearsome fighters, dedicated to the pursuit of mastery of martial disciplines. Their traditional weapon the oversized Katana which they wield either single or double handed with equal skill.
— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Zephyr Guard
description:
Each of the Tengu races serve a role within their society. The Suzume are the smallest of the warrior caste, but what they lack in size they make up for in speed and guile. These nimble and skilled bushi are an essential arm of the Tengu army, dodging and twisting in combat, as unpredictable as the zephyrs of wind from which they take their name. Their armour is as strong as it is light, the secret of its construction tightly held by only a few Haiatake smiths.
— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Buzenbo
description:
The rarest and largest of the Tengu, the Kurama are the leaders of the Tengu people. Buzenbo like all of his caste is a formidable warrior with both sword and bow. Standing ten foot tall and with a wing span three times that, the Kurama are a majestic sight on the battlefield. Soaring down and scattering the enemy with a thunderous beat of muscled wing before unleashing volley after volley of steel tipped arrows the length of a man. Even the bravest will tremble at the screech heard shortly before the shadow of Fujin’s wrath falls upon them.
— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Ryuhobo
description:
The teachers and spiritual leaders of the Tengu, keepers and communers with the great Kami, Amaterasu, Fujin, Raijin and of course the great spirit of the Mountain Rokan. Though small in stature the Koroko of the Tengu hold great responsibility within the ranks of the Tengu. Ryuhobo, like all Koroko holds a special bond with his brothers and sisters such is their attunement. A skilled healer and with hand and prayer. If the Kurama are the swift blades of the Tengu, the Koroko are its soul.
— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Naigubu
description:
A venerable and revered shisai, old as the mountains themselves. Though sight has left him he sees all, knows all; for the birds are his eyes, ears and wings now. He knows the name of wind, of fire, of earth, wood and steel, he knows the nothingness of the void. Such is the respect he is afforded by the Kami he is able to bless his allies or force those of the darkness away, prevented from nearing him. Sensitive as any temple master he is able to bend or steer the flow of ki.

The Father of the Mountains is holding the spiritual hearts of his people and will offer the lives of his people for the greater good.
— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Heavenly Body
description:
Heavenly Body is a roll and move game around the theme of fitness and nutrition. Player tokens wear jerseys that contain beans representing weight. Each player begins the game with $200 and 20 lbs. Players move around the board landing on squares and drawing cards that may result in the gain, loss or no change to money or weight. Players can also land on squares that allow them to bet other players on how many of a certain exercise they can do. The object of the game is to have the most money in the end.

At the end of the game, players must guess the weight of their token within a 3 lb margin of error to receive an additional $50. All weight is removed by paying the bank $20 per lb. All Olympic medals are cashed in for money depending on their type. After all players have finished this accounting, the player with the most money wins.

—user summary

name: Dig it! EX
description: This expansion adds a set of mission card. Each player draws a mission card before starting to dig at the beginning of his turn and if he completes the mission, he can bring back more diamonds from the mine.

name: Malifaux: Broken Promises
description:
After a year of chaos and fighting, the new Governor-General has finally forced the city into an uneasy peace. His Predecessor might have stopped there, content with there, content with the illusion of control, but Franco Marlow has bigger plans. Under his leadership, the Guild has tightened its iron grip on Malifaux City, and the Masters of the Guild have but one choice, obey his commands or suffer the consequences.

Divided by their own internal conflicts, the other factions of Malifaux have been unable to stop him. Distrust spreads like wildfire through the Arcanists, Nephilim slaughter Nephilim beneath the dark boughs of the forest, and the agents of the Ten Thunders murder each other in the streets.

Everywhere, promises are broken and loyalties are tested, only one thing is certain: nothing will ever be the same again.

Featuring exciting new models, two new upgrades for every master in the game, and great stories, Broken Promises adds more options to the Malifaux universe.

If you’re looking for new models for your Crews, a new way to play your favourite Master, or to delve deeper into the Malifaux worl, this book has something for everyone.

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Variable Player Powers

name: MMA Combat Card Game
description:
The MMA Combat Card Game is a two player game that brings the in-cage action of a mixed martial arts fight to your table.

Choose from a number of theme decks, including The Brawler, Tap Out Artist, Muay Thai Specialist, and more. When you've got a few fights under your belt, customize your own deck. The only thing standing between you and greatness is 3 Five-minute rounds... if you can last that long!

A game consists of Three Rounds. During each round both players get 5 turns each. Players start at 30 Toughness. When your toughness reaches Zero, you are "knocked out!" At the end of 3 rounds, if no player is knocked out, go to the judges scorecards to determine a winner - players count up the total victory points on successfully played cards during the game. Highest victory point total wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Simulation

name: SIGNS: Die Zeichen
description:
Renegade Acolytes from the church had once attempted to carry out a dark incantation ritual with the help of an old rune tome. To do this, they created a demonic portal over a pentagram with magical gestures. As the rite progressed, some acolytes soon became clear with horror that they were not capable enough to keep these demonic circle upright. What happened to them was not handed down. But now you are in possession of this old rune tome. So what will you do?

In SIGNS, 3 to 9 players try to sustain a sequence of numbers with their hands in each round. They are obliged to follow the rules imposed on them by runes. Each round comes with a further card, so the rules become more and more extensive. Anyone who shows a wrong sign and is caught by the other players must leave the circle. Only the bravest and cleverest summoner will succeed in maintaining the ritual to the end.

SIGNS is the first publication of Rocky Bogdanski, finalist of the 2016 Young Author scholarship and his co-author Kai Wetzel.

—description from the publisher

name: Ushimitsu
description:
Utsumi, the tourist town known for its scenic beauty, has a hidden face. Transmitted since ancient times, the tradition of the cursing ceremony called „Ushi-no-Koku-Mairi” (Ox-Hour Shrine-Visit) still persists, and the sound of hammer reverberates throughout the town at night. The curse accumulated in the land is summoning further calamities, and many tourist attractions are turning into haunted spots whirling with malice. People of unusual shapes cast their eyes upon the power of this curse, planning to get it for themselves. A suspicious chase for territory is about to begin!

Moving around the map of the town, wander from one spiritual spot to another, pursuing your rivals. Collect the negative energies scattered over the different places, and use your powers. When it comes to the crunch, play your trump cards. You can use them either to escape or to stop the ones pursuing you. If you catch up with a rival, you will have a chance for a surprise attack. If you succeed, you can snatch away their powers. If you can steal the powers from everyone before daybreak, the game ends, with you as the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Memory, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Choko
description:
The goal of Choko is to simply be able to the last player with the ability to move. On each turn, a player moves once, twice or three times depending on the throw of the die. Pawns are moved orthoganally. After a pawn is moved, its previous position is marked with a pawn. As the game progresses, pawns become increasingly constricted. As a new counter is added to the boatd with each move, players are able to define areas where there opponents do not have access.

—user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Enclosure

name: Dimentrios
description:
Dimentrios is a game about collecting. Collect more, and play will be different each time. But it is more than that. In Dimentrios, you play against a single opponent, trying to reach their base before they reach yours. A simple premise, but victory lies in your own strategy. Strategy is a must for Dimentrios. Simply collecting the most powerful characters will certainly not guarantee you a win. So order today, and become a Dimentrios master.
The game-play could be described as similar to a game like chess, but with enough new value to make it its own game. Value such as collectible cards, new boards, stats such as attack, defense, and health, and different ways to play.

name: Stadt Land Spielt! Sonderdrucke 2017
description:
A collection of promo materials (mainly expansions and demo games), released in a zip bag at the "Stadt, Land, Spielt"-Event in Germany and Austria.

Included are:
1. Geistesblitz: Gratis Demo-Spiel A standalone demoversion of Ghost Blitz
2. Russian Railroads: Juri Dreigleisky
3. First Class: Teatime
4. Piraten kapern: Sonderkarten
5. NMBR 9: Starting Tiles
6. Top Trumps Star Wars: Tseebo Promo Card
7. 9 extra large wooden bits from spielmaterial (3 pawns, 3 cubes and 3 octagonal prisms in blue, red and yellow respectively)
publishers: ABACUSSPIELE, AMIGO, Hans im Glück, Noris Spiele, Winning Moves Germany, www.spielmaterial.de

name: Dust 1947: Battle for Zverograd
description:
The year is 1947, and World War II is far from over! Thanks to the discovery of a crashed ship from outer space, Germany acquired access to advanced technology. New armament and VK-propelled walkers lumber on the battlefield. Discover a world in which soldiers use conventional rifles next to lasers and jet packs.

Dust 1947 is a hybrid of board and miniature games. Using high quality plastic figurines, players fight over a special mat divided into squares. Checking line of sight, movement, or weapon ranges is easy and intuitive thanks to light and clear rules. On the other hand the game offers a great tactical depth and wide range of possibilities when you create your fighting force.

Dust 1947: Battle for Zverograd is a two-player starter set for Dust 1947 that also serves as a standalone game.
categories: Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Simulation, Square Grid

name: Houkago Nana-fushigi
description:
Houkago Nana-fushigi (放課後７不思議 or „After School Seven Wonders”) is another horror-themed card game by Oishii Tanishi.

There is a rumour among the students called the „Seven Wonders”. Was your behaviour bad at the end of the semester? You have been chosen for an interesting cleaning duty: „All assigned members shall be spirited away” or „You shall be taken by the strangeness of the Seven Wonders”, and so on. Will you be able to execute your task? If you sneak away in the middle of it, it will be already too late, and you will become trapped in the school building!

name: Tv-seriespelet
description:
A Swedish quiz game about tv-series. Contains 500 questions in 5 different categories ("Nordic", "Drama/Comedy", "Fantasy/Sci-Fi", "Action/Crime" & "Oldies but Goldies").

The youngest player starts by choosing a category. The player to the left reads the question. You are allowed to continue until you choose the stop, your answer is wrong or all questions on the card have been answered. If you give a wrong answer you lose all the points you had collected during this turn.

The first player to reach 15 points is the winner!

—user summary
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: The Red Dragon Inn: The Iridescent Wyvern
description:
This additional drink card came as a promo in the deluxe edition of The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport.

Drink Effect: +3 Alcohol. Reveal the top 3 cards of your Character Deck, then draw those cards.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Bushido: Korusea
description:
The Korusea make up the bulk of the veteran seaman of the Jung, skilled sailors and warriors, armed with wicked curved blades which gut a man as easily as a fish. Their secondary weapon is a web woven from light but very strong twine, used to subdue an enemy up close or at range.
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Scroll of Umbra
description:
Umbra is a tabletop rogue-like set in a dungeon. Players choose between 4 classes or playing the monsters. The classes include the wizard,, who moves like a knight from chess and can pass over other pieces or walls; the warrior, who moves parallel with the edges and can move two spaces; the rogue, who moves diagonally and may leave or re-enter the game; and the princess who may choose how she moves.
The monsters are kobolds and goblins. Kobolds move parallel to the edges of the board. Goblins move diagonally. The monster player gets a piece for each player, and may move each piece 1 time per turn. Monsters controlled by another player can hunt players for points. Each player is worth 5 points to the monster player.
Players control peices that navigate an 8"x8" board using dice to determine if a space is a trap, a wall, or a hall. Sometimes player obtain treasure or gold. Gold is used to determine points at the end of the game. Treasure is represented by cards drawn from the treasure deck. Players determine the effect a treasure has when it is used. This causes the treasures to change each game. The game concludes after all players have exited or have been captured. The surviving player with the most points wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Six Feet Under
description:
Be the first to bury the newly departed with six layers of dirt before your opponent does. Shovel their dirt away to prevent them from winning, use a daisy card to pick a card from your opponents hand, and collect three Grave Robber cards to steal a buried coffin from them!

A simple pattern matching card game, players take turns playing Dirt Cards from their hand of six, trying to match the last played pattern. Match the pattern, use wild cards, or discard and draw to try and get the card you need. The first to place six Dirt Cards wins that round. First to bury 6 (or 3 for a quicker game) wins!

Hand drawn pen and ink illustrations and patterns make up the artwork and design of this playfully macabre card game.

—description from the publisher

name: Dictitious
description:
This ain't your mama's vocab

It's a hilarious game of fake words and crazy definitions!

Let's say you have the word "Smacaroni!" What do you think that could mean? Everyone makes something up, and then you voce on the best definition! There's no right or wrong answers here, only funny ones! Like the box says, "This ain't your mama's vocal."

Contents:
200 2 Sided Cards
60 Voting Tokens
Timer
Scratch Pad
Pencils
Rules

name: Malifaux: Katanaka Snipers
description:
When a bow simply doesn't cut it, the Ten Thunders turn to these ninjas. As the name suggests, these Ansatsu Sha are snipers employed by the Katanaka family to eliminate their rivals from afar.

Ten Thunders Box Set, containing two 32mm 'heroic' scale miniatures made of high quality plastic. Will require some preparation and assembly.

Set Contains:

Models

2 Katanaka Snipers

Stat Cards

2 Katanaka Snipers
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Last Full Measure: The Battles of South Mountain
description:
Last Full Measure is a series of free print-and-play games of battles of the American Civil War. South Mountain is the third game in the series.

A brigade scale game that uses regiment counters, as opposed to generic line markers, to spread the brigade over multiple hexes according to it's size. Ranged artillery fire, cavalry charges, command and control, all in under 10 pages of rules. Game files aids include Rules, Player-aid card with CRT and other charts and tables; Eliminated Units card, Order of Arrival card, and with 480 counters.

The Battle Book includes four Scenarios; Fox's Gap, Turner's Gap, Crampton's Gap, a the full campaign of all three battles; an initial strength chart, and a terrain effects chart specific to South Mountain.

The map measures 30" x 48" at a scale of 250 yard per 3/4" hex and 100 feet per level of elevation with 480 counters.

The full game is available for download at: http://UhlanGames.us
as are Zun Tzu gameboxes for all LFM games

—description from the publisher
categories: American Civil War, Civil War, Post-Napoleonic, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Covert: The King Character Card
description:
From Game Boy Geek Kickstarter 2017 Campaign

A new character card that may be selected by a player

Text:
You have a permanent camera and film to use for completing missions
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Spies/Secret Agents
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Perahu Buru-Buru
description:
In the 14th century, there was an Admiral of Sulawesi who had four sons. The Admiral promised to give a gift of a newly built ship made at that time: the Phinisi Ship — but only to one of his sons.

To determine who will win the ship in Perahu Buru-Buru, the Admiral of the Bugis tribe challenged his sons to sail on the open seas by boat. The one who best manages to navigate the waters will win.

name: Sacrificio
description:
Sacrifice Sacrificio is a turn- based strategy game of 2 to 4 players in which your spiritual and strategy skills will be tested as maximum priest. You will have to obtain the greatest number of human hearts to win the favor of gods and bring prosperity to your town personifying the maximum Maya priest.

You will in charge of three temples, where you will must go placing the corresponding priests. At the center will be located the victim, who is going to be sacrified by the dagger of the same color as temple to obtain his/her heart. As top priests, you can curse temples, sending eclipses or invoking our god Kukulcan to help us to complete our ritual of sacrifice and handicap our opponents.

The game is not language dependent - The board game can be downloaded for free here.

Sacrificio es un juego de 2 a 4 jugadores donde se pondrán a prueba tus habilidades espirituales y de estrategia como máximo sacerdote. Tendrás que obtener el mayor número de corazones humanos para ganar el favor de los dioses y llenar a tu pueblo de prosperidad.

Es un juego de estrategia por turnos donde personificas a un máximo sacerdote Maya. Estas a cargo de tres templos en los cuales, turno a turno, debes ir colocando sacerdotes según corresponda. En el centro de ellos deberá ir una víctima, la cual sacrificaras para obtener su corazón. Como máximo sacerdote podrás maldecir templos, enviar eclipses o invocar al dios Kukulkán para que te ayude a completar el ritual de sacrificio y a perjudicar a tus oponentes.

El juego no tiene dependencia del idioma - El tablero de juego puede descargarse gratis acá.

—description from the publisher

name: Letter Tycoon: Game Boy Geek Promo Card
description:
Promo from 2017 Game Boy Geek Kickstarter Campaign.

Claim this card when you use a "g"

Special Power: Owner of this card receives an extra turn at the end of the game
categories: Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Kingship: The Card Game
description:
It's Medieval Crazy Eights! Cards are powerful when possessed in numbers, but only the first player to discard them all wins the game.

The game of Kingship uses an 80 card deck ranging in card values from Ace to King and contains 3 various suits (Light, Dark, and Terra). Players must compete against their opponents to become the first player to use (or lose) all of their cards. Anyone familiar with the popular card game "Crazy Eights" with be able to jump into a game of Kingship right off the bat. Match the suit or number value to play a card and trigger its awesome card abilities! It is important to remember however that the closer you are to victory, the greater the chance you will become a target. That is why it's often a good idea to remain passive at the start and wait for another player to make the first move. For once a Queen is declared, any player may acquire Kingship, and from there, they can literally change the rules of the game.
mechanics: Acting, Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Memory, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Take That, Team-Based Game, Trading, Voting

name: See It! Slam It! Say It!
description:
See It! Slam It! Say It! is an easy to learn party game. The goal is to collect the most category cards within 10 rounds.

The game play is easy to learn. In a round, there is one alphabet card and four category cards. The four category cards are revealed and read aloud so everyone knows the topics. When the alphabet card is turned over, everyone must think of something that starts with the letter and matches one of the four categories. If a player has an answer, he or she must slam their hand on the category card and say their connection to win that card.

For example, the four categories are Action Movie, Ice Cream Flavor, Biblical Name and Vampire. The alphabet card that is revealed is a "B". A player could slam the Action Movie category card and say, "Bourne Ultimatum" or slam the Ice Cream category card and say, "Bubblegum".

There are other details like voting on tie-breakers, baloney answers, and no repeating that are covered in the instructions.

name: Economicus
description:
A game that combines features of Settlers of Catan and Munchkin. You buy companies and set up start-ups in eligible industries, get profit or sell your company if right the moment has come. You may even try to make a corporate raid. Doing all that you have to acquire your business reputation symbolized by the Stars - special game chips - that's how you score your points.
The game board represents 11 industries (agriculture, telecom, raw materials, etc). Each industry is marked with a die roll number. Each move players throw dices, the roll of the dice denotes an active industry in which players can bid for a company (private or public), start start-ups or sell their companies. Each player who owns a company in the industry marked with the number rolled or in a neighbor industry receives profit.
There are three decks of cards: options, events and crises. Option cards give additional advantages to a player, event cards hit all the players (negatively or positively) and crisis cards may turn your profit into a loss.
Main features:

A unique compound game board. Each time you will have a new game!
You won't get bored waiting for your turn, each move players interact with each other.
Each move you have to make decisions: how to invest in the industry (buy a company or set a start-up), when to increase your financial leverage, sell your company in a crisis industry or increase your share when prices plunge
Two game modes: a quick game (30 minutes, good for playing with kids) and a full game (1,5-2 hours).


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Auction/Bidding, Modular Board

name: Virus: Heroes Expansion
description:
Virus Expansion Set, which includes all the stretch-goals unlocked during the Virus campaign and Skills expansion.

It includes:

2 "Il Diavolo" miniatures
3 Boss card
1 Event card
1 Wound card
16 cards of "SKills" expansion
8 Special Rooms cards
categories: Action / Dexterity, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Real-time
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Second World War at Sea: Alternatives for ''Deutschland''
description:
Our 24th issue looks at the designs considered by the German Navy for their Deutschland-class armored cruisers, the famous “pocket battleships.” You get 20 new Second World War at Sea pieces, with six different versions of the ships plus the original design for the Scharnhorst class.

Design studies took two variant paths: an armored coast-defense ship for operations close to its bases, and a long-range commerce raider (the variant eventually chosen).

Our Alternatives for "Deutschland" variant gives you all three ships eventually built in all six variations. Some hewed to the restrictions of the Versailles Treaty; most did not. The designs range from heavily-armored ships with 15-inch guns to unusual heavy cruisers with 8-inch main batteries. And of course we have some Plan Z-related scenarios and scenario modifications for their use.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Nautical, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Five Seals of Magic: Circle VI – Circle of Change
description:
New spell circles available as add-ons to give you even more options for playing Five Seals.

Circle VI: Circle of Change
2 - Intimidation
3 - Balance
4 - Equality
5 - Invert
6 - Enrichment

During setup, this spell circle can be substituted for Circle 0. The second circle can be any circle you wish.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Marbowling
description:
Marbowling is a completely new twist on an old sport. In this game, a Shooter must navigate a Pro Ball marble down the 32" Lane, between the gutters and through the stationary pins to the scoring area.
Step 1: Roll the 6 dice to determine the placement of pins (ex. 1-1-2-4-4-5 = a 1 pin, 2 pin, 4 pin, and 5 pin)
Step 2: Place the pins in the pin holes according to the outcome of the dice roll.
Step 3: Shoot - aim the Shooter Ramp and send your Pro Ball down the Lane (Trick Shots and Hook Shots are encouraged)
Step 4: Score - The scoring area consist of 10, 20, 30, and 50 point pockets. A Shooter is allowed two attempts per frame or turn (1st ball = full points / 2nd ball = 1/2 points.) The highest score after 10 frames is the winner!

name: ATS: Briefing #3
description:
The third ATS Briefing, the first in many years is loaded with invaluable resource material for Advanced Tobruk System enthusiasts.
The 48 page issue, laid out in color, contains several new articles, such as:

Buildings as targets, with a handy table to assist decision-making
The Finns in WWII
Obstacles and demolition
Scenario design


But that's not why you called! This issue also includes a new suite of Busting The Bocage scenarios along with a remastered Pointe du Hoc map, printed on heavy cardstock. AS a bonus, the magazine includes a full-color replay of one of the new scenarios.
Additionaly, the ASL-comp chestnut "The Grain Elevator" is here for ATS players to enjoy, complete with cardstock map and scenarios to play on it.

Ownership of the ATS rules, playaids and system markers is required to make use of this material, as well as combat counters from Berlin: Red Victory and at least one ATS Normandy title, such as D-Day Rangers or Band of Brothers.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Bolt Action: Battle For Berlin
description:
This entire war has led to this monumental moment in world history, this is the Allies chance to end it all, this is Battle for Berlin…

Hitler’s armed forces make their last stand in the German capital, Berlin. Facing them the vengeful Soviet Union, swarmed into the shattered streets of the Fatherland. Every inch of ground was paid for in the enemy’s blood, the fighting bitter and with no quarter asked nor given...

Fighting alongside veteran soldiers, young boys and old men of the Hitler Youth and Volkssturm stalked Soviet tanks with panzerfausts whilst Soviet heavy IS-2 tanks duelled with their King Tiger counterparts.

This Bolt Action battle-set provides you with multi-storey buildings, barricades and shell holes around which to field the combined armour and infantry forces of the invading Red Army and the rag-tag German defenders.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Five Seals of Magic: Circle V – Circle of Assistance
description:
Small expansion that adds 25 scrolls (5 per player) to the game, scrolls of the Fifth circle.

2: Diverge
3: Retry
4: Empower
5: Cleansing
6: Upgrade
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Maze
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Last Friday: Whoopi
description:
Whoopi is a promo character for The Last Friday. At the begining of a chapter, players may decide to play Whoopi instead of a camper. Whoopi comes with a set of special rules indicated on the card.

Every turn Whoopi can reveal a clue token on the board and return it facedown in its original position.

This promo card was given out at SPIEL 2017 in Essen when buying a copy of the expansion Last Friday: Return to Camp Apache.
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Horror, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Cooperative Game, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game
publishers: Ares Games, Galakta, Heidelberger Spieleverlag, KADABRA, Pendragon Game Studio

name: Mistborn: House War – House Bylerum Promo Cards
description:
Contains:
House Bylerum House Sheet
Two Personality cards allied to House Bylerum (Amyse Bylerum & Tieran Bylerum)

This promo pack was given out exclusively to Kickstarter backers, and won't be included in retail copies.

All copies of Mistborn: House War purchased from the Crafty Games webstore include this pack.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Negotiation, Novel-based

name: ATS Port-en-Bessin: 47 RM Commando 7-8 June 1944
description:
PORT-EN-BESSIN, NORMANDY, 7 June 1944: Port-en-Bessin was a little fishing harbor west of Arromanches in Normandy, it was situated between two landing zones, Omaha Beach the American sector, and Gold Beach the XXXth British Corps sector. The 47th Royal Marine Commando came ashore east of Arromanches and progressed toward Port-en-Bessin; at night the Commando stopped a few kilometers from the objective. On 7 June the British launched the attack with fighter bombers support; about forty men were killed to capture the harbor's western side. On 8 June British commandos liberated Port-en-Bessin and linked up with Americans from the 29th I.D.
Welcome to ATS Port-en-Bessin! Even some of our vaunted tactical-level gaming compatriots may not realize that a house-to-house battle took place as part of the Normandy Invasion. The place was Port-en-Bessin, a small but important fishing town that was to be the objective for the 47 (RM) Commandos ... an amazing group of soldiers that would suffer heavy casualties in the operation. One source put it this way, " About two miles outside Port-en-Bessin, you'll reach a wooded hill with a grassy crown covered with orchids called Mont Cavalier. It was here that the surviving men of 47 RM Commando spent the night of D-Day, the twin peaks of the Eastern and Western features brooding ominously on the horizon. They had supplemented their weapons with German Schmeissers and Spandaus, captured in firefights along the way.
On the morning of June 7, they had got safely through the outer defences and headed into the port when disaster struck. While clambering up the steep slopes of the Western feature, one of their troops was caught out by withering fire from two German Flak ships, which were unexpectedly moored in the harbour. Eleven men were killed, 17 wounded and one – George Amos – captured. Meanwhile, back on Mont Cavalier, the unit's rear HQ was overrun.
By the evening of June 7, the Commando was in a desperate position: isolated and under constant threat of counterattack from numerically superior enemy forces; low on ammunition, depleted by heavy casualties and exhausted after two days' fighting with no more than two hours' sleep. And still those impregnable features loomed. "
To make things easy for you to get YOUR boots on the ground, a complete set of a set ofcombat counters is provided -- and a mission that will test your tactical-level mettle! OWNERSHIP OF THE ATS RULEBOOK 2014 plus standard small and large system markers is required to play.
Just bring your ATS Rulebook 2014 and system markers and you are ready to control every ... building to water's edge.

From the publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Dice Baseball
description: A Dice Rolling game for baseball. The game was designed by the creator of Phase 10. It was exclusively sold in K-Mart during the 1981 Christmas season. Players would roll the dice to determine if the hit was a single, double, triple, or home run and the direction of where the "hit" would go on the field. Similar to real baseball, the players would roll the dice in an alternating fashion for 9 "innings." The high score at the end of 9 innings would win the game.
publishers: K&K International, Warren Paper Products Co.

name: Se te ve el plumero
description:
Party game about personal questions.
The cards show characteristics or traits of a person, about physical, psychological or social questions - For example: To be a successful business-man/woman, to have a wonderful ass, to be the best friend in the room, etc.
You must use your money to bid for the cards you want to fit your objectives.
—user summary

El juego más divertido entre amigos
¿Cuánto pagarías por conseguir tus deseos?
¡¡No pararéis de reír!!
Un divertido juego en el que no pararéis de reír en tus reuniones con amigos, que, además, os aportará un mensaje apasionante. Fórjate una nueva vida, una nueva personalidad, comprando por medio de una ¡divertida subasta! virtudes, capacidades, rasgos que sacarán a relucir vuestras preferencias. ¡Desenmascararos, veros los Plumeros!, te sorprenderás de las preferencias de tus amigos. Cuánto pagarías por. ¿Tener un culo imponente?, ¿Heredar una gran fortuna? ¿Ser el más sexy de la discoteca? ¿Ser un empresario de éxito? . ¿Seguimos? El juego tiene un final sorprendete ¡¡descúbrelo!!
—description from the publisher

name: Cthulhu Wars: Six to Eight Player Shaggai Map
description: An expansion map for Cthulhu Wars. This is a 6-8 player version of the regular Shaggai Map, and follows the same special rules of play.

name: Star Command
description:
Tactical Space Combat - 22nd Century

Star Command brings the future to you!

Star Command is the tactical game of space combat in the 22nd century between the Terran Federation and the felinoid Shaanthra. Designed with both board gamers and miniature gamers in mind, Star Command uses simultaneous movement and fire featuring laser and missile weapons in starships using gravitic drives and hyperdrives for faster than light movement. Rules are included for strategic play and spacecraft markers are provided so that you may begin to enjoy the game immediately without buying expensive models. Additional rules for three-dimensional play.
—description from the publisher

Set in the same fictional universe as Kurtick's Strike Team Alpha.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Space Exploration, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Multiple Maps, Paper-and-Pencil, Player Elimination, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection, Three Dimensional Movement

name: Magic: The Gathering – Saviors of Kamigawa
description:
Konda's crime against the kami is revealed: He stole a living spirit. The abductee wasn't just any kami, either. It was a guardian of the boundary between the material and spirit worlds. As the war rises to a fever pitch, fueled by Konda’s pride and the kami’s fury, the veil between the material world and the spirit world is torn to tatters. Could Kamigawa's last hope for peace be the daimyo's sole heir?

The Kami War comes to a head with a bang. Take down your opponent with powerful new “hand size matters” cards and Epic spells.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Malifaux: Bishop
description:
From Malifaux Wiki

Bishop, Outcast Enforcer

Overview
Bishop is a Mercenary pit fighter whose main claims to fame are Swift, granting him a third AP, and a handful of useful triggers that make him quite effective in a variety of different situations.
Table of Contents
Overview
Mobility
Offense
Resilience
Upgrades
Tactics and Tips
Playing Against Bishop

Mobility

While Bishop's Walk of 4 is a bit of the slow side, his Charge of 7 makes up for it by letting him move quickly into combat. He's also Swift, granting him 3 AP during each of his activations, which allows him to move further than one might otherwise think after glancing at his stats.

Offense

Bishop is a melee-focused model, and that's where he shines.

His main attack is Chain Wrapped Fist, which has a high Ml of 6 but a damage spread of 2/3/4, which is a bit low for a model of his price. However, Bishop makes up for that with a variety of triggers which make him very versatile, and his Study Opponent ability allows him to target either Wp or Df, allowing him to both hit his opponent where they are weakest and to bypass a number of defensive triggers (such as Lady Justice's Riposte trigger, which only triggers on her Df flips, but not her Wp flips).

Bishop also possesses the Adaptive ability, which lets him choose a suit when he activates and add that suit to each of his duel totals during that activation. This makes Bishop very independent from the suits in your hand and essentially lets him pick which of his suits he wants to guarantee hitting during that activation. This also provides him a bit of defense from enemies that strip printed suits (such as Hannah or the Freikorps Librarian), as the suit gained from Adaptive is not considered to be printed on his card.

The triggers on Chain Wrapped Fist allow Bishop to quickly adapt to whatever enemy his is fighting. Penetrating Blow ignores Armor, Hard to Kill, and Incorporeal, Choke Out makes his opponent Slow, Knock Around pushes his opponent 3" in any direction, and Critical Strike just increases his damage by +1 for each Ram in his final dual total. With a flipped or cheated Ram and a Ram from Adaptive, this can increase Bishop's damage spread to 4/5/6, which is pretty impressive for a model with 3 AP!

Bishop's second attack is Haymaker, which costs 2 AP and doesn't deal any damage, but does make the target Paralyzed if it connects. It has a very high Ml of 7, making it a very accurate attack, especially when used as a Disengaging Strike.

Finally he has Flurry. This allows him to spend 2 AP and discard a card to get 3 Ml attacks against a single target. They will all have to be Chain Wrapped Fists as Flurry only allows Bishop to take attacks costing 1 AP.

Resilience

Bishop has higher than average defensive stats and a good number of wounds, which makes him difficult to kill in the best of situations. He's even harder to take down in melee, as his Cage Fighter defensive trigger deals 1/2/4 damage to anyone that makes a Ml attack against him and misses. The Crow he needs to hit his trigger is already built into his Defense, so he can Cage Fighter every attack that fails to strike him. Because of this, Defensive Stance is a good option with Bishop once he's in melee, as it improves his chances of dodging an attack (and thus counter-attacking via Cage Fighter) and still leaves him with 2 AP to fight back.

Upgrades

Bishop has two upgrades available to him in Outcasts.

Scramble increases his WK and Cg, which becomes even better on Bishop, as he has a third AP with which to get even more extra movement out of the upgrade.

Oathkeeper can be discarded at the start of Bishop's activation to give him Fast. If you thought that Bishop with 3 AP was good, 4 AP is even better. With it he can charge and flurry in the same activation, Charge twice, or Flurry twice.

When hired into Arcanists, the Imbued Protection upgrade will make Bishop have Df 7. This makes attacking Bishop in melee a huge risk, as he's just that much more likely to avoid the attack and hit his opponent right back with Cage Fighter.

With Guild, Lead Lined Coat grants Bishop Armor +1, which only serves to make him that much harder to kill.

Resurrectionists have Decaying Aura available to them, which punishes any model that lingers too close to Bishop for very long. Because Bishop is so difficult to escape in melee, this can be a viable option for those who like to toss him into the thick of things.

When hired into Ten Thunders, Recalled Training becomes an option, granting Bishop a +flip to all duels he makes for the rest of the turn. Because of his third AP, and his ability to counter-attack models that fail to strike him with Ml attacks, this upgrade makes Bishop very scary for one turn.

Tactics and Tips

Bishop is a melee-focused model, so try to get him into the thick of things as soon as possible. He does very well against weaker enemies that are likely to miss him and trigger his Cage Fighter counterattack, but can also hold his own against Henchman and Enforcers (particularly if he focuses on using Haymaker to paralyze them).

When you activate Bishop, take a moment to consider which triggers you need the most and then gain the appropriate suit via Adaptive. Remember that you can still use the suits from cards that you flip or cheat, so don't feel constrained by Adaptive if you need to hit different triggers during his activation or if the situation changes unexpectedly.

Playing Against Bishop

Bishop is a very versatile model that can be used in many ways. You don't really want to get engaged with him if you can help it, as his Df trigger makes him risky to attack with Ml attacks, and his high Ml makes it hard to disengage from him. Shoot him with ranged weapons when possible.

name: Justice League: Hero Dice – Batman: Promokarte
description: Promo card for Justice League: Hero Dice with German text "Verwerfe Dein Würfelergebnis und beginne Deinen Angriff von vorn." which means "Ignore your dice result and start your attack from the beginning."
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Magic: The Gathering – Hour of Devastation Planeswalker-Deck-Set
description:
The next step in the dragon's plan required self-sufficiency. A people who were willing to do the work themselves without the dragon's presence.. Finally, he made a promise to return, delighting in the writing of his own prophecies, and planting his promise in the gods and the minds and mythos of the denizens below. Mortals adored promises. They saw them as unmovable as mountains, when in truth they were mercurial as rivers.As the dragon departed, the small sun continued its slow journey across the sky. The time had come for the dragon to return to collect his hoard.

8 Island
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination

name: Kaiju Crush: Checkerboard / Oblique Promo Card
description:
Double Sided 'C' Objective card.

Checkerboard: 3 points for having 4 Territory Markers aligned diagonally in a checkerboard pattern.

Oblique: 3 points for having 4 Territory Markers aligned diagonally as off-set pairs.

name: KIWI
description:
A family card game that develops concentration and memory.

The players play cards to move the kiwi, but the kiwi doesn't physically move on the board until the end of the round. Instead, the players must remember the movements. If a card is played that has already been used in that round, then it has no effect on the kiwi's movement. At the end of the round and at the end of the game the question is the same: Where is the kiwi? The winner will be the one that pays the closest attention, who has the best memory, and who most often correctly answers the question.

name: Stay Away!: Promo Set
description: This set of three Stay Away! promo cards add mind-blowing (or just highly-explosive) powers to your game. The dreaded Necronomicon will turn a player into a babbling madman. H.P.L. will give you an insight into the darkest secrets. Dynamite... do we REALLY need to tell you what it's good for?
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game
publishers: Ares Games, Asterion Press, Delta Vision Publishing, Edge Entertainment, Escape Studios, Galakta, Hobby World, KADABRA, Pendragon Game Studio, Truant Spiele

name: Gerrymandering
description:
All things being equal the next election could go either way. It's up to you to make sure it swings in your party's favor. Campaign to encourage your voters and discourage your opponent's, change voter trends, and manipulate political boundaries to make sure your party gets into office. Players rearrange, flip, and replace tiles while manipulating the borders that make up the districts in game about American politics.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Timewarp Tonic
description:
One of three cards for The Red Dragon Inn: 2016 SlugCrew Minor Reward. This card was given away if you have registered in SlugCrew and have done their events.

This drink brings you 3 alcohol content and an additional turn after the "Drink Me!" phase.

A second edition of this card is part of the The Red Dragon Inn Smorgasbox (all editions).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Roman Trader
description:
As a Roman Trader, it's your job to ensure you have the best and most prestigious collection of goods available for purchase...

Roman Trader is a straight set-collecting card game with a couple of novel twists, not least of which is the fact that the goods you're trying to collect are 'open' to other players — they may know what goods you appear to be collecting, but they won't know if you're putting together a specialist collection of varied goods from a particular country/principality!

The ability to collect from the discard pile and effectively set the game going backwards is another twist, and there's also a selection of special cards available to buy that allow you to increase your Warehouse space (hand-size), Plunder goods from other players, Smuggle goods long thought lost into your warehouse, Increase your Market share of selected goods, or Invest in the collections of other players!
categories: Ancient, Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Economic, Memory, Negotiation
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Memory, Pattern Building, Set Collection, Trading

name: Chopply
description:
Chopply is a Mark 'Chopper' Read themed board game which uses the mechanics of a simplified version of Monopoly.
The game comes with an interactive DVD of Heath Franklin playing Chopper and is activated when landing on certain squares(functioning similar to Chance and Community Chest cards).
Like Monopoly the game is won when other players go bankrupt(which is significantly harder to achieve due to no house/hotel options). A 2 player game is most likely to take days to determine a winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Pokémon TCG: Neo Revelation Expansion
description:
Neo Revelation is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Awakening Legends.

The expansion includes 66 cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Neo Genesis Expansion
description:
Neo Genesis is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Gold, Silver, to a New World....

The expansion includes 111 cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Round of Fire
description: Round of Fire is a generic miniature system with an innovative initiative management. With the basic rulebook you can play modern, near future and post-apocalypse battles, but you will find all you need to play every historical and even fantasy setting. Units are at single man and squad level and you can play with your favorite 6/15/20/28mm miniatures.
categories: Book, Fantasy, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Pokémon TCG: Primal Clash Expansion
description:
Primal Clash is an English-language expansion roughly corresponding to the contemporaneous Japanese-language expansion Gaia Volcano/Tidal Storm.

The expansion includes 164 cards.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Zauberei hoch drei: Zusatz-Zauber
description:
This is a set of two new enchantments for Zauberei hoch drei. It was available at SPIEL'17 as a single card; the two tokens have to be cut out.

The new enchantments are:

Tarnkappe ("Magic hat"): If you are on the stairs, your teammates can still help you this turn.
Zauberkugel ("Magic Ball"): All Lumies revealed this turn will remain face-up until the end of the game.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Memory

name: Wir machen einen Krimi
description:
Story telling game for children. With the help of 55 playing cards a story is created. The cards are all nicely illustrated and textless.

Every player gets six cards. With at least three cards he tells a story. If the story makes no sense he gets his cards back. If the story is fine he gets 2 points for a 3 card story, 3 points for a 4 card story, etc. After that the next player gets a turn.

When a player cannot make story he draws three more cards, if that does not help he loses his turn.

Already existing stories may be used in the telling of a new story. When there are no more cards and a player uses his last card the game ends. Who has the most points wins the game.

For small children or beginners it is advised to start with less cards in the stack.

—user summary

name: Experiment on Dinosaur Island (fan expansion for Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island)
description:
New scenario for Robinson Crusoe

Trapped in the Visitor's Center while a storm rages and dinosaurs roam free, you have 10 rounds to drain fuel from different parts of the island to restore power to the electric fence while battling off an onslaught of increasingly dangerous predators. If you feel bold, you can also try to snag some dinosaur DNA samples for your own profit.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Kikori
description:
Kikori is Japanese for a lumberjack and is an area control game for two players.

Materials
7x7 board and 49 double-sided tiles

Play
One player plays with the yellow tree tiles the other player with the red tree tiles. The Kikori tile is placed in the center space of the board and is the only tile on the board at the start. Players take turns performing one of two actions.


Place two tree tiles on diagonally or orthogonally adjacent empty spaces (Player One on his first turn only places one tree)or
Place one tree tile on an empty space and move the Kikori to an empty space adjacent to the tree tile last placed and adjacent to at least one of your opponent’s trees. Next flip over one of your opponents' tree tiles that is adjacent to the Kikori. Flipped tiles become neutral for the rest of the game.


The game ends when a player is unable to take his turn.

End Game
The player with the largest group of trees diagonally and/or orthogonally connected is the winner.

—description from the designer

name: Dragon Watcher: The Card Game
description:
Dragon Watcher: The Card Game is a strategy and collection card game. Two or more players race to collect dragons while using special abilities to hinder their opponents. Are you ready to become the ultimate Dragon Watcher?

The base game includes enough cards for 2-5 players. If you wish to play a larger, longer game, you can play with two sets shuffled together.

name: SportIQ
description:
SportIQ is the ultimate game for sports lovers. It comes with 400 multiple-choice questions. Correct answers are counted as IQ points. It is played in teams over two rounds. The first round tests your knowledge. The second round tests your memory, making the game accessible and fun. You can take risks to score more points, but will you trust your teammates?

—description from the publisher

name: Jiggle
description:
This is a tile placing game for two to four players. Each player has a board of 7 x 7 squares, and the object of the game is to completely fill the board with coloured tiles - these being multicoloured and covering between 1 and 5 squares. Like-coloured tiles may not be adjacent, but can touch at corners. Game play involves throwing two dice to determine which tiles to use, and once placed, they may not be rearranged (tiles may be discarded, or refused). Throwing a six allows you to steal a tile from another player.

With dice, there is an element of luck, but strategic play can help mitigate this. Games are comparatively short so they are ideal fillers between more complicated longer games. Sometimes gameplay can be frenetic. Because of the simplicity, it can appeal to a wide age range.

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Long-Range Probe Resource
description:
The Long-Range Probe Resource is a participation prize given to players who participated in the "Trap Travesty" Organized Play Event. It is considered a Resource, and costs 6 Squadron Points.

When using this resource, you place 3 Mission Tokens on it. During the planning phase, you may place one of them into the play area within Range 3 of one of your ships. When that token is in play, you may target an enemy ship within Range 2 of it during the planning phase to force that ship to plan it's maneuver face-up that round.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: My 1st Game Association: Emotions
description:
This game is aimed at introducing little ones to the world of board games as early as age 2. At his age they are very skilled at recognizing the many emotions vital to their social development. Joy, sorrow, anger and fear are four basic emotions underlying social interaction. This game provides an excellent opportunity for you to accompany little ones in this new way of interacting with others through a simplified game designed just for them. With its two levels of difficulty, this association game will follow children as they progress.
The aim of the game is to fill the illustrated game boards with the emotion-disks. At first the child is just playing a matching game on their own which introduces them to emotions. In multi-player form each player gets a board and on your turn you turn over a disk. If a player has that disk on their board they get to keep it otherwise is it set aside. In the more advanced version you only keep the disk if it is on your board otherwise you put it back face down. The first player to fill their game board wins.

name: Virusbomb
description:
An entry in the 2015 18 Card PNP design contest by J. Ramón Palacios.

Setup

Shuffle and deal 8 cards to each player. Place the remaining card face up in the center of the table.
The play area will be a 3x3 card grid, with that card at the center.
The player who has been most recently sick chooses virus or leukocytes. The other player starts playing. The one with virus keeps the rules card as a reminder.


Gameplay

In turns, each player play 1 card face up on the play area, on a free space or completely overlapping another card. To overlap a card, the new card number must be higher than the overlapped card.
At the end of the game 9 cards must be exposed. None of the 9 spaces must be left uncovered. So, for instance, if there are 3 free spaces in the play area and players have 3 cards in their hands (one player with 2 cards; the other, 1 card), no more cards can


be overlapped.

If there are no free spaces and you have a card whose number is lower than the numbers of the cards in the play area, that card is out of the game.
The game ends when all the cards are played and the winner is the one with most virus or leukocytes on the board. In case of a tie, play again.

name: Pie Town: Special Order Micro Expansion
description:
The Special Order Card is a micro expansion for Pie Town.

Card Text:

When playing with this card, draw randomly from the ingredients bag 1 Common and 2 Rare Ingredients to place on the card.
During play, players may bake a pie using these Ingredients to immediately score 4 Victory Points and guess one Ingredient of an opponent’s Secret Recipe.
Refresh these ingredients after an order is filled.

Came with Dice Tower 2018 Kickstarter.

name: Neon
description:
The Ember has gone out, but the game is not over! The popular game from 2016 is being rebuilt with a fresh reprint, revised rules, and brand new art.

A completely standalone game that has its roots in Ember: the Magical Card Game, Neon is a brand new game that is compatible with the Ember, but has a completely new system of gathering the elemental energy to conjure creatures, along with a questing system, and an experience-points system that allows you to buy items, gain familiars, or to level up and increase your power.

Neon is played with 15 creatures from One to Five VP, and each creature sits in its own stack of five cards. Most of the creatures have powers, and one has a super power, while another has no ability at all. You may only conjure the top card in your turn, and each creature will drain some - or all - of your magical energy, so choose wisely.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Set Collection

name: Blobbiemundo
description:
The amazing collectible trading card game that introduces a new combat dynamic.

Blobbiemorph into the most powerful shapes in existence and participate in fantastical battles between modern animals, dinosaurs, warriors, and more!

Battle your opponents with 7 unique abilities:
Attack • Speed • Confusion • Defense • Perception • Camouflage • Weaponry

Change Environments and Eras to modify the rules of the Battlefield.

Use the Trenches for surprise attacks.

Activate Magical abilities for new game strategies!

name: Frigid Fight
description:
You are stuck on an island together, but the boat only fits one... You will have to kill everyone else, or, let them freeze to death on this extremely cold island before you escape...

Each character has abilities to help them be the last man standing on the island. Choose what you use wisely, or, you might get killed when you are week...

Try to get the others lower then you, so they freeze first, then, when everyone else is dead, take you one man boat to a warm climate and be happy.

it will fill you with laughs when you are trying to survive against your friends, family, or loved ones. Just don't take it to seriously when they leave you to freeze alone...

—description from the publisher

name: Magic: The Gathering – Core Set 2010
description:
The 2010 Core Set features 249 black-bordered cards, including randomly inserted premium versions of all cards in the set. It is available in booster packs, intro packs, and fat packs.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Nanclus
description:
This card is the "flex" prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Chronological Chaos."

Unique Romulan Crew (5 SP)
As an action, you may discard Nanclus and target an opposing ship within range 3. That ship rolls +1 attack die that round, but cannot roll defense.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: Star Trek: Attack Wing – Elizabeth Shelby
description:
This card is the "flex" prize for the episode Star Trek: Attack Wing Organized Play Tournament, "Resource Rumble."

Unique Federation Crew (2 SP)
When defending, your ship may reroll one of your blank results. If the attacking ship is a Borg ship, you may roll an extra defense die and reroll all of your blank results instead.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Phase Order

name: 101 Dalmatians Spoons Card Game
description:
A kid-friendly version of the classic "Spoons" party game.

Plastic "bones" are laid in the center of the table, equivalent to one less than the number of players. Each player has a hand of 4 cards; first player draws a new card and discards directly to the next player, who must take that card and discard to the next, etc. When the final player has drawn, s/he discards to a discard deck, and the beginning player draws a new card from the draw deck. As soon as one player has acquired a full 4-of-a-kind set, they discard and then claim a bone from the table, which triggers a mad dash on the part of the other players to grab the remaining bones. The slowest to claim a bone is eliminated from the game each round, leaving a single winning player.

This version differs from regular Spoons because that one requires players to simultaneously transfer cards to the left while accepting cards from the right, while this version has one player drawing then discarding at a time, and progressing around the table, one player at a time. Furthermore, the rules about being a "pig" and then a "hog" are nowhere in the Disney version,
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: The Red Dragon Inn: 2017 SlugCrew Minor Reward
description:
Adds 3 drinks to the drink deck

Alchemist's Artisanal Ale (this one also appears in The Red Dragon Inn: Allies – Evil Pooky)
Drowsy Poison
Wrench’s Alc-O-Matic
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor

name: Battle for Julu 207 B.C.
description:
The Battle for Julu was a battle between the forces of the Qin Dynasty and the rebellious State of Chu. It marks the beginning of the end of the Qin because the bulk of the Qin army was destroyed by the vastly outnumbered rebel forces.

This game employs a chit-pull system to simulate this key battle of Ancient China.

name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – Eeny, Meeny, Miny, Moe
description:
A finely detailed resin diorama, featuring one of the most iconic moments from The Walking Dead Comics. Suitable for display or as gaming pieces.

Contents:
Exclusive Negan, Rick, and Carl Character Cards
1 Diorama Base
1 Negan Miniature
1 Rick Miniature
1 Carl Miniature
1 Michonne Miniature
1 Maggie and Sophia Miniature
1 Glenn Miniature with alternate head

name: Armoured Digital Miniatures Game
description:
Armoured Digital (AD) is a 1/100 (15mm) scale tabletop skirmish wargame that features drone tanks and the ability to build new units during the game. Players fight for control of the battlefield by scoring more kills, securing ground or taking down the enemy commander.
Players select a hand of orders cards, representing programs, and then alternate selecting and playing them on their combat drones. Orders range from basic movement and shooting, through special actions like jamming, going hull-down and boosting signal power, right up to crashing enemy CPUs or reprogramming a drone to make it yours.
List building is flexible and easy, with players able to simply swap one unit out for another before battle. Players can even play with one set of miniatures and then switch to others by building them during the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Havespillet
description:
A quiz game about gardening and good neighbourship.

On your turn you roll a die and get a question corresponding to the square you land on.

name: Aprenda Jugando
description:
Aprenda Jugando is a game where you can demonstrate what you know and increment your knowledge of Art, Natural science, Social science and Sports and share them with friends and family.

The objective of the game is manage to get all 6 rings, one of each color, answering questions right.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Card Goblins: Expansão Piratas
description:
Pirate-themed expansion for Card Goblins, containing 15 cards. This expansion was released with the game during its crowdfunding campaign.

Shuffle these cards into the main deck and proceed as normal.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Pirates

name: Cthulhu: XOTHIC WARS – Xothian Greater Terrorbeast Box
description:
This box contains 1 complete Xothian Greater TerrorBeast. It is the largest of the two types of Terrorbeasts commonly available to the Xothians. It provides a massive level of brute force to your army - which can only be rivaled by an Avatar of the Elder gods. This is also a way to keep the figure count of your army low for scenarios, and still pack a powerful punch. Even a pair of Lessor Terrorbeasts have trouble fighting a single Greater Terrorbeast.

It contains 1 body, 2 arms, 1 head, 7 chin tentacles, and 1 MDF base.

name: Crickets
description:
The time is ripe for some gold old-fashioned family fun!

Plant three to six players around the table and let the mayhem begin as you race to plant the most crops and reap the most point. Fill your fields with wheat, oats, corn or beans. But watch out for those pesky crickets, because they'll devour everything in their path-unless, of course, you enlist the help of the famously faithful seagulls. You could also be hit by other hazards, like a wildfire or even a drought so dry the cows are giving evaporated milk.

And while it's a good idea to love your neighbor, watch out: he or she might just send come crickets your way. And don't forget that others can use a Helping Hand card to help themselves to your hand! When the dust finally settles, you're sure to find a harvest of fun for everyone with Crickets

Players start with 5 cards each, on your turn you draw one card and play a card. Play crops on one of your two fields, trying to fill it with five crop cards. Upon harvest, shuffle 4 of the cards back in the draw pile and keep one for scoring purposes. A player can also play crickets on each other's fields to cause the player to have crops eaten each turn. Play immediately cards have a black border and happen immediately and are things like fires and sick seagulls.

First to 30 points wins!

name: Spots
description:
Spots is a traditional Irish card game. A bit similar to Rummy, but older. Designed for four players, but can be played with three players using a 'dead hand' or with five players if the dealer 'sits out'.

Using a standard 52-card deck, each player is given eight cards and each turn a player must first draw a card from either the deck or the discard pile. A maximum of four cards may be laid on the table, either as a new set or connected to any existing set. At the end of the turn a player must discard a card from hand. Thus each player can make no more then two sets each game.

When a player has no more cards or when the deck is depleted, the game ends and players receive penalty points for all cards in hand. These are equal to the number of spots on each card, hence the name of the game. To clarify: Ace=1, 2=2, 3=3..., jack/queen/king=10 penalty points.

Additional rules: The ace is always low, so cannot go behind a king of the same suit. A player may play a double, which is extremely rare. These are exactly eight connecting cards of the same suit. The discard pile may not be spread out but the deck may be in order to know how many turns may be left.

name: Second Great War at Sea: Tropic of Capricorn
description:
From the publisher's website:

In late 1916, Woodrow Wilson attempted to bring an end to the First World War. He failed.

In another reality, he succeeded. The great empires survived, yet the peace proved flawed and world-wide war returned in 1940. That war is the background of our Second Great War at Sea series.

Tropic of Capricorn is a complete boxed game in the Second World War at Sea series, bringing our alternative-history Second Great War story arc to the shores of South America. Argentina, assisted by Chile and Britain, faces off against Brazil in a naval war in the South Atlantic.

Tropic of Capricorn includes one 22x34-inch operational map, the same “Rio de Janeiro” map included in our old Cone of Fire game (which will soon go permanently out of print). It covers the most important politically- and economically-important stretches of the Argentine and Brazilian coastlines including Buenos Aires and Rio de Janeiro.

Tropic of Capricorn also has 180 new silky-smooth and die-cut playing pieces: 100 “long” ship pieces and 80 standard-sized ones representing small warships and aircraft as well as task force and flight markers. These represent the fleets of Argentina, Brazil, Britain and Chile, though not exactly as they appeared in our reality.

Each of these fleets has undergone the expansion and reconstruction allowed by strong economic growth and relative political stability - without a German economic collapse to fuel it, the Great Depression is no more than a world-wide recession. Political and especially economic ties have aligned the Latin powers with their European partners: Argentina with Italy, Chile with Britain, and Brazil with the Central Powers of Imperial Germany and Austria-Hungary.

Tropic of Capricorn tells the story of the Second Great War in South American waters in our popular story-arc format: there are 24 scenarios, tied together with a narrative of the wider events they represent. The Second Great War setting was designed to maximize battleship action, and Tropic of Capricorn delivers.

Tropic of Capricorn is one of the first two new games to includes the Second Edition rules for Second World War at Sea: they’re even easier to play with, with more options plus full-color play aids.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation

name: Raggle Taggle Gypsy
description:
It's time once again for the Harvest Festival in the Kingdom of Hybras Isle. As the citizens of the Kingdom prepare for the annual celebration, it's up to you, the players, together to pay respects to the Ancestors' Tree, where the Luck of the people can be stored for the coming year.

Players decide when the game ends before beginning: First to X Coins (victory points that are also a resource in the game); Play X Rounds and whoever has the most Coins wins; Play until all Coins are taken from the Bank and the one with the most wins.

Each player draws a hand of three villagers at the start of each round. On their turns, players play a card, add their villager's luck value to the communal score, follow the effect of their card, then draws 1 card from the deck and passes to the next player.

But be careful - even luck has its limits, and you can't gather too much at a time without breaking the old tree. You can't play a card if it would raise the score over 99, and if you can't play any cards at all, you're out.

The last player left standing wins their prize for the round, the deck is shuffled back up, and the fun begins anew!

name: 789: the Simplest Dice Game
description:
789 is a quick dice game with pattern recognition.

The goal of the game is quite simple: you try to win tokens.

Components: one card, two dice and twenty five tokens.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Recognition, Player Elimination

name: Battle Stations
description:
Battle Stations is one of several games playable with the Katarenga board and pieces. This game is invented by the author of Katarenga.
In this game you start with an empty board. It consists of two phases.

Stations - You each in turn place a pawn anywhere on the board.
The battle - With all 16 pawns in place, you each in turn capture an opposing pawn following the normal rules of movement in Katarenga. If you can capture you must. If there are multiple capture possibilities, you can choose. If you can't capture, you must pass. You keep on passing until either you can capture again or both players have to pass.
The game is won by whoever has the most pawns left on the board or, in case of a tie, by the second player.

The rules suggest to score one point per remaining pawn followed by the switching of the first player.

name: Endless Pass: A Viking Saga – The Nine Hunter Promo Card
description:
This is a promo card for Endless Pass: A Viking Saga.

This promo card is a new Nine hunter card. It depicts two "Viking loses 1 health" symbols.

To play with this card, during setup players should either:

1) substitute it for the weakest hunter (the one resistant to the Storm Hammer) to make the Nine more powerful and dangerous

or

2) select The Nine at random from the 10 hunter cards to add more variation to the game.

Either way, you should always only play with 9 hunter cards total.

This promo card was released in Game Trade Magazine #217 (March 2018).
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Outsmart
description:
Outsmart is the fun and fast-paced family game featuring creative, engaging questions that all have multiple correct answers.

Playing Outsmart is simple:

Everyone takes an answer sheet; the dice is rolled to determine the number of answers required; a topic teaser and one question are read aloud; then players write answers to try and Outsmart their opponents by giving the most correct answers each round.

The trick to Outsmart is choosing between more popular and less obvious answers and then trying to say them, in turn, before other players do; since only original answers count.

Outsmart is knowledge, strategy, timing, luck and lots of humour all rolled into one. And every Outsmart game you play is fun and truly unique.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Hive Smashers
description:
Deep within the heart of the planet Insectivus, the Bee Clan and the Wasp Clan battle for supremacy. Both sides pit their fiercest warriors against one another in the hope of weakening or taking control of their enemy’s hive. Every hive that falls brings the war one step closer to ending.... Side with the honorable Bees wielding weapons of polished gold or align with the villainous Wasps, feral warriors of the badlands. But whatever you do...Protect the Queen!

Hive Smashers is a two-player card game using hexagonal cards to wage war. Each opponent creates a hive by circling his or her queen with strong warriors.

Once that's complete, each player takes turns laying a card down and then picking one up from the reserve pile. Laying a card down means covering an opponent's card on either hive. This is done with higher numbered cards. If a player lays down a card that strengthens their hive or weakens their opponents, then they are allowed to pick up an "Action" card. Action cards help players build tunnels or smash tunnels. If a tunnel is created to their opponent's queen (in the center) then a smash card can be placed on the queen to win.

But watch out, your opponent can do the same thing. On your turn, you must decide whether to strengthen the numbers in your hive, or attack your opponent.

name: Cache Me If You Can!: The Geocaching Card Game
description:
Cache Me If You Can! The Geocaching Card Game is a simpler, faster, and more portable version of the board game that was released in 2013.

In this 2 to 4 player game, players will take turns pressing their luck to collect as many points as possible. In order to take caches, you will need to have a coordinates card. Speciality caches will require specific equipment.

Players will flip cards until -


Two Hazard cards appear (or the Bear)
An Equipment Card is taken
Caches are Collected
