name: Gazala 1942: Italian Armored Divisions
description:
This is the nineteenth of the Avalanche Press Golden Journal supplements. It contains 40 additional counters with rules and scenarios for their use in Gazala 1942.
—user summary

Our 19th issue brings several Italian-themed variants to our Gazala 1942 game, with additional Italian armored divisions added to the game (in place of those deadly German panzer divisions).

There’s the 133rd “Littorio” Armored Division, which had just arrived and spent the battle acclimatizing its troops and vehicles to the North African desert but could have been brought to the front. The 131st “Centauro” Armored Division, which did not deploy to North Africa until after the campaign had already been lost. And the 134th “Freccia” Armored Division, which began forming but never saw action. Plus some other units that might have been present, allowing you to fight the Battle of Gazala without the Germans (spoiler: Gazala without the Germans is pretty tough for the Axis).
—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid

name: War Júnior
description:
Borders have been broken! You have now in your hands powerful missiles capable of decimating entire armies in a few seconds. Simpler rules that value strategy and make attacks and defenses much more exciting. Command your armies, conquering territories and dominating the world! Challenge your friends and feel the adrenaline of a real war!

—description from the back of the box (translated)

Romperam-se todas as fronteiras! Agora você tem em suas mãos poderosos mísseis capazes de dizimar exércitos inteiros em poucos segundos. Regras mais simples valoziram a estratégia e tornam os ataques e defesas muito mais emocionantes. Comande você também os seus exércitos, conquistando territórios e dominando o mundo! Desafie seus amigos e sinta toda a adrenalina de una guerra de verdade!

—description from the back of the box (Portuguese)
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Area-Impulse, Dice Rolling

name: Wargame Castle Assault: Sieges and Battles Edward I to Bannockburn
description:
One of a series of books that provide wargame rules and colour photocopiable figures for miniatures battles.

The Scottish and Welsh wars of Edward the first and second up to the Battle of Bannockburn, with barded knights, Scots schiltrons and wild Welsh archers fighting again for freedom. Featuring an extensive castle model with a siege assault force and a siege game included in the rules.

The miniatures are drawn and coloured by Peter Dennis, the well known face behind Osprey books, many illustrations and Martin Wallace's games. The buyer photocopies or scans the images provided, folds and cuts them out to make armies.

name: Zodiax
description:
Zodiax is an abstract strategy game for 2 players(2-3 with expansion)in which each player controls 6 of the 12 signs of the Zodiac.
Each sign has a unique force and ability that players can use to move one of their pieces into their opponent's gate and win.
Zodiax is a simple and easy to learn game with deep strategy.
Zodiax is a modular game, There are several different versions, each representing a different world Zodiac (Chinese Zodiac, Greek Zodiac, American Zodiac, Dinosaur Zodiac, etc.) Each version has the same rules but the pieces in the different sets have different powers. All sets are fully compatible so that players can use pieces from different sets to play against each other.

name: Wow! Werewolf
description:
A Japanese produced werewolf game that uses panels such as houses and roads to play!

Combining the panels of houses and roads will make the village board. Villagers will sleep in seperate houses every evening. Wolves can only raid along the road! Furthermore, there are special houses such as church where werewolves cannot attack and a log cabin that can block the road with logs to interfere with the attacks of werewolves.

Depending on different elements of movement, building and player powers, new developments and strategies that have never existed will be born!
categories: Bluffing, Deduction, Horror, Murder/Mystery, Negotiation, Party Game
mechanics: Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers, Voting
publishers: Little Future (リトルフューチャー)

name: As Long as the Grass Grows: The Conquest of the American West 1845-1881
description:
Beyond the great river Mississippi, where a part of your nation has gone, your father has provided a country large enough for all of you, and he advises you to remove to it. There your white brothers will not trouble you; they will have no claim to the land, and you can live upon it, you and all your children, as long as the grass grows or the water runs, in peace and plenty. It will be yours for ever.

President Andrew Jackson

As Long as the Grass Grows is a card driven board game depicting the Conquest of the American West from the Texas Annexation of 1845 to the surrender of Sitting Bull in 1881. At the start of each turn a President card is drawn and resolved, to determine the policies of the new administration, foreign affairs, and gold rushes. The players draw Action cards, make agreements, and play their cards as Events or for Action Points so they can move, raid, and fight with troops of cavalry and infantry, or tribal warbands. The United States Player wins by protecting pioneer trails, upgrading them to railroads, civilising tribes, and seizing control of territories, particularly those with pioneers and gold. The Great Plains, Northwestern, and Southwestern Tribal Players win by resisting the westward advance of the United States, maintaining control their homelands, and avoiding the Reservation for as long as possible.

Includes


Scenarios for 1845-57, 1857-69 and 1869-81, which can be combined into campaign scenarios.
Two player alternate history game with no US player.
108 Event cards including Generals, Chiefs, Pioneers, Gold Rushes, and Epidemics.
10 President Cards representing every president from 1845 to 1881, reflecting the policy of their administration.
Buffalo, Gold, Massacre, Trail, Peace Chief, and War Chief markers.
California, Oregon, Mormon, Bozeman, Smoky Hill, Santa Fe, Old Spanish, and Goodnight-Loving Trails allow rapid movement across the continent, may be raided by local tribes, and upgraded to railroads.
Control of territories by the British, Mexicans, Mormons, Texans, CSA, USA, and Tribes.
Variable victory conditions, increasing for the US and decreasing for Tribal Factions as the game proceeds.


—description from the designer
categories: American Indian Wars, American West, Political, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Events, Simulation

name: Guild Ball: The Mason's Guild – The Punishing March
description:
Hammer is legendary in everything he does. While others may falter, he only gets better – stronger, faster. He is an inspiration, like an ancient titan of legend.

— Harmony, Mason’s Guild

Hammer is the anchor at the center of the Mason’s Guild. One of the strongest players in the game today – and, he’s stamping his name into the world of Guild Ball at any cost.

Hammer’s team can attack and defend with equal ferocity - crushing the opposition with Hammer and Chisel while scoring goals through sheer force of will. Coaches will blunt their opponent’s attacks against a Granite Tower before Wrecking them with perfect Harmony.

This set includes: a ball, 6 player cards, bases, and 6 players: Hammer, Wrecker, Chisel, Veteran Harmony, Tower, Granite.

name: Guild Ball: The Union – The Bloody Coin
description:
“Aye, I was there that dark day, when Rage drew his line in the dirt. And one by one, they followed him, as the mean, gore covered bastard stared at them and offered them each a bloody coin. That’s when it all changed. When Rage became the Usurper.”

— Shank, Butcher’s Guild

This set includes: a ball, 6 player cards, bases, and 6 players: Veteran Rage, Strongbox, Snakeskin, Fangtooth, Minx, Hemlocke.

name: Guild Ball: The Exiles – New Alliances
description: Guild Ball: The Exiles – New Alliances includes a ball, 3 Jawbone Trap markers, 6 player cards, bases, and 6 players: Veteran Honour, Veteran Hemlocke, Veteran Minx, Veteran Decimate, Veteran Gutter, and Veteran Harriet "The Hat".

name: Doshboardgolf: The Shoreline Course
description: Adds a second board, with 9 new holes and different tile types.

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – Canterlot Nights
description:
Canterlot Nights is the name of the second set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release: May 23, 2014
European release: 5 June 2014

204 unique cards were released as part of the main set:

10 Mane Characters,
100 Friends,
30 Events,
29 Resources,
11 Troublemakers, and
24 Problems.


In terms of rarity, the main set contains

60 Common (C) cards,
62 Uncommon (U) cards,
60 Rare (R) cards,
6 Fixed (F) cards, and
16 Ultra Rare (UR) cards.


There is a 1 in 11 chance for a Canterlot Nights booster pack to contain an Ultra Rare card in place of a Common card (an increase from Premiere's 1 in 13 chance).

Flutterbat is a "secret" Ultra Rare such that it is not listed in the set checklist, but it is still part of the set and still has the same chance to be obtained from booster packs as any other Ultra Rare in the set.

In addition to the main set, there is also a foil parallel set of 56 cards. Of these Foil (f) cards, 44 of them are foiled versions of cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 4 chance for a Canterlot Nights booster pack to contain a parallel Foil card in place of a Common card.

The promo set of 19 cards cannot be found in booster packs. Of these 19 Promo (P) cards, 12 of them are foiled versions of cards in the main set, and 6 are unique to the set. Twilight Sparkle, Ursa Vanquisher has been previously released as part of the Premiere main set.

Theme Decks:


Princess Celestia & Rarity Theme Deck
Princess Luna & Rainbow Dash Theme Deck
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: My Little Pony: Collectible Card Game – The Crystal Games
description:
The Crystal Games is the name of the third set released for the My Little Pony Collectible Card Game.

American release dates:
Theme decks: November 21, 2014
Booster packs: December 5, 2014

European release date:
10 December 2014

206 unique cards were released as part of the main set: 6 Mane Characters, 95 Friends, 35 Events, 34 Resources, 12 Troublemakers, and 24 Problems.

In terms of rarity, the main set contains 60 Common (C) cards, 60 Uncommon (U) cards, 60 Rare (R) cards, 10 Fixed (F) cards, and 16 Ultra Rare (UR) cards. There is a 1 in 11 chance for a Crystal Games booster pack to contain an Ultra Rare card in place of a Common card.

Princess Twilight Sparkle, Princess of Friendship is a "secret" Ultra Rare such that it is not listed in the set checklist, but it is still part of the set and still has the same chance to be obtained from booster packs as any other Ultra Rare in the set.

In addition to the main set, there is also a foil parallel set of 50 cards. These Foil (f) cards are foiled versions of cards found in the main set but are otherwise the same as their main set equivalent. There is a 1 in 4 chance for a Premiere booster pack to contain a parallel Foil card in place of a Common card.

The promo set of 18 cards cannot be found in booster packs. Of these 18 Promo (P) cards, 12 of them are foiled versions of cards in the main set and 6 are unique to the set.

Theme Decks


Opening Ceremonies Theme Deck
Special Delivery Theme Deck
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Multi Stacks
description:
Multi-Stacks is a cooperative game that can be played with a regular 52-card playing deck. Players work together to beat the deck rather than each other. It is quick to play and easy to learn. The goal is simple: work together to use all the cards in player's hands before running out of cards in the deck.

Every turn consists of three phases: Draw, Play, Pass. Each player will have to choose how many cards to draw, which cards to play on the stacks, and which cards to pass to fellow players. Roles limit what cards can be played so that players have to depend on each other. Work together to keep yourself and your teammates from getting stuck with cards you cannot play. If everyone gets stuck, you lose. Play all the cards in your hands to win the game!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Open Drafting, Pattern Recognition

name: Hunt for the Ring: Frodo Baggins Promo Card
description:
Alternate Frodo Baggins Company Card given out during conventions including GenCon 2018.

It is the same art as the one that comes in the base game, but a different ability on the card.

Card abilities:

During a Nazgul Encounter, if you must draw more than one Corruption tile, spend one Fellowship token (only one) to draw one tile less.

Frodo's Resolve: After moving, flip this card to move again. Reduce the Fellowship pool by 1 token.
categories: Deduction, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Novel-based
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Isla Cobra: El Mar de la Niebla
description: Being the third entry of the Imperio Cobra franchise, this game was much simpler than its predecessors, as it was aimed at younger children. Although it was created to try to take advantage of the fame of the saga, it went very unnoticed.

name: Mana Clash
description:
Players simultaneously choose a spell to cast and an effect to block from a list of four elemental schools, each with four different levels of spells, then they reveal their choices. Blocked spells are played with no effect, while other spells resolve. The first player to end a turn without mana loses the game.

Mana Clash is a two-player tactical guessing game, revolving around a rock-paper-scissor mechanism, but having mana/casting/blocking potions to manage as consumable resources, which adds information as to what your opponent might play.

Mana Clash was designed on commission as a merchandise product for Mana Flask, a shop&pub for gamers located in Brescia (Italy).

—description from the publisher

name: Dirty Dough
description: In the game of Dirty Dough, only those with the filthiest minds will triumph! This truly twisted dough-sculpting party game puts your creativity and depravity to the test. Round up a threesome for quickie play, or divide a larger group into two teams and play competitively dirty! Whichever mode you chose, the rules are as easy as the players. Before anyone starts diddling the dough, the selected sculptor chooses a Dirty Dough card. All cards have three categories (Sexy, Kinky, Disgusting) and hints. The sculptor reads their card’s category and hint aloud, then flips the timer over. With 60 seconds on the clock, players compete to guess what obscene scene the sculptor is molding. The first one to collect three cards wins! If this isn’t hard enough, use the challenge tiles to make team play even dirtier. Sculpt using only one hand, with your eyes closed, or use one of your teammates as a sexy mannequin!

name: Turncoat
description:
Players must complete five missions successfully or succumb to the mole.

Set Up: Remove all 10's and jokers from the deck and make an identity deck out of the following cards:
Players 2: 10, 10, Joker
Players 3 or 4: 10, 10, 10, Joker

Shuffle the cards and hand one out to each player, removing the other cards entirely from the game. The player with the Joker is the turncoat. Give five cards to each player.

THE MlSSlON: The game is played over a series of missions. On a player's turn they look at the top two cards of the deck and select one to determine the mission, placing the other card face-down in the discard pile. lf a player draws a picture card (known as a spy) it is immediately discarded and a new card is drawn. Then, each player takes a card and places it face down next to the mission. When all cards have been placed, add one face-down from the deck, shuffle the cards, and reveal them. Cards matching the suit of the mission add to the team's total; other cards subtract from it. The total must be equal or higher than the value on the mission card to succeed. If any spies were placed, the mission fails.

ACCUSING: At any stage a player can accuse another of being a turncoat. If they are right, the team wins. If not, the turncoat wins. If there was no turncoat, everybody loses. Otherwise, the game is won by the team if they succeed five missions, and won by the turncoat if the team loses five missions.


From the designer: "Werewolf (or as it is sometimes called, "Mafia") was always a fantastic game for me, and one I played a lot in my early university years. It is a game of two teams, but of unknown identities. It is an interesting mix of old and new design concepts; the heated discussion and bluffing generated by Werewolf is very modem; whereas the player elimination and sitting around is becoming ever more rare with each new design. One immensely popular (but lengthy) board game involving traitors is Battlestar Galactica, by Corey Konieczka. It sets players on a spaceship, trying to collectively ward off dangers, which would be easier, were it not for the traitor in the midst. I have extracted the game's clever system of sabotage-by-card, and came up with Turncoat."
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents

name: Grand Manoeuvre Napoleonic Wargames Rules
description:
Grand Manoeuvre is a set of miniatures wargames rules for the Napoleonic period. The rules are written with 6mm figures in mind, although guidance is supplied for using them with other scales. The basic manoeuvre element is an infantry battalion or cavalry regiment.

The publisher website describes the rulebook as follows:

The rules form two booklets: an introduction to “Game and Period Fundamentals” and the main part; "The Rules in the Sequence of Play".

Game and Period Fundamentals is a sixty-one page introduction which provides the background to the period’s warfare; the tactical formations and battle arrays that were used, it explains the grand-tactical manouevre of commands and the various forms of skirmishing practices and these are illustrated with colour diagrams.

Information is provided upon how each of the major armies formed line of battle, their methods of re-deployment, their national tactical systems throughout the period and notes on army command structures.

The introduction explains the games' unit, ground and time scales and explains the basis of the rules and the game terms used and in addition to this information, it provides players with general advice on tactics.

National troop classifications and general's ratings are listed.

The Rules in the Sequence of Play has eighty pages which for clarity’s sake are and spaciously laid out on each page, so that when necessary players are able to find the rule that they are looking for!

Grand Manoeuvre has a total of 144 pages and 38 colour tactical diagrams. Provided for the players to help them are: An eight page, black & white quick-reference mini-booklet. Orders & messages sheets Optional unit number labels` sheets.

name: Bella Contra Barbaros: Rome's Wars Against the Barbarians – Marius to Trajan
description:
BELLA CONTRA BARBAROS covers the period of Rome's wars with the barbarians from 100 BC to 100 AD; from the reforms of Marius to the Dacian War of Trajan.

Basically, there are two contrasting systems of organisation and tactics and command and control
Firstly the Romans - who are regulated and disciplined - good order is important to their manoeuvre and success in battle. This is the Roman army's great strength.
The barbarians on the other hand - their warbands and cavalry are less-controllable but faster and rather more fluid in their battlefield movements. The barbarians' main strengths are their impetuous attacks and surprise in ambushes.

Combat Resolution
An adaption of my Grand Manoeuvre Napoleonic set, the combat rules are not dice-heavy; the modifiers that most game systems use (for flank attacks, disorder, and other tactical advantages) are significant points in determining the combat results and instead it is the dice rolls that modify the outcomes. Generally, the die roll itself plays a less of an important part in determining combat results; usually it only adds one point in the combat calculation unless the combat element has impetus and then two dice are used.

Stratagem Cards
There are some interesting ancient period flavours in this optional rule.
These cards will provide some challenges for players to deal with.
The cards include many of the stratagems mentioned by Frontinus and Polyeanus. There are 34 tactical ploys and stratagems. The cards can be selected by players, or picked randomly in the game set up phase for use in deployment or for use during the game itself.

Inspirational Pre-Battle Speeches
A chance to deliver a rousing address to the troops before battle to encourage them to fight well… perhaps their morale is shaky and needs to be boosted?
Another optional rule which adds period flavour; a pre-battle speech may give the player's forces some combat or morale advantages.

Heroic Death Rules
Added to the mix (and only if things are going badly for the player) is the possibility of a heroic death for both barbarians and Romans – the Roman version of this being called the “devotio”.
We may reflect that Boudicca is better known than Gaius Seutonius Paulinus.
Everyone knows the name of Spartacus, but only the rather more keen, historical wargamer would know who Marcus Licinius Crassus was, or of his ultimate fate.
This option gives the Barbarian player (who must be a tribal king, or a commander in chief) a chance to "win" on his, or her own terms even though in fact their armies will be defeated and the cause of the rebellion is lost.

Scenario Booklet
There are eight historical battle scenarios from Rome's wars and campaigns against the barbarians; each has an introduction, umpires notes, player briefings and victory conditions, terrain generation rules and army lists.

The eight battles in the booklet are:
Vercellae 101 BC - Marius` great victory over the Cimbri.
Mutina 72 BC - Spartacus defeats the Governor of Cisalpine Gaul.
Histria 61 BC - Burebista defeats "The Monster", Gaius Antonius.
Sabis River 56 BC - Caesar verses three Belgian tribes.
Arbalo 11 BC - Drusus ambushed by the Sicambri.
Volcaean Marshes 7 AD - The Batos unite against the Romans.
Mons Graupius 83 AD - Agricola marches against the Caledonians.
The First Battle of Tapae 86 AD - Decebalus` Victory.

Historical and Points based Army Lists
Extensive Army Lists for most of wars and campaigns with Barbarians in the period are provided hopefully these will produce historical and balanced armies. In addition, I have made points-based army lists for Romans and Barbarians.

Battlefield Terrain Generation Rule Booklet
This booklet has specific terrain rules for each theatre of the major wars with the barbarians.

QRB`s
You can play these rules with various scale figures. Three versions of a six-page Quick Reference Booklet are supplied for use with 30, 40 & 60mm base widths - players are advised to use the closest one in size to their own particular basing.

Game Markers are supplied
Game marker files for hits, order and formations are supplied - players only need to print, fold, cut and glue or laminate them. Also provided are cards to remind players about the inspirational pre-battle speech effects. And to assist players some simple orders cards that may be hand-held or placed on table.

Campaigns
Victory conditions are suggested according to scenario or campaign conditions and there are also recommendations for dealing with post-battle pursuits, and fluctuating morale in campaigns.

The Rule Book
111 pages, with 66 colour photos and images illustrating the rules, a glossary of game and historical terms and an index.
Black and white copies of rules & quick-reference booklets are provided.

-from publisher's website

name: The Partisans: An Extra Politics Board Game
description:
The Partisans is a tabletop game for 4-6 players based on the Extra Credits mini-series, Extra Politics. In the game, you play a political ideology attempting to move the government towards your goals. Of course, other players have different ideas about what the government should be doing.

Players take turns as the Committee Chair and work together to craft bills from amendment cards. All the players then vote on weather or not to pass the bill. VP are scored if players vote with the ideals of their faction and players gain extra power by voting with their lobbies.

When the game ends, a round of final scoring takes place based on the currant priorities of the government. The player with the most points is the winner!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Negotiation, Role Playing, Simulation, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Hazard Mountain: An Inference Game
description:
"Correctly making inferences will help you blast down the mountain to win."
An educational game in which players will:

make inferences
understand and analyze text
read for meaning


(Reading Comprehension: Level 2)

Players read 'question cards' with a short text and answer the accompanying question based on the text. Correctly answering the question allows them to roll the die and move down the ski hill to a new square. Specially marked squares along the way cause special events, such as losing a turn or helping another player. The first one to the bottom wins.

—user summary

name: Gangfight Skirmish Game System
description:
If you're like us, you have too many miniatures and too little time to learn every game out there. Never fear, the Gangfight Skirmish Game System is here! With our all new hardcover rulebook, you will learn how to play games in any setting, with any miniatures you want! Perhaps you'd like to see if a Warjack can kill a Dreadnought? Or maybe you'd like to create a heroic warband with fantasy characters from 4 different game systems? All of this is possible with the Gangfight Skirmish Game System!

The Gangfight Skirmish Game System features unique characters, alternating activations, ongoing campaigns, fast & fun gameplay, lots of skills, custom equipment and more!

—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Fantasy, Pirates, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Beastmaster Th'Uk Tar – Hero Expansion
description:
Bend the creatures of the Ru steppes to your will with the Beastmaster Th'Uk Tar – Hero Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! Marked by the Ynfernael with hooked feet and razor fangs, this Uthuk tribesman was destined for glory from infancy. Now a chieftain, he uses his unholy link to lead his pack to war, and all shall either submit or perish!

—description from the publisher

name: Runewars Miniatures Game: Ventala Skirmishers – Unit Expansion
description:
Defend the borders of the Aymhelin Forest with the Ventala Skirmishers – Unit Expansion for Runewars Miniatures Game! Since they first appeared in Mennara centuries ago, the Ventala have developed a deep friendship with the Latari. Now, these enigmatic creatures are proud to offer their services as scouts and warriors. Pledge your loyalty and protect your elven allies!

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Knobelix
description: This is an interesting variant of a dice game: The active player rolls all the dices, but only the other players can see them. By deducing, the active player can find out what was his original result of the dice roll.

name: Domino: Im Einsatz
description:
Alarm! Alarm! Blue lights are speeding around everywhere! Which vehicles and personnel belong to the police, to the emergency medical services, or to the fire department?

In Domino: Im Einsatz, you need to look closely and lay down the tiles appropriately. With some luck and a good eye, you can secure the most blue lights and win.

name: Pokémon TCG: Luminous Frost Theme Deck
description:
The Luminous Frost Theme Deck is from the Burning Shadows expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, but also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Water and Fire type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Alolan Ninetales.

Like other Theme Decks, Luminous Frost includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, an Alolan Ninetales deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. (User Summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme

name: The Baseball Card Game
description:
An impressive, minimalist approach to playing “dice baseball” (although this game uses a card-draw from a standard playing-card deck for its random-results generation). Designer Jeff Downey has managed to incorporate just about every nuance of table-top baseball into a few pages of very clear rules and only two charts. If you like to rush, this is potentially the quickest playing baseball game available.

Very general player-attributes are “graded” for overall skill (Batter, Eye, Power, Defense/Fielding, Speed) i.e. a batter’s Power rating could be “Star”, “Good”, “Average”, or “Poor”. Likewise, a pitcher would be rated similarly for Control etc.

For each at-bat, a card is drawn. It is first checked against the pitcher-rating chart, and depending on the result, following cards may need to be drawn, i.e. the pitcher-result may indicate “Batter”. In this case, the batter has put the ball into play and so the batter chart is used when drawing the next card (using the
batter’s particular rating, of course.) The result might be a hit or possibly “Eye”, so then the batter’s ability to wait for a good pitch is being called into question. We go to “Eye” chart and draw another card for the result etc.

Steal, bunt, hit and run, double plays, sac flys, errors, and fielding are all represented in this fascinating, fast and very successful “micro-game”.

It is easiest to use a fictional team and randomly generate the attribute-grades, but you can certainly use real stats and create a general guide for using historical players.

—user summary

name: Pokémon TCG: Leaf Charge Theme Deck
description:
The Leaf Charge Theme Deck is from the Celestial Storm expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the seventh expansion in the Sun & Moon series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Grass and Lightning type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Sceptile.

Like other Theme Decks, Leaf Charge includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Sceptile deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme

name: BATTALIA NCBC: Moodies
description:
"If you're small and wayward, it doesn't mean that you are useless, right...? Ok, it's not always easy for the master, because we're a bit erratic too and we always want to be fed, fed, fed... otherwise unhappy and this means, bad support for the master and short list of possible wishes.... But if we're happy and in a good mood - master will be satisfied too, this means - long list of wishes for happy master... And last but not least - we are very jealous and just need to be "THE ONE AND ONLY" for the master!"


NCBC is a collection of mini expansions based on neutral big scale figurines, which are designed to enlarge the immersive Battalia universe, introducing a whole bunch of new strategic possibilities to the players and adding completely new adventure elements to the basically competitive plot. In general they don't belong to any faction (resp. to any player) and can be played in different combinations with the basic game or with the BIG!Expansion. We don't recommend to mix more than 3 different types of NPCs in your games in order to avoid higher complexity. But you can mix them in totally different combinations, which ensures the long-term replayability and excitement in this game universe. Normally the NPCs have small complementary rules, which are provided only online on Battalia's home page battalia.eu as high resolution printable PDF files. The miniatures are distributed in small packaging boxes with custom artwork as separate items or possibly in bundles.
categories: Card Game, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Blood Red Skies: British – Bristol Blenheim Mk IV Bomber
description:
The Bristol Blenheim was originally developed from a design for a fast civil airliner. At the outbreak of WW2 Blenheims formed the mainstay of the RAF Bomber squadrons fighting over Europe and went on to see action in Africa, Asia and even on the Eastern front.

Over four thousand Blenheims were built before it was retired in favour of newer designs.

Contains:

3 x Bristol Blenheim MkIV British Bomber
3 x Decal sheet
3 x Advantage Flying Base and extension
3 x Double-sided Pilot Skill discs
1 x Aircraft Card
1 x Assembly instruction leaflet
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Action Points, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Story Builders
description:
It's time to go a quest! What stories will you tell on the way?

Only the crafty will be able to fulfill all their quests before the other.

A drafting game where you can choose to draft a new quest, or draft a new Story Builder. When you draft a Story Builder, you have to add it your tableau, and once placed, it can never be moved. In order to complete a quest, you must have it's requirements somewhere in your tableau in a 3-in-a-row.

When you complete a quest, you also can activate it's reward which will do things such as breaking opponent's tableaux or letting you draft extra elements. Completing a quest does not remove its requirements from your tableau, they remain to be used again in future quests.

The first player to complete 10 quests wins. Efficient placement of the Story Builder tokens will let you double and triple up their usefulness to finish quests faster.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Role Playing, Tile Placement

name: Grand Manoeuvre Nineteenth Century Wargames Rules Variants (1811-1851)
description:
Grand Manoeuvre`s Rules for 1811-1851 cover the following wars:

1. The South American Wars 1811-1824.
2. The November Uprising 1830-1.
3. The Egyptian–Ottoman Wars 1831–3 & 1839-41.
4. The Mexican War of 1846-8.
5. The First Italian War of Independence 1848-9.
6. The Hungarian Uprising 1848-9.
7. The 1st Schleswig-Holstein War 1848-51.

The set includes the following: A rules introduction booklet, which explains the game basics and historical terms. The introduction includes rules amendments for each war, units` and generals` ratings. The main rules booklet, which has the main games rules in sequence of play. A black and white copy of the main rules booklet, a copy to save on printer ink! A quick reference 8 page mini-booklet, which has most of the main rules. Rules amendments notes for each war listed above. These have notes on; tactical doctrine, unit qualities, leadership and where appropriate the weapons used by each side and their effects on the rules. Orders and messages sheets, Unit/A.D.C. number labels, and order cards are playing aids to make player`s order writing easier.

Note: for gamers who already have the original Napoleonic rule set, they would just need Grand Manoeuvre Rules Updates for 1811-1851

-description from publisher's website

name: Tiny Tanks
description:
Tiny Tanks is a fast-paced, clever little shooter to get your game night started – you’ll have a blast! Matches are fast - only a couple minutes each. And it's quick to reset! We recommend playing 4 or 5 matches in a sitting as warmup on game night!

Players control a tank moving across a field. There are three main actions: Move, Action Card, and Shoot. Each has their own straightforward rules to follow.

The goal is to strategically approach an opponent tank (which often involves putting yourself in danger) and destroying it! The simple mechanic makes for fast paced appetizer-style gameplay. The Action Cards blend simple instructions with humor and style.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Movement, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: Orang Rimba: The Forest Keeper
description:
Orang Rimba or Anak Dalam tribe is a native resident of Bukit Dua Belas National Park in Jambi. They live harmoniously with nature that provides them resources to live and survive. However, the peace is suddenly broken. Some parts of the forests are massively exploited by irresponsible people, leaving nature prone to destruction and lost of many resources.

In Orang Rimba: The Forest Keeper, players represent two members of the Orang Rimba tribe. Each turn, they spend action points to move around the forest gathering resources, complete a goal, deliver goods to barter for other goods, and chase away the illegal loggers who irresponsibly exploit the forest resources for their own benefit.

The game ends after twelve rounds or when one of the players has managed to complete all of their goals.
mechanics: Action Points, Commodity Speculation, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Svenska språket
description:
Do you get clammy when other people can't separate "they" and "them", and do you know the antonym to the word "advantage"? Do you yell at the tv when you hear a proverb used incorrectly? Here is the quiz for us who is not "born behind a wagon".

This game contains 60 questions, in addition to a category tile, that can be used as a standalone game, or to expand your Bezzerwizzer game with this new category.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Benefactor
description:
"Did you receive my last letter? Good. I know that being placed in the high council takes a lot of responsibility. Steering the union into wealth and prosperity without bias or favoritism is not an easy task. That is why they picked you. That is why I picked you. Ensure that certain factions prosper more than the others, without being obvious, and I will make sure your political career is long and illustrious. If not, I can find someone else to assist me. ~Your Benefactor."

Your goal as a high council member is to have seven influence points by doing favors and spotting traitors. Most rounds, the active player moves a shared worker token to an empty trade deal space and players vote to raise both factions. Should be easy, but if your bias is discovered, you'll be exposed and censured. Better to play sub-optimally or spark a scandal or two. Be careful about moving up too quickly: you'll be watched more carefully and have extra administrative duties to distract you from your real work: doing the will of your benefactor.

—description from the publisher

name: Stadt Land Spielt! Sonderdrucke 2018
description:
A collection of promo materials (demo games), released in a plastic bag at the "Stadt, Land, Spielt"-Event in Germany and Austria.

Included are:
1. Set Schnupperspiel
2. Sleeping Queens Mini
3. Silhouette gratis Demo-Spiel
4. Kingdomino for 2 players
5. 41 wooden bits from spielmaterial (5 extra large brown discs, 1 smaller, but higher disc of the same colour and 7 octagonal prisms each in blue, black, green, yellow and natural wood colour respectively)
publishers: AMIGO, Game Factory, Noris Spiele, Pegasus Spiele, www.spielmaterial.de

name: Czech Legion: Escape from the Soviet Union
description:
Czech Legion is a simulation of the operations of the Czech Legion in Russia, from May to December 1918. In this game, the player must secure control of most of Siberia, an escape route for the Czech Legion, as well as various other missions such as rescuing the Czar’s family or capturing the gold reserves of the Russian State.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area-Impulse, Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation

name: Kero: The Boss Variant
description:
Apply the boss sticker at the back of both their respective tokens (1 for each clan).

Those tokens now play like any other explorer tokens but have an ability that can be triggered once per game:
In case of a tie, the boss power can be activated to win the territory on which it is located. If both bosses are activated on the same card, no one wins.

Promo found in Plato Magazine 109.
categories: Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Real-time, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Fall's Leaves Fall
description:
Fall's Leaves Fall is a roll and write game about us as drafts that help Autumn leaves fall to the ground from a tree.

Pretty simple, right?

Well, the are 2 small restrictions for movement and in your way down you get to take victory points from other leaves you meet, dandelions and get bonuses from various sources, plus in your personal board you can have a set collection bonus plus a bonus if you reach down first!

All you need is to print the main board, the player board and the rules, get six dice and as many colored pencils as the number of players and start rolling and falling !!!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Line Drawing, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: tumult
description:
Tumult is a checkers variant where both players jump over the tokens of the opponent to remove them from the board.
The player with the most remaining tokens on the board wins.

This is a travel game version.

name: BodoCa
description:
User summary
BodoCa is short for 'Board Game's Card Game'. It is a Japanese card game with only Japanese text on the cards, so is very language dependent as is.

BodoCa is a party trivia card game about board games. The cards contain board game attributes such as theme, component, or designer. There are two play styles: expert and family.

For the family game, the game flow is similar to 20 questions. Each player, except the leader, has a hand of ten cards. The leader thinks of a game, then the players use their cards to narrow down the title. The person who guesses correctly wins the round.

For the expert game style, players are dealt a hand of cards, then each play one card. Players then try to come up with games that fit the criteria described by the cards in play.
publishers: Colorful Spiele (カラフルシュピーレ)

name: Tower of Madness: Gen Con Promo Set
description:
Four card promo set from Gen Con 2018 includes:

Dr. Jin Wu
Officer Brady
Casey Calleigh
Professor Culpepper
categories: Action / Dexterity, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Horror
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Batman Miniature Game: The Joker – Clowns Party
description:
Don't make us laugh. The green hair. The crazed smile. The maniacal cackle. You know exactly who he is and how far he'd go to put a smile on your face.

Whether by way of award-winning films like "The Dark Knight," Emmy-winning animated programs like "Batman: The Animated Series," video game appearances such as the record-breaking "Batman: Arkham Asylum," or the countless comics stacking comic book shelves and digital libraries, the Joker stands unquestionably as the most recognizable and popular comic book villain in pop culture history. Unpredictable, violent and incredibly dangerous, he is chaos personified and has taken on everyone from his archenemy Batman to even the Man of Steel.

But Gotham remains his primary home and Batman his biggest adversary, and no hero is perhaps better suited as in many ways, the Joker is the polar opposite of the Dark Knight. Both were created by a great tragedy, but Batman has since vowed to do whatever it takes to prevent similar incidents, the Joker revels in creating chaos and destroying lives, believing that life’s a big joke and psychotically demonstrating that in a moment, it can all change.

Not much is known about his past, but his acts during the present are what define the Joker as one of the greatest threats to our heroes and the people they've sworn to protect. He's killed a Robin, crippled Batgirl, and tortured and murdered countless people throughout the DC Universe—all just for a laugh.

Bat-Boxes are the ultimate way to jump into the action of the Batman Miniature Game! Each box contains a complete Crew and all the cards you need to play. In addition, in each Bat Box you will find a unique Objective for your Crew and a brand new scenario. If you’re new to the Batman Miniature Game, you’ll find a set of Quickstart Rules in each box, so you can start playing right away!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Batman Miniature Game: Suicide Squad
description:
Superheroes aren't the answer to every problem. Sometimes, extreme situations require extreme measures…or extreme individuals. The sort of individuals who call the infamous Belle Reve Prison home—super-villains.

Of course, no one will officially admit to any of this. That's the charm of Task Force X, perhaps better known by its nickname: the Suicide Squad. This team of super-villains, assembled by their director Amanda “The Wall” Waller, undertakes high-risk covert operations and in exchange receive commuted prison sentences. And we do mean high-risk. Regardless of abilities and talent, every member of the Squad is expendable—it’s expected that many will not return. As expendable assets, all members are fitted with an explosive device in their neck to assure obedience. If Squad members try to escape while on a mission...well, escape isn't an option. Runaway and its BOOM!

Given the rigorous requirements of the job, the Suicide Squad lineup is always in flux. The roster has included Deadshot, a precise marksman and assassin; Harley Quinn, a peppy but psychotic villain; Captain Boomerang, the man who turns boomerangs into lethal weapons; Enchantress, a powerful sorceress who can wield magical energy; and their sometimes field leader Rick Flag, an elite soldier who is one of the only members who isn’t a super-villain.

A group of super-villains who have a license to take drastic action in the name of serving a mission? There's no way that could end badly.

Bat-Boxes are the ultimate way to jump into the action of the Batman Miniature Game! Each box contains a complete Crew and all the cards you need to play. In addition, in each Bat Box you will find a unique Objective for your Crew and a brand new scenario. If you’re new to the Batman Miniature Game, you’ll find a set of Quickstart Rules in each box, so you can start playing right away!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Batman Miniature Game: The Riddler – Quizmasters
description:
Riddle us this: what cerebral criminal with an affinity for purple and green loves challenging the Dark Knight with cleverly calculated crimes and puzzling plots?

One of the Dark Knight's most infamous villains, Edward Nygma enjoys flaunting his intellectual superiority by conducting crimes and leaving clues for Batman to piece together. While this habit constantly leads to the aptly named Riddler failing in his criminal endeavours, his puzzle-problem actually stems not only from his own narcissism and ego, but also from a deep-seeded psychological compulsion. Because of this, the Riddler often finds himself a resident of Arkham Asylum following his inevitable capture.

Possessing a genius-level intellect, the Riddler creates elaborate, sometimes Rube Goldberg-esque traps, and is even willing to use innocent civilians as bait. Although not physically imposing, the Riddler's brilliance, neurosis and lack of empathy make him an incredibly dangerous foe. He cares very little—if at all—about the lives of those he uses in his plots and instead only sees them as disposable pawns in his continuing intellectual battle against Batman.

Bat-Boxes are the ultimate way to jump into the action of the Batman Miniature Game! Each box contains a complete Crew and all the cards you need to play. In addition, in each Bat Box you will find a unique Objective for your Crew and a brand new scenario. If you’re new to the Batman Miniature Game, you’ll find a set of Quickstart Rules in each box, so you can start playing right away!

—description from the publisher
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Awkward Party
description:
Game Intro. "Let’s face it. You don’t really want to be here. You don’t really want to talk to any of these people. You don’t really even want to play this game. But you came here for a reason, and you’re not going to get it unless you’re prepared to engage in a little small talk, the occasional social lubricant, and some generous nodding and smiling. If you play your cards right—literally in this case—you might just walk out of here a new person... yeah, who are we kidding, you’ll just be happy if you get through the evening with your dignity intact."

Awkward Party is a thematic card game, with party game elements, that pokes fun at the bizarre traditions and anxieties that define awkward social gatherings. At the start of the game, each player receives a hand of seven Awkward Party cards (hand limit 7), three Why Am I Even Here? Cards (hand limit), and sets their individual Awkwardness meter to 5. The Party Interest meter is put in the middle of the table and also set to 5. The Awkward Party cards are the main cards that the players play throughout the game with varying effects. They come in a number of categories such as Conversation, Venue, Money, Role, Drink, Support, Romantic Encounter, Rejection, and Something Interesting. The Conversation cards also have their own subjects such as Weather, Movies, Sports, Religion, Politics, and Sex.

The Why Am I Even Here? cards are the secret objectives each player is trying to complete. They also vary considerably from having a Conversation with all other players to receiving Money from two other players to acquiring the "Someone's Dog" card. Once one of their objectives has been completed, the player must reveal the corresponding Why Am I Even Here? card. In most cases, the winner of the game is the player who has revealed the most Why Am I Even Here? cards. There are a few exceptions such as the "Go Home" and the "Street Cred" Why Am I Even Here? cards, which are only completed and revealed when a particular game-ending event is triggered, even if it is not on the player's turn. If the event is triggered, the player holding the corresponding Why Am I Even Here? card wins the game regardless of how many revealed Why Am I Even Here? cards other players have. The game ends immediately when any one of the following events occurs:

A player reveals three completed Why Am I Even Here? cards.
A player's Awkwardness meter exceeds 10 (and they are forced to leave the party).
Party Interest drops below 1.
Party Interest exceeds 10 for the third time and the cops arrive to shut it down.


Game-play itself is turn-based. Each player turn has four phases:

Play 0-2 Awkward Party cards.
Discard any number of Awkward Party and/or unrevealed Why Am I Even Here? cards.
Draw Awkward Party and/or Why Am I Even Here? cards up to the hand limit (revealed Why Am I Even Here? cards still count).
Reduce Party Interest by 1.


If a player plays a conversation card on another player, any player may play another card to join the conversation if their awkwardness is low enough and they have a matching subject. With the exception of Conversation, Rejection, Money, and Support cards, turns can be stolen by other players by playing a card in the same category as the card just played. This card counts as the first card played by the player that just stole the turn. Turn-stealing can be chained, one card at a time, so long as players continue playing cards from the same category.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Simulation, Storytelling, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Who's There?
description:
To set up Кто там? (Who's There?), place the colored animal figurines on the table, then cover them with the houses so that young players won't see where each animal hides.

One child takes a card with a picture of an animal on it and tries to guess where that animal hides. After several turns, they need to remember four or five different animals at once, which can be a tough challenge when you're only a toddler...

name: Pokémon TCG: Electric Eye Theme Deck
description:
The Electric Eye Theme Deck is from the BREAKpoint expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the ninth expansion in the XY series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the XY series. It predominantly focuses on Lightning and Psychic type Pokémon.

Like other Theme Decks, Electric Eye includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Luxray deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. The initial release features a Mirror Holofoil Mega Gyarados coin while later releases feature a Cracked Ice Holofoil. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme

name: Pokémon TCG: Wave Slasher Theme Deck
description:
The Wave Slasher Theme Deck is from the BREAKpoint expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the ninth expansion in the XY series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the XY series. It predominantly focuses on Water and Grass type Pokémon.

Like other Theme Decks, Wave Slasher includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Greninja deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. The initial release features a Non Holofoil Mega Gyarados coin while later releases feature a Confetti Holofoil. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Video Game Theme

name: Inner Sanctum
description:
The knowledge of the world is hidden from the eyes of normal men. Only those deemed worthy in the eyes of those in the circle can earn the right to learn these secrets and enter the Inner Sanctum. But only one maybe chosen. Will you be the one?

In Inner Sanctum you try and control illegal businesses, politicians, spells, artifacts, rituals and other cultists, to rise up levels inside your cult. You do this by collecting sets of Control cards and have a larger set of that type than anyone else.

You can blackmail, leak scandals, police raids and more. You do this by playing action cards on your turn.

The deeper you go, the more corrupt you get. Everything you do, causes you to collect more and more corruption. The more corruption the harder it is to make it to level 7 and win the game. But if you gain too much corruption, the Dark One will come and take you.

How deep are you willing to go, will you sell your soul? will you call on the dark one himself for a shot at stealing victory out from under your rival cultists, and be the favored. Or will he take you back to his dark realm to never be seen again.

To play the game, players take turns drawing cards in the control phase, playing action cards and collecting sets of control cards.
When the Gathering phase is called, each player plays their sets and if you have more control cards than your opponents in a specific type, you gain a level(s).

If no one is at level 7, then a new control phase begins.

—description from the designer

name: Molins de Rei. 21-12-1808
description:
The battle of Molins de Rey was a battle that took place on december, 21st 1808 near Llobregat River close to Barcelona (Spain). It opposed French forces of general St.Cyr to the Spanish forces of general von Reading.

This game would be a Jours de Gloire series game.

The Spanish army tries to maintain a position apparently strong but with a weak flank. The French must try to coordinate a flank attack with a frontal attack to try to capture the entire enemy army. Historically the Spaniards were defeated but they avoided being surrounded.

The different divisions are activated by chits drawn from a cup, but the activation does not guarantee that the player does everything he wants.

The turns are 1 hour and the game lasts a maximum of 10 turns.

Rules: Jours de Gloire
Scale: 1 hex. = 330 m - 1 counter = 1 regiment/battaillon
Map size: A2

Spanish army: 15.000 men - 21 counters
French army: 25.000 men - 21 Counters

name: Town League Hockey
description:
In Town League Hockey, YOU are a newly arrived General Manager of a team in the Town Hockey League.
Somewhere in the far north... hidden among the great Canadian wilderness... where the snow falls year round, the bitter cold bites your face, and the sound of the wolves in the forest lull you to sleep at night... lies the hidden hamlet of Town.

Town is a humble, kind, hard-working community, but once a year, the people of Town become rivals... and they compete in an annual hockey tournament for the prestigious Frosty Cup! In Town League Hockey, you will control either the Gold or Silver team and guide your players to the ultimate prize!

Town League Hockey is a mid-weight game about playing a match of hockey. It was created to fill this niche because I found all hockey board games were either very light or very heavy. Town League Hockey is simple enough to learn in a few minutes, but deep enough that you will be mulling over your choices as you decide how to respond to on-ice events, where to skate with the puck to get the best shot, and when to rest or play your best players.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Asterix Game Set
description:
The game contains two variants: 1. Liberation Game, 2. Happy Families (a quartet game). The first variant involves the following:
It is an exciting game for 2 players. The cards are dealt as follows: one player uses the carts with the red backs and the other player the cards with the blue backs. Each player thus receives 26 cards. Each player arranges the cards in 4 rows of 6 cards and below this a fifth row consisting of 2 special cards (the "Magic Potion" and the "Normans"). All cards are placed face down. The aim of the game is to keep Britannia out of Roman Hands and find the magic potion as fast as possible!

Throw the die and turn over a card from your opponent's first row. If this card matches the symbol on the die, you can remove this card to clear a path to the magic potion. If the symbol and card do not match, turn the card face down again. Play now passes to your opponent. You can place "steps" horizontally, vertically and diagonally. You and your opponent take turns to roll the die and, if you get lucky, remove a card. But watch out for the "Julius Caesar" Cards!

name: Fetus Feud
description:
Fetus Feud takes you into the womb for a fast paced strategic battle to be the first born. Players take turns playing cards like Ultrasound, Overdue Baby and Pregnancy Cravings to collect contraction cards. Whoever has the most contraction cards when the Labor card is played is "crowned" the winner.

The deck contains attack, defense, and special cards that players can use to attack fellow wombmates, defend themselves and draft their hand. The key is to end the game by playing the Labor or Induce Labor card when you think you have enough contraction cards to win.

—description from the publisher

name: Hoplomachus: Crowd Favor Gladiators – BGG Promo Pack 2
description:
These Crowd Favor Gladiators are something of a collectible chip that can be used on all 3 games of the Hoplomachus series.

These CF Gladiators are a limited chip that may be found at conventions, in special promo packs, during Kickstarters, etc.

These chips are designed solely for some added fun and flavor, and they are NOT part of the Hoplomachus storyline. We designed these to honor our demo volunteers, reviewers, backers, and other influential people!
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame

name: Hoplomachus: Crowd Favor Gladiators – BGG Promo Pack 3
description:
These Crowd Favor Gladiators are something of a collectible chip that can be used on all 3 games of the Hoplomachus series.

These CF Gladiators are a limited chip that may be found at conventions, in special promo packs, during Kickstarters, etc.

These chips are designed solely for some added fun and flavor, and they are NOT part of the Hoplomachus storyline. We designed these to honor our demo volunteers, reviewers, backers, and other influential people!
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Wargame

name: What to Wear?
description:
Welcome to the Dress Up Show! You must change the colors of your outfits as fast as possible to match the assigned missions and score points. Some costumes have special colors and patterns. Can you beat the other players to be crowned the Dressing King/Queen?

In What to Wear? players use their colored plastic cards to match the colors and patterns shown on each mission card. Some missions require a bit knowledge of color mixing and reasoning. Get some practice and you may become the master of colors!
publishers: Kang Hsuan Educational Publishing Corp, Muduko

name: Strategos
description:
A Series of American Games of War Based Upon Military Principles and Designed for the Assistance Both of Beginners and Advanced Students in Prosecuting the Whole Study of Tactics, Grand Tactics, Strategy, Military History, and the Various Operations of War. Illustrated With Numerous Diagrams. To Which Is Appended a Collection of Studies Upon Military Statistics as Applied to War on a Field Map. By Charles A.L. Totten, First Lieutenant, Fourth United States Artillery.

—description from the publisher

This two volume work was a set of rules designed for simulating battles on the tabletop, in the style of Kriegsspiel. Rules are included for The Minor Tactical Game, The Grand Tactical Game, The Battle Game, and The Advanced Game. Units represent corps. A map scale of 5-10 inches to the mile is recommended.

—user summary

name: Grumantra of Dalhalla: Varna
description:
In the esoteric world of Dalhalla, once you reach the rank of Adhipa there's so many things to do, yet you have to polish your ability to control Vishra. Therefore a mystical method of training was invented, and later on this method became popular even among the youngest of Dalhalla.

This training is Varna, and this game of the mind, each Adhipa tests their mental strength against another Adhipa to conquer the power of Vishra. In Grumantra of Dalhalla: Varna, you can either create or destroy elements of opposing forces by adding more force to your elements. This process works differently for each element, depending on an elemental diagram.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Static Capture, Tile Placement

name: Pokémon TCG: Twilight Rogue Theme Deck
description:
The Twilight Rogue Theme Deck is from the Forbidden Light expansion of the Pokémon Trading Card Game, the sixth expansion in the Sun & Moon series. However, it also contains cards from earlier expansions in the Sun & Moon series. It predominantly focuses on Fighting and Psychic type Pokémon. The main Pokémon is Dusk Form Lycanroc using its Dangerous Rogue attack to punish the opponent for having a large bench. The secondary Pokémon is Dusknoir which uses its Dark Invitation ability to force the opponent to fill up their bench.

Like other Theme Decks, Twilight Rogue includes damage counters, a custom coin, one two-player mat, a Dusk Form Lycanroc deckbox and a TCGO deck access code. (User summary.)
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme

name: Fist of Dragonstones: The Tavern Edition – Percy Promo Pack
description:
Fist of Dragonstones: Tavern Edition - Percy Promo Pack is a set of 4 cards and depict characters seen in The Dragon and Flagon.

These are "Special Character Cards" that include: Sir Percival ("Percy"), Wizardess, Barbarian, and Swashbuckler.

These four Special Character Cards can be shuffled directly in the Special Character Card deck in the game.
categories: Bluffing, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Torrvald Orksbane: Adeptus Astartes Commander Set
description:
Torrvald Orksbane is a psyker of impressive power, able to conjure blizzards of destructive energy from the air and send bolts of freezing cold crackling from his fingertips. He has a knack for hunting Orks, saying he can ‘see’ their raw aggression on the wind – as a Space Wolf his every sense is sharpened, and as a Librarian, that includes those beyond mortal capabilities. When the force fields that protected Megaborealis went down, Torrvald lived up to his name, seeking out the Reivers known as the Fangs of Ulfrich before taking the fight to the Orks in the borer-hives.

Add a Commander – a powerful hero character with unique abilities and rules – to your Adeptus Astartes kill team with this set. It contains a multipart plastic Primaris Librarian miniature, a set of cards packed with exclusive rules and a sheet of tokens for use in-game:

- A Primaris Librarian: this multipart plastic kit is used to represent Torrvald Orksbane – or the Commander of any Adeptus Astartes kill team you wish – clad in Mk X power armour, with many elaborate accoutrements, from his ornate multi-layered cloak to the detailed wiring of his psychic hood, armed with a force sword in his right hand and a holstered bolt pistol
- A datacard for Torrvald Orksbane, featuring his characteristics, weapons, abilities and specialisms, along with a card featuring his background
- A card featuring Torrvald Orksbane’s skill tree – Primaris Librarian specialisms which can only be used by that character
- 4 Librarius Discipline psychic power cards, including the exclusive Stormcaller psychic power
- 5 Adeptus Astartes Commander Tactics Cards, including 2 Tactics exclusive to this set
- A sheet of tokens for use in games of Kill Team – this includes 1 Move/Charge token, 1 Fall Back/Advance token, 1 Ready/Shoot token, 6 Tactic/psychic power tokens, 3 wound tokens, and 3 objective tokens.

— description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Hind Helicopter Expansion
description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

The Hind expansion includes a plastic Hind Helicopter, Hind helicopter card, 2 hero cards, 4 crew cards, and 4 upgrade cards

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Chieftain Tank Expansion
description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

The Chieftan tank expansion contains a plastic Chieftain tank, Chieftain Tank Card, Chieftain (Stillbrew) Tank Card, Hero Card, 2 Crew Cards, 2 Upgrade Cards.

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Abrams Expansion
description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

The Abrams expansion contains
- Abrams Tank
- M1 Abrams Tank Card
- IPM1 Abrams Tank Card
- M1A1 Abrams Tank Card
- Hero Card
- 2 Crew Cards
- 2 Upgrade Cards

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Cobra Helicopter Expansion
description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

The Cobra helicopter expansion contains:
- plastic Cobra Helicopter
- AH-1 Cobra Helicopter Card
- 2 Hero Cards
- 4 Crew Cards
- 4 Upgrade Cards

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – T-64 Tank Expansion
description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is an easy-to-learn, quick-play, small-scale game, where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

The T-64 tank expansion contains
- plastic T-64 Tank
- T-64 Tank Card
- Hero Card
- 2 Crew Cards
- 2 Upgrade Cards

name: Tanks: T-34 (Early) Tank Expansion
description: The T-34 was the most-produced tank of World War II. When the German Wehrmacht first encountered it in battle in 1941, German tank generals von Kleist and Guderian called it "the deadliest tank in the world." The fast-moving T-34 tank was the mainstay of the Red Army's tank force throughout the war.

name: Hey Brother
description:
Hey Brother is a game of hard-talking 1980s wrestlers for two or more players. Talk the best trash to make your opponent crack before you do, but try not to embarrass yourself in front of Mean Gene.

To start, randomly choose the first Monarch of the Mat. The Monarch challenges whichever other player they want, then spits a few lines of their best 1980s wrestling promo impersonation. Take turns back and forth until one of you loses your furious concentration. When someone cracks, the other player is now Monarch of the Mat and challenges any other player. Keep playing until everyone taps out. The final Monarch wins the title belt.

The game comes printed on a bandanna.

name: FusionPlay Heroes: Hero Pack – Titchy & Snooks
description:
Titchy & Snooks - The tiny and the tarantula

This hero packs adds the Titchy, the young girl and her mutated spider friend "Snooks" to the game.

The Hero Pack contains everything that is needed to play with this new hero team.

Although they lack in strength and defense, Titchy and Snooks exceed all other heroes in agility. Their protection is evasion and their damage comes from a high critical hit chance. To support this, they have powerful buffs and debuffs to raise their own and lower the opponent’s dexterity. Playing them right means to prevent the opponent from hitting them.
categories: Card Game, Electronic, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: FusionPlay Heroes: Hero Pack – Kim Oh No
description:
Kim Oh No - An ancient angry assassin

This hero packs adds Kim Oh No, the japanese assassin with his uncontrollable outbursts to the game.

The Hero Pack contains everything that is needed to play with this new hero.

With his excellent defense, Kim is protected very well against physical attacks. His strength lies in continuously inflicting wounds to the opponent. This always forces the opponent to decide whether to tolerate the wounds or change his strategy and cure them. Be careful when the opponent attacks with Mental attacks. “Inner Spirit” can help against that.
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Grab Your Pitchforks and Torches!
description:
This 2 player game is meant to be a quick pocket sized game to play when time is short.

You are trying to be the first mob of people to capture 3 monsters that are around your town. First one to capture 3 monsters wins the game.

The game is an 18 card deck, with 14 of those cards in play. Each card has 2 values on it, a pitchfork or a torch. You collect the totals you need to capture the monster. Once you have captured it, you move onto the next monster, and start collecting your angry mob of pitchforks and torches again.

name: Poka Yoke
description:
Poka Yoke is a combinatorial game for two players. It's the follow-up to Tixel and Regatta.

The rules of Poka Yoke are exactly like the Tixel rules (see below) with the addition of the following 'piece promotion' rule:

If in a single turn a player picks up 1 of her own pieces (during a bonus move) to end the turn, then the picked up piece is promoted to a Regatta piece. In any single game at most 2 pieces per player can be promoted in this fashion.

Brief description of the Tixel rules:
On a turn, a player can either place a new Tixel piece or move one of her own Tixel pieces already on the board. A Tixel piece can be "active" or "inactive"; only active pieces, which are at a 45º angle, may be moved. Making pieces inactive is done by moving next to or passing an active piece.
Chaining moves is important as this temporarily unlocks three additional move types (aside from placing or moving a piece). If a piece that is moved is made inactive at its end position — i.e., it's sacrificed — a player can take an extra move if she so chooses; aside from placing or moving a piece, she can now remove a piece from the board, activate an inactive piece, or pivot an active piece to reorient its hollow side.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Grid Movement, Tile Placement

name: Vikings Gone Wild: Phal Phalson
description:
A promo card available from Tric Trac online store only.

Unit.
Purchase Price: 3 beer, 1 gold.
Effect: Gain 2 strength or 2 defense + draw 2 cards then discard one card from your hand.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Mythology, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: A Plus
description: A Plus, a.k.a. A+, is a co-operative game designed to reinforce and improve social skills for autistic children. With the help of a parent or other adult, players work together to complete a series of activities by matching them. At the end of the game, players receive an A+ if they completed all six activities.

name: Yoga Dice: A Fun Game of Rolling and Posing
description:
Have fun stretching with Yoga Dice! This cooperative movement game helps children learn the practice of Yoga while increasing flexibility and focus. Players roll the dice and choose a pose to hold together as a group. If everyone can hold the pose for the number of breaths rolled on the breath die, they advance a color token along the track. But if a focus symbol is rolled, the group loses some of its focus and the focus token advances! If all the color tokens cross the finish line before the focus token, everybody wins! Includes 36 poses to try.

—description from the publisher

name: Ocius
description:
Ocius is a crazy game of skill and speed, fast and fun for the whole family and for people with different age.

Playing cards corresponds to 5 different actions.

In turn,a player turns a card from the stack and all players have to perform the associated action together.

What is your goal??
You have to stay without cards to win!!!

Perform the action as fast as possible and be careful not to make mistakes or you will receive any cards from your opponents!!!

As soon as possible will be available translations of the rules card into other languages.

—description from the publisher

name: Quickfire
description:
Quickfire is a two-player dice-flicking dexterity game. Each player receives 3 dice and place them on three podiums on their side of the board. Three dice of a neutral colour are placed in the centre of the board.

On the count of three the players then flick their dice at the three target dice. The round ends when either 1) there are no target cubes left to aim at, or 2) one player is out of dice. The scores are then tallied: 1 point for each die in the opponent’s tray and 1 point for each of the opponent’s dice that have left the board. If one of the players is out of cubes, the other scores 1 point for each target die left in the field of play. The first to 9 points wins the game.

name: To the Moon
description:
Free game published in the May 2018 (GTM #219) issue of Game Trade Magazine.

The game utilizes the Pairs game system and is designed with the Deluxe Pairs deck, though it can be played with any Pairs deck.

Background: You and your friends are racing into space. Play your cards right, build a rocket, and head to the Moon!

To the Moon is played over several rounds. Each round is made of several countdowns, or tricks. The goal of each trick is to be the last player still “in,” and this earns you one point for every card in the trick.

To start the round, shuffle the deck and deal a hand of cards to each player. The number of cards you deal out varies with the number of players, as follows:

Players: 2 3 4 5 6
Cards: 8 7 6 5 4

The dealer plays the top card of the deck to start the first trick. Each trick represents a countdown, and may therefore contain no more than one card of each rank. Play proceeds clockwise, skipping players who are out. On each turn, you may do one of three things: build, test, or withdraw

Build: Play a card from your hand into the countdown. This card can’t match any of the cards that are already there. If you complete a perfect countdown (all ten cards), then you win this trick immediately. Otherwise, play continues, and you are still in.

Test: Play the top card of the deck. If it is a legal play, then your test is a success, and you are still in the trick. If it matches another card, then you are knocked out of the trick, and take that card into your hand.

Withdraw: Play no cards, and take yourself out of the trick. You also take one card from the table into your hand, unless this would leave no cards on the table.

Note: When out of the trick, lay your hand face down on the table, with the card that you just took face up on top. This makes it easier for everyone to see who is in and out.

Taking the Trick: When only one player remains in the trick, that player wins the trick and scores those cards. All players come back in, and the winner leads the next trick by playing the top card of the deck. If the deck is empty at this step, the round is over.

Scoring: Each card captured in a trick is worth one point. Play six rounds, and then the highest total score wins.

name: Lunch Rush
description:
Free game published in the July 2018 (GTM #221) issue of Game Trade Magazine.

The game utilizes the Pairs game system and is designed with the Lord of the Fries Deck, though it can be played with any Pairs deck.

Background: The Zombies at Friedey’s Restaurant have a funny way of making lunch. They throw all the ingredients into a bowl, and when a sandwich forms, they grab it.

You Need: A Pairs deck and a way to keep score.

Note: This game can be played cutthroat (with everyone playing alone), but with more than three players we prefer playing in teams. See Team Play with Odd Numbers below to learn how to do this with five or seven players.

Structure: Lunch Rush is played in several rounds. In each round, players take turns playing cards into the center and trying to complete “sandwiches.”

A sandwich is a sequence of cards in which one or more smaller cards lie between two matching larger cards. For example, 9-8-3-9 is a “nine sandwich,” made from two 9’s surrounding an 8 and 3.
