However, 9-8-10-9 is not a nine sandwich, because the 10 is larger than the 9’s. Playing a 10 into the second sequence would create a ten sandwich: 9-8-10-9-10.

Note: Two matching cards in a row does not make a sandwich, because there must be at least one smaller card between them.

To Begin the Round: Shuffle the deck and deal a hand of cards to each player. The number of cards in hand, and the total number of rounds to play, is as follows:

Players: 2 3 4 5 6 7
Cards: 10 9 8 7 7 7
Rounds: 6 6 4 5 6 7

Sequence of Play: Starting on the dealer’s left, each player in turn plays one card from their hand into the sequence in the middle of the table. If you complete a sandwich, you pick up those cards and score them.

Scoring: For the “bread,” the large cards that bracket the sandwich, you score one point per card. For the “meat,” the smaller cards inside the bread, you score face value. For example, a sandwich of 7-4-7 would be
worth a total of 6 points: 4 for the meat, and 1+1 for the bread. Keep these cards aside, with the bread face down and the meat face up.

Play continues until all players’ hands are empty. Record your scores for the round and pass the deal to the left.
The total number of rounds in the game is given above.

Team Play with Odd Numbers?

With five or seven players, you can use a format of rotating teams. The dealer plays alone, and the other players divide into two teams. With five players, the teams are A-B-A-B-D, where D is the dealer. With seven, they are A-B-A-B-A-B-D. In a full game, each player deals once.

Because these teams are temporary, each player keeps a separate score. Both of the players on a team score all of that team’s points.

name: Ogre: Scenario Book 3
description:
Ogre Scenario Book 3 has nine new scenarios to expand your Ogre battles. Written and designed by Steve Jackson for use with Ogre Designer's Edition, most are compatible with Ogre Sixth Edition as well.

An Ogre questions its luck in "Gauntlet" as it returns home. "Longview" features a Command Post that can fight back. And in "Sidewinder," the map is turned on its side, changing the dynamics of the terrain for both the Ogre and the defenders. These and six other scenarios are curated for your enjoyment!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Variable Player Powers

name: Sai fare come me?
description:
“Sai fare come me?” is a game of movement in which players have to imitate a position or an action.

The box contains 56 cards divided into 2 groups of different difficulty and 4 objects (a ball, a disk, a ring and a cube).

The current player draws a card and tries to imitate the indicated action. Each card presents an illustration of an animal: the animal can be stationary in a certain position, in motion or intent to interact with an object. The positions are for children 3+ years old, while movements are for children 4+ years old.

In the game there are also cards depicting a wolf. To win, players must discover 12 "action" tiles before 4 "wolf" tiles.

-description from designer

name: Numeri... che pizza!
description:
“Numeri… che pizza!” is a game in which children can learn to count, make the first additions and even develop memory.
The box contains 24 slices of pizza of different sizes, 2 pizza containers, 2 dice and 5 hats. Each slice has a number from 1 to 4 on one side and an ingredient with the respective quantity on the other. For example, on one side there is the number 3 and on the other there are 3 mushrooms. Some slices are rotten.
The current player rolls the 2 dice (which show an ingredient and a number) and takes the corresponding segment.
The game includes 3 modes:
- Basic mode (for 2 players aged 4+): whoever completes a pizza first earns a hat. To complete a pizza you have to take exactly 10 ingredients. The winner is the first player with 3 hats.
- Complete mode (for 2 players aged 5+): compared to the previous mode, the slices should be placed face down on the side with the number. As a result, children should remember the ingredients below and avoid rotten pizza slices.
- Cooperative mode (for 1 or more players aged 5+): the children collaborate and try to complete a pizza before that rotten pizza is formed.

-description from designer

name: Le jeu du loup: Rapido go !
description:
The wolf is tired of walking! There must be a more fun way to get around! Find as quickly as possible the means of transport corresponding to the number of wolves. A game of observation and speed!

—description from the publisher

A card of the deck is turned and the played must compare it as quickly as possible with the back of the next card. The back of the cards show one to three images of the wolf, while the front show one image of a means of transport (tractor, motorbike, train, roller, ...), two images of a second one and three image of a third one. The first player to say the name of the transport corresponding to the number of wolves wins the card.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: In the Trenches: Devil Dogs 2 Faith & Sacrifice
description:
IN THE TRENCHES (ITT) system designed by John Gorkowski, this series enables players to game historically accurate simulations of tactical operations from the Great War. ITT challenges players to move and fight with company-level formations made of separate platoon-sized units during five minute, impulse-based turns. The historically accurate maps are scaled to 100 yards per hex. This approach recreates WWI command and control problems and inspires historically accurate play without forcing decisions.

Devil Dogs 2 Faith & Sacrifice is an expansion/battle pack for Tiny Battle's In the Trenches: Devil Dogs. It adds counters for both the US Marines and German's, including tanks and four scenarios covering battles between them in the last year of the war, each with its own map.

The list of the 4 scenarios - which each include 1 to 3 alternate scenarios:

1. The Farm: "As the troops in field-gray uniforms emerged from the woods and began their assault across the field, prone Marines spread out across a small ridge made sight adjustments and windage estimations. The Marines of the 2nd Battalion, 5th Marine Regiment, lying in the grass at Les Mares farm, readied their Model 1903 Springfield rifles and laid out five-round stripper clips of .30-06 ammunition beside them for easy access."

2. Advance on Vierzy: "On 17 July 1918, the Marines and other Allied units marched through rain and mud near Soissons. Early on the morning of 18 July the 5th Marine Regiment began a major offensive by sweeping the Germans from Translon and Verte Feuille Farms. The swift advance was halting only after the enemy managed to reinforce their defense line running south through Vierzy. After regrouping, the Marines were ordered to advance on Vierzy later that afternoon."

3. Carnage at Bouresches: "After the costly gains in Belleau Woods and near Lucy, Marine forces turned their attention to clearing the Germans from Bouresches. The depleted 5th Marines, having sustained heavy losses in an open ground assault near Lucy approached Bouresches from the woods to the West. The 6th Marines had been ordered to aid the attack on Bouresches from its position near Triangle Farm."

4. Action at Blanc Mont: "The first week of October saw heavy fighting and left both Marines and other allied units stuck well forward of supporting forces. Nicknamed 'The Box' by Marines since they were forced to defend against counterattacks from all sides. On the 7th and 8th of October Marines, with support from other units pushed into St. Etienne to take out the fortified MG positions and escape 'The Box'."
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Haunt the House: Graveyard
description:
A new press your luck location for you to visit during the game!

Components:

4 Gravestone tiles (identical on the front. On the back, 2 are blank, 1 shows a skull, 1 shows a Phantom)
1 Gate card

Setup:

Shuffle the 4 Gravestones face down and place them in a row, with the Gate nearby.

Gameplay:

On your turn (max once per turn), you may use 1 Action to play a Scare face down onto the Gate card. When you do, you may pick any Gravestone and peek at the back side, then place it back in the same spot.

If the Scare you play is the fifth Scare on the Gate, the four earlier Scares on the Gate are discarded (but the one you just played stays there).

When there has been a BOO and players who played correct invisible Scares are claiming their rewards, a player picking a reward has the third reward choice of pointing at a gravestone and revealing it. That player earns whatever is on the back side, multiplied by the number of Scares on the Gate. Then (even if nothing was won), all Scares on the Gate are discarded and the Gravestones are reshuffled.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Scimitar Tank Expansion
description:
With a powerful engine and aluminium armor, the Scorpion and Scimitar light tanks are fast and lightweight. As such, the vehicles form the backbone of British Army reconnaissance units. While engaging in a stand-up fight is the last thing on the minds of crew, the designers equipped tanks with enough sting to take on all but the toughest enemy tanks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Wargame

name: TANKS: The Modern Age – Soviet T-72 Tank Expansion
description:
TANKS: The Modern Age is a small-scale game where you take command of a Tank Platoon, seeking to destroy your opponent's tanks and secure victory.

TANKS is a flexible game with lots of ways to create a finely-tuned platoon. In an hour, you can pick your tanks and crew, upgrade them to your specifications, defeat your enemy (or die trying).

The T-72 expansion contains:
Unassembled Plastic T-72 Tank
T-72 Tank Card
Hero Card
Crew Card
3 Upgrade Cards

name: Super Dungeon: Tengu
description:
Tengu is a mini-boss for use in your games of Super Dungeon.

For centuries, the Tengu have bartered or traded their magical and martial skill to the competing clans of Kagejima. Sometimes they do so for gold, for more offerings at their shrines, or for shiny baubles. Other times the requests are more unusual, such as whispers of love from a beautiful woman, the first wail of a newborn, or thirty stems of saffron.

—description from the publisher's website
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures, Mythology
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Super Dungeon: Uzumaki
description:
Uzumaki is a Clan Kitsune themed hero for Super Dungeon! This hero is themed to the Kitsune Clan, and is a must-have addition for players who pick up the new Clan Kitsune Super Dungeon Warband.

Usumaki is unlike his otherwise reclusive Kitsune kin. Where others recoil at the sight of travelers, Uzumaki is often the first to greet them and offer them warding runes and medicines in exchange for stories of the world beyond his clans' hallowed forests. Social, skilled, and savvy, he is ill-suited for the more solemn life his clan's spirit-haunted trees offer.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Miniatures
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Codenames: Cartes promo – Univers Geek
description:
This is a promo pack of ten additional double-sided cards for Codenames.

Catwoman / Lara Croft
Diablo / Mordor
Godzilla / Zelda
Gollum / Mickey
Homer Simpson / Pikachu
Jack Sparrow / Luigi
James Bond / Narnia
Poudlard / Sangoku
Princesse Leia / Wolverine
Westeros / Yoda
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Spies/Secret Agents, Word Game
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Team-Based Game

name: Vremya Valery: Vozvrashenie Valery
description: Russian expansion to Who's the Dude. It's includes a new 96 cards with words to explain with Dude. What's about the Dude? He strikes back!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Real-time

name: Dead Line
description:
Dead Line is a simple wooden game of chance for two players.

One player begins by rolling both dice. Each player starts on position 1. To move on to position 2, the player must roll a two on one dice or a combination equaling two. After rolling, then moving if possible, the next player goes. Continue the same way to position 3, and so on.

First player to 10 wins!

—user summary

name: Rally Cross
description:
In Rally Cross each player decides themselves how he or she wants to drive their car. There are no dice or other randomness - apart from the surprises other players create.
—description from the box (translated)

Players take turns moving their race car around a track (it's easy to design your own tracks). The car has to move according to its gearing/speed. You can only increase/decrease speed in steps of one, so plan in good time for the next curve.
—user summary

name: Z War One: Damnation – Delta 6 Expansion
description: The frozen north of the UK is a safe haven during the winter months, the undead firmly frozen in their tracks. Refugees and military alike sit behind the relative (if a bit chilly) safety of the wall. One group of elite soldiers are not so lucky...
categories: Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling

name: Pic! Six!!
description:
Pic! Six!! is a football board/card game for 2 or 4 players. Play centers around action at the Line of Scrimmage. Each turn is a “Down”. Each player plays a combination of cards trying to win the “Down” The results are a combination of charts and dice. One player uses their “Offense” cards & the other uses their “Defense” cards.
Each player has two “Audible” cards, so they are able to change their play during the “Down”.
A sand timer is used to keep the game moving along.
There is a set of “Special Teams” cards which the players share when needed.
The first player/team to score 10 points wins.
The whole idea is to have a fast-paced game.

“Fast-playing light simulation of a 2-Minute Drill” The perfect description by tempus42

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Krowdfunder: The Game
description:
Welcome to Krowdfunder – the crowdfunded game about crowdfunding. In this game, players try to successfully fund as many projects as possible through a simple mechanic that recreates the rollercoaster experience of running crowdfunding campaigns.

Basically, you are creating a campaign for a project and are trying to make it as successful as possible, maximizing the two key factors of any crowdfunding campaign: the number of backers and the pledge that each backer is going to make.

At the setup of the game, players are given a starting hand of campaign cards, a draw pile is made with the remaining cards. A selection of audience cards are placed in the centre of the table for the players to see, which are flipped before the game starts so players have to try and remember where the best of these cards are.

Players take turns to draw a card from a central draw pile; there are five different suits of cards that players are trying to collect to generate enough money to meet their funding goal. The suits are: pledges, stretch goals, add-ons, videos and buzz! Each campaign card depending on its type will provide the player with either coins or backers, multiplying the number of each together gives the player their funding total.

Mixed with these campaign cards there are also special action cards that allow players to interact with other players and the game further to help them get the cards they need.

Once a player has collected a set of the required cards, they are able to launch their project, declaring this to the other players as everyone tries to grab an audience card from the centre of the table to help them meet their goal.

Once a player has successfully funded projects worth 40 coins, they are declared the winner.

—description from the publisher

name: Mr. M's Bunny Hunt
description:
User summary
マーさんのバニーハント (Mr.M's Bunny Hunt) is a criminal speed game from Japan (published in English and Japanese).

In the game of Mr. M's Bunny Hunt, you are a member of an anti-societal organization, and dispatch bunny girls to underground casinos.

You must dispatch girls as fast as possible, strictly following the casino owner's will. If you fail, you must make an apology in anti-societalists' traditional way, which means cutting one of your fingers off. But don't worry. Because you are a bio-mafia, your lost finger will be regenerated shortly. That being said, you might end up at the bottom of the ocean if you make many mistakes.

In this game, players try to play cards the lead player has specified as fast as possible.
Each round, the lead player plays an initial card face-up, declaring "color follow", "number follow", or "no follows". The other players find eligible cards from their hand, display them, and touch the initial card to indicate finish. The eligible cards are:
"color follow": cards that share color with the initial card
"number follow": cards that share number with the initial card
"no follows": cards that don't share color or number with the initial card

If a player played any non-eligible card, that player must take all cards displayed. Otherwise, the player who finished last must take them.

The game ends when a player gets rid of all cards from their hand, in which case that player wins.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは反社会組織の構成員となり、地下カジノへバニーガールの斡旋を行います。
送り込むバニーガールの条件は胴元（親プレイヤー）の意向に従わねばなりません。
ゲームはリアルタイムで進みます。マフィアは時間に厳しいものです。
仕事が遅い者には相応のケジメ（失点）が待っていることでしょう。
でもご安心を。我々はバイオマフィアなので失った指はすぐ生えてきます！
とはいえ、あまりに失態が多ければ見せしめとして海の底に沈められてしまうのです！
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Mafia, Party Game, Real-time

name: Cult Following: Cult Classics
description:
Cult Following: Cult Classics is an expansion for Cult Following: The One True Game. This expansion includes 75 sign cards inspired by classical religions. Mix these cards in with the base game, or keep them separate to allow players the choice of regular or Cult Classics cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Easy Profit Game
description:
The point of the game is to complete a profitable (or not) year in business. The result of playing the game is an enhanced understanding of the basic financial tools commonly used in business. The participants make up a team of executives for a fictitious company (can also be played individually).

The flow of the game is that each player or team of players make up a company that lives through a year in business, one month at a time. They run into many opportunities and some of those opportunities become obstacles if they do not respond to them correctly. And, the team has to deal with annoying things that happen in business like paying bills and dealing with an employee that steals from you or spending money on something that was not anticipated. Each month, the team completes that months section on a P&L, Balance Sheet and Statement of Cash flows.

During the process, players are interacting with our website, their team and other teams and all of these relationships have an effect on the outcome of the game. The team with the most profit at the end of the game (year) WINS!

To start the game, the players must divide into teams. Each team being made of 1-3+ players. Teams can be bigger for large groups but 3 is the ideal largest team size. The teams name their company and roll dice to determine which side of the game board to play on (franchise vs. non-franchise) and from there, the players reference the "play now" section of the website to capture their region info to note on the main game board before they begin the first turn.

Each turn equals a month in business. The game lasts for 12 months (1 year) but the first quarter (3 months) has already been completed so the teams actually begin in April using Jan-Mar as a template for how to proceed.

Each team begins by rolling a dice to determine if they pull a "sales" card or a "company" card. Sales cards tend to lead to better results but not always. Following the instructions on the sales card, the team proceeds with completing the income sheet for that month. They then use those results to complete the balance sheet and then the cash flow statement.

Finally, they check the economic health of the other teams in their community to see if they are growing or declining which effects their income for the following turn (month).

This cycle continues in and through December where the winner is determined based on their total earnings, cash at the bank and owners equity.

Despite all the financial terms the game is both realistic and fun to play for families or professionals.

—description from the publisher

name: Tactic All Stars Coach Collectible Card Game
description:
In this collectible card game players take the role of the soccer team managers.

Each player is given 6000 currency to spent on players for their team. The same player may not be chosen twice.

After the teams have been chosen it is time to play soccer. Each player has their own board where they put their player cards. Both players start with a ball on their goal keepper. The ball is moved by rolling a dice and players do so in turn. With 1-2 the ball goes backwards, 3 sideways and 4-6 forward. If the ball can't move back it stays where it is.

When a player gets the ball to attacking zone a kick occurs. The attacking player throws the dice again and adds the value to the kickers attack value. Defending player checks the defending value of the goalkeeper and the player of his who has the ball and counts them together. If the attacker has a bigger sum the kick is a goal, and if defending sum is bigger the game continues.

The game ends when an agreed number of goals is made.

This is basically a two player game, but can be plaid with multiple people as a tournament.

name: Norsaga: PAX 2018 Promo Cards
description:
Promotional cards from PAX East 2018.

4 double-sided cards that expand Norsaga: Odds and Endings.

Immortal - Guardian: Tuva Sunwrath (Might)
Immortal - Guardian: Just Grame (Lore)
Immortal - Guardian: The Insatiable Wishard (Craft)
Immortal - Guardian: Pol at the Threshold (Faith)

Gameplay
These cards function identically to the Guardian Immortal cards found in Norsaga: Odds and Endings. When playing with Immortals, shuffle these in for additional variety.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Micro-Combat
description:
Pathogens are attacking the population of the city! As good healthcare professionals you have the mission of thwarting this threat. Your city depends on you! Micro-Combat is a game of cooperation - you can only overcome these pathogens by working together!

Micro-Combat is a game designed to work among the young population on the subject of infectious diseases and to understanding the causes and risk factors for antimicrobial resistance.

In Micro-Combat you will play the role of health authorities who have the mission of thwarting the attack of pathogenic agents (virus, bacteria, fungi and parasites) which can make the population of your city ill. Your goal is to avoid any of the characters in the game losing all their defenses, and to do this you will have different preventive measures and medications... which are not always enough.

The game has 3 types of cards: character cards, attack cards (pathogens, "out of stock" cards and antimicrobial resistance cards) and defense cards (prevention measures and medications)
At the start of the game, 5 characters are chosen at random and placed in the center of the table. Each character has some defense points and an innate prevention measure.

The game consists in using the defense cards in order to stop the characters from losing their defense points due to the effects of the pathogen cards. Everyone plays at the same time, with no turns or player order. The pathogens are defeated through player cooperation. The game consists of 6 rounds. Each round includes the following phases: exposure (to pathogens); prevention and treatment; infection and contagion. If a character reaches zero defense points, the players lose the game.

-description from designer
publishers: Barcelona Institute for Global Health (ISGlobal), Troquel Games

name: 221B Baker Street Expansion Pack
description:
50 new cases for the 2016 Gibsons edition of 221B Baker Street: The Master Detective Game
Rules, Clues and Solutions + collectible metal playing piece
categories: Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Murder/Mystery, Novel-based
mechanics: Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Moscow Assailed, 1941
description:
A hex-and-counter game covering this most decisive Russian Front battle, 30Sep41-31Jan42 in 8 semi-monthly turns at 20 miles - 32 kilometers - per hex and basically corps to army scale. Map scale is same as for SPI's now classic War in Europe. German operational intelligence limited by Russian maskirova/deception pieces.

4 especially strong panzer divisions are broken out for deep penetration and exchange small change.

Simple airpower units and rules, including Russian paradrops ... if both korps aren't already eaten up in the ground battle.

Unpredictable, press-your-luck combat system for risk-takers, along with extra German offensive phases - one at the start and another later ... which also makes for good solitaire play.

And my famous/notorious Siberian Reserve Gamble. :-)

—description from the designer
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Push Your Luck, Secret Unit Deployment, Simulation, Variable Phase Order

name: Over Malvern Hill
description:
Rules for miniature wargames set in the American Civil War. The rules can be played in most figure scales and the rules are so flexible that players do not have to rebase their armies and armies based to different rules systems can be played against each other. Table sizes can be as little as the usual 4 x 6 to as large as there is space.
Unit be they infantry cavalry or artillery have only one statistics, a Fatigue Score. The Fatigue score of a unit is a numerical representation of the unit’s combat capabilities based on its Grade and its Élan. A units training, combat experience and psychological state are all rolled up into the units Fatigue Score. The higher the Fatigue Score number, the better the troop type will perform....

name: Munchkin Collectible Card Game: Dorksteel Hat Promo Card
description:
Dorksteel Helmet cards. It's a rank 0 item that does nothing, except in the text it has the word "Stealthy."

Stealthy means the card with the ability cannot be targeted by cards or abilities that require a target.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting

name: Dungeon Escape! Infest!
description: This expansion adds new monsters and items, as well as traps, ambushes and infest tiles. It also includes varied difficulty room tiles (easy and hard difficulty) and 6 scenarios.

name: Rachmistrz
description: Rachmistrz (Reckoner) is a lightweight math game with a real-time twist. During a turn 3 dice with numbers are rolled and players start to calculate their best move! All players use addition, subtraction, multiplication and division to reach one of numbers available on the main board. They place their tokens on the result of their operations. They have to be fast as once covered, numbers on the board become unavailable for the rest of the game! At the end of the game, the player with most connected tokens is declared the winner. Once you have mastered the regular board with whole numbers try the flip side of the board presenting you with fractions!

name: Fight for 50 Billion
description:
This game is a hero ability card game. When the game start, everyone picks 3 hero cards as their ability. Each turn, a player can choose two actions to do:

Draw 3 cards
Take 2 public cards
Play 1 card
Finish 1 goal card
Cure any units


There are 2 different types of cards:

Unit card: When you play the unit card, you can use the ability of the unit. The number of the same unit you have determines LV of the ability. After you use the ability, the unit will keep on your board.
Magic card: Use the ability and discard it.


After your turn, each finished goal card will earn 1 Billion. The player who reaches 50 Billion first will win the game.

—user summary

name: ウィルス・マネー (Virus Money)
description:
User summary
ウィルス・マネー (Uirusu Manee) Virus Money is a Japanese card game (English rules online).

The players are traders gathered to try to make a profit in the cryptocurrency market. They learn of a stock exchange where they can bid on assets and make a killing. But there is also a hidden back door they can use to steal cryptocurrency from others.

Players place bids using the assets they have on hand in order to score the most points and be declared the winner. Each player is given a role at the beginning, and this affects how points are scored but is not revealed until final points are tallied.

The regular players earn points by bidding, acquiring and playing cards, while trying to avoid having points stolen by the Virus Player. The Virus Player conceals their identity and tries to get the other players to take their assets, earning points by taking them back at the end.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは、仮想通貨でひと儲けしようと集まった者たちです。
とある取引所では、競りで取引を決め大もうけできると知ります。
しかし、そこには、他人の仮想通貨を奪う裏道が隠されていたのです―。
このゲームでは、手持ちの資産を上手に活用し、より多くの得点をしたプレイヤーが勝利します。まず最初に得点計算まで公開されない役職が決められ、それにより得点する方法が変わってきます。
通常プレイヤーは競りでカードを獲得・使用してウィルスプレイヤーに減点されないように得点、ウィルスプレイヤーは正体を隠して自分の資産を他のプレイヤーに獲得させ、それを奪うことで得点します。
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Real-time

name: Last Wan Standing
description:
You and your buddies just got back from a big heist... but now you can't decide how to split up the haul. As you reach for your guns one question runs through everyone's mind - who will be the Last Wan Standing?

Each turn players will reveal a target and a numbered bullet chip. The numbered bullet determines how quickly you shoot, and the target determines who you shoot at. The catch is that the numbered bullets aren't re-usable, so you have to decide if you want to save your quickest shots for later in the round or not. There are other complications, like the "Down" chip that lets you dodge most bullets, your secretly selected "amigo" who you can't get target and get points for avenging, or the "quick draw" target chip that lets you defeat anyone shooting you on the same number, that allow for surprising plays.

Note: "wan" is the Japanese word for "woof" and is pronounced the same as "one".

—user summary

name: Days of Ire: Budapest 1956 – Printing Press Promo Card
description:
Setup: Place this card next to the main board at the beginning of day 3, as close to Blaha Lujza Square as possible. Do not add any fighters to this location at setup.

Gameplay: This is a new location, pieces can move to the same as any other location on the board, but it is only adjacent to Blaha Lujza Square. It has a printed event that can be solved by the Revolutionary player(s) the same way as any other event. If
the event is solved, the location is removed from play (and its printed effect performed). If the event is not solved by the end of the game, it counts against the events on the board, and triggers its printed penalty effect.

The Printing Press is supported both in Zhukov and Conflict modes, in any player counts.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Modern Warfare, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Team-Based Game

name: Taking Stock
description:
You are a stock market investor who is looking to get the most out of your money. Buy low and try to control the market to gain you the most victory points!

Everyone starts out with the same ten numbered cards and uses these to bid on stocks. Bids are collected each round and stock prices change based on the total amount bid for each stock. Stock values, using VPs as currency, rise with high total bids on that stock. However, bidding low actually wins you the stock itself.

After 6 rounds the stock values in your portfolio are calculated and whoever has the most VPs wins!

—description from the designer

name: Talk, You Fiend!
description:
Acting as a hired torturer for the Mad King, the goal of "Talk, You Fiend!" is to be the best at your job by inflicting as much pain as possible on the prisoners by choosing to play varying levels of pain cards. Compete against other players to see who is the best at the job, but be careful not to overdo it as the prisoner can only collectively take so pain much before breaking.

If the prisoner survives, the player with the highest pain card wins the prisoner, the points, and the round. If the prisoner breaks then be ready to collect the dreaded "Shame Token". Out-wit and bluff your competitors to see who is the best torturer. The first player to reach 10 points wins the game!

-description from the publisher

name: Gamergate: The Card Game
description:
A two player adversarial game, you’ll compete with the Social Justice Warriors trying to get away with egregious breaches of ethics before Gamergate can create enough of a fuss and social pressure to expose them, all the while flaming each other on Twitter, screaming for attention and being trolled hard. Gamergate the Card Game, is a trick taking game that is played in rounds. Once an "Ethics Breech" card has been drawn then the two sides take turns playing cards trying to score greater numbers than the other player. Once the the round is over then the player with the higher score wins the "ethics breech" (trick). The player with the higher number of tricks wins the game.

—user summary

name: Ultimate Music Trivia Quiz
description: Trivia quiz game with four categories - pop, rock, movie soundtracks & hits of the 80’s.

name: Sinful Cinema
description: Players compete to craft the funniest, raunchiest and most ridiculous porn parody titles for Hollywood movies. A judge player draws a card with the title of a movie on it then all players take turns creating the most porn parody like title of the movie. The judge awards points for the most creative! Play continues around the table until a set amount of points are reached. Cards include a parody title at the bottom for bonus points if someone guesses it.

name: Struggle and Strife
description:
Medieval fantasy game for 2-5 players where the board changes every time you play. Play cards from your hand against defending dice rolls in order to take control of land and net victory points for your faction. Brave wild encounters to attain powerful enhancements or gain helpful advantages without risk. Through the 10 rounds collect the most victory points in order to become the leading force on the board at the end of the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Storm of Chaos
description:
Warhammer: Storm of Chaos is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page softcover book is a campaign sourcebook, enabling Warhammer players to recreate the battles of this mighty Chaos invasion on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Hordes of Chaos
description:
Warhammer: Hordes of Chaos is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 112-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Hordes of Chaos faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Beasts of Chaos
description:
Warhammer: Beasts of Chaos is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Beasts of Chaos faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer (Sixth Edition): Dwarfs
description:
Warhammer: Dwarfs is an expansion to the 6th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 80-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Dwarfs faction and field it on the tabletop.

Released shortly before the coming of the 7th edition of Warhammer, this is a second army book for the Dwarfs faction in the 6th edition.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Nemesis 9 Tyrantis: Tyranid Commander Set
description:
The bioform codified by the Inquisition as Nemesis 9 Tyrantis is a true horror. It prizes terror so highly it likes to leave one prey-creature from each group of victims alive so they might spread their fear to the common herd of Vigilus like a virus. Nemesis 9 Tyrantis has on more than one occasion been mistaken for the leader of the planet’s Genestealer Cult infestation – however, so long as the Broodlord gets to feed on the minds and bodies of the populace, it cares little for the chatterings of ambulatory biomass.

Add a Commander – a powerful hero character with unique abilities and rules – to your Tyranid kill team with this set. It contains a multipart plastic Broodlord miniature, a set of cards packed with exclusive rules and a sheet of tokens for use in-game:

- A Broodlord: this multipart plastic kit is used to represent Nemesis 9 Tyrantis – or the Commander of any Tyranid kill team you wish – standing atop a chitinous structure, poised ready to strike with his truly horrifying monstrous rending claws, his maw open and showing off rows of sharp fangs
- A datacard for Nemesis 9 Tyrantis, featuring its characteristics, weapons, abilities and specialisms, along with a card featuring his background
- A card featuring Nemesis 9 Tyrantis’ skill tree – Broodlord specialisms which can only be used by that character
- 3 Hive Mind Discipline psychic power cards
- 3 Tyranid Commander Tactics Cards, including 2 Tactics exclusive to this set
- A sheet of tokens for use in games of Kill Team – this includes 1 Move/Charge token, 1 Fall Back/Advance token, 1 Ready/Shoot token, 6 Tactic/psychic power tokens, 3 wound tokens, and 3 objective tokens.

-description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Warhammer 40,000: Kill Team – Crasker Matterzhek: Genestealer Cults Commander Set
description:
Crasker Matterzhek of the Elevated Siblings bears the standard of his kindred, a sacred duty given to him by Primus Desh. The icon of Grandsire Wurm must be seen from the highest vantage point, to boost the rebellion’s morale in this vital hour – with the cult’s most experienced kill team alongside him, Crasker feels sure he will make it to the very tip of the sprawl’s tallest spire. Perhaps he will raise it so high that the Star Children will see him, and grant him the desire he so fervently desires...

Add a Commander – a powerful hero character with unique abilities and rules – to your Genestealer Cults kill team with this set. It contains a multipart plastic Acolyte Iconward miniature, a set of cards packed with exclusive rules and a sheet of tokens for use in-game:

- An Acolyte Iconward: this multipart plastic kit is used to represent Crasker Matterzhek – or the Commander of any Genestealer Cults kill team you wish – armed with an autopistol, blasting charges and rending claws the Iconward clutches his cult’s sacred banner hoisting it aloft to inspire his broodkin to surge forward in a wave of indiscriminate violence
- A datacard for Crasker Matterzhek, featuring his characteristics, weapons, abilities and specialisms, along with a card featuring his background
- A card featuring Crasker Matterzhek’s skill tree – Acolyte Iconward specialisms which can only be used by that character
- 4 Broodmind discipline psychic power cards
- 5 Genestealer Cults Commander Tactics Cards, including 2 Tactics exclusive to this set
- A sheet of tokens for use in games of Kill Team – this includes 1 Move/Charge token, 1 Fall Back/Advance token, 1 Ready/Shoot token, 6 Tactic/psychic power tokens, 3 wound tokens, and 3 objective tokens.

-description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Pacific Throat Punch
description:
Pacific Throat Punch is a double-blind wargame simulating the conflict between the Empire of Japan and the Allied Powers from Pearl Harbor to mid-1944. Both players move units on their own maps. When units enter unoccupied or enemy-controlled areas, they are revealed and placed on a combat tile. While sea and air combat are critical, the only way to drive an opponent from a territory is through the use of ground forces.

Please note that the artwork is unfinished and is for personal use only as it contains some material borrowed from the internet.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven

name: Warhammer (Seventh Edition): The Empire
description:
Warhammer: The Empire is an expansion to the 7th edition of Warhammer: The Game of Fantasy Battles.

This 96-page softcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect The Empire faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Luku Luku Map
description:
LUKU-LUKU is an education game with three editions – Noun, Abstract and Map. It’s a fast game and based on the name, it is about how fast your eyes can move. This game tends to make people aware of their surroundings. Lukuluku Map is more of a geographical game while Abstract teaches stars, numbers
and regular shapes in a fun way depending on what the player wants to learn.

description:

This 96-page hardcover book is an army book, that provides all kinds of information required to collect Tomb Kings faction and field it on the tabletop.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame

name: S.F.X.: The Sound Effects Game
description:
The game includes a CD with 33 recorded sounds, such as a church bell, a glass breaking, a car crash, a duck, etc.

Every player gets 5 cards and as soon as the sound from one of his card is played, he must put it down as fast as possible.

name: Limite Limite: Gold
description:
Limite limite Gold is a new expansion for the game Limite Limite, a French implementation of Cards Against Humanity.

The lead player in turn chooses a question with a blank space, other players must choose an answer that must be funny, with the proposed cards having a big chance of being offensive. A strong knowledge of French language and culture is recommended to understand everything.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Secret Moon: Thief Promo Card
description:
Japanese Promo character, that is sent separatedly with English pamphlet rules if requested.

This character has some special rules:

He is in neither side of princess nor minister.

You cannot use "Hide/Protect" or "Capture".
If you are targeted by "Inquire", you must choose to answer as Princess/Wanderer or Minister (and get marker depending on your answer).
All characters including soldiers can "Capture" you.


This promotional character will win the game with this condition:

When Princess team or Minister team fulfill their winning condition, you are not captured.
In this case, you are the only winner of the game.

If Thief is a NPC, he never wins.

name: The Name of the Wind: Sympathy Dueling
description:
"Sympathy is not for the weak of mind.”
― Patrick Rothfuss, The Name of the Wind

Based on the bestselling book from author Patrick Rothfuss: "The Name of the Wind - Sympathy Dueling" is a 2-player head-to-head battle using the book's unique magic system.

Players divide a standard 52‐card deck into a Red deck and Black deck. Each player takes a color deck and shuffles, and then deals 4 cards face up in a vertical line. These 4 cards represent the player’s “candle”.

The table area in front of the player is the player’s “mind”. Here they will be able to draw and play cards from their source deck.

To win, player's use their cards to "light" the opponent's candle by converting all 4 cards to their color.

—description from the designer

name: 50 Clues: Ritualet
description:
You are an investigation team sent to a tragic event. A passenger car has crashed after a short car chase. The driver has fled, while the officer who participated in the hunt lies on the asphalt dead of gun shot wounds. From the trunk of the passenger car, a desperate rattle is heard from a dying woman. Nude, shot and with a strange sign cut into her upper body. Two fingers amputated. You soon find out that she is one of the five women who have disappeared in recent months.

The "ritual" is a macabre crime quest that you must solve. By calculating codes and combinations of tracks on different cards, you dig your way through the investigation.

You start the game via a smartphone at 50clues.com, which keeps track of time and helps you along the way. This is where you enter codes and combine clues from the cards. Making errors or using the help function costs extra time that is added to the total time spent. It's life or death to solve the puzzle quickly.

If you love crime stories and cryptic puzzles, then the "ritual" is for you.

It only takes three minutes to get started with the game.

Nominated for Best Board Game at Fastaval 2018.
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Mature / Adult, Murder/Mystery, Puzzle, Real-time

name: First Battle
description:
First Battle is Real War Game Simulation created by the US Army, Fort Leavenworth, Kansas, USA. this version is 75 pages in total; 53 pages of Rules; 13 pages of Tally Sheets; etc.

The military units are meant to represented by user created, folded tent cards, with a military symbol on one side. In the "Open-Mode" configuration of this simulation each Team has a wall-mounted 1:50k planning map and the Simulation is played out on a table-mounted 1:25k map, divided into 2x3' sectors (roughly 10ft. across and 12ft. between the Divisional commanders). Each side has 3 Div. Commanders; 3 Artillery Commanders, 2 Operational Leaders; an Overall Commander; and an Operational Aide (22 people in total). To run the run the "Closed-Mode" a total of 55+ people are required. In the "Closed" version the Commanders are in a separate room from the Simulation and have status updates conveyed by written notes of brief, one-way, phone messages. HO scale miniatures (Roco) are typically used in the "Closed" version, so that limited "Aerial" photos (or sketches) can be requested. Combat is resolved through Dice-Rolling in a fashion similar to most commercial wargames of the era.

This is obviously more than your typical war-game, but it is a streamlined version of actual military simulations used by the US Army in the 1970's.

—user summary
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Real-time, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Paper-and-Pencil, Simulation, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Floaty Fight!
description:
In Floaty Fight!, a.k.a. Schiffe versenken, players need guesswork and their powers of deduction to discover the whereabouts of all the opponent's floaties to win the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Latuvu
description:
To play smart by car or train ... Today children spend more and more hours by car or train. Latuvu is a wonderful way to observe the landscape while playing. This is to identify in the landscape that unfolds before our eyes, the illustrations on the cards. The cards drawn are captioned in English and French ...

In each round a card is drawn and then the first person who sees the corresponding thing shown on the card scores one point. The game ends after an predefined time or score.

name: See the Sea
description:
See the Sea is a classic bingo game with sea animals for the youngest players. Three versions of the game are included:


2+ years: to get know undersea world
3-5 years: classic bingo game - draw the tockens and fill your field.
4-7 years: bingo+memory with die. Roll the die and open as many chips as you have on the die. Get open animals from your field and be the first who complete it.


Perfect simplicity to enjoy time together with youngest kids.

name: Hidden Paths
description:
Hidden Paths is an abstract/spacial puzzle game for 2 to 4 players. In Hidden Paths, players are lost in a mysterious forest and are attempting to escape. Players play pattern cards to the Forest Core for placing path cubes that will eventually scoring points. Players can also play pattern cards in the Market to collect resources and other pattern cards to build up their hand. After scoring pattern cards, that pattern card scored is used to create your path out of the forest using your personal map. Each colored square you explore - you gain points, immediate resources and/or step closer to unlocking additional personal upgrades and finding your way to victory!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition

name: I Can't Even! Game
description:
I Can’t Even! (aka ICE):
Friends Split into 2-3 teams, with 2-6 players on each team.
Teams compete in quirky 60-second challenges to win points. Team with the most points wins.

It's competitive, hysterical party game that gets you on your feet and off the couch. Point valued cards are laid on a table, teams have a player (the host) read point valued card aloud then complete the challenge in 60 sec. Once the card is read; the timer starts. No time to think, just GO! The higher the point value the harder the challenge is to complete in 60 sec. With 200 unique cards in the box, challenges are never the same & literally could be a-n-y-t-h-i-n-g.

Once all cards are played, teams compete in the showtime round, giving each team a chance to gamble all,none or a portion of their points.
The anticipation, the excitement, the urgency of it all is something you have to experience yourself. It’s up to you. Pick your card, complete the challenge, get the points. Do you have what it takes? Even if you think you can’t, YOU CAN!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Turn Order: Time Track
publishers: Shut The Front Door Entertainment LLC
